text:
Kwa maneno ya computational, neno la hesabu ya mpangilio ni mpangilio wa neno la lambda. Hiyo ni, inayotazamwa kama mfumo wa aina, hesabu inayofuata inaweza kuonekana kama kutoa agizo la tathmini ya muda wa lambda. Kwa hivyo, tuseme $ \ gamma \ vdash e_1: a \ hadi b $, na $ \ gamma \ vdash e_2: a $. Katika kupunguzwa kwa asili, neno la kuondolewa kwa maana ni $ \ gamma \ vdash e_1 \; e_2: b $ - ambayo ni, matumizi. Walakini, kumbuka kuwa hii haituambii kama kutathmini $ E_1 $ kwanza au $ E_2 $ kwanza. Katika hesabu inayofuata, mgawo unaolingana wa ushahidi lazima uonekane kama $ $ \ mathsf {let} \; f = e_1 \; \ mathsf {in} \; \ mathsf {let} \; v = e_2 \; \ mathsf {in} \; x = f \; v \; \ mathsf {in} \; x $ $
au sivyo must look like   $$\mathsf{let}\; v = e_2\;\mathsf{in}\;\mathsf{let}\;f = e_1 \;\mathsf{in}\;\mathsf{let}\; x = f\;v \;\mathsf{in}\;x$$  Here, the let-form is the proof term corresponding to the use of the cut-rule, and since all of the left rules act only on hypotheses/variables, this forces us to bind all intermediate results to variables. This requirement ensures that we are forced to explicitly say which of $e_1$ or $e_2$ we reduce and bind to a variable first.   For purely functional languages, this explicitness doesn't matter, but as you add effects it becomes easier to work with sequent calculi. This is why things like calculi of control effects/classical logic are typically presented sequent calculus.

Nilivunja axle yangu ya chini ya bracket siku chache zilizopita, na nilipoondoa crankarms niligundua baiskeli yangu ya zamani ni kutumia kikombe na bracket ya chini lakini muhimu zaidi ganda la bracket ni isiyo ya kawaida. Haina nyuzi, kikombe cha kushoto kimekwama au kimewekwa juu yake na huenda njia yote hadi upande wa kulia wa ganda. Kwenye upande wa kulia ni nyuzi na inaruhusu kikombe cha kulia kiweko ndani yake. Nimejumuisha picha chache. Picha ya kwanza ni upande wa kushoto wa ganda, axle iliyovunjika bado iko, unaweza kuona kipande cha hexagonal ambacho kinazunguka kikombe cha kushoto ili kuiweka kwenye ganda nadhani, ingawa kikombe cha kushoto tayari kimejaa kwa ganda na Haina hoja kabisa. Picha ya pili ni left cup naked. You can see a little space between the shell and the cup all around it. And how it goes all the way until the right side of the shell.  Third pic is the right side of the shell. The left cup seems more firmly attached to the shell on this side. There seems to be some glue between the cup and the shell. The inside of the cup is threaded to allow for screwing the right cup.      Have you ever seen that kind of system? Is it safe? I was planning to clean the cup, clean the bearings (maybe throw some new ones), grease and replace the bearings, put a new axle, close and seal everything, and finally screw the crank arms. Is this the correct procedure to replace this kind of bottom bracket?

Claw katika grafu $ g (v, e) $ ina vertex $ v \ katika v $, na ni majirani watatu - $ \ {x_1, x_2, x_3 \} \ katika v \ setMinus \ {v \} $ , ikiwa $ \ {x_1, x_2, x_3 \} $ fomu seti huru katika $ g $. Shida inatuuliza tuthibitishe kuwa shida ifuatayo ni kamili: Je! Kuna seti ya $ k $ vertices $ s $, kwamba $ g (v \ setminus s, e) $ haina claw? Ni rahisi kudhibitisha kuwa shida iko katika NP - tunaweza kuangalia katika polynomial time whether the graph is claw-free after removing $k$ vertices. So now the only thing needed is to find a reduction from some known NP-complete problem to this one. I've been stuck on this problem for 2 weeks - I've thought about reducing VERTEX COVER, but after fiddling with it I think this may be a dead end. I will be grateful for any tips, that would point me in the right direction.

Hartmanis na Stearns, "Juu ya ugumu wa computational wa algorithms", shughuli za Jumuiya ya Mathematics ya Amerika 117: 285-306 (1965) Hii ilikuwa karatasi ya kwanza ambayo ilichukua uchunguzi wa ugumu wa wakati, na hakika ilikuwa nia ya msingi kwa Hartmanis and Stearns' joint Turing award. While their initial definitions are not quite what we use today, the paper remains extremely readable. You really get the feeling of how things were in the old "Wild West" frontier of the 60's.

Kujitambua labda sio ngumu sana. Viumbe vyote vinaonyesha mazingira yao kwa namna fulani; Bila mifano hii (pamoja na vyanzo vya chakula, wanyama wanaokula, nk) hawaishi. Aina zingine zina maelezo zaidi kuliko others.  Self-awareness just means having a model of your environment that is so detailed that it includes yourself.  Lots of people want to mystify this, for reasons that escape me.

Je! Hii ingefanya kazi? Tatizo ni nini? Hakuna mchoro wa dhibitisho kwamba hii ni algorithm ya wakati wa polynomial inapewa. Hoja ambapo algorithm inaweza kuacha kuwa algorithm ya wakati wa polynomial ni hatua ya 3: kuwa polynomial isiyo ya kawaida, ni jambo la kawaida kurekebisha polynomial hii na angalia ikiwa ni sawa 0 au la. Hata hivyo kurekebisha polynomial isiyo ya kawaida ni ndogo kutoka kwa maoni ya dhana, haijulikani ikiwa inaweza kufanywa kwa wakati wa polynomial (au hata nafasi ya polynomial). Kwa polynomials ya multivariate, ni dhahiri kwamba polynomials kama $ (1+x_1) (1+x_2) \ dots (1+x_n) $ haiwezi kurekebishwa katika nafasi ya polynomial. Kwa polynomials zisizo na usawa, maelezo ya uundaji wa shida huwa muhimu. Ikiwa polynomial ya pembejeo imepewa na mzunguko wa hesabu na coefficients ni kutoka $ \ mathbb z $, basi squaring inayorudiwa itakupa mifano tele ya polynomials ambazo haziwezi kurekebishwa katika nafasi ya polynomial. (Shimo mara nyingi hufanywa juu ya uwanja laini, ambao huepuka aina hii ya mlipuko wa nafasi.) Mchoro wa uthibitisho ambao the algorithm works as intended has too many holes for being a valid mathematical proof. However, it is quite possible that there is a proper mathematical proof showing that the proposed algorithm works as intended, and this wouldn't even be a surprise. Here are some of the holes:     $f$ should be a union of hypersurfaces (homogeneous polynomial)   This reads like a claim that $f$ is a homogeneous polynomial iff $f=0$ is a union of hypersurfaces (through the origin). But $f(x,y,z)=x^2+y^2-z^2$ is a homogeneous polynomial for which $f=0$ is not a finite union of hypersurfaces.     Supposing $f$ is an homogenous polynomial (worst case), each hypersurface is able at best to make $f=0$ along $n−1$ of the Vandermonde line-vectors.   This seems to assume that $f(x_1,\dots,x_n)=\prod_i(\sum_j a_{ij}x_j)$, which might be yet another interpretation of "union of hypersurfaces". The hole in the proof here is that the "(worst case)" claim isn't proved. Note that $f(x,y,z)=x^2+y^2-z^2$ is a homogeneous polynomial, but it cannot be written in the assumed form.

Nina fox talas rlc kongwe. Inazidi kuwa chini ya uzani wa uzito, lakini hata kukaa tu na kuibadilisha inasisitiza kikamilifu. Ikiwa nitaivuta itaongezeka tena, au itaondoka itakuwa rebound. But it seems to slowly sink when im on the bike.   Lock out still works, and the PSI is at 90-100, and I weigh 185. So that seems to be within normal range.
Vest ya usalama inaweza kusaidia, wanaweza kupata joto kidogo lakini mimi have wrapped my backpack in one for extra visibility on the commute

Niliambiwa tu kwamba gurudumu langu ni toast. Kweli - ni mdomo tu. Nilikuwa na chuchu nyingine iliyovunjika na, walipoifungua, walisema oksidi ya alumini ilinyesha ndani yake kama shaker ya chumvi. Nadhani ilikuwa ni wakati uliopita wakati niliunda magurudumu. Ahh vizuri, nadhani hiyo ndio unayopata wakati wa kupanda mwaka mzima huko Chicago ambapo waliweka chini ya chumvi mbili kwa kila theluji. Kwa kweli ningependa kujenga gurudumu jipya kwani kitovu kina maswala kadhaa. Nilitumia muda nikitafuta kitovu kipya na nilikuwa nikishonwa. Kutumaini mtu hapa anaweza kuwa na kiongozi. The wheel is 6 speed and uses a freewheel. Six speeds is all I need in flat Chicago and I have a whole pile of very nice 6-speed freewheels already. Plus, my bike fits a 126mm rear wheel.  So, does anyone know anyone making a nice 126 rear hub? 40 (or 48) holes please. I carry lots of groceries and the the roads in Chicago are terrible. Cartridge bearings please. I find cartridges fare way better in salty slush that dominates the streets for months out of the year. I'm pretty good at repacking bearings, but I really don't have the time to do it repeatedly.  thanks for any leads or insights!
Kwa kweli inaonekana kama una kibali cha kutosha kwa watengenezaji. Wale wanaonekana kuvunja kwa muda mrefu calipers too.  If you don't have fender mounts on the rear - you can always use P-Clips.

Shida ya mzunguko wa Hamiltonian na shida ya wauzaji wa kusafiri ni kati ya shida maarufu za NP na imesomwa sana. Ninatafuta for applications of the HamCycle and TSP. What are some interesting real world problems where the HamCycle and TSP come up?

Ningependa kufanya uelekezaji wa kiotomatiki, sema kutatua shida za maneno au kupunguza kwa hali ya kawaida, katika nadharia ya usawa ya hesabu ya lambda iliyochapishwa (na aina ya bidhaa na kitengo). Vivyo hivyo, katika lugha ya nadharia: ningependa kufanya uelekezaji katika jamii iliyofungwa ya Cartesian iliyowasilishwa na seti ya jenereta laini and relations. I would be interested in any references on this topic.  I understand that inference in this setting is generally undecidable. However, I wonder whether there is any literature that either gives useful conditions under which exact inference is possible or proposes heuristic algorithms for approximate inference.

Hapa kuna picha ya usanidi. FYI Dengfu ananitumia sehemu kadhaa za FOC kwa sababu nilikataa gharama zao za usafirishaji! I don't know if I will install them though because after  short while the same problem will happen.

Nina $ n \ mara n $ matrix $ a $. Masharti yake ni $ a_ {ij} =-x^{w_ {ij}} $ ikiwa $ i \ neq j $ na $ a_ {ii} = \ jumla_ {j = 0}^{n+1} x^{w_ {ij}} $ kwenye diagonal. Matrix ni ulinganifu kama $ w_ {ij} = w_ {ji} $. Nambari $ w_ {ij} $ ni ya kiholela. . Kuliko baadhi ya mtoaji $ w $, kwa wakati polynomial katika $ n $ na $ \ varepsilon^{-1} $ na huru ya thamani kubwa $ w_ {ij} $? Kama sanduku nyeusi, naweza kutumia algorithm ambayo inahesabu idadi ya njia kwenye DAG, fupi kuliko kizingiti $ l $ na kosa $ (1+ \ varepsilon)^{\ pm 1} $. Nilipanga kuhesabu utaftaji wa LU ya $ A $. Basi ningeweza kupata uamuzi kama bidhaa ya idadi ya polynomial ya polynomials na idadi ya polynomial ya maneno: $ det (a) = \ prod_i^n f_i (x) $ ambapo $ n \ katika o (poly (n)) $ na Kila $ f_i (x) $ ina maneno mengi ya polynomially. Sasa ningeunda DAG ambayo inawakilisha uamuzi: $ monomial $ x^{w_ {ij}} $ ingewakilishwa vertices mbili zilizounganishwa na makali na uzani $ w_ {ij} $. DRM ya polynomials $ F (x) $ na $ g (x) $ ingewakilishwa na vertices mbili zilizounganishwa sambamba na grafu ambayo inawakilisha $ f (x) $ na grafu ambayo inawakilisha $ g (x) $. Bidhaa ya polynomials $ f (x) g (x) $ ingewakilishwa na grafu zinazolingana na $ f (x) $ na $ g (x) $ mfululizo. Yote ni vizuri hadi sasa, ningeunda grafu na takriban njia za kuhesabu fupi kuliko kizingiti kutoka upande mmoja hadi mwingine. Lakini shida ni kwamba polynomials $ f (x) $ itakuwa na masharti hasi. Hiyo inamaanisha kuwa ninahitaji kufuata wimbo wa parity of individual paths, effectively making 2 copies of the DAG and switching between them when parity changes. In the end I have to calculate the paths that end up with negative parity and subtract them from the paths that end up with positive parity. This can kill my approximation ratio since I do not know the relationship between the number of positive and negative parity paths.   Is there a different way how to represent the determinant as a product of polynomial number of polynomials, hopefully without negative terms and without division? I need to avoid any actual determinant calculation, since the expansion may generate a polynomial with number of terms exponential in $n$.  The original intent is probably obvious: I am trying to count spanning trees shorter than some value $W$. The determinant of the matrix $A$ is a generating polynomial for these. Evaluating the polynomial fully would not give a FPTAS, since we can have at most $n^{n-2}$ distinct weight spanning trees (consider a complete graph with edges of lengths $2^i$ for edge $i$.)   In this case, it seems that applying some division-less LU decomposition and then counting paths with parity will not work: if we calculate the determinant according to the Leibniz formula  $\det(A)=\sum_{\sigma\in S_n}sgn(\sigma)\prod_{i=1}^n A_{i,\sigma_i}$, the expansion will contain cyclic subgraphs that will eventually cancel out. But there can be many cyclic subgraphs, shorter than the MST. So if we set counting  threshold to the value of the MST, we might make a large error in the subtraction, unless the LU decomposition somehow magically takes care of this.

Katika jibu lingine juu ya mahesabu ya mzigo wa kusimamishwa, @criggie ilitoa mifano kadhaa ya miundo tofauti ya kusimamishwa, 1) kiwango cha nne-bar, na 2) bar-bar ya nne: wazi kuna pili ina uhusiano ngumu zaidi, lakini ni nini ni nini the twin-link four-bar suspension design trying to solve?   The twin-link seems to have a bigger virtual pivot point and the magnified axle path seems to swerve less laterally, but it's hard to tell from the exaggerated diagram.

Ninasasisha kutoka kwa baiskeli ya Shimano Tourney na Newbie kwa hivyo tafadhali kuwa mzuri kwangu .. lol :) Ninapanda njia na njia rahisi za baiskeli na barabara kadhaa. Kwa nchi ya msalaba - barabara ya nusu ya barabara/ nusu ya mlima, ambayo is better? - A 1X11 SRAM/Shimano system or do I need 2 gears in front with a front derailleur? Considering ease of pedaling, shifting and more slower shifts in gear, isn't a 2X10 set up better?  Thanks

Je! Ni mada gani za TCS zinazokosekana kwenye Wikipedia ungependa sana kuwe na nakala kuhusu? Wanaweza kuwa wa kuachwa au mada tu ambazo unafikiri zinapaswa kuwa na nakala. Mada moja kwa kila jibu tafadhali ili mtu anayetaka zaidi ones can be voted up.  Update 5/2/2017: Shuchi Chawla is leading an effort to improve TCS coverage on wikipedia. I'm adding this update in the hopes that people will update their answers as appropriate, add more answers, and/or contribute to the effort!

Tuseme ninakupa $ n $ zilizoandikwa sarafu $ C_1, \ cdots, c_n $ ya upendeleo usiojulikana. Ninakuahidi kwamba sarafu zimepangwa na upendeleo (i.e. $ \ forAll i ~ ~ \ mathbb {p} [c_i = 1] \ leq \ mathbb {p} [c_ {i+1} = 1] $) na saa angalau moja ya sarafu haijakamilika (i.e. $ \ ipo i ~ ~ \ mathbb {p} [c_i = 1] = \ frac12 $). Kazi yako ni kupata sarafu takriban isiyo ya kawaida. Hiyo ni, lazima upate $ i _*$ kama kwamba $ \ mathbb {p} [c_ {i _*} = 1] \ katika [\ frac13, \ frac23] $. Ili kufanya hivyo, unapaswa kugeuza sarafu chache iwezekanavyo. Hapa kuna algorithm that completes the task by flipping $O(\log n \cdot \log \log n)$ coins: Perform a binary search over the coins - this takes $O(\log n)$ steps. For each step, flip the coin $O(\log \log n)$ times so that the bias of the coin can be approximated to within $0.1$ with probability at least $1-1/O(\log n)$. A union bound shows that this will be correct with high probabiliy.  Can we do this using $O(\log n)$ coin flips?

Shida inaweza kutatuliwa kwa $ O (n (m + n \ logi n)) $ wakati. Suluhisho hapa chini ni msingi wa moja na Grötschel na Pulleyblank kushughulikia njia fupi na idadi (isiyo ya kawaida) ya kingo (Gröschel na Pulleyblank kwa upande wake huchangia kwa 'Waterloo-Folklore'. Schrijver inachangia suluhisho lao kwa J. Edmonds. Sisi 'Utatatua shida kubwa ya kupata kiwango cha chini cha uzito wa $ S - t $ na idadi isiyo ya kawaida (hata) ya kingo. Nafuu ya isiyo ya kawaida na hata suluhisho ni kiwango cha chini cha uzito $ s - t $ njia. Acha $ g = (v, e) $ iwe graph yako ya pembejeo. Unda graph mpya $ g '$. Grafu $ G '$ ina nakala mbili za $ G $ iliyoainishwa $ G_1 $ na $ G_2 $. Kila makali $ e \ katika $ inahifadhi uzito wake katika $ G_1 $ lakini inapewa uzito $ 0 $ kwa $ G_2 $. Mwishowe, kwa kila vertex $ V \ katika V $, $ g '$ ina makali ya uzito $ 0 $ kati ya nakala za $ V $ katika $ G_1 $ na $ G_2 $. Acha $ v_i $ iwe nakala ya $ V $ katika graph $ g_i $. Pata uzito wa chini kabisa unaolingana $ m $ katika $ g ' - s_2 - t_2 $ kwa $ o (n (m + n \ logi n)) $ wakati (gabow [1990]). Acha $ p = (v, e ') $ iwe na kingo za $ m $ ambazo zilinakiliwa kutoka $ g $ (ikiwezekana na kuzidisha). Sehemu moja iliyounganishwa ya $ P $ ni kiwango cha chini cha uzito wa $ S - t $ na idadi isiyo ya kawaida ya kingo, na uzani wake wa usawa ni sawa na uzito wa $ M $. Ili kudhibitisha madai hayo, acha $ p $ kiwango cha chini cha uzito $ s - t $ katika $ g $ na idadi isiyo ya kawaida ya kingo. Acha $ m $ iwe sawa kabisa ya $ g ' - s_2 - t_2 $ iliyo na nakala za $ g_1 $ ya kwanza, ya tatu, nk Edges za $P$, $G_2$'s copies of the second, forth, etc. edges of $P$ and the $0$ weight edges between $v_1$ and $v_2$ for every vertex $v$ not in $P$. Matching $M$ has the same weight as $P$'s parity weight, so some perfect matching of $G'$ contains $P$ and has the appropriate weight.  Conversely, let $M$ be a perfect matching in $G' - s_2 - t_2$, and let $P = (V,E')$ contain exactly the edges of $M$ that were copied from $G$ (possibly with multiplicity). For every vertex $v \notin \{s,t\}$, either $v$ is incident to two edges copied from $G$ in $M$, or both copies of $v$ were matched along a $0$ weight edge not present in $G$. Vertices $s$ and $t$ have one matched copy in $M$. Therefore, every vertex of $P$ has degree $2$ or $0$ except for $s$ and $t$ which have degree $1$. Therefore, $s$ and $t$ lie in the same connected component of $P$, and that component is a path. Further, when tracing the edges of that path from $s$ to $t$ you find they come from $G_1$, then $G_2$, then $G_1$, etc. ending with $G_1$. There are an odd number of edges, and the parity weight of that path is the weight of those edges in $G'$. Every other component of $P$ must have non-negative weight, so $M$ is a perfect matching in $G' - s_2 - t_2$ with weight no less than $P$.  Finding a minimum parity weight $s - t$ path with an even number of edges is solved in exactly the same way, except you find a minimum weight perfect matching in $G' - s_2 - t_1$.

Ndio. Kwa pendekezo 2.3 ya [1], sehemu zote za msingi za LP zinahusiana na vijidudu ambavyo vina mizunguko isiyo ya kawaida, na kwa hivyo ikiwa grafu haina mizunguko isiyo ya kawaida, LP has an optimal solution that takes on only integer values.  [1] G. L. Nemhauser and L. E. Trotter Jr. Properties of vertex packing and independence system polyhedra. Mathematical Programming, 6:48–61, 1974.

Ninajaribu wazo la algorithm ya hesabu ya msingi kulingana na umoja wa quadratic. Inafanya kazi kama ifuatavyo: Acha $ n $ iwe nambari tunayotaka kuangazia. Chagua laini iliyofungwa $ b $ kupata $ b+1 $ laini laini ambazo pia ni laini mod $ n $ kwa kila jozi laini ya $ x \ equiv y \ pmod {n} $, sababu $ x $ na kuzidisha $ x, y $ na kila sababu kuu na nguvu isiyo ya kawaida. Itageuka $ x $ kuwa mraba kisha endelea kutatua kama ilivyo kwa ungo wa quadratic baada ya $ B+1 $ B-laini kumepatikana kupata maadili ya B-laini sio rahisi, hapa ndivyo ninavyopanga kuifanya. Acha $ n $ iwe $ \ logi {n} $ $ s $ iwe kikundi cha logi cha primes zote hadi $ b $ kwamba $ s_i = \ logi Inaweza kutofautishwa katika $ s '$ ni mwanachama katika $ s $ jumla ya $ s' $ ni kubwa kuliko $ n $ jumla ya $ s '$ ni ndogo exponential ya jumla ya $ s' $ inapaswa kuwa B- karibu zaidi Thamani laini kwa $ n $, na kwa hivyo inapaswa kuwa na nafasi kubwa ya kuwa yenyewe yenyewe. Rudia hatua hapo juu na $ \ logi {kn} $ ambapo $ k $ ni nambari ndogo hadi you found $B+1$ smooth values.  The problem of finding the minimal $S'$ can be seen as a special case of the knapsack problem where weights equal to costs. I have been trying to solve it via the two approaches below  Convert $n, S$ to integers. I could only use a very small precision of 1000 before I ran out of memory. I ended up having values $y$ values of the size of $N$ Build $S'$ by picking random values between $0$ to $B$ (including non-primes) when the sum of $S' > n - log(B_B)$, pick the last value by doing a binary search on the range of $0-B$ searching for the closest value $\log{}$ for $n - log(B_B)$. This one was more successful and gave $y$ values of the order of $\sqrt{N}$. The reason it worked is that any value on the range $0-B$ must be a prime or a composite of one of the $B$ bounded primes.  But the conclusion is that both of those methods are not good enough for finding the nearest B-smooth value to $kN$. Have someone already try this direction? Is there a better way of calculating $S'$?

Kwa njia ile ile ambayo kazi ya beaver iliyo na shughuli nyingi hufafanuliwa kwa mashine za Kujaribu, tunaweza kufafanua kazi inayofanana kwa hesabu ya Lambda isiyo ya kawaida: juu ya maneno yote katika ULC yaliyoundwa na vitunguu vya N, vigezo na matumizi, ambayo ina fomu ndefu zaidi? Hii inaweza kuelezewa kwa njia kadhaa: tunaweza kuzingatia tu kurekebishwa kwa masharti ya ULC, au tunaweza kutafuta ndefu zaidi normal form over all replacements.  Clearly, this function is not computable for arbitrarily large n, for the same reason as for the standard Busy Beaver function. However, I am interested in whether anything is known about this function for small values of n. What values is it known for? What bounds exists for higher n? For what n is the value known to be independent of ZFC?

Kujaribu kupata suluhisho bora kwa uzani-max-3sat, toleo lenye uzani wa shida ya optimization 3, ni NP-ngumu. Kwa kweli, hata kukadiria toleo lisilo na uzani wa max-sat kiholela ni dhahiri NP-ngumu na nadharia ya PCP. Algorithm ya canonical ya kukaribisha uzani-max-3sat ni max-walksat. Kuangalia kote nilipata habari juu ya algorithms zingine (i.e. tawi-na-zimefungwa, algorithm ya DPL) ambayo ni commonly used to find solutions to 3-SAT or (unweighted) MAX-3SAT, but I didn't see any discussion of how well these would work for the weighted version. Intuitively, without being adapted they would not work as well.  I'm wondering what other algorithms are commonly used to approximate WEIGHTED-MAX-SAT, if there are well-known WEIGHTED-MAX-SAT solvers, and the relative quality of these algorithms/solvers.

Nadhani jibu ni "ni ngumu", na labda hawatambui kiwango dhahiri katika utaftaji wa chomsky katika misemo ya kawaida hairuhusu kutambua lugha zisizo za kawaida. Hii ni ngumu kuona katika utaratibu wa kawaida wa automata, lakini karatasi hii inaelezea kutumia utaratibu wa "derivative" wa Brzozowski zaidi, ambao unaruhusu kufafanua "maneno ya kawaida" yanayosaidia $ \ neg R $ na kuingiliana $ r \ & s $. Seti ya lugha za kawaida pia imefungwa chini ya shughuli hizi, na shughuli za kupendeza zinaweza kuelezewa kwa suala lao. Kwa mfano, hasi kuangalia $ r (?! S) p $ inaweza kuandikwa kama $ r (p \ & \ neg (s.*)) $ Chapisho hili linaelezea nguvu ya "perl compatible regular expressions" (PCREs). They can recognize at least the context free languages and more. However, Python does not use full PCREs, and in particular lacks the DEFINE keyword, which the author used to prove it can recognize all context-free languages. (The proof is basically embedding BNF-style grammar productions into a PCRE.)   I'm not aware of a way of embedding BNF-style productions into python regular expressions, so it's unclear whether python regexes can recognize all CFLs. They can also clearly recognize non-regular languages like the collection of strings on the alphabet $\{a\}$ which have a composite length r'^(aa+)(\1)+$', which is not even context-free.

Kutoka kwa maoni hapo juu: Katika Stefan Kratsch, Pascal Schweitzer, graph isomorphism kwa madarasa ya grafu yaliyoonyeshwa na vifungu viwili vilivyokatazwa: GI ni wakati wa polynomial (kwa kweli) inayoweza kutekelezwa kwa $ (k_s, i_t) \ maandishi {-free} $ graph, lakini pia . Hariri: Kama ilivyoonyeshwa kwenye maoni, $ k_ {1, t} $ haina mzunguko (nilisoma utangulizi wa karatasi haraka sana). Baada ya kufikiria kidogo juu yake, inaonekana ni rahisi kudhibitisha yafuatayo (asili?): Matokeo hasi: kwa kila laini iliyowekwa $ \ {H_1, ... h_k \} $ ambayo kila $ h_i $ ina mzunguko, the Shida ya graph isomorphism (GI) iliyozuiliwa kwa darasa $ \ mathcal {C} $ ya $ (H_1, ..., H_K) \ maandishi {-free}} graph ni kamili. Uthibitisho: Zisizohamishika darasa la $ (h_1, ..., h_k) \ maandishi {-free} $ grafu ambazo kila $ h_i $ ina mzunguko, na kupewa $ g_1, g_2 $, acha $ r $ iwe urefu wa Mzunguko mrefu zaidi wa $ h_i $ s. Badilisha kila makali $ (u, v) $ ya $ g_1, g_2 $ na njia ya urefu $ l = \ lceil r/3 \ rceil $ na kuongeza $ l $ node mpya $ (u, p_1, p_2, ...,, p_l, v) $ (tazama takwimu hapa chini). Kwa ujenzi grafu mpya $ g'_1, g'_2 $ ni $ (h_1, ..., h_k) \ maandishi r/3 \ rceil + 3> r $; Na ni rahisi kudhibitisha kuwa wao ni isomorphic ikiwa na tu ikiwa $ G_1 ya asili, G_2 $ ni isomorphic. Kielelezo: Grafu $ G_1 $ upande wa kushoto, na sawa $ (h_1, ..., h_k) \ maandishi {-free} $ graph $ g'_1 $ kulia (tuseme kwamba mzunguko mrefu zaidi wa $ h_i $ ina urefu wa $ r = 15 $, kwa hivyo kila makali ya $ g_1 $ hubadilishwa na njia ya urefu $ l = 5 $. Tunaweza pia kupanua matokeo hasi kwa shida ya mzunguko wa Hamiltonian, kwa kweli ni ya haraka corollary to the following (original?):  Theorem: for any $k \geq 3$, the Hamiltonian cycle problem remains NP-complete even if we the graph $G$ does not contain cycles of length $\leq k$.  Proof We know that the Hamiltonian cycle problem is NPC even on a planar directed graph $G$ with each node $v$ satisfying: $outdeg(v) + indeg(v) \leq 3$ (Papdimitriou and Vazirani, On Two Geometric Problems Related to the Travelling Salesman Problem). We can transform the graph $G$ to an undirectde graph $G'$ simply adding a node on the incoming edge of nodes $v$ that have $indeg(v )=1$, and to the outgoing edge of nodes $v$ that have $indeg(v)=2$. Then we can replace the nodes of $G'$ with the gadget in the figure below. It is easy to see that there are only two valid traversals (zigzags) that visit each node of the gadget exactly once (red and green paths in the figure): the gadgets cannot be traversed from top-to-bottom, otherwise the horizontal (incoming or outgoing) path would be cut out. Furthermore we can place enough nodes on the vertical/horizontal segments of the gadgets, and extend the number of its zigzags, to ensure that no cycle of length $\geq k$ is possible  in the gadget or in a triangle of 3 gadgets linked together. This assures that  if the resulting graph $G''$ has an Hamiltonian cycle, then the original graph $G$ has also an Hamiltonian cycle (the converse is immediate by construction of the gadget).    Corollary: Hamiltonian cycle and path problems remain NP-complete even if restricted to  $(H_1,...,H_k)\text{-free}$ graphs, where every $H_i$ contains a cycle.

Swali lako linaonyesha kuwa unaanza mada hii. Kuna utafiti maalum sana katika hatua hii juu ya mada hii ya mifano ya hesabu na kompyuta kwa kueneza virusi. Tabia ya kueneza virusi imeona kuwa na kufanana kabisa katika virusi tofauti/tofauti za milieus mfano, virusi vya wanadamu, virusi vya wanyama. Havent aliona karatasi nzuri ya uchunguzi wa kisayansi. Walakini hapa kuna ref mbili zilizoandikwa by leading computer scientist experts/specialists/discoverers in natural/physical applications of graph theory. full disclosure, they are popular science type books, but they should be sufficient for your query to find further research leads.   Linked: the new science of networks, Barabasi. Ch 10 Viruses and Fads. Six Degrees: The Science of a Connected Age, Watts. Chapter 6, Epidemics and failures

Nyingine tu ningeongeza ni taa nzuri sana - hata wakati wa mchana. Madereva watakuwa wakizingatia zaidi kuendesha na labda wamejifunga au kwa sehemu iliyofunikwa windows. Itakuwa nyeusi/overcast - even during the day.  Having rear flashing lights, and another one higher on your jacket/helmet is a good idea.  Also check that you rear lights / reflectors haven't been covered by thrown up dirt.

Wazo la jumla la "gari la lever," au mwendo wa kurudisha nyuma badala ya mwendo wa kanyagio hutangulia hata uvumbuzi wa baiskeli ya kisasa ya almasi-fikiria nyota maalum kutoka 1886. Hivi karibuni, kulikuwa na sehemu ya biocam, The Facet Biocam, The Alenax, na Walker Wall. Ndani ya ulimwengu wa kurudisha drivetrains, baiskeli ya kamba inavutia katika matumizi yake ya vifaa (dyneema kusambaza nguvu) na the ability to vary mechanical advantage on the lever arm (although the Alenax was able to achieve this simply using hub gears).  But check out what Jobst Brandt had to say about the Alenax. His basic point is that you're converting reciprocating motion to rotary motion, which is mechanically less efficient. I haven't been able to find any studies of the biomechanics of lever-drive bikes.

Nenda kwa baiskeli ya 1200 cx. Sababu za hii ningetoa: unaweza kubadilisha magurudumu/matairi kwenye baiskeli ya CX na baiskeli yake ya barabara. Ukiwa na matairi ya CX juu yako unaweza kupanda eneo kubwa la barabara za barabarani you'll come across A $400 MTB is unlikely to be very good, unless you find a second hand bargain MTB's are terrible on road I've got a CX bike which I ride on-road in the winter, and would definitely recommend them

Ballpark itakuwa ~ masaa 2, ikiwezekana hadi saa 1 dakika 45. Ikiwa utaweka lengo la akili la "masaa 2" basi utakuwa kwenye wimbo. Utashangazwa na "upepo wa kunyonya" unaozalishwa tu kwa kuwa barabarani na kundi la waendeshaji wote wakienda upande mmoja. Sio lazima rasimu/rasimu na ikiwa haujawahi kujaribu kabla ya watu wengi ni wakati mbaya wa kuanza. Ikizingatiwa kuna maelfu ya waendeshaji, inaonekana kama tukio la ushiriki wa watu wengi kuliko mbio. Ikiwa unajua njia na una wakati katika wiki zinazoongoza kwenye hafla hiyo, hakika unapaswa kupanda yote route.  This will teach you the corners and points to look out for.  However your time will be increased by intersections and road traffic.  If there are climbs in this route you will want to try them at various powers and see if your physique and endurance allows a high effort, or if you need to rein it in and get to the top with reserves for the next piece.  There's a good chance you'll find other people practising the route too.  So observe them and see if your actions are different.  Try it their way and see if it feels better.   Also this is the chance to set some strava times for segments.

1) Labda. Inategemea wewe. Sio kila mtu anayeweza kumudu muda mwingi kwa safari yao. 2) Labda sio - unahitaji wastani wa karibu 22 mph, ambayo ni mengi kwa kusafiri hata kwenye uwanja wa gorofa - 15 mph ish ni kasi nzuri zaidi kwa msafiri kwenye uwanja wa gorofa (mimi huenda karibu 18 mph ikiwa mimi ' m kwa haraka, lakini umbali wangu ni mfupi sana na very flat). Google Maps is pretty good on expected time for commuting type riding, I've found. If you were to do it in an hour somehow (or even at 18 mph, which would be about 1 hour 15 minutes), you'd be sweaty and need to shower at work (probably). At 15 mph, you'd be taking about 1.5 hours. Expect slower speeds if you have hills or traffic or other holdups/slowdowns.

Nitajaribu kujibu swali juu ya kwanini baiskeli zinachukuliwa kuwa magari badala ya kuorodhesha sheria za mitaa ambazo zinasema sana. Dhibitisho ambayo naona ni: baiskeli ni mashine ya usafirishaji, kwa hivyo gari. Tautologically. Wapanda baisikeli wanafanya kama watumiaji wengine wa gari. Kwa ujumla husafiri haraka kuliko watembea kwa miguu, hawawezekani na wana uzito zaidi. Kutibu baiskeli kama watembea kwa miguu kunaweza kusababisha utelezi, kama watu wanaopanda baiskeli ndani ya majengo na maduka makubwa ya watembea kwa miguu. Bila sheria za baiskeli kwa ujumla hufanya zaidi kama watumiaji wa gari kuliko watembea kwa miguu. Wanapanda barabarani, wanasafiri kwa mistari moja kwa moja, wanapakia baiskeli yao zaidi kuliko wangeweza kubeba bila hiyo, wanawanyanyasa watembea kwa miguu kwa kuwa polepole na kusonga kwa nasibu. Kwa kihistoria ninatarajia ni kwa sababu baiskeli ni mashine na zina tabia kama magari mengine kuliko wanavyofanya watembea kwa miguu safi. Ninashuku sheria iliyoandaliwa katika nchi nyingi in a simlar way to the UK as described by Tom77 in his answer. Originally power came from people and draft animals and the speed range was between ox carts and galloping horse riders. But a galloping horse is a fragile thing, so riders tended to be careful because if the horse falls the rider is likely to die. Note that this is the opposite to a motor vehicle hitting a pedestrian. But a horse at a walk or trot can move off the road and walk around a relatively slow-moving pedestrian or cart. So you had the pragmatic situation that pedestrians were expected to move out of the way of horses, everyone waited to pass carts until it was physically possible, and important people yelled a lot.  I expect that the formalisation went "the faster you go the more you have to avoid other road users. This is therefore the law".

Kama ilivyo kwa swali la kwanza, ndivyo kupunguzwa hufanya. Kwa jinsi ya kupunguza #3SAT kwa #monotone-2sat, angalia uthibitisho wa #p-ukamilifu wa #monotone-2sat [val79b], ambayo ni msingi wa utaftaji wa #p wa kudumu [val79a]. Ili kupunguza #SAT hadi #3SAT, kupunguzwa kwa Cook kutoka kwa shida yoyote katika NP hadi 3SAT ni muhimu na kwa hivyo inapunguza #sat hadi #3SAT. Jibu la swali la pili ni hapana. Kupunguzwa kwa [Val79a] kutoka #3SAT hadi Kudumu hakuhifadhi idadi ya suluhisho. Moreover, if a reduction from #SAT to #Monotone-2SAT (or Permanent) which preserves the number of solutions were known, the same reduction would reduce the decision version of SAT to the decision version of Monotone-2SAT (or Bipartite Matching), implying P=NP.  References  [Val79a] Leslie G. Valiant.  The complexity of computing the permanent.  Theoretical Computer Science, 8(2):189–201, 1979.  http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/0304-3975(79)90044-6  [Val79b] Leslie G. Valiant.  The complexity of enumeration and reliability problems.  SIAM Journal on Computing, 8(3):410–421, Aug. 1979.  http://dx.doi.org/10.1137/0208032

Lattice ya jamaa ni msingi wa axiomatic kwa algebra ya uhusiano. Kwa kutabiri, mabadiliko ya hoja hupunguza kwa hoja za usawa katika mfumo huo wa axiom. Hapa kuna mifano: kushinikiza-kuchagua-kupitia-mradi kutaja wengine wengi kama umoja na ushirika of [relational] join operation, or permutting selection via join are trivial in the sense that they are fundamental lattice laws.  You mentioned theorem provers; not surprisingly, some research has been facilitated with Prover9.

Algorithms nyingi na muundo wa data huchukua ufikiaji wa familia ya kazi za hash zinazoridhisha mali nzuri (sema, $ k $ -indence au $ k $ -universality). Katika visa hivi, kwa kawaida tunadhani kwamba tunatoa mfano wa kazi za hash kutoka kwa familia hizi kwa bahati nasibu. Je! Kuna matukio yoyote ya algorithm au data structure sampling from a family of hash functions in a way that isn’t uniformly at random? For example, do any randomized algorithms or data structures sample from hash families using other distributions to, say, bias where elements end up hashing or to introduce some correlations among hashed values?

Nitajibu swali la "Ikiwa mgongano utafanyika" swali, sio "nitazuiaje mgongano", kwa sababu hiyo imeshughulikiwa tayari. Je! Ni ujuzi gani wa hali ya juu wa baiskeli ni muhimu kwa msafiri au mpanda farasi wa jiji? Na mbinu za kupunguza jeraha wakati wa kuanguka au kupasuka? Wote wana vidokezo vya usalama. Ingawa vifaa vya usalama vya jumla zaidi tunapaswa kuwa na "wiki inaweza kuwa nzuri. Pia nitafikiria kuwa hawajaribu sana kukugonga. Ingawa kwa kuwa karibu 1/3 ya vifo vinajumuisha dereva mlevi hii inaweza kuwa sio sahihi kabisa. Mzozo kutoka nyuma licha ya kuwa moja ya mgongano unaogopa sana, hii pia ni nadra sana (ingawa ni mbaya sana) kwa karibu 1.4% ya vifo. Ikiwa itafanyika wewe ni karibu kabisa kuwa bora kupanda barabarani ili kuizuia - kugongana na kitu kwa kasi ya baiskeli Beats ikigongwa kwa kasi ya gari. Mgongano kutoka upande ikiwa mtu atakuendesha kutoka upande sijui ni nini unaweza kufanya. Kuinua miguu yako juu ya eneo la athari au hata kuruka kwenye gari kunaweza kusaidia, na angalau kupunguza chances of you being crushed underneath it. My focus would be on quickly deciding whether to brake to avoid it, or sprint to avoid it. Then do that. Avoiding the crash is always the better option.  Crashing into something  This usually happens when a motorist turns in front of you or crashes into something in front of you. The cliche "superman" crash, where you fly over the car leaving your bike behind. As with motorcyclists, the best advice is to jump, because if your legs hit the handlebars and break you'll be in a lot of pain for a long time. Better to jump over the car, land on the other side and lose some skin. I've done this a few times and cracking a bone in my shoulder is the worst that's happened.  The advice in the linked questions above is definitely relevant here. Wearing reflective and highly visible, abrasion-resistant clothing will help, as will cycling gloves and decent shoes. A helmet is also handy. I have dynamo lights that don't turn off and a blinking red light on the back of my helmet that I often use in daylight as well.

Nimepata mamia ya tubulars na nimejifunza ujanja kutoka kwa mechanics bora zaidi kwenye mchezo huo ikiwa ni pamoja na wrench ya zamani na timu ya Motorola na fundi wa zamani wa kozi ya Mavic. Siku hizi tubulars hutumiwa tu katika cyclocross, kufuatilia na katika kiwango cha juu sana cha mchezo. Kuna sehemu tofauti za chini: usalama. Tubulars zisizo na usawa zinaweza kusonga kwenye kona. Hii haifai kuchukuliwa kidogo. Hata faida za juu zimevingirisha tubulars (Joseba Beloki kwa furaha alishuka kwa bidii katika 2003 Tour de France, akimaliza kazi yake) kwa asili ndefu ya kuvuta breki zako zinaweza kuwasha moto wa kutosha ili kulainisha gundi kusababisha tairi iliyovingirishwa. Gharama. Tubular nzuri hugharimu zaidi kuliko kiwiko kizuri. Urekebishaji. Hauwezi kugonga tubular wakati wa safari. Unapaswa kuchukua nafasi ya tairi nzima. Hii inamaanisha unahitaji kubeba angalau tairi moja ya vipuri kwa kila safari (na natumai hautapata gorofa zaidi ya moja!) BTW hii inapuuza akiba yoyote ya uzito ambayo ni ndogo kuanza. Shida. Kuweka tubulars ni mchakato wa siku nyingi, haswa ikiwa unaziweka kwenye rims wazi kwa mara ya kwanza. Kupata tairi kwenye mdomo ni ngumu sana kuliko kuweka hata mgumu zaidi. Now, all that said if you're going to move forward I strongly suggest using mastik instead of tape. Tape isn't that much less messy and the bond seems to be less consistent then a good gluing job.   Park Tool has as good a guide as any on mounting tubulars as anyone: http://www.parktool.com/blog/repair-help/tubular-tire-gluing  A few other tips:   Do NOT use 3M Fast Tack! Some people swear by the stuff. I've personally seen several tires roll from using it. This is especially true with Continental tubulars. Fast Tack actually dissolves the glue that holds the base tape to the tubular casing. Someone a few years back did a study on tubular cements and Fast Tack did very poorly (http://kuktl.dept.ku.edu/bicycle/Cusa1.pdf) Stick to Continental or Vittoria.  Mount the tires to a clean rim, inflate them to high pressure (120+ psi) and let them sit for a while (as in several days). This will make it much easier to mount them.  People will tell you to put a foot in the tubular and then pull up until you hear a popping sound. They claim this is stretching the tire to make it fit easier. These people are idiots. The popping your hearing is the base tape detaching from the casing or threads in the casing tearing. Don't do this!
Hii pia ilifanywa, kwa kujitegemea, na lubiw na Racz in 1991.  See http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/089054019190034Y .

Sandpaper ya Al Oxide inaonekana kufanana na rangi inayoonekana kujenga juu ya mnyororo na safu za aluminium. Vinginevyo ni chuma yenyewe labda, au mchanganyiko. Kutumia pete za chuma kunaonekana kukata juu ya ujenzi huu (nimebadilika kuwa chuma kwenye baiskeli za zamani). Nimetumia nta kwa miaka michache sasa lakini ninaongeza tungsten disulphide kwenye nta kwa hivyo hii sasa ni nyeusi kuliko nyeusi :-) lakini inafanya kazi vizuri. Labda sivyo last as long or is not as easy to replenish as wet lube but has bonus of dry clean chain - ie won’t mark clothing / legs, after the excess wax is removed from outside surfaces of the chain at least. Just got my on-one stainless steel single front ring, new sram chain is there, just awaiting my sun race 10sp wide range cassette, and will then change all over to 10x1 setup.

Robin Milner alifafanua viboreshaji kama aina ya muundo wa picha na muundo kama wa graph lakini mahali ambapo node zinaweza kutengenezwa. Wao hurekebisha mchakato wa hesabu kama CCS na $ \ pi $ -calculus, lakini Milner anaonekana kuwa amekusudia kutumiwa zaidi kwa jumla: maelezo ya semina kutoka muda mfupi kabla ya maelezo yake ya kifo. Kuangalia nyuma badala ya mbele, utangulizi wa maandishi ya Milner ya 2009 nafasi na mwendo wa mawakala wa mawasiliano, haitoi historia nyingi za kihistoria. Milner alikubali wazi mizizi yake katika ambients za rununu na hesabu ya PI. Bado mfano huo ni wa jumla sana kwamba lazima uwe na viungo vikali kwa mifano ya zamani. Are there historical predecessors of bigraphs?   Focusing on the syntactic elements rather than the way they are used to capture evolving systems, an obvious precedent is A. B. Kempe, A Memoir on the Theory of Mathematical Form, Philosophical Transactions of the Royal Society of London 177, 1–70, 1886.  Kempe's paper may have introduced vertex and edge coloured graphs (I am ignorant of earlier usage but would welcome pointers).  Kempe also appears to have had some of the same kinds of general applications in mind that Milner envisaged.  Are there other predecessors that should be mentioned?  (Edit: now marking this a community wiki, in the hope of attracting further answers.)

Shida mbili kuu. Kukamilika (angalia nadharia za kutokamilika kwa Gödel) na saizi kubwa ya nafasi ya utaftaji (kuna nadharia nyingi ambazo hazivutii zaidi kuliko zile za kupendeza). Maendeleo makubwa yamefanywa kwa kutumia wasaidizi wa dhibitisho (CoQ, Isabelle, Agda, nk). Na haya mtaalam wa hesabu anaandika nadharia na lemmas na msaidizi wa dhibitisho husaidia kupata uthibitisho na inahakikisha kwamba uthibitisho ni halali. Njia moja rahisi ambayo kompyuta inaweza kudhibitisha nadharia mpya ni kuchukua nadharia mbili zilizopo, $ P $ na $ Q $ na kuzichanganya ili kufanya nadharia $ p \ wedge q $. Kwa kweli, ikiwa utaratibu wa utaftaji ni wajanja zaidi, basi unaweza kugundua vitu vya busara zaidi, lakini kupata kitu cha kufurahisha na cha asili kinaweza kuhitaji hila na mbinu nyingi za busara kwa upande wa programu. Nadharia za kutokamilika za Gödel ni relevant here because they place a fundamental limit on what can be discovered within any proof system: a computer could never discover the proof of the consistency of its own logic.  This paper describes how the proof assistant Coq is used to prove the four colour theorem. Mechanized mathematics (overview ) is one area of TCS devoted to (semi)automatically proving theorems (and in general using computers to help mathematicians).   One area where automated theorem proving (of sorts) is making an impact is in model checking and model finding. Model checking deals with determining whether a given system satisfies a given property, whereas model finding finds a system to satisfy a given collection of properties. The tool Alloy employs model checking and model finding to good effect, and it's quite usable.

Unaweza kuchukua nafasi ya kujirudia na hesabu ya vidokezo vilivyowekwa, kwa hivyo unachohitaji ni kurekebisha -point -point: (a -> a) -> a ambayo inakidhi fix f = f (fix f) kisha, ukipewa ufafanuzi wa kurudi tena wa f: a -> b, f = φ (f) tunaweza kufafanua f kama f = fix (λg.Φ(g))   Here fix has type ((a -> b) -> (a -> b)) -> (a -> b).  You may consider this to be cheating, but the question is not really research-level precisely because the connection between recursion and fixed points is a basic piece of knowledge. I am guessing that maybe you did not know about the connection.

Hapa kuna safari yangu ya "umbali mrefu", ambayo ni chuma cha zamani cha MTB bila kusimamishwa. Niliichukua kwa saruji ili kuisogeza na nilihisi kucheza, nilidhani reli za saruji zinaweza kuwa zilizofunguliwa, lakini kama kwa picha, kuna ufa 90% ya njia karibu na sura. Nimeinama kufungua zaidi na shinikizo la kidole cha kati. Ufa unaonyesha ushahidi wa kutu, kwa hivyo imekuwa mapumziko polepole badala ya ghafla. Mimi ni kilomita 100 na nina miguu mirefu, na urefu wa sentimita 91. The frame is too small for me at 20" / 51 cm.  The seat post was reinforced internally with extra pipe (I have bent seat posts before). The post extended 10cm into the frame (i.e., well past the crack) and then 29cm up to the seat.  Strava says I've done 2,949 km on this bike in the last 15 months.  So my main question: is this an old-age fatigue failure of the frame, or did I break it by being too tall, or too heavy?  Second – is the frame repairable or is it now scrap?

Nimekuwa nikijaribu bure kuondoa kaseti ya nyuma ambayo mimi mwenyewe niliweka karibu mwaka mmoja uliopita. Nipate kuwa nimeimarisha pete ya kufuli na sasa siwezi kuiondoa bila kujali ni msimamo gani ninashikilia mchanganyiko wa gurudumu-mjeledi-wrench. Je! Ni nini ugumu wa shida ifuatayo? (k. $? Vipi kuhusu the complexity where $f$ is the translation of a Boolean formula under the standard translation? (viz. $t(x) = x$, $t(f \vee g) =  1-(1-t(f))(1-t(g))$ and $t(f \wedge g) = t(f) t(g)$; thus, a $\{0,1\}$ assignment satisfies $f$ iff it satisfies the polynomial equation $t(f)=1$.)

Baiskeli 6 ya kasi ina nafasi ya nyuma ya mm 126 wakati magurudumu ya kisasa zaidi yatahitaji nafasi ya nyuma ya mm 130 (ambayo unaweza kurekebisha kwa kuweka baridi sura). Ikiwa unapata gurudumu mpya la mbele pia, utahitaji kufanya hivyo kwa uma vile vile (uwezekano). Ikiwa utaenda kasi 7 na juu, wewe can get a cassette wheel, but if your Tempo has indexed shifting, you'll need to use friction mode (or get new index shifters) and adjust the derailleur accordingly.   The Schwinn Tempo has 700c wheels and there are decent 700c freewheels with 126 mm hub spacing made by Velo Orange under their Grand Cru line.

Watu kadhaa wametoa maoni kwamba hakuna tofauti kati ya nasibu na pseudorandom, na kwamba kazi yoyote ya bahati nasibu inaweza kuigwa kwa kuamua. Hii sio kweli. Fikiria una kete mbili. Moja ina pande 3 na upendeleo usio na maana mwingine una pande 12 na hakuna upendeleo ni nambari iliyo kwenye upande wa 3 wa kufa baada ya kuisonga n ndio nambari ya kufa upande wa 12 baada ya kuisongesha mimi ni nyakati za pembejeo yako ya kazi ni Mimi na wewe tunapaswa kuamua S. unafanya hivyo kwa kuchagua thamani inayowezekana kwa S na kujaribu kuihamisha to 12 times, stopping when you reach I.  If your function is deterministic you start with an arbitrary S or your choose an arbitrary S based on I. If you are lucky, the 3 sided dice will be biased towards your arbitrarilly chosen S, but there is a 2/3rds chance that your arbitrarilly chosen starting S will be a worse than random starting point. Even if you are able to make a pseudorandom choice of a starting S based on I, you will still have a bias, and you are more likely than not, that this bias will be non-concordant with the unknown bias of the 3 sided dice.

Ikiwa ningekuwa kwenye viatu vyako kwenye makutano haya, mpango wangu wa shambulio ungetofautiana sana kulingana na wakati wa siku, hali ya hali ya hewa, na hali maalum ya trafiki. Ikiwa ilikuwa giza na/au mvua, naweza kuvuka kama mtu anayetembea kwa miguu hata wakati ninafahamiana na makutano na nina taa nzuri, ili tu kupunguza hatari ya kupoteza ngozi. Wakati wa mchana, kulingana na kikomo cha kasi, labda ningetumia pengo rahisi katika trafiki kwenda take the middle of that lane I need to turn left. Or, I'll often time it so that I can blend in with a line of stopped/slow moving cars and smoothly take the middle of the lane, most of the time the other drivers will get the idea ( you're going to occasionally run into a few jerks no matter what you do, don't take it personally ).  Just take your time and feel it out, you'll get the hang of it.
Huffman coding kwa data compression.

Baiskeli nzuri - kutoka kwa mistari ya jumla ya sura kitu chake dhahiri kutoka miaka ya 80. Bomba la kichwa ni fupi, kwa hivyo nadhani hii ni sura ndogo, labda 50cm au chini. Curve iliyotamkwa ya uma ya mbele ikawa ngumu kadri muda ulivyoendelea kwa sababu ya mabadiliko ya utengenezaji. Pia uma wa kulia una mlima wa taa ambao ulikuwa wa kawaida kwa wakati huo. Vipande vitatu vya fedha kwenye bomba la juu ni zaidi ya muundo wa 70s, lakini zinaweza kuwa sio za asili. Baiskeli ina brakes badala ya calipers ya bei rahisi, kwa hivyo baiskeli ya katikati sio baiskeli ya bajeti. Hizi zinahitaji kusimamishwa kwa cable, kwa hivyo labda ni vifaa vya asili. Nina hakika minyororo inasimulia hadithi pia - wana tofauti kabisa kati ya kubwa na ndogo, kwa suala la jino count. Your rims are interesting - I can't tell if they are steel or aluminium (ie replaced later) The only damage I can see is the two stays holding the rear of the front mudguard.  Normally they'd be straight, not bent up which suggests something got in the spokes once.  Minor as long as nothing's rubbing. I suggest you clean that filthy chain and cassette, then relubricate.  That blackness is suspended grit which is slowly grinding away at the components of the transmission. I would call this a touring bike from the early 1980s.  Its not a race bike, but that crankset would help it get up hills when loaded.  The better brakes also help a heavily loaded bike come down the other side. Overall, looks like a loverly bike and a pleasure to ride.

Kama Anthony anasema, chupa / bladders zinazoweza kuanguka lazima ziwe njia ya kwenda. Wanakuruhusu kurekebisha kiasi cha maji unayobeba kila siku, bila kuchukua chumba nyingi wakati hautumii. Didn't use them all the time, since I had bike bottles too, but they came in handy when I needed to go for a couple of days without access to water.  Purification tablets are also a must !

Nina jibu la swali linalohusiana sana. Hopcroft & Ullman -79, p.170: Theorem 7.8 $ l $ inarudiwa ikiwa na tu ikiwa $ l $ imetolewa kwa mpangilio wa canonical mstari wa mwisho wa dhibitisho unasoma kwamba kwa ujumla hatuwezi kuonyesha TM fulani ambayo inakubali $ L $, lakini nadharia inasema tu kwamba TM moja kama hiyo ipo. Haijaelezewa ikiwa hii ni kwa lazima au ikiwa ni upungufu wa uthibitisho huu. Swali ni ikiwa kunaweza kuwa na algorithm $ m _? $ Ambayo inapopewa mpangilio wa mpangilio wa canonical kwani pembejeo hutoa decider inayolingana kama pato. (Hatujaweka vizuizi vyovyote juu ya kile algorithm hufanya ikiwa imewasilishwa na pembejeo zingine.) Nadhani kuna hoja rahisi kwamba hii haiwezekani: kwa hila rahisi inawezekana kuangazia lugha zinazoweza kuamuliwa na waandaaji wa mpangilio wa canonical. Kwa hoja ya kawaida ya diagonalization haiwezekani kuzidisha lugha zinazoweza kuamuliwa na waamuzi. Ikiwa $ m _? $ Ilikuwepo, basi tunaweza kubadilisha hesabu ya the decidable languages by canonical order enumerators (possible) into an enumeration by deciders (impossible).   1. explained: We start with an enumeration of all TM enumerators, which is possible, since given a string it's (easily) decidable whether it encodes an enumerator or not. We modify each $M_E$ in that enumeration into a $M'_E$ that skips the outputs that break the canonical order.  This can be done by letting $M'_E$ simulate $M_E$ on one of its work tapes. $M'_E$ only writes to its output tape the words generated by $M_E$ that don't break the canonical order. Alternatively we could modify each $M_E$ to a $M''_E$ that stops outputting words altogether if $M_E$ generates a word that breaks the canonical order.  Those $M_E$ in the original enumeration that are already canonical order enumerators will go relatively unscathed through this modification process. $M'_E$ will in those cases generate the same words in the same order as $M_E$, so $M'_E$ will represent the same (decidable) language as $M_E$.  Canonical order enumerators and deciders are in a sense equivalent objects, but yet not equivalent, since it's only possible to go constructively in one direction.

Nadhani uwekezaji wa uwekezaji wa kichwa nzima ni kitu fulani kwa baiskeli za BMX. Inafahamika, kwa sababu zilizoainishwa hapa chini. Sehemu za kawaida za baiskeli ambazo zinaweza kuwa uwekezaji-kutupwa ni: kichwa lugs kuacha vikosi vikosi chini ya bracket ganda kiti-kukaa na mnyororo-kukaa madaraja ya taji njia rahisi zaidi kuona kwa nini uwekezaji wa uwekezaji ni bora kulinganisha na njia mbadala Vitu sawa vinaweza kufanywa: (Kubadilishwa kutoka hapa) Uwekezaji wa Uwekezaji: Hii ndio njia ya kawaida ya kutengeneza lugs za hali ya juu. Hii ndio aina ya kongwe ya kutengeneza chuma kwenye sayari. Mhuri na Kuvingirwa: Hii ndio njia ya gharama kubwa ya kutengeneza lugs kwa idadi kubwa, kwani zinaweza kupigwa mhuri kutoka kwa karatasi ya gorofa, na kuunda kwa sura inayohitajika. Kuunda Bulge: nadra, hii inajumuisha kuweka bomba la chuma ndani ya umbo mold and using hydrostatic pressure to expand and shape the tube. Welding/Brazing Tubes Together & Filing:  This is also a common method, but intricate and time consuming. Machined/CNC'd: Possible but not really used. Wastes a lot of material.   The two biggest problems with all the alternative methods are:   They are formed into a different shape from a cold, pre-formed piece of metal (Stamped, Bulge, Machined/CNC'd), thereby reducing strength, or They have some weak spot (Rolled, Welding/Brazing), thereby reducing strength.   In investment casting, the steel is allowed to settle into its final shape while it's hot and allowed to slowly cool. This means that in it's final form, the metal is under absolutely zero stress trying to maintain it's shape. Furthermore, it ensures very even distribution (for example, rolled steel may be thin on the convex side and thick on the concave side).

Nadhani shida yangu ni kwamba ninasoma juu ya kufafanua bila kusoma mengi juu ya $ cc^{bi} $ kabla ya hii. Je! Ni karatasi gani nzuri ambayo inaleta na iko peke yake? I see no difference between $:$ and $|$ the rules for both seem the same. Karibu wiki mbili zilizopita nilichukua baiskeli yangu kwenye duka la baiskeli la ndani kupata huduma. Hapo awali ilikuwa ikiteleza gia chini ya mzigo na mwisho sikuweza kutumia gia ya chini kwenda juu ya kilima ingekuwa tu kila wakati. Nilitaja kung'ara / kuteleza kwa yule mtu kwenye counter. Wakati nilienda kuchukua baiskeli yangu nilikuwa malipo ya $ 170 kwa seti mbili mpya, nikabadilisha kitu cha aina moja ya bolt ambayo iligawanywa (inayoitwa koni au kitu kando ya mistari hiyo) na kuwa na gia zote zilizowekwa vizuri. Niliambiwa pia kwamba mkono wa nyuma wa derailleur ulikuwa umeinama na hii ilielekezwa. Baiskeli hiyo iligharimu $ 100 tu kutoka kwa rafiki wa kuaminika ambaye aliipanda tu na baiskeli ana miaka 3. Kwa hivyo huduma hiyo ilikuwa ya gharama kubwa ikilinganishwa na gharama ya baiskeli nzima. Katika siku chache zilizopita zimeanza kuteleza tena chini ya mzigo ambayo ndio ilikuwa ikifanya hapo awali na haitashikilia gia wakati wote katika mchanganyiko wa chini sana 1 1 kila wakati huteleza hadi 1 2. Pia ni kelele sana wakati mimi Kaa katika gia yangu ya wastani ya kupanda ambayo ni katika 4 au 5 katika gia za nyuma. Crunching ni hatari kidogo kwa sababu inaweza kutokea kuchukua kutoka kwa taa za trafiki au wakati mimi kuweka shinikizo zaidi ili kuacha makutano / mzunguko nk Wakati magari yanangojea nyuma yangu. Jambo lingine ni wakati nilichukua baiskeli yangu niliuliza juu the slipping and the response was kind of like "ah, yeh, ah, that should be OK now" which sounded to me like they didn't take it for a significant ride after repairing.  On the other side, these guys are supposed to be reputable, they have been around for a few years and the bike is not a supermarket bike it was actually purchased in their shop and in their defence the bike worked and sounded like a dream when I took it out of the shop so it is possible they did take it for a test ride even if they didn't sound convincing when they said so.  I'm only an amateur so it is hard for me to describe what the problem is, it's like a split second crunch and it doesn't move down or up gear. Sometimes it feels like it is just slightly out of gear and then after riding for 2 minutes it will crunch for a second and then it will not crunch again unless I change to a different gear. Sometimes I can just sense that it isn't quite right and swith back and forward between gears. Although, when I look down at the rear gears it all looks settled even if it doesn't feel right.  I'm also not sure if it is the rear derailleur cogs where it is slipping or the gears, I have no idea because I can't visually spot it and can't tell exactly where the sensation is.  I would appreciate any advice on what my next steps should be?

Ramani zilizoangaziwa kwenye muda (maelezo kutoka hapa): (inahusiana sana na shida iliyopendekezwa na Magnus kupata) Acha $ f $ iwe ramani ya mstari wa piecewise kwenye muda wa kitengo na $ x $ kwa muda huu. Tunazingatia mlolongo wa iterates kuanzia $ x $: $ x $, $ f (x) $, $ f (f (x)) $, na kadhalika. Kwa kuzingatia $ F $ na $ x $, je! Mlolongo huu unafikia kiwango cha $ F $? Kuamua pia haijulikani kwa lahaja ya kufikia: given $F$ and $x$, and $y$, does the sequence starting from $x$ reach $y$ in a finite number of iterations?  It is open even when $F$ has only two linear pieces.  Remark: for this problem to make sense, $F$ and $x$ (and $y$) must have a finite description. We assume here that $x$ is rational, and that the slopes and breakpoints of $F$ are also rational.  A reference: Asarin 2011.

Hii ni chapisho la zamani sana kwa hivyo labda umeshakutana na jibu kama unavyotaka. Kwa kuwa nimekuwa nikisoma FO (LFP) kwa miezi michache iliyopita. Nina uelewa wa majibu unayohitaji. Kujibu hitaji la positivity, hitaji linatokana na ukweli kwamba upimaji ikiwa formula inachukua mwendeshaji wa monotone au sio haiwezekani katika mifano laini na isiyo na kikomo. Je! Ninamaanisha nini kwa formula ya kukamata mwendeshaji wa monotone? Tuseme unaandika fO $ [\ sigma $] formula na mpangilio wa pili wa bure sema $ \ phi (\ vec {x}, x) $, ambapo $ | \ vec {x} | = ar (x) $, Halafu tunaweza kufafanua mwendeshaji anayelingana $ f_ \ phi $: $ \ mathcal {p} (a^{ar (x)}) \ mapsto \ mathcal {p} (a^{ar (x)}) $ ambapo ar ( X) Je! Arity ya mpangilio wa pili na ni kikoa cha $ \ sigma $ -structure $ \ mathbb {a} $ na $ \ mathcal {p} (z) $ ndio seti ya nguvu ya Z. Na $ f_ \ phi (z) = \ {\ \ vec {a} \ katika a^{ar (x)} \ | \ \ mathbb {a}, \ vec {a}, z \ mifano $. Ikiwa mwendeshaji huyu ni monotone basi tunaweza kukamata kwa urahisi uliowekwa point in both finite and infinite structure following the knaster tarski's fixed point theorem mentioned in the above answers. But, the problem is testing whether the formula written out of the form as above encodes a monotone operator or not is undecidable so we need to get the next best thing. Positivity in the second order free variable ensures the monotonicity requirement is met, its a standard structural induction to prove this phenomenon. Question is, is it enough?   To that, I have no solid answer yet, since I'm still reading. I can point to papers on this front. At least the one explaining ideas I mentioned here, are from the paper, Monotone vs Positive - Ajtai, Gurevich. It also further mentions another paper Fixed point extensions of first order logic by Gurevich and Shelah that states the fixed point operator when applied to the positive formula doesn't lose expressive power when compared with the application being done over arbitrary monotone formulas.
Swali la kawaida: Je! Kuna mbinu zozote za kukadiria genus of a graph? I am interested in bipartite graphs.

Inawezekana kile kinachotokea ni kwamba bolts za shina hazitoi nguvu ya kutosha ya shina kwenye shina, na shina linaenda katikati. Unaweza kuangalia maelewano ya shina na gurudumu kwa kutazama chini kutoka hapo juu. Shina inayowekwa vibaya inapaswa kuwa dhahiri. Hakuna 'bolts za ndani' kwenye vifaa vya kichwa, kwa hivyo unaweza kumaanisha ama kuziba kwa upanuzi wa bomba au moja of the stem bolts. If one of the stem bolts was stripped the thread in the stem may also be damaged. Try making sure the bolts are tightened to correct torque (should be printed on the stem). If a bolt will not tighten to that torque the stem thread is damaged and you need to replace the stem. You can also try a carbon installation compound that helps grip carbon components.

Sina uhakika unamaanisha nini kwa "isiyo ya kijinga", lakini vipi kuhusu hii. $ L = \ {0^{2^k} | k \ geq 0 \} $. Lugha hii ni not regular therefore, any TM deciding it must run in $\Omega(n \log n)$. The simple algorithm (crossing every other 0) is optimal.

Kwa kuwa baiskeli ni mpya shida inaweza kuwa kila wakati huko lakini haukugundua, au ilitokea wakati huo huo ulipobadilisha mnyororo. Nitadhani, kwamba kila kitu kilikuwa kinafanya kazi kabla ya mabadiliko na yote uliyobadilisha yalikuwa mnyororo, na hakufanya marekebisho mengine. Moja ya yafuatayo inaweza kuwa suala. Anza saa 1 kama uwezekano mkubwa. Mnyororo umewekwa vibaya. Angalia bolts zote na spacers zimewekwa kwa usahihi na vizuri. Kuna habari katika maoni juu ya swali lako. Ikiwa ni lazima kuondoa mnyororo mpya na kusafisha ile ya zamani, angalia nafasi kati ya milo na kwamba mabadiliko hufanya kazi kwa usahihi. Kisha urekebishe mpya na kulinganisha nafasi. Derailleur ya mbele inahitaji marekebisho. Ulisema katika maoni kwamba derailleur ya mbele inabadilika kutoka kwa mnyororo mdogo hadi sawa. Inaweza kuhitaji marekebisho kadhaa to the lower limit screw to make it move down / inwards a little more to give a better change from large chainring to small. This page gives info on adjustment: http://www.parktool.com/blog/repair-help/front-derailleur-adjustment#article-section-5   The less likely solutions:   The chainring is not compatible with your crank or chain, compare it with the chainring supplied with the bike. Chain length. When you change from large chainring to small the amount of chain used will reduce. This slack is taken up by the rear derailleur. As you've put a larger small chainring on, the rear derailleur is taking up less slack, there's a very slim possibility this is affecting the change.  If you removed the crank arm to change the chainring, it's not attached as tightly as before.    Try 1 and 2 and see if they solve the problem. Steps 3, 4 and 5 are included for completeness.

Tuseme tunapewa maelezo ya programu, $ s $, na tunataka kufikiria juu ya mipango $ p $ ambayo inakidhi $ s $. Mtu anaweza kupenda kufikiria kuwa ikiwa vipimo ni 'rahisi', mpango unapaswa kuwa 'rahisi'. Ninavutiwa na taarifa isiyo ya kawaida, au taarifa kama hiyo katika kesi kwamba ninaisema vibaya: Kwa ujumla, hatuwezi kudai kwamba kwa $ s $ $, mpango $ P $ unatosheleza $ S $ na zote ni 'ndogo' na 'haraka'. Ninatafuta vitu vitatu: njia sahihi ya kusema hapo juu rasmi. Wazo la jinsi ya kudhibitisha kitu kama hicho. Nukuu kwa karatasi au maandishi ambayo hushughulikia shida hii. Inapatikana zaidi kwa wataalam wa nadharia isiyo ya utata/ugumu, n.k. Mwanafunzi aliyehamasishwa wa CS, bora. Motisha yangu kwa shida hii inatoka kwa taarifa inayohusiana juu ya ukubwa wa uthibitisho. Ninatuma mchakato wangu wa mawazo hapa ili ujue ni wapi ninatoka kwenye hii na kile nimejaribu. Tunapenda kufikiria kwamba ikiwa taarifa ya hesabu ni mafupi ya kutosha kusema kwa urahisi, basi inapaswa kuwa na uthibitisho mfupi, wa kifahari. Walakini, ni karibu nadharia ya watu, kuisema kwa njia isiyo rasmi, kwamba kuna taarifa za hesabu ambazo ni kweli lakini ni ushahidi wake mfupi ni mrefu sana ikilinganishwa na urefu wa taarifa ya asili. Tamaa yetu ya dhibitisho fupi ni upanga wenye kuzeeka mara mbili; Sisi ni kila wakati kuangalia kwa kifupi, safi, uthibitisho bora, lakini tumebaki tukihisi kutoridhika na uthibitisho mrefu wa kompyuta, kama ile ya Theorem ya rangi nne, wakati inawezekana kuwa kweli hii ni dhibitisho fupi zaidi. Ili kufanya 'nadharia ya watu' juu ya urefu wa dhibitisho kuwa rasmi zaidi, tunaweza kusema kwamba haipo kazi inayoweza kutekelezwa $ F $, kwamba kwa taarifa zote za hesabu $ t $, ikiwa $ t $ inadhibitishwa, urefu wa Uthibitisho mfupi zaidi $ p $ ya $ t $ sio kubwa kuliko $ f (| t |) $, ambapo $ | t | $ ni urefu wa $ t $. Ili kuifanya iwe halisi, hii inatuambia kwamba ikiwa $ A $ ni, kwa mfano, kazi ya Ackermann, basi kuna nadharia $ $ $ ambayo uthibitisho mfupi una urefu wa angalau $ A (| t |) $. Hii sio ngumu sana kudhibitisha. Tuseme madai hayo yalikuwa ya uwongo na wacha $ f iwe hivyo kwamba kila nadharia ya urefu wa $ n $ ilikuwa na dhibitisho la urefu sio zaidi ya $ f (n) $. Acha $ t $ iwe taarifa kutoka kwa nadharia yoyote isiyoweza kuepukika $ \ mathcal {t} $ na $ n = | t | $. Sasa ongeza uthibitisho wote wa urefu kwa $ F (n) $ zaidi. Halafu $ t $ ni nadharia ikiwa na tu ikiwa angalau uthibitisho huo ulioainishwa ni dhibitisho la $ t $. Kama $ t $ ilidhaniwa kutoka kwa nadharia ya kutosha 'ya kuvutia' ili isiwezekane, tunayo utata, kwani mchakato ambao tumeelezea tu ni utaratibu wa uamuzi wa $ \ mathcal {t} $. Marejeleo yafuatayo yanafaa. Joel Spencer. Nadharia fupi zilizo na uthibitisho mrefu. Mwezi wa Hisabati wa Amerika, 1983. http://www.jstor.org/stable/2975571 F. H. Norwood. Uthibitisho mrefu. Mwezi wa Mathematics wa Amerika, 1982. http://www.jstor.org/stable/2320927 Mtu anaweza ramani wazo hili kwa Mashine ya Kujaribu: Hakuwepo kazi ya $ F $, kwamba kwa mashine zote za Turing $ m $, Ikiwa $ M $ halts, basi inasimama ndani ya $ F (n) hatua za $ ambapo $ N $ ni saizi ya $ m $ chini ya mpango fulani wa usimbuaji wa mashine ya Kujaribu. Mtu anaweza kutoa hoja kama hiyo hapo juu, kimsingi akitoa utaratibu wa kuamua shida ya kukomesha. Nilitarajia kufanya madai kama hayo juu ya saizi ya mpango ambao unakidhi maelezo: Hakuwepo kazi ya $ F $, kwamba kwa maelezo yote ya programu $ S $, ikiwa $ S $ imeridhika na programu fulani, Halafu urefu wa mpango mfupi zaidi $ P $ ambayo inakidhi $ S $ sio kubwa kuliko $ F (| s |) $, ambapo $ | s | $ ni urefu wa $ s $. Inageuka hii sio kweli. Kwa nini isiwe hivyo? Vizuri, maybe some version of it is true, but not the way that I had formulated it.  One thing to notice is that this immediately calls to mind the notion of Kolmogorov complexity. Roughly speaking, the Kolmogorov complexity of a string, $w$ is the length of the smallest program that outputs $w$ when taking no input. As it turns out, the Kolmogorov complexity of a string is often smaller than $|w|$, and never larger than $|w|$ by more than a programming-language-dependent constant. So this isn't really what we want.   Why not? Specifying a program by providing a single string that must be the output of the program is not a very powerful or flexible way to specify programs. In some sense, the specification language is very weak compared to the implementation programming language (which is presumably Turing complete). At the other extreme, a Turing-complete specification language and an implementation language that can do nothing except print a single string constant is useless. What we would like to be able to do is state something like ``on input $n$, the program outputs the $n$th Fibonacci number'', and then consider the size of the smallest program in a Turing-complete model of computation that behaves this way.   Specification. We first need to define what we mean by a specification. Here is an attempt. Let $S(u,v)$ be a computable binary predicate on binary strings. We interpret the first argument $u$ as the initial configuration of a Turing machine tape and $v$ as the configuration of the Turing machine tape when (and if) it halts. The specification indicates that for any pair of binary strings $(u,v)$ the desired TM when initialized with $u$ on the tape halts with $v$ on the tape if and only if $S(u,v)$. \  Specification Size. Since $S$ is a computable binary predicate, there exists a TM, say $M_S$ such that when provided $(u,v)$ as input on the tape, indicates whether $S(u,v)$ holds (say by printing 0 or 1 as the case may be). We then take the size of the specification to be the size of the (smallest?) $M_S$ that computes $S(u,v)$. We take the size of a Turing machine to be, say, the length of the description of the state transition relation.   Constructing a program that satisfies a spec with only constant overhead. With the specification phrased this way, one can construct a TM, $M$ that takes the spec $S$ as input and computes a function $g$ such that $g(u) = v$ if and only if $S(u,v)$ holds.   Outline of the operation of $M$, that takes $u$ as input on the tape:   Let $\mathcal{M} = \{M_1, M_2, \ldots \}$ be an enumeration of all possible Turing machines. Using a dovetailed computation, run every $M_i$ for $j$ steps on $u$. If $M_i$ halts with final tape configuration $v$, simulate $M_S$ on input $(u,v)$. If $M_S(u,v)$ halts in an accept state, then output $v$ and halt.   The above will be a fixed size machine that satisfies an arbitrary computable specification by outputting $v$ for input $u$ if and only if $S(u,v)$.  So now where are we? The above discussion seems to provide a counter example, and it does, but at a high price. The machine $M$ as described will take A LOT of steps. So now we are in a position to restate our earlier claim as a new conjecture:  Informally, there are specifications where the program that satisfies the specification cannot be both small and fast.   This is where I am stuck.  I've found one seemingly relevant paper, and I am slowly digesting it:  Manuel Bloom. On the Size of Machines. Information and Control, 1967.  https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0019995867905463  I've also tried to see how Rice's Theorem applies here, but I don't quite see that either. It seems like this problem combines both semantic and syntactic properties.  Any pointers would be greatly appreciated.

Ikiwa unapata mibofyo mingi kwa umoja wa gurudumu la mapinduzi (inayohusiana na hata mvutano uliozungumziwa) sio suala hapa. Safari ya bumpy kwenye gari haitaharibu gurudumu - magurudumu ya baiskeli yaliyopigwa ni kweli yenye nguvu. Ukweli wa gurudumu ni rahisi kuangalia. Na gurudumu lililowekwa chini ya ardhi spin gurudumu na uangalie jamaa wa mdomo kwa hatua rahisi kama vile pedi za caliper za kuvunja. Ikiwa una disc brakes kipande cha mkanda au tie ya zip kwenye kukaa kwa mnyororo inafanya kazi vizuri. Magurudumu mengine yatakuwa na kupotoka kwa baadaye au radi, lakini ikiwa mdomo hautagonga kitu chochote kisichosababisha shida hii. A loose spoke would create a click once per wheel revolution so that’s not the problem either.   I strongly suspect you have a problem with a bearing. Hold the wheel off the ground, grab the tire/rim and rotate the wheel. If you feel resistance, grinding or 'notchiness' there is a problem. Also try to push the rim back and forth laterally, there should not be any lateral movement or play. You can also take the wheel out and turn the axle by hand to feel for resistance, grinding, notchiness, or play  Next step is to determine what kind of hub you have and how to disassemble it to find out what broke.

Shida kuu ni kuvunja mwanga kunaweza kuchoma breki kupungua kwa ufanisi wa jumla. Kitendo cha kawaida ni ~ 30 vituo ngumu inahitajika kulala kwenye pedi. Kwa hivyo best thing to do is go for a ride and get up to 30+ km/h and then brake hard down to stopped.  Repeat.  And then see if your brakes work better.

Unauliza maswali kadhaa ambayo ni sawa lakini tofauti. Je! Kwa nini kitabu cha hott haitumii usimbuaji wa kanisa kwa aina za data? Encodings za kanisa hazifanyi kazi katika nadharia ya aina ya Martin-Löf, kwa sababu mbili. Kwanza, MLTT ni ya utabiri. Kuna uongozi wa ulimwengu, na kila aina huishi katika kiwango fulani cha ulimwengu, na aina kwa kiwango cha $ N $ inaweza tu kumaliza aina katika viwango vidogo vya ulimwengu $ k <n $. Encodings za kanisa kama katika Mfumo F au COC zinahitaji upendeleo usio na maana, ambapo unaweza kusisitiza viwango vya aina na aina ambazo ni sawa, au hata kubwa. Pili, hata ikiwa umeelezea data kama nambari za asili na encodings za kanisa, kufanya uthibitisho na aina hizi, unahitaji kanuni za ujanibishaji ili kudhibitisha mambo juu yao. Ili kupata kanuni za ujanibishaji wa encodings za kanisa, unahitaji kutumia hoja kulingana na usawa wa Reynolds, na swali la jinsi ya kuweka kanuni za ndani kwa nadharia ya aina bado haijatulia kabisa. . was written!)  Next, you are asking why the foundation is not minimal. This is actually one of the distinctive sociological features of type-theoretic foundations -- type theorists regard having a small set of rules as a technical convenience, without much foundational significance. It's far, far more important to have the right set of rules, rather than the smallest set of rules.   We develop type theories to be used by mathematicians and programmers, and it's very, very important that the proofs done within type theory are the ones that mathematicians and programmers regard as being done in the right way. This is because the arguments mathematicians typically regard as having good style typically are structured using the key algebraic and geometrical principles of the domain of study. If you have to use complicated encodings then much structure is lost or obscured.   This is why even type-theoretic presentations of propositional classical logic invariably give all the logical connectives, even though it is formally equivalent to a logic with just NAND. Sure, all the boolean connectives can be encoded with NAND, but that encoding obscures the structure of the logic.

Chaguo jingine lenye nguvu kwa kuchora picha ni asymptote. Ni lugha, sio GUI, na mpira umeoka ndani. Ikiwa unajua metapost ya Knuth basi fikiria kama hiyo lakini kwa kuchora hupanuliwa hadi 3D na kwa syntax inayojulikana zaidi, kwa kuwa kawaida hutengeneza kusimama -Kuna picha ambazo unaingiza kwenye hati. Ni kwa uhuru available, under current development, and comes with TeX Live or MiKTeX.  For folks who know TikZ, one contrast is that there you usually include the drawing generation as part of the document, which adds complexity, and here the 3D stuff is arguably more powerful.  There is a great tutorial, and a large number of packages, including an unofficial graph package that I find useful.

Tuseme kwamba $ f_ {1}, ..., f_ {k}: \ {0,1 \}^{r} \ kulia \ {0,1 \}^{r} $ ni kazi za biolojia. Kwa $ n \ geq r $, wacha $ g_ {f_ {1}, ..., f_ {k}; r} = \ subseteq s (\ {0,1 \}^{n}) $ kuwa kikundi kidogo inayozalishwa na i. Kazi $ f_ {i} \ mara id_ {n-r} $ ambapo $ id_ {n-r}: \ {0,1 \}^{n-} \ kulia \ {0,1 \}^{n-} ni kazi ya indetity , na II. Mappings $ \ pi _ {\ sigma} $ kwa vibali $ \ sigma \ katika s_ {n} $ ambapo $ \ pi _ {\ sigma} (x_ {1}, ..., x_ {n}) = (x _ {\ Sigma (1)}, ..., x _ {\ sigma (n)}) $. Acha $ t_ {f_ {1}, ..., f_ {k}; n} $ kuwa nambari kubwa ya asili $ m $ kiasi kwamba kikundi cha ulinganifu $ s_ {m} $ embeds katika kikundi $ g_ {f_ {1 }, ..., f_ {k}; r} $. Tunasema hivyo $(f_{1},...,f_{k})$ is of exponential growth if there is some $\alpha>1$ and $c>0$ where $t_{f_{1},...,f_{k};n}>c\cdot\alpha^{n}$ for all $n\geq r$. We say that $(f_{1},...,f_{k})$ is of polynomial growth if there is some polynomial $p$ where $t_{f_{1},...,f_{k};n}<p(n)$ for all $n\geq r$. We say that $(f_{1},...,f_{k})$ is of intermediate growth if it is not of polynomial nor exponential growth. Does there exist a collection of bijective functions $(f_{1},...,f_{k})$ of intermediate growth?

Nilijua mfano wa BSS wa hesabu hivi karibuni. Ninaona kuwa mfano bora wa hesabu ya kusoma ugumu wa njia za uchambuzi wa hesabu (taz. Ugumu na hesabu halisi; Blum, Cucker, Shub, Smale.) Nadharia nyingi za kujifunza za PAC zinahusika na mfano wa kawaida wa hesabu. Nilikuwa najiuliza, are there any research or literature regarding PAC learning in the BSS model?   The reason is that most of practical methods of computation over real numbers are based on numerical analysis which seem disconnected from the standard PAC learning developed in TCS community. Whereas the BSS model seems natural and well-suited for such studies.

Kwa kadiri ninavyoweza kuona kutoka kwa picha yako, uharibifu wa baiskeli yako ulisababisha rangi hiyo Fleck lakini nyuzi za kaboni zinaonekana kuwa sawa. Kufanya kitu chochote kinachoweza kuhatarisha kunaweza kuharibu nyuzi. Ikiwa baiskeli yako iko chini ya dhamana, ningeuliza mtengenezaji. Ikiwa sivyo, ningepaka rangi kwa uangalifu juu ya chipsi ili kuziba nyuma na kuzuia uharibifu zaidi (wa mwili na UV) kwa nyuzi za kaboni. Ikiwa baiskeli yako ni ya hivi karibuni, mtengenezaji au duka lako la baiskeli (LBS) anaweza kupata rangi ya kugusa katika rangi inayofaa. Tena, unaweza kutaka kuuliza na mtengenezaji kile unahitaji kufanya ili kudumisha dhamana yako ya sura. Ikiwa huwezi kupata rangi halisi kupitia lbs yako au mtengenezaji, unaweza kwenda kwenye duka la sehemu za auto na uangalie safu zao za rangi za kugusa na kupata kitu karibu na vya kutosha. Hii inaweza kuwa ngumu kwani chips ziko katika eneo ambalo rangi inafifia kuwa nyeusi. Rangi ambayo ni nyepesi sana kwa ujumla haionekani kidogo kuliko ile ambayo ni giza sana. Wakati uko the parts store, get some clear coat as well.  The little touchup paint bottles should cost about 3-8 Eurodollars each and come with their own little brushes.   Now, with metal frames and when you have an exact paint match, you want to sand down the metal so that you can remove any oxidation and lay down some primer. But you have a carbon frame, the damaged area is so small, and sanding may cause more fibers to abrade so I wouldn't risk sanding it.  Instead, I'd clean the area with some isopropyl alcohol and then apply the touch up paint very carefully. The area is so small that you likely won't need primer either but if you got some, it wouldn't hurt. Thin layers applied multiple times with time in between to dry is better than a blob of paint.   After the final layer had dried, apply the clear coat.   Ps. Don't use clear nail polish lacquer as it yellows under UV and age and is quite brittle. It's only designed to last a few weeks at most and then its removed and reapplied.
