Shida yako ni kweli katika $ \ maandishi {dp} $-kamili. . {Dp} $-Tatizo kamili la SAT-UNSAT, ambalo lina jozi zote $ (\ varphi_1, \ varphi_2) $ ya fomula za proposil kama kwamba $ \ varphi_1 $ ni ya kuridhisha na $ \ varphi_2 $ haifai. Kwa kuzingatia mfano $ (\ varphi, t_0, k) $ ya shida yako, tunaunda mfano $ (\ varphi_1, \ varphi_2) $ ya Sat-UNSAT. Shida ya kuamua ikiwa kuna $ t_1 $ kama kwamba $ t_1 $ inatofautiana kutoka $ t_0 $ katika angalau $ k $ maeneo na $ t_0 (\ varphi) \ neq t_1 (\ varphi) $ ni katika $ \ maandishi {np } $, kwa hivyo (kwa $ \ maandishi {np} $-ukamilifu wa SAT) tunaweza kuunda $ \ varphi_1 $ katika wakati wa poly ambayo inaweza kuridhisha ikiwa tu ikiwa $ T_1 inafaa. Vivyo hivyo, shida ya kuamua ikiwa kwa $ t_2 $ zote ambazo zinatofautiana kutoka $ t_0 $ kwa sehemu zaidi ya $ k-1 $ inashikilia kuwa $ t_2 (\ varphi) = t_0 (\ varphi) $ iko katika $ \ maandishi {conp } $, kwa hivyo (kwa $ \ maandishi {conp} $-ukamilifu wa unsat) tunaweza kuunda $ \ varphi_2 $ katika wakati wa poly ambao hauridhiki ikiwa tu ikiwa mali hii inashikilia $ t_2 inayofaa. $ \ maandishiSf {dp} $-ugumu unaweza kuonyeshwa na a reduction from SAT-UNSAT, that I will sketch here. Let $(\varphi_1,\varphi_2)$ be an instance of SAT-UNSAT. Without loss of generality, assume that $\varphi_1$ contains exactly one variable more than $\varphi_2$. Let $x_1,\dotsc,x_{n+1}$ be the variables occurring in $\varphi_1$, and let $y_1,\dotsc,y_{n}$ be the variables occurring in $\varphi_2$. Then let the formula $\varphi'_1$ be $\varphi_1 \wedge \bigwedge_{i=1}^{n+1} (x_i \leftrightarrow \neg x'_i)$, where $x'_1,\dotsc,x'_n$ are fresh variables. Similarly, let the formula $\varphi'_2$ be $\varphi_2 \wedge \bigwedge_{i=1}^{n} (y_i \leftrightarrow \neg y'_i)$, where $x'_1,\dotsc,x'_n$ are fresh variables. We then define the formula $\varphi$ as $\varphi'_1 \vee \varphi'_2$. We let $T_0$ be the truth assignment that sets all variables to false. Finally, we let $k = n+1$. We know that $T_0(\varphi) = 0$. Satisfying $\varphi$ by flipping $k-1$ bits in $T_0$ can be done iff $\varphi_2$ is satisfiable, and satisfying $\varphi$ by flipping $k$ bits can be done iff $\varphi_1$ is satisfiable. Together, $k$ is the minimal number of bits to flip to satisfy $\varphi$ if and only if $(\varphi_1,\varphi_2) \in$ SAT-UNSAT.

Ninajaribu kupunguza shida ifuatayo kwa uundaji unaojulikana zaidi. Nina rundo la subsets $ \ {s_i \} _ {i \ katika i} $ ya seti fulani laini. Ningependa kuwaweka katika (disjoint) vikundi $ \ {g_j \} _ {j \ in j} $ kwamba $ \ max_ {j \ katika j} \ kushoto | \ bigcup \ {s \ katika g_j \} \ kulia | $ ni ndogo iwezekanavyo. Idadi ya vikundi $ | j | $ ni $ k k $ $. Mfano: $ k = 2 $, $S_1 = \{a, b\}$, $S_2 = \{b, c\}$.  If $G_1 = \{S_1\}$ and $G_2 = \{S_2\}$, then  $$ \max_{j \in J} \left| \bigcup \{S \in G_j\} \right| = \max\{|S_1|, |S_2|\} = 2$$  If instead $G_1 = \{S_1, S_2\}$ and $G_2 = \{\}$, then  $$ \max_{j \in J} \left| \bigcup \{S \in G_j\} \right| = \max\{|S_1 \cup S_2|, |\{\}|\} = 3$$  so the latter grouping is worse than the former.

Ninajaribu kuainisha shida ifuatayo: Nina $ n $ sanduku tupu ($ n_i $ ni kiasi cha sanduku la $ i $ -th, $ 1 \ leq i \ leq n $) na $ m $ vitu vinavyoonekana ($ M_J $ ni kiasi cha $ j $ -th bidhaa, $ 1 \ leq j \ leq m $). Kiasi cha jumla cha masanduku yote is exactly equal to the total volume of all items. I need to find a distribution of items among boxes which minimizes the number of item divisions.   I suppose this problem is NP-complete, and is some kind of set coverage problem, but I can't find appropriate variation of it.

Nina baiskeli ya barabara ya Z80 kama ile iliyoonyeshwa hapa chini. Je! Itawezekana kuongeza breki za disc badala ya breki za caliper zilizokuja nazo? Sina mpango wa kupata baiskeli mpya kwa muda so I thought this would be a beneficial upgrade because I ride in the rain from time to time.    I suppose my other question would be, if it is possible, would it be worth it?

Wazo la kutumia mlolongo wa michezo kama sehemu ya dhibitisho la kupunguza usalama linatabiri marejeleo uliyopewa (hiyo is implicit in work dating back to the early '80s if not earlier, and explicit at least by the late '90s).

Nilitaka kuchapisha hii kama maoni, lakini kwa kuwa siwezi kujua kabisa njia ya kufanya hivyo nadhani italazimika kuwa "jibu" badala yake. Ninakubali kwamba swali ni nzuri. Kwa kweli, swali lile lile linaweza pia kuulizwa juu ya urefu wa azimio la azimio (i.e., idadi ya vifungu vinavyotokea katika kukanusha, kuhesabiwa na marudio) na upana wa kukanusha (kwa mfano, saizi ya, au idadi ya fasihi zinazotokea ndani , kifungu kikubwa zaidi katika kukanusha). Katika visa hivi vyote kuna mipaka ya "dhahiri" ya juu, lakini haijulikani wazi ikiwa mtu anapaswa kutarajia kulinganisha mipaka ya chini au la. Kwa hivyo, nilitaka kuongeza swali moja na maoni moja. Swali linahusu urefu wa kukanusha. Inaonekana ni sawa kuamini kuwa kifungo kwa urefu kilichoainishwa katika maoni na Massimo ni ngumu, lakini tunajua hii? Na maoni yanahusu upana. Kumbuka kuwa kwa kipimo hiki, wakati wa mawazo unaonyesha kuwa jumla ya moja kwa moja chini haishiki. Kwa width, one instead refutes the whole $A$-formula for each clause $B_i$, in width $w_A$, say, plus the width of the $B$-formula, and then one refutes the $B$-formula in width $w_B$. Assuming that both formulas have constant initial width, the width of the refutation of the direct sum will be essentially $\max (w_A, w_B)$.  This is of course an easy observation, but the point is that it might indicate that the question for space could be tricky. This is so since almost all lower bounds on space in refutation we know of go via width lower bounds. (That is, the space lower bounds were derived independently, but with hindsight they all follow as a corollary from the beautiful paper "A Combinatorial Characterization of Resolution Width" by Atserias and Dalmau.) But if there is a direct sum theorem for resolution clause space, it will not follow from width lower bounds but has to be argued directly, which at least so far has seemed to be much harder. But of course there might be some easy argument that I am missing.

Kuweka baridi 114mm hadi 130mm ni muhimu. Kawaida sheria ya kidole kwa mpangilio baridi ni unaweza kwenda hatua moja, kama vile kutoka 126mm hadi 130mm or 120mm to 126mm. A three speed freewheel bicycle is extremely rare and I'd personally leave it alone, it's just too valuable to risk destroying the frame.

Ninatumia bolt ya wahoo elemnt na sensor ya kasi ya rpm. Wapandaji wachache wa kwanza na baba yangu niligundua umbali wangu uliopimwa ulikuwa karibu 2-3% kutoka kwake, nilitumia saizi ya kawaida ya 2.096m ya gurudumu langu (700x23c). Yeye hutumia polar V650 ambayo huipima na GPS. Wakati ninaporuhusu Strava ipate tena umbali pia ina tofauti hii. Baada ya haya nilianza kutumia kipengee cha kusawazisha kiotomatiki lakini kosa hili bado holds, not much has changed. I also did a rollout test where my circumference come to be around 2.093m. This difference however only accounts towards a 100m difference in distance. Nowhere near the difference that the GPS units calculate.   Anyone of you have any experience with these kind of sensors and data discrepancy? GPS is quite trustworthy when looking at the total distance so I'm not sure what to trust.

Ningependa kuongeza gia kwenye Tricycle ya mtoto wangu mlemavu wa Pashley. Nimeanza kwa kuongeza kasino 5 ya kasi, lakini nimekwama kujaribu kujua jinsi to shift the gears as there is no where to mount a derailleur and not enough vertical clearance anyway. Any suggestions for alternative gearing solutions would be appreciated.

Fikiria data za algebraic kama vile: orodha ya data A = nil | Cons A (Orodha a) Aina za kurudi za kila mjenzi kwenye data ya data ni sawa: Nil na Cons Orodha zote za Kurudi a. Ikiwa tunaruhusu wajenzi kurudisha aina tofauti, tunayo gadt: data tupu - hii ni tamko la data tupu; Tupu haina data ya wajenzi data noncempy nullableList a t ambapo wazi :: nullableList mtu tupu aliyekaliwa :: a -> nullableList a b -> nullableList mtu ambaye hajakamilika ana aina A -> nullableList a b -> nullableList A noncempty, wakati Cons ina aina A -> Orodha A -> Orodha a. Ni muhimu kutambua kuwa noncempy ni aina, sio muda. Mfano mwingine: data sifuri data succ n data sizedList a t ambapo peke yake :: sizedList sifuri na marafiki :: a -> sizedList a n -> sizedList a (succ n) aina za kusudi katika lugha za programu ambazo zina aina tegemezi huruhusu aina za kurudi kwa wajenzi Kutegemea maadili (sio aina tu) ya hoja. Usawa wa usawa: = hata | Odd.  Definition flipParity (x:Parity) : Parity :=   match x with     | Even => Odd     | Odd => Even   end.  Fixpoint getParity (x:nat) : Parity :=   match x with     | 0 => Even     | S n => flipParity (getParity n)   end.  (* A ParityNatList (Some P) is a list in which each member is a natural number with parity P. *)  Inductive ParityNatList : option Parity -> Type :=   Nil : forall P, ParityNatList P | Cons : forall (x:nat) (P:option Parity),    ParityNatList P -> ParityNatList    (match P, getParity x with      | Some Even, Even => Some Even      | Some Odd, Odd => Some Odd      | _, _ => None    end).   A side note: GHC has a mechanism for treating value constructors as type constructors. This is not the same as the dependent inductive types that Coq has, but it lessens the syntactic burden of GADTs somewhat, and it can lead to better error messages.

Madai yaliyonukuliwa kutoka kwa kitabu hicho ni kweli. Sio kweli kwamba $ z_1 $ lazima kila wakati kusafiri na vidhibiti vyote vya $ \ lvert \ psi \ rangle $. Kwa mfano, ikiwa $ x_1x_2 $ imetulia $\lvert \psi \rangle$ (e.g., if $\lvert \psi \rangle$ was an EPR pair) then $Z_1$ does not commute with $X_1X_2$ and $Z_1$ is not a stabilizer of $\lvert \psi \rangle$.

Labda mchezo mzuri wa asili ni yafuatayo: Mchezaji 1 amewekwa katikati ya maze na lazima afikie njia ya kutoka ili kushinda. Mchezaji wa 2 yuko kwenye maze sawa na lazima akusanye seti ya "vifaa" ili kujenga mtawala wa redio ambayo inamruhusu kufunga exit (na kushinda). Kuamua hatua inayofuata kutoka kwa nafasi ya kushinda ni rahisi kwa mchezaji 1: fuata njia fupi kutoka kwa msimamo wake wa sasa na exit; lakini inaweza kuwa ngumu sana kwa mchezaji 2. Hakika ikiwa vifaa (vilivyobaki) of the radio controller are on the vertices of a grid graph of $n$ nodes (suppose that Player 2 is himself on an adjacent vertex) and the distance between Player 1 and the exit is exactly $n$, then he must find an Hamiltonian path in order to move.  To make the game more "interactive", we can also add some extra actions to Player 2 that can only cause a polynomial slowdown in the calculation of the next move for Player 1; for example allowing him to block a fixed numbers of corridors of the maze.

Piston yangu mbili Shimano Xt breki ni kaimu ya kushangaza ... bastola moja haitarudi mahali sahihi, kwa hivyo pedi moja ya kuvunja inaweza kuwa ikisugua wakati wote, ambayo hairuhusu gurudumu langu lipite kwa uhuru ... nimefanya mengi Vitu vya kujaribu kurekebisha. Nimetumia grisi, maji ya kuvunja, and I have also "exercised" the possible lazy seal/piston. Currently the wheel spins fine from my recent "exercising session", but the piston is still more extended than the other one.   What else could I try? Would it be worth it to buy a replacement caliper cheap from Jenson USA?

Unaweza kulinganisha jiometri ya FX na ukaguzi wa msalaba. Kulinganisha mechi, mechi za 56cm. Kulinganisha urefu wa bomba la juu, kati ya 58cm na mechi ya 60cm. Chini ya msingi jiometri ni different.  On another note, the FX doesn't seem to be a particularly high-end bike, so purchasing a complete Surly could possibly provide more economical than moving the parts to a new frame.

Hiyo inaonekana kwangu kama bolt iliyojaa. Unaona jinsi cable imeenea chini ya bolt? Hiyo inamaanisha kuwa kamba zaidi labda zimeharibiwa. Shida sio kwamba kamba moja imevunjika, lakini kwamba kamba zaidi zitavunja kwa muda mfupi. Kwa hivyo ndio, fanya kitu juu yake hivi karibuni. Ikiwa una bahati utakuwa na uwezo wa upepo wa pipa adjuster kwenye lever ya kuvunja ndani na utumie cable ile ile, kwani mtu yeyote wavivu wa kutosha kuacha cable kama hiyo kwenye baiskeli inaweza kuwa wavivu wa kutosha kutovua adjuster in. But I wouldn't bet on it, and either way it's safer to bin the cable and put a new one on, since you won't have much cable left after the fastening bolt which is not ideal (there's a short, sharp end that's hard to get an end cap on and the cap will be poking out at an annoying angle, or without the cap there's lots of sharp ends on the exposed strands).  This also gives you a change to see what the shop you bought from is like with warranty service issues.

Nina maji ya CycleOps 2, na ninadhani yako inafanya kazi vivyo hivyo kwani wote ni wakufunzi wa maji. Wakufunzi wa maji hawana upinzani unaoweza kubadilishwa. Ikiwa unataka upinzani kuwa mgumu, badilisha baiskeli kuwa gia ngumu. Upinzani utaongezeka kadri gurudumu lako linavyoongezeka haraka. Inaonekana baiskeli yako ina mnyororo wa mbele 46 and an 11 tooth sprocket in the back as your hardest gear. This should be plenty of resistance, again, assuming it has similar resistance to my trainer. I usually have mine on the middle chain ring on the front which in my case is 42 teeth. I don't usually make it anywhere close to the smaller cogs.

Kuna Oracle iliyojengwa karibu na $ m \ mara n $ matrix $ $ $ yote ambayo viingilio vyake ni 0 au 1, ambapo $ m> n $. Oracle inachukua kama pembejeo vector ya nambari $ B $ na viingilio chanya, na majibu kama ifuatavyo: Oracle inajibu ndio, ikiwa kuna vector halisi $ X $ na $ AX = B $. Oracle inajibu hapana, ikiwa hakuna vector halisi $ x $ inapatikana. Inajulikana zaidi kuwa kuna baadhi ya Vector $ B $, ambayo viingilio vyote vimefungwa na anayejulikana (wazi) $ C $ $. Swali: Ni hali gani kwa $ A $ ambayo itatuwezesha kupata ndio-vector $ b $ in polynomial time?    I'm actually working on a slightly different problem, and the context is a bit hard to explain: in my problem matrix $A$ represents an incidence matrix for a minimum edge clique cover of a graph $G$. Each column of $A$ is a (maximal) clique in $G$, with a $1$ in entry $i,j$ if vertex $i$ is in clique $j$. Ideally, such an $A$ would satisfy the problem statement.  I am interested in deterministic algorithms, not a randomized algorithm.  I was wondering which search terms I should put into Google, and what type of literature exists on this problem.

Kweli, hapa kuna algorithm: Fikiria trafiki ya posta na ubadilishe kila nodi na faharisi yake kwenye trafiki ya mapema. Kwa mfano, wacha tuseme unapata: 3 4 2 7 8 6 9 5 1. Kutoka hapa unaweza kuona: 1 ndio mzizi kwa sababu ndio nodi ya mwisho katika posta inabaki kugawanyika "3 4 2 7 8 9 9 5" (bila 1) katika sehemu mbili: kushoto na kulia, na kisha kuyashughulikia tena. Fikiria shida ya pili. Kumbuka kuwa seti hii ni ya fomu: (nodi zote za subtree ya kushoto kwa mpangilio fulani) (node zote za subtree ya kulia kwa mpangilio fulani) - i.e. safu za subtree haziingii. Kwa hivyo lazima tu tupate mpaka, ambao, kwa sababu ni trafiki ya msingi, inapaswa kuwa mzizi wa subtree ya kushoto (ni jambo la mwisho kusindika kutoka kwa subtree ya kushoto; yote that follows is the right subtree).  But note that the root of the left subtree is the item with the smallest preorder index.  So this means that in "3 4 2 7 8 6 9 5", the left subtree is rooted at 2, and the problem splits into "3 4 2" and "7 8 6 9 5".  Recursively, we get a tree: 1 { left = 2 { left = 3, right = 4}, right = 5 {left = 6 {left = 7, right = 8}, right = 9}}.  P.S. Note that in this form the algorithm is O(n log n), but it's easy to make it O(n) - just remember in a lookup table (obviously in O(n)) for each element "x" of the array, the position of x+1 - then, whenever you pick x as a root, the left subtree ends at the position of x+1.

Ninaelewa kabisa maoni yako juu ya kununua rack na panniers, ikiwezekana kuhusisha sura/baiskeli mpya, kwa hivyo yafuatayo ni maoni tu kwa muda mrefu. Mwishowe, sio nzuri kwa mgongo wako kubeba uzani mzito, haswa wakati baiskeli kama msimamo wako wa nyuma sio sawa kwa kubeba uzani (kulingana na pia ni kiasi gani unategemea mikoba). Pia (gusa kuni) a fall with a heavy backpack is in principle (more cyclist mass=less acceleration) better, but in practice much worse than a fall with panniers, when the extra weight rests on the bicycle. Also, a backpack won't allow you to roll on the ground, happily dissipating excessive momentum during a fall (this is solely based on my own experience though, somebody might want to ask a dedicated question on this topic :) ).

Shida hii kimsingi ni sawa na kuzidisha kwa matrix. Wacha tuangalie $ \ jumla_ {i = 1}^{n} x_ {i} ry_ {i} $ kwanza, ambapo $ x_i $ na $ y_i $ ni matawi ya diagonal. Ikiwa $ a $ ni matrix na viingilio vya diagonal ya $ x_i $ kama safu ya $ i $ -th, na $ b $ ni matrix na kofia ya diagonal ya $ y_i $ kama $ i $ -th safu, basi the Bidhaa yenye busara ya $ AB $ na $ r $ ni sawa na $ \ jumla_ {i = 1}^{n} x_ {i} ry_ {i} $. Ikiwa viingilio vyote vya $ r $ sio sifuri (hata ikiwa haifai kuwa kamili), basi $ ab $ inaweza kujengwa upya kutoka $ \ sum_ {i = 1}^{n} x_ {i} ry_ {i} $. Kwa hivyo ugumu wa computational wa shida hii ni sawa na ugumu wa kuzidisha wa matrix. Kwa kesi $ \ jumla_ {i = 1}^{n} a_ {i} db_ {i} $, ambapo $ a_i $ na $ b_i $ ni matrices za mzunguko, we first have to apply FFT to $A_i$, $B_i$ and $D$, to get back to the case $\sum_{i=1}^{n}X_{i}RY_{i}$. We need $2n+1$ FFTs of size $n$ for this, so this adds $n^2\log n$ to the complexity. Also in this case, it can happen that the FFT of $D$ has only very few non-zero entries. In this special case, the complexity will be quadratic times the number of non-zero entries. This can happen, if the i-th entry on the diagonal of $D$ is $r^i$, where $r$ is the $n$th root of unity. But already when $D$ has the same entries but permuted arbitrarily, the FFT of $D$ will not be sparse (in general).

Nimekuwa nikitumia viunganisho vya cable ya plastiki, kama inavyoonekana kwenye picha hapa chini, kushikilia kikapu cha baiskeli kilichowekwa kwenye rack. However, they loosen up every couple of months. What would be a better solution (easy to do, and more durable)?

Mtu alitoa maoni juu ya glavu za sorbothane. Ninashuku kuwa hii inaweza kuwa nyenzo bora kwa sababu hii (vibration damping). Binafsi natafuta glavu za baiskeli za sorbothane au baa za kushughulikia na labda pia saruji/kiti cha sorbothane. Kwa kweli kiti kinapaswa kubinafsishwa kwa uzani wa wapanda farasi, na sorbothane inapaswa be contained as in my experience it can turn into sticky goo in temperatures found in hot climates. I also haven't tested how it works in winter weather - but if it's in isolated strips inside gloves that could well avoid any winter related issues with it.

Trailers za tag ni nzuri kwa sababu wanamruhusu mtoto wako kushiriki katika kile tunachojua ni uzoefu mzuri-safari ya baiskeli. Shida zilizo na lebo zimeorodheshwa katika majibu ya Jay. Nadhani weehoo ni hella baridi. Ni sawa katika kazi kwa trela ya tag-pamoja ambayo umesema, lakini msimamo wa mtoto ni wa kukumbuka. Mtoto anakaa lower on a WeeHoo than on other tag-alongs which is better for balance.  There are pedals so the kid can feel like he/she's helping.  If the little one gets tired of pedalling, they can sit back and fall asleep!  It's great for little kids.  Our LBS carries this.  It is also on the web at http://www.weehoobicycletrailer.com/.

Ninachunguza mizani katika* na dhahiri milki yote inahitaji kuratibu za maeneo yote kuhesabu gharama ya H. Hii ni sawa ikiwa unafanya kazi kwenye gridi, lakini vipi ikiwa unahitaji to work solely on graphs where "traveling in a straight line" doesn't make sense at all?  Are there any heuristics that works solely on graphs (i.e. without requiring coordinates of the locations)?

Je! Ni kweli kwamba kwa usambazaji bora $ \ nu $ (sio lazima sare) ambayo hupata utofauti wa chini $ \ mathsf {disc} (\ mathsf {disj} _n) $ kwa kutokujali function $\mathsf{DISJ}_n$ we have for every rectangle $\mathcal R\subseteq\binom{\{1,2,\dots,n-1,n\}}{\sqrt n}\times\binom{\{1,2,\dots,n-1,n\}}{\sqrt n}$ $$\nu(\mathsf{DISJ}_n^{-1}(0)\cap\mathcal R)\geq\alpha\nu(\mathcal R)-e^{-\alpha n^\beta}$$ for some $\alpha>0$ and $\beta\in(0,1)$?

Ninatafiti baiskeli mpya ya barabara kwangu, kujaribu kutambua lazima kutoka kwa huduma nzuri. Disk/breki za diski ziko kwenye orodha ya lazima, lakini maelezo ya pedi za kuvunja ni utata. Sintered: na chuma kwenye pedi, bora katika mvua na kwa waendeshaji mzito, na hupitisha joto zaidi kuliko resin. Resin ya kudumu au Organic: Non-metallic, porous, worse in water.  Much better initial grab, quicker wearing  My question is: Are there any compelling downsides to running a sintered brake pad and a resin brake pad inside the same caliper/calliper?   Resin pad will be worn out before the sintered one - so buy two sets of resin pads per set of sintered pads.

Sasa, kwa ajili ya ufanisi, lazima turudi kwa familia ya hashi $ H $. Acha $ p $ iwe ndogo kabisa ambayo sio chini ya $ 2 \ hspace {-0.04 in} \ cdot \ hspace {-0.04 in} c \ hspace {-0.04 katika} \ cdot \ hspace {-0.04 katika} j ... Vinginevyo, $ \ maandishi {upeo_collision_probability} \ leq \ maandishi {digrii} \ hspace {.02 in}/p \; = \; (. \ leq \; . \ leq \; . = \; $ $ (\ lceil \ maandishi {pembejeo_length} \ rceil \ hspace {-0.04 katika}-\ hspace {-0.05 in} 1)/p \; <\; . Katika} j)/(2 \ hspace {-0.04 in} \ cdot \ hspace {-0.04 in} c \ hspace {-0.04 in} \ cdot \ hspace {-0.04 katika} j^{\ hspace {.02. 2}) \; = \; 1/(2 \ hspace {-0.04 katika} \ cdot \ hspace {-0.04 katika} j) $. Kwa hivyo njia ya kufunga ya Wikipedia ina uwezekano mdogo wa mgongano wa jibu hili. Na Bertrand's Post, $ P $ itakuwa chini ya $ 4 \ Hspace {-0.04 in} \ cdot \ hspace {-0.04 in} c \ hspace {-0.04 in} \ cdot \ hspace Hspace {.02 katika} 2} $, kwa hivyo kwa $ j $ iliyopewa katika nary, LogSpace inaweza kupata $ p $ na mgawanyiko wa kesi na kufanya shughuli za hesabu mod $ p $. Hasa, NC2 inaweza kufanya vivyo hivyo. Angalia kwamba njia ya hashing ya Wikipedia inachukua pembejeo kama mkondo, kwa hivyo (kwa $ J $ iliyopewa katika nary) NC2 inaweza kupata automata ya mwisho kwa kila hashi katika familia ya $ P $. Kwa hivyo, kwa ujenzi wa bidhaa, NC2 inaweza kupata automata ambayo itatumia hash yoyote katika familia ya $ P $ kujaribu sehemu zote mbili za matokeo ya msingi wa automata - ikiwa msingi wa automaton ungesimama bila kutoa pato au kumaliza sehemu isiyolingana na Thamani za Hash, basi automaton inayosababisha itaingia katika hali ya kukataa; Ikiwa automaton ya msingi inatoa pato la kutosha bila yoyote ya yale yanayotokea, basi automaton inayosababishwa huenda kukamilisha0 au kukamilisha1, imedhamiriwa na thamani ya kidogo msingi wa automaton ulikuwa unarekodi. Kwa uwezekano wa masharti niliyoenda mapema, kuna $ H_0 $ ni familia ya $ p $ kwamba, wakati hiyo inafanywa na $ \ operesheni {urefu} (x_0) $ na $ \ operesheni ya jina {urefu} (x_1) $ na $ $ H_0 (x_0) $ na $ h_0 (x_1) $, kwa kila kipengele $ i_0 $ $ \ {0, \ hspace {-0.05 in} 1, \ hspace {-0.03 katika} 2, \ hspace {-0.03 in} 3, ... } 1 \ hspace {-0.02 katika} \} $, uwezekano wa automaton inayosababisha kukamilisha $ i_0 $ -th kidogo ya $ x_0 $ || $ x_1 $ ni zaidi ya mara mbili uwezekano wake wa kukamilisha kidogo. Ni wazi, kwa kila automaton kama hiyo, kuna zaidi one pair ​ $\langle \hspace{.02 in}y_0,\hspace{-0.03 in}y_1\rangle$ ​ of $\big[$strings with length less than $\: C\hspace{-0.04 in}\cdot \hspace{-0.03 in}j\big]$ satisfying the previous sentence's condition. ​ ​ ​ Furthermore, the $p$ family and its outputs  are given by integers mod $p$ and the lengths are restricted to being less than ​ $C\hspace{-0.04 in}\cdot \hspace{-0.03 in}j$ ,  so for $j$ in unary, NC2 can output a list of all such automata. @ Now, assume that all probabilistic transitions are coin-flips, i.e.,  equal probability of going to each of 2 possible next-states:  There are only polynomially many possibilities for the workspace's contents, so the automata's sizes are polynomial. ​ ​ ​ Each transition probability is in {0,1/2,1}, so by Lemma 6.1, (for $j$ given  in unary) NC2 can determine whether there is a pair of $\big[$strings with length less than $\: C\hspace{-0.04 in}\cdot \hspace{-0.03 in}j\big]$ satisfying the condition in the paragraph just-before the at-symbol, and if so, find that pair.  There's almost certainly a simpler method, but as a brute-force for determining whether-or-not  the strings represented by such pairs are equal, NC2 can build the deterministic finite automata from those representations which give one output per step, construct their product, and check  whether-or-not that product automata reaches a state from which [exactly one halts or they  give different outputs]. ​ Thus NC2 can (for $j$ given in unary) output a list of pairs such that  [each string which the Turing machine has probability greater than $1/j$ of outputting]  is the eventually-periodic string encoded in the obvious way by exactly one of the pairs in the list.  Now it's time to show that NC2 can find the probabilities of those strings being outputted.  We start by dealing with no-further-output scenarios. ​ Non-deterministic logspace can check whether-or-not there is a sequence of random bits which will cause further output from a given configuration, so NC2 can replace entering those configurations with entering the halt state.  The remaining configurations all have some way of giving output. ​ Since loops can be removed from any such way, it must be that for each non-halt configuration, there's a way to give output with at most number_of_configurations transitions. ​ Since non-zero transition probabilities are at least 1/2, one will have that for each non-halt configuration, the probability of giving output from there in  at most most number_of_configurations transitions is at least 1/(2^(number_of_configurations)).  That remains the case as long as it stays in configurations which weren't replaced with halt,  so for all positive integers t, the probability of it doing so for t steps without giving output  is at most (1-(1/(2^(number_of_configurations))))^(floor(t/(number_of_configurations)))  That goes to zero as t goes to infinity, so for each time and configuration-at-that-time, the probability of [giving no further output but not halting] is zero. ​ By countable additivity, the previous sentence remains true when "for each time and configuration-at-that-time," is removed, so the probability of [the total output being finite without the automata ever entering its halt state] is 0.  For infinite eventually-periodic strings, apply the previous paragraph, then further modify  the automaton to have it track its output's location in ​ ​ ​ the pre-periodic part ​ / ​ the period ​ ,  as applicable, and halt if it would output something other than the eventually-periodic  string's next bit. ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ The only other way for it to not output the whole eventually-periodic string  is its output being finite, so by the previous paragraph, the probability of it outputting the  eventually-periodic string is one minus the probability of it reaching the halt configuration.  For finite strings, apply 2 paragraphs ago then further modify the automaton  to track [the amount of output it has given, up to the string's length, inclusive],  enter an accept state if has outputted the whole string and would halt (for a reason other than  the following part of this sentence), and halt if it [hasn't finished outputting the string and  would output something other than the next bit] or would output more than the string.  By two paragraphs ago, its probability of outputting the string without entering the accept state is zero, so its probability of outputting the string equals its probability of entering the accept state.  By Lemma 6.1, given $j$ in unary, NC2 can compute those probabilities. ​ NC2 can also  compare those probabilities to $1/j$, so can strip out the pairs with probability at most $1/j$.  In summary, given $j$ in unary and an automaton whose probabilistic transitions  are coin-flips, NC2 can output a list of triples ​ $\langle \text{prob},\hspace{-0.02 in}x_0,\hspace{-0.02 in}x_1\rangle$ ​ such that  the pairs formed by taking the right two entries from distinct triples  represent distinct eventually-periodic strings and for each such eventually-periodic string, the left entry of its triple  is the probability of the automaton outputting that string and each of those probabilities is greater than $1/j$ and for each string x, if the probability of the automaton outputting $x$ is greater than $1/j$ then  $x$ is eventually-periodic and represented by the right two entries of one of the triples  . ​ (In light of this paper, I suspect Lemma 6.1 can be improved to put its problem in TC1.  If so, then TC1 can also do everything relevant to this answer that NC2 can do.)    Applying that to the OP's problem:  NC2 can round the probabilities down to fractions with denominator $j$ and remove the denominators. ​ Since $j$ is in unary, logspace can reduce mod $j$, and thus sample "as close to uniformly as possible" from $\{\hspace{-0.02 in}0,\hspace{-0.05 in}1,\hspace{-0.03 in}2,\hspace{-0.03 in}3,...,j\hspace{-0.04 in}-\hspace{-0.04 in}2,j\hspace{-0.04 in}-\hspace{-0.05 in}1\}$. ​ ​ ​ ​ Note that ​ $2\hspace{-0.05 in}\cdot \hspace{-0.05 in}\lceil \log_2(\hspace{.05 in}j)\rceil$ ​ random bits are enough to make the error less than $1/(2\hspace{-0.05 in}\cdot \hspace{-0.04 in}j\hspace{.02 in})$. ​ ​ ​ For the same reason, logspace can use the list of [triples with integer left entries] and the element from $\{\hspace{-0.02 in}0,\hspace{-0.05 in}1,\hspace{-0.03 in}2,\hspace{-0.03 in}3,...,j\hspace{-0.04 in}-\hspace{-0.04 in}2,j\hspace{-0.04 in}-\hspace{-0.05 in}1\}$ to add the integers, stopping if/when the sum exceeds the element, and then [if that happened then output the eventually-periodic string indicated by the most recent triple's other two elements, else output $\bot$].  Thus NC2 can do those things after it computes the list, so DSPACE$\hspace{-0.02 in}\left(\hspace{-0.04 in}O\hspace{-0.05 in}\left(\hspace{-0.04 in}(\hspace{.02 in}\log(n)\hspace{-0.03 in})^2\right)\hspace{-0.03 in}\right)$  can also do the same things. ​ ​ ​ That means DSPACE$\hspace{-0.02 in}\left(\hspace{-0.04 in}O\hspace{-0.05 in}\left(\hspace{-0.04 in}(\hspace{.02 in}\log(n)\hspace{-0.03 in})^2\right)\hspace{-0.03 in}\right)$ can use  at most ​ $2\hspace{-0.05 in}\cdot \hspace{-0.05 in}\lceil \log_2(\hspace{.05 in}j)\rceil$ ​ random bits to sample from a distribution such that, other than $\bot$,  the probabilities for each output are less than $3/(2\hspace{-0.05 in}\cdot \hspace{-0.04 in}j\hspace{.02 in})$ away from the original probabilities, and whenever the latter is greater than $1/j$, the resulting probability will be greater than $1/(2\hspace{-0.05 in}\cdot \hspace{-0.04 in}j\hspace{.02 in})$.  Now, plugging in ​ $j = 2^k$ ​ and [using just $k$ random bits] and $\big[$using the actual input machine's structure as a Turing machine to simulate reading from a $\left(\hspace{-0.04 in}O(S)\hspace{-0.04 in}\cdot \hspace{-0.04 in}2^S\right)$-state automata whose probabilistic transitions are all coin-flips$\big]$ gives a ​ $O\hspace{-0.04 in}\left(\hspace{-0.03 in}(S\hspace{-0.04 in}+\hspace{-0.04 in}k)^{\hspace{.02 in}2}\hspace{-0.03 in}\right)\hspace{-0.02 in}$-space algorithm that uses $2\hspace{-0.05 in}\cdot \hspace{-0.04 in}k$ random bits to sample from a distribution such that, other than $\bot$, the probabilities for each output are less than $1\hspace{-0.04 in}\big/\hspace{-0.07 in}\left(\hspace{-0.04 in}2^k\hspace{-0.04 in}\right)$ away from the original probabilities, and whenever the latter is greater than $1\hspace{-0.04 in}\big/\hspace{-0.07 in}\left(\hspace{-0.04 in}2^k\hspace{-0.04 in}\right)$, the resulting probability will be at least $1\hspace{-0.04 in}\big/\hspace{-0.07 in}\left(\hspace{-0.04 in}2^k\hspace{-0.04 in}\right)$. ​ ​ ​ (Since $2^k$ is a power of two,  $k$ random bits is enough to choose the element from $\{\hspace{-0.02 in}0,\hspace{-0.05 in}1,\hspace{-0.03 in}2,\hspace{-0.03 in}3,...,j\hspace{-0.04 in}-\hspace{-0.04 in}2,j\hspace{-0.04 in}-\hspace{-0.05 in}1\}$ perfectly uniformly.)  That achieves what you're after.

Unachohitaji ni "mtoaji wa mbegu" na vigezo vifuatavyo: Mbegu ya urefu $ o (\ logi n) $, uboreshaji wa uboreshaji $ n/2 $, na urefu wa pato $ n^{\ omega (1)} $. Hizi zinajulikana. Wakati sijasasishwa na tafiti za hivi karibuni, ninaamini sehemu hiyo 3 of Ronen's survey is enough.  The only thing you will need to show is that your source has sufficient "min-entropy", i.e. no n-bit string gets a probability of more than $2^{-n/2}$, which I think is clear in your setting.
Unaweza pia kupata zingine other problems in http://garden.irmacs.sfu.ca/?q=category/theoretical_computer_science

Hapana. Hakuna mabadiliko ya sura inahitajika. Wakati pekee ambao ningeweza kufikiria hii itahitajika ni ikiwa unaangalia the electronic groupos, and frames that have specific battery mounts for one particular groupo. However, even then I'm sure there'd be a workaround.

Inaonekana kama hakuna slack ya kutosha kwenye cable ya nje ya brake. Picha zitasaidia sana - unaweza kuziongeza na [hariri] dhana yangu ni mkutano duni. Inaweza kurekebishwa - unaweza kununua cable zaidi ya kuvunja kwenye kit ambayo inapaswa kukuruhusu ufanye tena baiskeli. Lakini baiskeli ni mpya na hiyo haifai be necessary.  You might choose to return the bike as "unsuitable" that's up to you.  Aside - we might spot other issues with assembly if you add some clear well-lit photos.  Add one from the right hand side of the bike showing the whole thing, one showing the handlebars area, and if you can a third showing the bike's rear wheel cassette and derailleur.

Ikiwa lugha haifanyi kazi kamili, kuna shida za kitamaduni ambazo haziwezi kusuluhisha. Kwa hivyo, kutoka kwa mtazamo wa ndani hadi lugha, huwezi kufanya kila kitu unachotaka. Ikiwa unataka kutumia lugha kamili isiyo kamili kubuni aina fulani ya usanifu wa kompyuta, pia utaingia kwenye shida. Ili kuelezea au kuiga kitu ambacho kinakusanya kamili, lugha yako inahitaji pia kuwa kamili. Python, C, na Java zote zinajaribu kamili, kwa hivyo huwezi kuandika vifaa vya lugha hizo kwa lugha ambayo sio. Michezo ya video Minecraft na Dwarf fortress can simulate Turing machines, so you can't program those games in a language that isn't Turing complete. Powerpoint slide transitions are Turing complete, so you can't write Microsoft Office in a language that isn't Turing complete, or run it on a system that isn't Turing complete.  A programming language that isn't Turing complete isn't a "full programming language" in a sense, and someone who is telling you that a programming language is Turing complete is assuring you that this language can in fact do all of the things that the standard programming languages can.

Ikiwa gurudumu lako limetapeliwa (harakati za baadaye) ndani ya 0.5mm inachukuliwa kuwa nzuri. Uvumilivu sawa wa 0.5mm kwa mzunguko wa gurudumu. Kumbuka tu kuwa unaweza kuhitaji kuchukua "mkazo" kutoka kwa gurudumu kwani spika zinaweza kuibuka na torque iliyotumika kwenye chuchu. Ni sauti ya kupiga ambayo hufanyika wakati gurudumu lililojengwa upya limejaa kwa mara ya kwanza. Punguza tu spika pamoja, kana kwamba ulikuwa unacheza kama kinubi. Unapaswa kusikia pings kadhaa kisha angalia if it is true and round, adjust as needed.  You mentioned it was your front wheel so you can flip it round to check if you have it dished equally (lateral offset) as is the norm for most front wheels.  A blob of blutac and a pin on the fork blade can be used as a guide.  And finally the wheel will go out of true with use especially during the first few rides, so check it after a couple of months.  Hope this helps.  Mark

Njia hiyo haifanyi kazi: Kuamua mraba uliochanganywa kwa kuchukua barua mbili zinazolingana haitoi mraba uliochanganywa ... Tazama maoni ya Radu hapa chini. Pendekezo linalotumia sarufi anuwai za concatenation (RCGS, ona http://hal.inria.fr/inria-00073347/en/): nilikuwa chini ya maoni kwamba RCG ifuatayo inatambua lugha yako "iliyojaa" juu ya laini ya mwisho Alfabeti $ \ sigma $, iliyohaririwa baada ya maoni ya kwanza ya Radu: $ $ {\ ndogo \ kuanza {align} s (xy) & \ kulia a (x, y) & (1) \ newline a (ax_1, ax_2y_1y_2) & \ kuliarrow A (x_1, y_1) \, a (x_2, y_2) $ \ Sigma $ na $ \ varepsilon $ inaashiria kamba tupu. Sarufi huangalia na kitabiri cha pili kwamba inalingana na barua kutoka kwa tukio la kwanza na barua hiyo hiyo katika tukio la pili la neno. Halafu inadhani jinsi ya kulinganisha mabaki ya herufi za neno la kwanza, i.e. $ x_1 $ na sehemu ndogo ya mabaki, ambayo ni $ y_1 $. Kila kitu kabla ya $ y_1 $ kwa hivyo ni ya mfano wa neno la kwanza; Tunaiita $ x_2 $ na tunadhani kwamba inalingana na kiambishi kadhaa kuanzia $ y_2 $. Kumbuka kuwa $ y_1 $ na $ y_2 $ inaweza kuwa na herufi kutoka kwa visa vyote vya neno, lakini $ x_1 $ na $ x_2 $ ina herufi kutoka mfano wa kwanza. Kwa mfano, hapa kuna derivation inayowezekana ya kamba yako $ ABCABDCD $: $ $ {\ ndogo \ kuanza &(	ext{by } 1, X=abc, Y=abdcd)
ewline               &\Rightarrow A(bc,bdcd)\,A(\varepsilon,\varepsilon)&(	ext{by } 2, X_1=bc, Y_1=bdcd, X_2=Y_2=\varepsilon)
ewline               &\Rightarrow A(c,c)\,A(d,d)\,A(\varepsilon,\varepsilon)&(	ext{by } 2)
ewline               &\Rightarrow A(\varepsilon,\varepsilon)\,A(\varepsilon,\varepsilon)\,A(d,d)\,A(\varepsilon,\varepsilon)&(	ext{by } 2)
ewline               &\Rightarrow A(\varepsilon,\varepsilon)\,A(d,d)\,A(\varepsilon,\varepsilon)&(	ext{by } 3)
ewline               &\Rightarrow A(d,d)\,A(\varepsilon,\varepsilon)&(	ext{by } 3)
ewline               &\Rightarrow A(\varepsilon,\varepsilon)\,A(\varepsilon,\varepsilon)\,A(\varepsilon,\varepsilon)&(	ext{by } 2)
ewline               &\Rightarrow^3\varepsilon&	ext{i.e. success} \end{aligned}}$$  For $0011$, $${\small egin{aligned} S(0011)&\Rightarrow A(0,011)
ewline        &\Rightarrow A(\varepsilon,\varepsilon)\,A(1,1)
ewline        &\Rightarrow A(1,1)
ewline        &\Rightarrow^\ast \varepsilon \end{aligned}}$$  Now, Boullier shows in the previously linked paper that there is a dynamic programming polynomial time algorithm for RCGs, which answers your question if the above grammar is were correct.  The idea is that, although I presented above the instanciations of variables $X$, $Y$, etc. as strings, they really are intervals inside the input string, which can be properly tabulated.

Hii inategemea aina ya baiskeli ya stationary unayozungumza. Kuna mtindo wa zamani na baiskeli ambazo zinafanana na baiskeli za barabarani (angalau katika suala la msimamo wa mwili), na vile vile baiskeli kadhaa za kumbukumbu. Kuna baiskeli ambazo zinafanana vizuri na baiskeli zote tatu za stationary. Walakini, inafaa kutaja hiyo kwa sababu tu uko vizuri a stationary bike, does not mean you will be comfortable on a bike with the same posture.  For instance the first bike I linked to is very much upright.  A bike like that would be fine for a quick trip to the corner store, but you would probably tire of it quickly if you were trying to get some serious exercise.

Nilisoma karatasi Ahmed Younes, "algorithm ya wakati wa polynomial iliyofungwa kwa shida mbili za graph", 2015. Doi: 10.1007/s11128-015-1069-y ambayo imechapishwa katika Usindikaji wa Habari wa Springer. Karatasi hiyo inaonekana kudai kuwa hutoa algorithm ya BQP kwa shida ngumu za NP za min-bisection na max-bisection. Ikiwa ni kweli, hii inapaswa kumaanisha kuwa $ np \ subseteq BQP $, ambayo itakuwa ya kushangaza sana kwa sababu ni kawaida kwamba $ np \ sio \ subseteq BQP $. Kuna matokeo hata kwamba jamaa na Oracle isiyo ya kawaida, $ np \ nsubseteq BQP $ na uwezekano 1. Charles H. Bennett, Ethan Bernstein, Gilles Brassard, na Umesh Vazirani, "Nguvu na Udhaifu wa Kompyuta ya Quantum", 1997. Doi: 10.1137/s0097539796300933 I'm puzzled because it seems to me that  the complexity analysis of the paper  concerns query complexity not time complexity. In other words, it is not clear the algorithm is in BQP. On the other, the implications of the paper  should have been clear to any reviewer  in quantum computing so  I expect that the reviewers really checked  all the details of the paper to confirm the result  otherwise it wouldn't be published.  Is the algorithm in the paper really in BQP? Does the paper really imply that NP $\subseteq$ BQP?   Ahmed Younes, Jonathan E. Rowe, "A Polynomial Time Bounded-error Quantum Algorithm for Boolean Satisfiability", 2015

Kuzungumza juu ya sayansi, kuna mambo mawili hapa: wakati wa hali ya ndani - cogs ndogo na nyepesi kwenye crankset ya kompakt inamaanisha wakati mdogo wa hali ya hewa, ambayo inamaanisha kuwa unahitaji nguvu ndogo kupata kuongeza kasi sawa. Katika hali hii crankset ya kompakt inatoa faida kidogo. Kumbuka: Param hii haina maana kabisa linapokuja suala la kudumisha kasi ya kusanya - yote ni juu ya kuongeza kasi. Ufanisi wa drivetrain - Nimeandika tayari chapisho juu yake mahali pengine, lakini kwa kifupi: na ufanisi sawa wa gia Drivetrain inaboresha na cog kubwa ya nyuma (gia nyepesi nyuma). Kwa kuwa na crankset ya kompakt unahitaji cog ndogo nyuma kwa uwiano sawa wa gia, itakuwa na shida kidogo. Kwa see the overall effect, we'd have to make calculations for each crankset, power input and gear ratio separately, but I'd argue that drivetrain efficiency will be a little more important here (it's due to friction force, which is there all the time), so a compact crankset could be a "slower" option. However the differences in both cases will be barely noticeable on the road, and even less noticeable off-road. Or at least placebo effect can give a feeling of much larger difference than even extreme cases of the above factors - if you didn't know which one you're using, you probably wouldn't be able to feel the difference. So unless you're fighting a Marginal Gains war in a world tour peleton, it's not a thing worth worrying about.

Kama chapisho linakubali, uwepo wa algorithm ya wakati wa polynomial kukadiria kiasi cha polytope ya convex ni mabadiliko ya mchezo. Algorithm ya quantum ni chini ya uwezekano wa kupendeza isipokuwa inashindana na algorithms ya classical. Baada ya yote, bila kigezo hicho, algorithm yoyote ya classical inaweza kuitwa tu algorithm ya quantum badala yake. Hiyo ilisema, bado kuna nafasi ya kasi ya polynomial, na maoni kuu, yanayojulikana kwa aina hiyo ya kasi ni matembezi ya kiasi, haswa ukizingatia kwamba kuongeza kasi ya classical katika kesi hii ni msingi wa kutembea kwa bahati nasibu. . Kwamba kunaweza kuwa na kuongeza kasi kutoka kwa matembezi ya kiasi. Kwa hivyo, inaonekana kwamba watafiti wanajua maoni haya, lakini kwamba hakuna mtu aliyejaribu kujua ni kuongeza kasi gani ya polynomial ambayo unaweza kupata kwa shida hii. Labda hauwezi kupata chochote ikiwa classical bora algorithm has some sort of spoiler, such as a separate stage which is not a random walk with comparable running time.  Here is a collection of papers that all mention the basic idea in passing; again, Google Scholar seems to suggest that no one has gone further.   arXiv:quant-ph/0104137 - Quantum Walks on the Hypercube arXiv:quant-ph/0205083 - Quantum random walks hit exponentially faster arXiv:quant-ph/0301182 - Decoherence in Discrete quantum walks arXiv:quant-ph/0304204 - Controlling discrete quantum walks: coins and intitial states arXiv:quant-ph/0411065 - Quantum walk on a line with two entangled particles arXiv:quant-ph/0504042 - Entanglement in coined quantum walks on regular graphs arXiv:quant-ph/0609204 - Quantum speedup of classical mixing processes arXiv:0804.4259 - Speed-up via quantum sampling A random walk approach to quantum algorithms Discrete quantum walk for solving nonlinear equations over finite fields   The other side of the classical algorithms to estimate the volume of a convex polytope is linear programming.   I don't know there has been any progress finding a quantum acceleration for that.  It seems difficult to avoid a stage of linear programming in order to put the convex polytope in a favorable position for sampling.
Jinsi na wapi kuhifadhi baiskeli yako wakati haujapanda, pamoja na maswali juu ya jinsi ya prevent weather damage and theft -- although 'locks' is a separate tag in and of itself.

DRM ya Einstein ni njia rahisi ya kuelezea shughuli za tensor ambazo zimepata njia katika maktaba za tensor kama numpy, tochi, tensorflow, nk kubadilika kwake kunaturuhusu kuwakilisha bidhaa ya matawi matatu, $ x $, $ y $, $ z $ ya Vipimo $ (a, b) $, $ (b, c) $, $ (c, d) $ kama x.y.z = einsum ('ab, bc, cd-> ad', x, y, z) hata hivyo, hapo juu hapo juu Inakusanya kwa kitu kama A_ katika anuwai (A): kwa d_ katika masafa (d): res [a_, d_] = 0 kwa b_ katika masafa (b): kwa c_ katika masafa (c): res [a_, d_] += X [a_, b_] * y [b_, c_] * z [c_, d_] asili hii ni ya quadratic katika saizi ya matawi wakati simply doing einsum('ac,cd->ad',einsum('ab,bc'->'ac', X, Y), Z)  Would be merely cubic. There are roughly three levels of optimization we can imagine a smarter implementation of einsum to perform.  Decompose an einsum of tensors $(x_1, \ldots, x_n)$ into an einsum of pairs of tensors $x_1, x_2$, $e(x_1, x_2), x_3$, etc to optimize computation time.  Rely on associativity (where applicable) to pick those pairs judiciously (this is a classic dynamic programming problem) and construct the appropriate intermediary tensors.  Discover Strassen-like formulas for the specific tensor computation   While 3 seems clearly out of reach, 1 and 2 seem like they could be achievable exactly with a reasonably straightforward algorithm. Are such algorithms known for generic einstein summations? Have they been studied?

Nadhani unataka algorithm inayofaa, k.v., ambayo wakati wake wa kukimbia ni polynomial katika $ n $. . } Chaguzi za parameta ya $ kupata moja sahihi. Kwa kweli, wakati wa kukimbia wa njia hii ni muhimu kwa $ n $, kwa hivyo nadhani sio kile unachotafuta.) Katika kesi ambayo $ p = m $, hii Jenereta inajulikana kama jenereta ya usawa. Inajulikana kuwa dhaifu. Tazama jibu langu la kupasuka jenereta ya kuunganishwa (juu ya usalama wa IT.Stack) kwa algorithm inayofaa ambayo inavunja jenereta hii ya pseudorandom. Kwa muhtasari usalama wa jenereta (wakati $ p = m $): idadi ya sampuli za mara kwa mara zinatosha kuvunja jenereta. Algorithm inahitaji hesabu rahisi tu na inahitaji idadi tu ya nyongeza na kuzidisha, ikifuatiwa na operesheni ya GCD. Sijui kama jenereta hii itakuwa pseudorandom kwa darasa lolote la ugumu, kama TC0 au AC0; Labda wengine watakuwa na ufahamu juu ya hilo. Kumbuka kuwa ikiwa unachagua juu ya kuhitaji algorithm ya cryptanalysis kufanikiwa na uwezekano 1, na kukimbia katika wakati wa polynomial bila ubinafsi wowote, basi hautapenda algorithm yangu. Algorithm yangu inaendesha kwa wakati wa polynomial, na inafanikiwa kupata $ F $ kwa pembejeo kubwa; Kama matokeo, inafanikiwa kutofautisha matokeo ya jenereta hii ya pseudorandom kutoka kwa mkondo wa kweli wa nasibu na faida karibu na 1. Katika ulimwengu wa cryptographic, hii ni "mapumziko" ya usalama wa jenereta. Walakini, ikiwa unataka algorithm ya kujifunza ambayo inafanikiwa (katika kupata $ F $) kwenye visa vyote vya shida, na ina wakati wa kudumu, algorithm yangu sio hivyo. . producing an incorrect answer, e.g., due to a cosmic-ray bit flip.  My algorithm infers $f$ correctly for all but an exponentially small fraction of inputs. You can choose parameters so the probability of error due to unlucky choice of inputs is smaller than the probability of error due to a cosmic ray causing a bit flip error. So from an engineering perspective, it's essentially as good as deterministic, for all practical purposes.  But it's possible it might not be what you are looking for, if you care more about complexity classes than about whether the generator is usefully secure in an engineering sense.)  In the general case, I don't know what the most efficient cryptanalysis algorithm will be, but I would be pretty surprised if this is secure.  Linear congruential generators are notorious in the cryptographic community for being insecure.  However, you might enjoy the following paper, which while it does not address the specific question you asked, is somehow related:   Inferring sequences produced by a linear congruential generator missing low-order bits.  J. Boyar.  J. ACM 36(1), pp.129--141, Jan 1989.   Also, since $m$ is not a divisor of $p$, note that there will be a statistical bias of the outputs of this generator.  In particular, values in the range $0 .. b-1$ will be slightly more likely than values in the range $b .. p-1$, where $b= p \bmod m$.  The magnitude of this bias depends (roughly) upon the size of $p/m$; the larger $p/m$ is, the greater the bias.  More precisely, the statistical variation distance between pseudorandom and random, due to this effect, is $\delta = 2b(m-b)/mp$, for a single sample.  Therefore, I would expect that $O(1/\delta^2)$ samples should suffice to distinguish the pseudorandom stream from a truly random stream, simply by exploiting this bias.  This attack does not take into account all of the available structure in the output of the generator, so I would expect that better attacks are probably possible.

"posted-price" means that the price of any bundle $S$ is the sum of prices of items in $S$, i.e. $p(S)=\sum_{i\in S} p_i$ where $p_i$ is the price of one copy of item $i$. The utility of buyer $j$ when he receives bundle $S$ can be formulated as: $u_j(S)=v_j(S)-p(S)$ where $v_j(S)$ is the valuation of $j$.

Unamaanisha unataka kuchukua nafasi ya BB-FIT BB kwa bracket iliyotiwa chini? (kwamba pia hufanyika kuwa Hollowtech II ni suala la upande) ambalo haliwezekani. Sura hiyo ni ya vyombo vya habari-inafaa au iliyotiwa nyuzi, sio zote mbili. BBS ya HollowTech II (zile za GXP) cranks zinapatikana zote kama zilizopigwa na kama vyombo vya habari. Cranks za Hollowtech II hutumia pia cranks 24 mm, lakini zile za GXP ni nyembamba (22 mm) upande mwingine. It is not compatible and you need a Hollowtech II compatible press-fit BB (e.g. BB-MT800 press fit) compatible with your frame (the housing dimensions, the outer BB diameter + the housing length).  I suggest to just take the bike to a bikeshop and telling the you want them to install a BB for your cranks. Installing a press-fit BB requires the press anyway, so you can skip the measuring and ordering.

Kama majibu mengine na maoni yameonyesha, unaweza kufanikiwa kupanda baiskeli ya barabara kwenye changarawe huru. Kuna sababu kuu tano, na zote zimeunganishwa: kina cha changarawe. Ufunguo wa kupanda kwenye changarawe ni mistari laini. Epuka zamu kali: Kadiri changarawe zaidi, gurudumu lako la mbele linachimba zaidi na kuzidisha harakati zozote unazofanya. Hii ndio husababisha maporomoko mengi kwenye changarawe. Otoh changarawe ya kina kirefu, haifanyi "kunyakua" gurudumu lako. Inafanya kama fani za mpira na unapojaribu kugeuza magurudumu yako tu kutoka chini yako. Kwa hivyo Amri ya 1: Mistari laini. Kasi unayoshambulia. Inachukua uzoefu ili kuzurura jinsi ya haraka ya kukaribia changarawe; Ni ngumu kuelezea. Njia ya kiraka kipya cha changarawe kwa uangalifu. Kisha kudumisha kasi ya mara kwa mara, hata ikiwa inamaanisha kutoka kwenye sanda ili kuweka nguvu na kuharakisha katika changarawe zaidi. Sheria ya 2: Kasi ya mara kwa mara. Upana wa matairi yako. Nyembamba matairi yako zaidi unazama kwenye changarawe. Kwa hivyo changarawe ambayo sio ya kina kwa matairi ya MTB ni gumu kwa matairi ya barabara ya ngozi. Matairi kwenye mseto au baiskeli ya kutembelea kwa ujumla ni sawa kwa changarawe with practice. So for each bike you ride, rule 3: learn how it handles. The geometry of your bike. A racing frame has steeper angles than a touring frame or a hybrid. The steeper angles accentuate the issues. So repeat rule 3: learn how it handles. The kind of gravel. From light sand with grains of 1mm to coarse gravel with 1cm (.5 in) grains, to 5 and 10 cm (2 and 4 in) rocks. Basically, when the grains are near the width of your tires, it's time to slow down. When the rocks are bigger than your tires you are running serious risks of cutting your road tires: they're just not designed for this. Rule 4: The larger the gravel the slower you should go.   Many falls by gravel novices are due to not knowing the first two rules: smooth lines and constant speed. They are the key.   After mastering those, you can step up to gravel on uphill and downhill slopes, and corners. The same rules apply, but with downhill you have to add smooth even handed braking. On uphill you have to add smooth pedaling.  Enjoy. It's a great skill to have.

Nina mipira 400, ambayo 100 ni nyekundu, 40 ni ya manjano, 50 ni kijani, 60 ni bluu, 70 ni zambarau, 80 ni nyeusi. . n.k, siwezi kuwa na "nyekundu, nyekundu, nyekundu, njano ...." na, vibali vyote ni "sawa" uwezekano wa kutokea. (Kweli, ikiwa biashara ya ufanisi dhidi ya unbisedness ni nzuri ya kutosha, sijali ufanisi zaidi kuliko unbiasedness). Nilijaribu kurekebisha Fisher-Yates-kzuth, lakini matokeo sio bora. Kwa nini Fisher-Yates haitoshi? Kama FY inachukua mabadiliko ya Monte Carlo. And the output distribution treats the same colour balls differently, i.e. it would generate biased result for my needs.  And, the Naive thinking would be to filter out / backtracking all bad permutations from the whole space. When the restriction is very strong, say, if we have only 300 balls and 100 of which are red, then there will be too many back tracking/failures before getting an appropriate permutation.  So, ultimately, I would wish to be able to iterate through all good permutations. However, because the number of valid permutations is too large, i can only randomly sample some of them. I wanna the statistical feature of the "some" of them resemble the population as much as possible.

Ikiwa hiyo ndiyo uzito wa mtengenezaji uliopendekezwa, basi ndivyo ilivyo. Ikiwa unatafuta "uzito wa max" unaweza kubeba, basi anza kupakia. Ikiwa utaenda mbali sana, basi ni chini ya hiyo. Pia ujue upeo wa mzigo wa tuli ni juu kila wakati kuliko mizigo yenye nguvu. Cos tu unaweza kuweka mamia ya kilo kwenye haimaanishi kuwa baiskeli itashughulikia hiyo wakati wa kusonga, na kuvunja inakuwa sketchy kabisa wakati vigezo vimezidi. Walakini, mfano halisi wa ulimwengu. Nina trela ndogo ya mtoto, ambayo imekadiriwa kuwa pauni 35 au kilo 18 za mzigo wa moja kwa moja. Nimebeba UPS mbili za asidi, na nilipima trela nzima kwa kilomita 100 nilipofika nyumbani. Baiskeli ilikuwa ya kutisha kupanda - nilikuwa nikifunga trailer with my 20" folding bike, even at 15 gear inches it was an effort to get over any grades.  And these grades were merely "crossing the crest of a road" at an intersection.   At one point I had to ride up a half-metre high railway crossing, and it was horrible.  Then, going down the other side was like a runaway rollercoaster.   I also managed to barely avoid jackknifing the combination when stopping for a red light.  And for my efforts, I managed to subtly bend one of the stub axles on the trailer.  Upshot - the manufacturers recommended limits are what they set.  While you can probably exceed them, all the risks and consequences are on you.  I would not expect a warranty to be serviced if you routinely overload the bike.

Ikiwa una sarafu ambayo ina uwezekano usio na kipimo wa vichwa vya kutua, basi unaweza kukadiria na kosa lililofungwa la kwanza $ k $ ya uwezekano huu kwa kutumia $ O (4^{k}) $ sarafu. Hii hukuruhusu kuunda mashine na kosa lililofungwa ambalo linajumuisha kazi isiyoweza kutekelezeka. Kazi isiyo na kipimo ni $ k $ th kidogo ya uwezekano. The computation is estimating the probability of landing heads by flipping the coin $4^k$ times. Considerations of running time don't matter when you're worrying about whether a function is computable or uncomputable, so it doesn't matter that it takes time exponential in $k$ to estimate the $k$th bit of the function; it's still an uncomputable function.

Uchunguzi wa hivi karibuni wa njia mbili za njia mbili: Matokeo ya zamani na ya hivi karibuni ya Pighizzini inasema katika utangulizi: Gharama za hesabu za 1NFAs na 2DFAs na 2NFAs na 2DFAs bado hazijulikani. Shida ya kuyasema ililelewa mnamo 1978 na Sakoda na Sipser [32], na dhana kwamba sio polynomial. Licha ya majaribio yote ya kuisuluhisha, shida hii bado iko wazi. Kama ilivyoelezewa katika kifungu cha 6 cha uchunguzi huo, swali linahusiana na shida ya L dhidi ya NL, kwa hivyo inaweza kushangaza kuwa shida bado haijasuluhishwa. Kuhusu mipaka ya chini, Sehemu ya 5 inasema yafuatayo: Swali 1NFAS dhidi ya 2DFAs limetatuliwa katika kesi ya uno katika [4] kwa kuonyesha kuwa gharama ngumu ni ya polynomial, kwa usahihi θ (n²). Hii inatoa pia chini inayojulikana kwa kesi ya jumla. Hariri (2017/09/18): Kuhusu mipaka ya juu, nadharia ya PhD ya Christos Kapoutsis hutoa chanzo muhimu (shukrani huenda kwa András Salamon kwa maoni yake muhimu hapa chini). Sehemu ya 2 ya nadharia ya PhD inataja yafuatayo: pili, it is even conjectured that this alleged exponential difference in size between 1NFAs and 2DFAs covers the entire gap from n to $2^n - 1$ which  is known to exist between 1NFAs and 1DFAs [35]² In other words, according to this conjecture, a 2DFA trying to simulate a 1NFA may as well drop its bidirectionality, since it is going to be totally useless: its optimal strategy is going to be the well-known brute-force   one-way deterministic simulation [47]. So, once more we have an instance of the claim that the obvious, highly inefficient solution is also the optimal one.   [...]      ² As with 2DFAS (cf. Footnote 1 on page 8), a 1DFA is allowed to reject by just hanging anywhere along its input. Without this freedom, the gap would actually be from $n$ to $2^n$.   References:  Pighizzini, Giovanni: Two-Way Finite Automata: Old and Recent Results. In: E. Formenti (Ed.), Proceedings 18th international workshop on Cellular Automata and Discrete Complex Systems and 3rd international symposium Journées Automates Cellulaires, AUTOMATA & JAC 2012, pp.3-20.  Kapoutsis, Christos: Algorithms and lower bounds in finite automata size complexity. PhD thesis, Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Cambridge, MA, USA 2006.

Unayo nyuma. Unaposimama, miguu yako (iliyoinama kwa goti) hutoa kusimamishwa, ikitenganisha misa isiyo na baiskeli (baiskeli) kutoka kwa uzito wa mwili wako. Hii ni rahisi kwenye baiskeli, sio ngumu zaidi. Ingawa baiskeli inaambatana na matuta, sio lazima kushughulika na misa yako kwa kufanya hivyo. (Kweli, kusema madhubuti, kusimama ni ngumu juu ya misingi yako, cranks na bracket ya chini, but overall it is easier on the frame.)  When you're seated, there is still some suspension from your butt and whatever springiness is in the seat, but it's not as effective. The jolts you're feeling are being transmitted through the wheels and frame.  Your bike can't "take it instead of you" because if you're taking it, you're taking it through the bike, not directly from the road.

Vipuli vya chuma kwenye sura vililetwa kwa baiskeli za Trek mnamo 1985. Baiskeli za barabara za Trek zilianguka katika vikundi vitatu - utalii, michezo, mbio - na msingi wa gurudumu, pembe za sura, na vifaa vinavyofaa kwa jamii. Tube ya kiti kilichowekwa nyuma ya kibali cha gurudumu inaonyesha baiskeli fupi ya baiskeli ya gurudumu. Mwaka wa mwisho kwa sura ya chuma na msingi mfupi wa gurudumu ni 1989 kwenye Trek 400, na 660. Kwa sura ya chuma iliyo na lugs kati ya 1985 na 1989 nimepata baiskeli mbili za mbio ambazo zilikuja na sehemu za Shimano 105. - 1987 560 Mfano huu wa beji ya kichwa cha mwaka unalingana na sura yako - 1988 560 Trek ilibadilisha beji ya kichwa hii year  So, it's possible that your bike is a 1987 560 with a swapped out handlebar and stem. Or, it the frame could be one of the other short wheelbase Trek road bike frames in 1987 with the handlebar, stem, and 105 components added.  Look at the catalog for 1987 and compare the parts on your bike with the parts on the bike in the catalog. If you get a solid match then you have a 560.    Also, as Jeff and Andrew indicate in the comments to the original post your serial number may provide you with information about your frame via the Serial Number Decoding Project.  Information derived from vintage-trek.com

Katika "Metric inayofanana" (Li, Vitanyi, et. Al) wanafafanua umbali wa kawaida (au umbali wa kufanana) kama kazi $ \ omega \ mara \ omega \ hadi [0,1] $ ambayo ni sawa na inakidhi Mahitaji ya wiani kwa kila $ x \ katika \ omega $ na kila $ C c \ katika [0,1] $: $ \ DisplayStyle | \ kushoto \ {y: d (x, y) \ leq c \ kulia \} | <2 ... Sio wazi kabisa kwangu kwamba ufafanuzi huu unawakilisha pana variety of "distance" measurements. Their conclusion is that because the normalized information distance is universal in this class of metrics, it is philosophically universal in all metrics we care about. But it's not even obvious to me that Euclidean distance (restricted to $\left \{0,1\right \}^n$) can be modified to satisfy this definition. That's not even close to mentioning distance measures for, say, language sentiment or other distances used in applications.  It would be great if we could say, for instance, that every computable metric has a normalized version which satisfies this definition. Is this known? If not, what is known?

If a customer tells me there are multiple creaks on such a bike or if I can pick up on it from just handling the bike, I might go that route.  There aren't really any ways of simulating load in the stand. There are a few tricks useful for isolating noises in the headset and bottom bracket areas involving sideloading or selectively loading certain areas with the bike on the ground, but they don't simulate full riding loads so they're not a substitute for test riding.

Ikiwa mtu anafikiria jiografia kama uchambuzi wa jiometri ya Worldline ya utaftaji wa Grover, onyesha chini ya metric kwamba utaftaji wa Grover unafuata jiografia. Chini ya utaftaji mdogo pia, utaftaji wa Grover unafanya kazi vizuri. Pia, kwa kuzingatia uboreshaji, chini ya aina ya metric ya Kahler - metric ya uchunguzi wa Fubini - Utaftaji wa Grover hauwezi kufuata jiografia, ona kwa uchunguzi wa ujangili. Marejeo ya Ufanisi, na Utafiti wa Jiometri ya Habari ya Grover search.  Alvarez et al started with showing Grover search follows a geodesic under the Fubini-Study metric, and they explored other quantum algorithms such as Shors algorithm. Though this was done in context of Fisher information, still showed that under the Fubini-Study metric Grover search follows a geodesic. Also, Alvarez et al show under Fisher information assumptions - "Shor's factorization does not preserve constant Fisher's information".

Kufuatilia tu kwenye barabara ya gorofa, baiskeli ya mlima au hali nyingine ya kawaida, tumia tu mguu ambao unajisikia vizuri zaidi katika nafasi ya mbele. Ufunguo halisi wa kufanya wimbo mzuri, thabiti ni kupata usawa wa shinikizo la mbele na kanyagio chako cha mbele na upinzani na breki zako au kanyagio chako cha nyuma (ikiwa unapanda gia iliyowekwa). Ufunguo mwingine wa kusaidia kuwa nimepata muhimu sana ni kujaribu kuweka usawa wa baiskeli ili uweze kugeuza mikoba yako katika mwelekeo sawa na mguu wako wa kuongoza. Hii husaidia kusawazisha shinikizo za mbele/nyuma. Kwa kuongeza, inasaidia kuzuia kushuka kwa sababu ya kuingiliana kwa vidole, ambayo sio mpango mkubwa kwenye mlima bikes as it is on track bikes and road bikes because the front wheel is further out in front of the bike.  If you're trackstanding on an actual track in track racing - like a match sprint race - you'll want to have your right foot forward and turn your bars to the right. This allows you to use the banking of the track as your reverse resistance and your lead (right) foot as your forward pressure. Doing the opposite will make it much harder to control as gravity will want to pull you down to the middle of the track.  This same school of thought can be applied to a hill or other grade when mountain biking.

Hii ni njia nyingine ya kudhibitisha kuwa sio mashine zote za Kujaribu zinazoweza kutabirika. Kwanza ni rahisi kutambua kuwa: Mashine zote za kusitisha zinatabirika; Mashine zote ambazo zinaandika milele kwenye sehemu laini ya mkanda ni ya kutabirika; Mashine zote ambazo zinapanuka kuelekea pande zote za mkanda zinaweza kutabirika ($ n = m, q '= \ empterset $). Kesi ya kufurahisha ni wakati mashine inaendesha milele na kutembelea idadi isiyo na kikomo ya seli zinazopanua tu katika mwelekeo mmoja. $ Ifuatayo $ m_ {u} $ ambayo inapanua haki haitabiriki. Mwanzoni huandika $ \# \ langle m_0 \ rangle $ kwenye mkanda; Ikiwa sehemu ya kulia kabisa ya mkanda ina $ ... $ $ ($ ... $ ni maudhui ya zamani ambayo hayajashughulikiwa ya mkanda) kisha inaiga $ m_i $ kwenye mkanda tupu (kwa kutumia sehemu ya kulia ya mkanda) na angalia ikiwa inasimama kwa $ 2^{| m_i |^i} nafasi ya $ (idadi ya seli); ikiwa itasimama katika $ 2^{| m_i | at the end it clears the right part of the tape and leaves    $$...H:\# \langle M_{i+1} \rangle$$  and jump back to step 2.  Suppose that $M_u$ (possibly padded with some dummy states to increase its size) is predictable by $N_u$.  There exists $M_k$ that simulates the whole computation of $M_u$ up to $...\# \langle M_k \rangle$ (recursion theorem) and in parallel simulate $N_u$ using no more than $2^{2|M_{k-1}|^{k-1}}$ space. Indeed $N_u$ has the same path of $M_u$ by hypothesis, so after processing every $M_u(\#\langle M_i \rangle)$, $M_k$ can shift the whole tape to the leftmost cell and continue with $M_u(\#\langle M_{i+1} \rangle)$ (both $M_u$ and $N_u$ will never use space on the left of $\#$ again). Finally it can discover if $M_k$ (itself) halts in space $2^{|M_k|^k}$ immediately after step 2: it's enough to examine whether $N_u$ is in a $Q'$ state when the simulated $M_u$ writes the $H$ or not.  If it uses less than $2^{|M_k|^k}$ space then $M_k$ can loop right and never halt, otherwise it halts; this leads to a contradiction ($M_k$ would be able to diagonalize itself).

Ninajua Alexander Razborov ambaye kazi yake ya zamani ni muhimu sana na hutumika kama msingi wa uthibitisho wa Blum. Nilikuwa na bahati nzuri ya kukutana naye leo na kupoteza muda wowote kuuliza maoni yake juu ya jambo hili lote, ikiwa hata alikuwa ameona uthibitisho au la na maoni yake ni nini juu yake ikiwa angefanya hivyo. Kwa mshangao wangu, alijibu kwamba yeye indeed was aware of Blum's paper but didn't care to read it initially. But as more fame was given to it, he did get a chance to read it and detected a flaw immediately: namely that the reasonings given by Berg and Ulfberg hold perfectly for the function of Tardos, and since this is so, Blum’s proof is necessarily incorrect as it contradicts the core of Theorem 6 in his paper.

I've not answered the question so...  The gear range for a bike is substantially dictated by the lowest gear - you start with what you need to deal with the ascents you will be tackling (based on your personal abilities and other factors) and then cover a range dictated by your gearing 'til you get to a top gear. You hope that you end up with something that allows you to complete the climbs whilst not spinning out (getting to the point where you can't pedal fast enough) too early on the descents or whilst on the level. Ideally you'd like the ratios available between the two ends to be reasonably evenly spaced and easily selectable.   Mountain bikes tackle more extreme slopes so need lower gears - hence want triples. Touring bikes tackle the slopes with more weight, so need lower gears - hence want triples. On a recumbent you want to spin up hills in a low gear but are even more keen on being able to turn a high gear - hence want triples (and sometimes more to extend the gear range). On a "road" bike you're assumed to be fitter and stronger and to pedal with a higher cadence - you also want less weight so you give up on the extra chainring.

Je! Ni njia gani ya kawaida ya kupunguza Büchi-Automata (au pia Müller-Automata)? Kuhamisha mbinu ya kawaida kutoka kwa maneno laini, i.e. kuweka majimbo mawili kuwa sawa ikiwa maneno "kumalizika" ya majimbo ambayo yanakubaliwa ni sawa, hayatafanya kazi. Kwa mfano fikiria Büchi-Automoton kukubali maneno yote na idadi isiyo na kikomo ya A inayojumuisha mbili states,  a initial and a final state, and the final state is entered each time an a is read, and the initial state is entered each time a different symbol is read. Both states are considered equal by the above defintion, but collapsing them yields an automata consisting of a single state, and thereby accepting every words.
