Kuna kazi ya Minsky-Papert, ambayo ni formula ya kina-mbili, au inaundwa na, ambapo AU ni ya ukubwa $ n^{1/3} $ na ni ya ukubwa $ n^{2/3} $ . I.e., ni $ au_ {n^{1/3}} \ circ na_ {n^{2/3}} $. Halafu kuna shida fulani ya ugumu wa mawasiliano iliyosomwa katika makaratasi uliyounganisha, ambayo sasa ni kazi ya kamba 2 $ N $ -bit $ x $ na $ y $, ambapo $ x $ inapewa Alice na $ y $ kwa Bob. Kazi hii ni $ au_ {n^{1/3}} \ circ na_ {n^{2/3}} \ circ (x \ vee y) $, labda imeonyeshwa wazi kama $ \ bigvee _ {i = 1} ... ambayo both papers you linked to prove a sign rank lower bound. If you look at Corollary 1.1, they're talking about this function, not the Minsky-Papert DNF.  Note that any communication problem can be represented as a matrix, by having $x$ index rows and $y$ index columns. The papers prove lower bounds on the sign rank of this matrix for the above communication problem. (Rank and sign rank being measures that make sense for matrices.) What Minsky and Papert showed was a sign degree (or threshold degree) lower bound on the Minsky-Papert DNF. Degree (and sign degree) are measures of Boolean functions.

Grafu za sayari zina genus sifuri. Grafu zilizoingizwa kwenye torus zina jenasi wakati mwingi 1. Swali langu ni rahisi: Je! Kuna shida zozote ambazo zinaweza kutatuliwa kwa polynomially kwenye grafu za sayari but NP-hard on graphs of genus one ? More generally are there any problems that are polynomially solvable on graphs of genus g but NP-hard on graphs of genus > g ?

Maono ya kompyuta hayafafanuliwa vizuri kama shida ya nadharia, lakini kujifunza kwa mashine kuna mfumo mzuri wa nadharia unaoitwa kujifunza kwa PAC ambayo mtu anaweza kujaribu kushughulikia swali lako. Ni wazi ikiwa kujifunza ni ngumu, i.e. ikiwa kuna darasa ambalo haliwezekani kwa ufanisi (PAC) learn.  Some results that indicate learning is probably hard:   Some classes (e.g. automata) are cryptographically hard to learn. Some classes (e.g. k-term DNF) are NP-hard to properly learn.   Perhaps some good news?: we're unlikely to find an NP-Hardness of learning result unless the polynomial hierarchy collapses.

IMHO Fork ya MTB "Athari ya kufungia" haina uhusiano wowote na tofauti za mnato wa mafuta. Sababu iko kwenye slider ya plastiki (mjengo) iliyoketi kati ya stanchions za nje na za ndani (miguu) ya uma. Kama mgawo wa upanuzi wa mafuta ya polyethilini ni kubwa mara 10 kuliko that of steel the slider shrinks around the inner leg and even pulls out of the outer one. You may try to cut the slider vertically and glue it to the inside of the outer leg, or just block the suspension till warmer days.

Unafanya mambo sahihi. Kwa kuwa crank hiyo ilifanywa, Shimano kimsingi ameshuka kabisa 30/42/52 kote kwenye bodi kwa niaba ya vitendo zaidi 30/39/50, ambayo ni nzuri kwa njia nyingi (watu wengi wanaotumia mara tatu hawana haja ya 52 ). A073 itafanya kazi lakini kujiandaa itakuwa tofauti. Pia ni crank isiyoweza kubadilishwa ya mnyororo, na kibinafsi nadhani daima ni huzuni kidogo kuweka cranks kama hizo kwenye baiskeli ambazo actually get ridden, although it's not a huge deal because the steel rings will last a long time.  If you wanted a crank that was a) Shimano, b) a 100% drop-in replacement including ring size, c) has replaceable rings and d) still real cheap, that would be FC-2303, still available on ebay. (Also this isn't a likely-to-become-outdated recommendation, because that model will probably remain the last one Shimano ever made that fits all those criteria).

Je! Kuna toleo la nadharia ya Toda kwa viwango vya kati vya uongozi wa polynomial? Kwa usahihi zaidi, kuna tofauti yoyote ya nadharia ya Toda ambayo inasema: wacha $ \# wsat $ iwe idadi ya mgawo wa kuridhisha kwa a boolean formula, where $(\log_2 n)^w$ variables (out of $n$) are assigned to TRUE.     $\bigcup_{i=1}^k \Sigma^P_k \subseteq P^{\# wSAT}$ ?   If something of this form is known, a reference would greatly help.

Ufungashaji wangu mzuri ni pamoja na: Vyombo: Funguo za Hex kutoshea baiskeli yako: 2mm, 4mm, 5mm muhimu zaidi, 6mm na 8mm. Baadhi ya baiskeli hutumia 2.5mm na 3mm. Dereva wa T25 ikiwa una breki za diski. Phillips na screwdrivers gorofa. Chombo cha mnyororo na kiunga cha bwana au mbili (inaweza kuhitaji kuondoa viungo vilivyopotoka). Tiro levers viraka, gundi, zilizopo za ziada na pampu au inflator. Valves za vipuri, karanga za valve, na karanga za vbrake na spacers. Crescent au kubadilika wrench pliers ndogo kisu kisu ndogo file sandpaper (emery karatasi) patches kweli zana yangu ya zana ina baiskeli maalum ya baiskeli ambayo ina funguo za hex, screwdrives na chantool. Multitool ya "nje" kutoka duka la vifaa ambayo ina vifaa, kisu, viboreshaji, vinaweza kufungua. Wrench ndogo (inchi 8) ya crescent na kitanda cha patching. Yote inafaa katika mfuko mmoja wa jezi, kesi ndogo ya penseli au mfukoni mmoja kwenye mkoba. Food and Liquids:   Fruits, cereal bars or peanuts. According to the trail and thinking what I would need in case of bike failure beyond on site repair possibilities. For short rides (2 hours or less) I carry only water (600ml per hour), each extra hour add 600ml of isotonic or sports beverage.    That is why I have two cycling backpacks of different sizes for mountain biking. For Road biking I fit my bike with 3 bottle holders and affix toolbags under the saddle or handlebar.  Others:   Personal documents, Identification and a card or bracelet indicating a contact number for emergencies, blood type and known allergies, if any. Money in small denominations (Think of what is needed to buy a snack or beverage Phone and an on the go charger (extra battery or power bank) Protective eyewear, gloves, extra layer of clothing.

Au maoni ya Meir ni karibu lakini sio sawa, kwani ingeridhika na uthibitisho kwamba P dhidi ya NP sio huru hata kama mtoaji hakujua ni ipi. Toleo lililorekebishwa ni "X ni ama hash ya dhibitisho kwamba p = np au hash ya dhibitisho kwamba p $ \ ne $ np", ambapo hash ni sha256, say.  Running that statement through a zero knowledge proof system gives the desired evidence.  However, if I was given such a proof, I would assign higher probability to someone having found a bug in the logical system being used.  It would be quite difficult to surmount that qualification in practice, since bugs in proof systems are fairly common.

Nina magurudumu ya kaboni isiyo na kaboni ZIPP 404 Silaha ya Silaha 10, ambayo nimenunua kwenye breki zangu za Pinarello Ultegra Rim. Sasa nasikia kwamba magurudumu ya kaboni yanapaswa / lazima iwe nayo special brakes.  Question is: How do I determine if I have right brake pads? and   Is it MUST to be special pads for carbon, what if not?

Ikiwa utatafuta nodi kwenye mti wa kucheza nusu, kimsingi ni kushinikiza maeneo fulani karibu na mzizi, kupunguza shughuli za utaftaji wa baadaye. Kozi yangu pia inasema kwamba ikiwa utatafuta nodi na nodi haiko kwenye mti wa kucheza nusu, bado lazima ufanye semi-play on the search path in the tree. But isn't that basically pushing nodes to the root that aren't actually have been searched for?  So my question would be : why do you still have to perform semi-splay even if the node you search for is not in the tree?

"Darasa la kwanza" hapa ni takriban matumizi rasmi ya kifungu kinachomaanisha "kuwa na haki na haki zote", toa au chukua. Njia mbadala itakuwa "darasa la pili", kama ilivyo katika kifungu "raia wa darasa la pili", lakini hiyo inaonekana kuwa isiyotumika mara kwa mara katika muktadha huu. Ni, kama Ohad anasema, hulka ya lugha ambayo vyombo (kazi au vinginevyo) huchukua kama "darasa la kwanza", na pia sio lazima tofauti ya wazi. Kawaida chombo cha darasa la kwanza kingefanya be something tangible that can be created and used as a value at run time, without significant obstacles compared to being defined at compile time. In the case of functions, this usually means allowing higher-order and anonymous functions. A function that is not higher-order is first-order. Functions that are not anonymous don't really have a general term that I know of. But first-order functions with names can still be first-class if the language allows it.

Nilikuwa najiuliza ikiwa kuna mtu ana wazo la nini suala langu ni nini na ni jinsi gani ninaweza kuirekebisha gia ni ngumu sana kubadili, 6 hadi 5 ni ngumu lakini bado inaweza kufanya na kwenda from 5 to 1 is just not happening, however when it comes to going in the other direction the lightest touch will make it go from 1 to 6  any idea how i could fix this?

Rahisi sana - mnyororo mpya ni mfupi sana. Labda ulinunua mnyororo na viungo vichache sana, labda ni kosa la uzalishaji. Shimo (umbali kati ya vituo vya pini) ya mnyororo wa baiskeli ni 1/2 ", kwa hivyo ni rahisi kuhesabu viungo kwa kupima. Urefu wa mnyororo unaohitajika imedhamiriwa na urefu wa mnyororo na mnyororo mkubwa na saizi ya sprocket. Kawaida unapata mnyororo viungo vichache pia ndefu na ukate kwa ukubwa na re-join. When replacing a chain you can use the old chain to size the new one. If the old chain is lost chain length can be determined by fitting to the bike. Park Tool has a good video on how to do that.

Napenda kupendekeza hii http://www.bikesdirect.com/products/gravity/liberty_cx.htm Ninafanya dhana kwamba hautasafiri kwenye nyuso za barabara za pristine na italazimika kujadili mashimo na curbs .. wewe Unataka mpira zaidi kuliko MTB lakini hautaki upinzani wa matairi hayo ya mafuta. Shika na mkoba. Nimetumia Timbuk2 anuwai messenger bags over the past 20 years for commuting and unless you have them full, they slide around and end up on you tummy ... no good. I'm guessing you're going to be carrying a laptop with you. Get a decent backpack with a laptop sleeve and vented back.. Your back will thank you for the ventilation, especially in India!

Nilinunua baiskeli mbili tu huko Australia na ninashangaa njia bora ya kuzipakia na kuwasafirisha kwenda nchi yangu. Wamekaa kwenye nyumba ya jamaa hivi sasa. Labda nitatuma kwa meli kwa sababu ya gharama kwa hivyo kiasi ni muhimu. Kwa bahati mbaya jamaa yangu sio mzuri na zana na hajui chochote kuhusu baiskeli na hajawahi hata kubeba moja, kwa hivyo ninajaribu kufanya kitu rahisi na rahisi. Wazo langu kwa sasa ni kuondoa magurudumu ya mbele na chini na kugeuka the handle bars. Lower the seat as far as it will go, remove the outside facing pedal, and put the bikes side by side facing different ways.  Is there a better way? How should I go about protecting the wheels/spokes during the packing?  Cost, volume, and ease are my main concerns, these are cheap mountain bikes and my guy isn't mechanically inclined to the extent he'd probably have to borrow a spanner rather than own one. Already shipping will probably cost more than the bikes did.

Nilikuwa na shida kama hiyo ya sauti lakini ilikuwa kwenye bracket iliyotumiwa vizuri. Nilidhani bracket ya chini ilipigwa risasi, lakini nilipoondoa ilikuwa sawa. All I did was to reinstall it adding lots of grease to the inside of the lockring -- I think the clicking may have been some motion of the bracket inside the lockring.

Misingi isiyo na picha inashikilia miguu yako salama zaidi na kutolewa rahisi kuliko vidonge vya vidole na sehemu. Kama unavyojua, inawezekana kukaza kamba kwa point where they must be released before the foot can be removed from the pedal. A properly functioning clipless pedal will always release the riders foot.

Kwa kudhani unamaanisha kufikia umbali kutoka kwa bolt ya katikati (kwa kuweka brake ya caliper) hadi katikati ya kiatu cha kuvunja: kwa kituo cha kuvunja kituo (k.m. breki nyingi za caliper), ufikiaji umedhamiriwa na urefu wa mikono ya kuvunja, Na unaweza kupata ufikiaji tofauti kwa kubadilika kwa kuvunja kwa muda mrefu au mfupi (au kufanya bolt ya kushuka hukuruhusu kutumia kifupi cha kufikia wakati unahitaji kufikia muda mrefu). Walakini, breki zilizowekwa juu ya wakubwa kama V-brakes zina "kufikia" kwao kuamua na msimamo wa wakubwa kwa kuongeza kuvunja. Hii inaweza kutofautiana kutoka kwa sura hadi sura (au uma kwa uma) kidogo, lakini kawaida sio zaidi ya 10-15 mm au hivyo kuruhusiwa kwa marekebisho ya pedi ya kuvunja. Isipokuwa labda ni Moto BMX V-BRAKE: ambayo wakati mwingine hutumiwa kwa 26" -> 700c conversions and might be enough for your purposes if you can find one.   Another way to do the swap is with a brake post conversion adapter -- a piece of metal which mounts at the brake posts to provide brake posts further up.   Something like this (commonly used for 26 inch -> 700c swaps -- one for these purposes is likely a bit too big for you):    Plus a V-brake with sufficient adjustment.  Another option I've seen (which I wouldn't recommend) is people taking a rectangle of metal, mounting the brake pad at the top of the rectangle, then attaching the bottom of the metal to where the brake pad is normally mounted. This likely results in a good loss of braking power, plus you have to make sure the mount is very secure.

Naamini sehemu ya plastiki ni sawa na ile iliyotambuliwa na nambari 21/22 kwenye mchoro hapa chini. Sina jina kwa ajili yake, ingawa. I am also not suggesting that this is the exact model that is on this bike but I believe it is the same principle.

Hii ni kweli kwa muda mrefu ikiwa unapunguza tu kuelekea fomu dhaifu ya kichwa. Lakini ikiwa unataka kwenda mbali zaidi, unaanza kupunguza chini ya Lambdas. Ikiwa unaangalia Lambda-calculus safi (iliyochapishwa au la), lazima uwe unapunguza chini ya lambdas ikiwa unapunguza masharti yaliyofungwa. Na wakati unapunguza chini ya Lambdas, haufanyi kazi tena kwa masharti yaliyofungwa. Hapa kuna mfano ambao huanza na muda uliofungwa wa lambda ambapo tovuti zote zinazofunga hutumia majina ya kipekee, huendelea kwa muda na binders zinazorudiwa lakini zisizo za kukamata, kisha hufikia muda na kukamata, ambayo inahitaji ubadilishaji wa alpha kuendelea. Muda wa kwanza sio wa aina tu, lakini unaweza kurekebisha hii kwa kuibadilisha kuwa $ (\ lambda w. (\ Lambda z. W z z) (\ lambda x. \lambda y. x y))$ which is simply-typed and shows the same binding-related issues.  $$ \begin{array}{rl} (\lambda \underline{z}. \underline{z} \underline{z}) \underline{(\lambda x. \lambda y. x y)} \quad \to & (\lambda \underline{x}. \lambda \color{blue}{y}. \underline{x} \color{blue}{y}) \underline{(\lambda x. \lambda \color{red}{y}. x \color{red}{y})} \\ \to & (\lambda \color{blue}{y}. (\lambda \underline{x}. \lambda \color{red}{y}. \underline{x} \color{red}{y}) \underline{\color{blue}{y}}) \\ \to & (\lambda \color{blue}{y}. \lambda \color{red}{y}. \color{blue}{y} \color{red}{y}) \end{array} $$  That last step requires alpha-conversion, to make the blue $y$ and the red $y$ distinct.  Your proof sketch is correct as long as you apply the beta rule in a context that does not bind any variable. If you extend the proof to the lambda context case, it fails when $x$ is in the context.

Nilitafuta mifumo kadhaa ya kujenga kupunguzwa kutoka kwa shida ya NPC, lakini sikupata njia ya kuwakilisha "mtiririko" na "uma" ... kwa hivyo (baada ya kazi fulani) hii ni algorithm ya polynomial .. . ALGORITHM Orodha ya kuanzia inaweza kutazamwa kama safu ya $ N*2 $ mfululizo "shimo". Kwa kila jozi ya awali $ (A_J, B_J) $, weka "kipengee" $ B_J $ kwa nambari ya $ A_J $. Kila jozi inaweza kutazamwa kama makali yaliyoelekezwa kutoka kwa nafasi ya $ A_J $ hadi nafasi $ B_J $. Hoja inajumuisha kuchukua kipengee $ B_J $ kwa nafasi ya $ A_J $ na kuipeleka kwa nafasi yake ya marudio $ B_J $ (shimo la marudio linakuwa PeG isiyoweza kusongeshwa). Tunafuta makali, na kuendelea kuchagua hoja inayofuata ambayo itaanza kutoka kwa moja ya vitu viwili vya karibu vya $ B_K $ kutoka nafasi $ B_J $ (shimo tu kati ya $ B_J $ na $ B_K $ zinaruhusiwa). Lazima tupate mlolongo wa $ N $ mfululizo. Kwa kila $ (A_J, B_J) $ Fikiria $ B_J $ (kwa nafasi ya safu $ A_J $) kama kipengee cha kuanza $ $ $. Kwa kila $ (A_K, B_K), A_K \ NEQ A_J $ Fikiria $ A_K $ kama kipengee cha mwisho $ $ $ (makali kutoka nafasi $ A_K $ hadi nafasi $ B_K $ itakuwa makali ya mwisho). Tengeneza mlolongo wa hatua kutoka $ anza $ kwa kutumia vigezo vifuatavyo hadi ufikie $ $ mwisho $ (na suluhisho limepatikana), au hali ya kusimamishwa wakati unafanya harakati unarekebisha kilele kwa nafasi ya $ b_j $ na safu imegawanywa katika sehemu mbili $ l $ (kushoto) na $ r $ (kulia) na njia pekee ya kutoka $ l $ hadi $ r $ (au kutoka $ r $ hadi $ l $) inatumia makali ambayo kuruka kote Kigingi. Weka $ edgeslr $ = idadi ya kingo kutoka kushoto kwenda kulia (usihesabu makali ya mwisho) $ edgesrl $ = idadi ya kingo kutoka kulia kwenda kushoto (usihesabu makali ya mwisho) $ flow $ = $ edgeslr - edgesrl kesi $: A) Ikiwa $ | mtiririko | > 1 $ Halafu moja ya sehemu hizo mbili hazitaweza kufikiwa, acha sasa tuseme kwamba $ mwisho> b_j $, i.e. $ mwisho \ katika r $ b) ikiwa $ flow = 1 $ basi kuna makali ya ziada kutoka kushoto kwenda kulia, wewe Lazima uende kushoto (chagua kipengee cha karibu cha $ l $), vinginevyo hautawahi kufikia $ mwisho $ c) ikiwa $ flow = -1 $ basi kuna makali ya ziada kutoka kulia kwenda kushoto na node yoyote unayochagua hautawahi kufikia $ mwisho $, acha d) ikiwa $ flow = 0 $ lazima uende kulia (chagua kipengee cha karibu cha $ r $), vinginevyo utafikia $ mwisho $ ikiwa $ end <b_j $ ($ end \ in l $) , B, C, D wameingizwa. Kumbuka: Wakati wa kusonga kushoto au kulia, lazima uzingatie $ mwisho $ kama kilele. Kwa mfano, ikiwa lazima uende sawa, lakini kipengee cha karibu juu ya $ r $ ni $ mwisho $ basi hoja haiwezekani (na lazima uendelee na jozi nyingine $ (anza, mwisho) $) tumia utaftaji huo kwa kila hoja. Ugumu wa mtiririko juu ya kila shimo unaweza kuwekwa katika O (n) na kutumika tena katika kila skati. Matanzi ni: kwa kuanza = 1 hadi n kwa mwisho = 1 hadi n kwa hoja = 1 hadi n kufanya hoja (rekebisha kilele na usasishaji mtiririko) angalia ikiwa hoja nyingine inaweza kufanywa kwa kutumia mtiririko hakuna chaguo wakati wa hesabu, Kwa hivyo ugumu wa algorithm ni $ o (n^3) $ nambari hii ni utekelezaji wa kazi wa java wa algorithm: strangesort ya umma {tuli int peg = 0xffffff, hole = 0x0; tuli int m = 0, n = 0, uchaguzi = 0, aux = 0, mwisho; Tatizo la Int [] [],,, [], Edgeflow [], uwanja []; Boolean ni_hole (int x) {kurudi x == shimo; } boolean is_peg (int x) {kurudi x == peg; } Boolean ni_ele (int x) {kurudi! IS_PEG (x) &&! is_hole (x); }; int [] cp (int src []) {// Nakili safu ya int res [] = int mpya [src.length]; System.ArrayCopy (SRC, 0, Res, 0, Res.length); kurudi res; } / * Tafuta kitu cha kwanza upande wa kushoto (dir = -1) kulia (dir = 1) * / int kupata (int pos, int dir, int nm) {pos += dir; wakati (pos> = 1 && pos <= m) {int x = shamba [pos]; ikiwa (is_peg (x) || (pos == mwisho && nm <n-1)) kurudi 0; ikiwa (is_ele (x)) kurudi pos; pos += dir; } kurudi 0; } utupu wa ujenzi_edges () {Edgeflow = int mpya [M+1]; kwa (int i = 1; i <= m; i ++) {int kuanza = i; int b = shamba [anza]; ikiwa (! " -> " : "") + "(" + demo[j][0] + "," + demo[j][1] + ")";             }                          r = "SOLUTION: "+r;         }         else             r = "NO SOLUTIONS";         System.out.println(r);     }     }

Katika mantiki ya sifa ya sifa, kiboreshaji ni kazi $ f: \ sigma^* \ kulia \ phi_ \ mathcal {l} $ ambayo inachukua maneno kwa formula juu ya a (first-order) language. The formulae are usually interpreted as directed acyclic graphs but they could be restricted to trees (ASTs).

Ikiwa uhusiano kati ya vizuizi vitatu ni "au", basi lugha ni CFL. Suluhisho hutumia ukweli kwamba CFL zimefungwa chini ya umoja. Kwa wazi, zifuatazo ni cfls: $ l_1 = \ {a^ib^jc^k \ katikati i \ ne j, \ k \ ge 0 \} $, $ l_2 = \ {a^ib^jc^k \ katikati i \ ne k, \ j \ ge 0 \} $, $ l_3 = \ {a^ib^jc^k \ katikati j \ ne k, \ i\ge 0\}$ (if one is not convinced, one can look on $L_i$ as concatenation of CFL and regular language. For instance, $L_1$ is $\{a^ib^j\mid i\ne j \}$ concatenated to $\{c\}^*$.  The desired language is the union of the above $L=L_1\cup L_2\cup L_3$. So, it is CFL.

Mimi ni mtaalam wa hesabu anayesoma ugumu wa maandishi ya Arora na Barak, na nina shida kufuata maelezo moja katika uthibitisho wao wa nadharia hii dhaifu ya PCP: Theorem 11.19. Tunayo NP $ \ subseteq $ PCP (poly ($ n $), 1) uthibitisho wao hufanya hisia zaidi ya nambari isiyoelezewa 0.8 kwenye ukurasa wa 253 katika aya ya mwisho ya uthibitisho/sehemu. (Mbali na hiyo, nadhani kuna kosa lingine ndogo.) Nitachora uthibitisho wao hapa chini na kutoa muktadha wa swali ili watu wasio na nakala ya kitabu waweze kufuata. Nambari yao 0.8 inatoka wapi? Na inapaswa badala yake iwe 0.501? Rasimu yao ya mkondoni ya kitabu hicho ni tofauti ya kutosha kwamba sikupata 0.8 huko (ambayo katika rasimu, iko katika kifungu cha 18.4.2 kwenye ukurasa wa 367). Swali langu ni juu ya toleo lao lililochapishwa. Kwa kweli, swali hili ni tofauti na swali lingine nililoweka hapa wiki chache zilizopita. Mchoro wa uthibitisho wao: Wacha Quadeq aashiria shida ya kupewa seti ya hesabu za quadratic zaidi ya $ \ mathbb {f} = \ mathbb {f} _2 $, ili kujua ikiwa inaridhisha. Shida hii ni kamili. Zinaonyesha kuwa Quadeq ina sifa ya PCP kutumia polynomialy bits nyingi za nasibu na idadi ya maswali ya mara kwa mara. Mfano wa quadeq na equations $ M $ na $ n $ vigezo vinaweza kusimbwa kama $ m \ mara n^2 $ matrix $ A $ na vector $ B $. Kazi ni kujua ikiwa kuna vector $ \ mathbf {u} \ in \ mathbb {f}^n $ kama kwamba kuruhusu $ u = \ mathbf {u} \ otimes \ mathbf {u} $, tuna $ $ AU = B $. Kwa kweli, $ \ mathbf {u} \ otimes \ mathbf {u} $ imewekwa kwa njia ya kufanya $ u $ vector ya safu (na sanjari na fahirisi za safu ya $ A $). Kuingia kwa $ i, J $ ya $ \ mathbf {u} \ otimes \ mathbf {u} $ ni kwa ufafanuzi $ u_i u_j $. Verifier $ V $ inatarajia dhibitisho $ \ pi \ in \ {0, 1 \}^{2^n + 2^{n^2}} $ ili kuweka kazi mbili $ f \ koloni \ mathbb {f}^n \ to \ mathbb {f} $ na $ g \ koloni \ mathbb {f}^{n^2} \ kwa \ mathbb {f} $. Katika uthibitisho sahihi, $ F $ ni encoding ya Walsh-Hadamard kwa mgawo wa kuridhisha $ \ mathbf {u} $. Kwa maneno mengine, $ f (\ mathbf {x}) = \ mathbf {x} \ odot \ mathbf {u} $, ambapo $ \ odot $ inaashiria bidhaa ya dot (mod ya kufanya kazi 2). Pia, kwa uthibitisho sahihi $ g $ ni encoding ya Walsh-Hadamard kwa vector $ \ mathbf {u} \ otimes \ mathbf {u} $. Kwa hivyo, $ f $ na $ g $ ni kazi (kazi za mstari hadi $ \ mathbb {f} $). Hapa kuna hatua tatu katika uthibitisho wao: Hatua ya 1: Angalia kuwa $ F $ na $ G $ ni 0.999-karibu na kazi za mstari. Ikiwa sio, basi kataa uthibitisho uliosafishwa $ \ pi $. Ikiwa $ F $ na $ G $ sio 0.999-karibu na kazi za mstari, basi hatua hii itashindwa na uwezekano mkubwa. Tuseme hatua ya 1 inapita. Piga kazi za Linear $ \ tilde {f} $ na $ \ tilde {g} $. Kwa kuamua kwa ndani, tunaweza kuuliza $ \ tilde {f} $ (au $ \ tilde {g} $) kwa kufanya maswali mawili hadi $ f $ (au $ g $). Yoyote query to $\tilde{f}$ will succeed with probability at least 0.998. They state that Steps 2 and 3 of the proof "will use a small (less than 20) number of queries to $\tilde{f}$, $\tilde{g}$."  Side question: In the rest of the proof, don't they query $\tilde{f}$ exactly 20 times and $\tilde{g}$ exactly 11 times?  Of course the 31 total queries is not less than 20, nor is 20 itself (in case they weren't summing the 20 and 11). Regardless, they (still correctly) point out that "with high probability (say $> 0.9$) local decoding will succeed on all these queries."  Step 2: Let $\mathbf{u}$ be the vector encoded by $\tilde{f}$. Verify that $\tilde{g}$ encodes $\mathbf{u} \otimes \mathbf{u}$.  This is done by doing the following test 10 independent times: "Choose $\mathbf{r}, \mathbf{r}'$ independently at random from $\mathbb{F}^n$, and if $\tilde{f}(\mathbf{r})\tilde{f}(\mathbf{r}') \neq \tilde{g}(\mathbf{r} \otimes \mathbf{r}')$ then halt and reject." (I will skip why this check works.) If $\tilde{g}$ doesn't encode $\mathbf{u} \otimes \mathbf{u}$, then on any of the 10 trials, the verifier will reject $\pi$ with probability at least 1/4. In this case, it will reject $\pi$ with probability at least $1 - (3/4)^{10} > 0.9$. Assume Step 2 passes.  Step 3: Verify that $g$ encodes a satisfying assignment.  This is done by making a random combination of the $m$ equations encoded by $A$ and $b$. Then $\tilde{g}$ is queried once to check this new equation. If the instance $A$ and $b$ is not satisfied by $\mathbf{u}$, then with probability at least 1/2, it won't satisfy this new equation. In their conclusion, they state that if $A$, $b$ is not satisfiable, then for all (necessarily incorrect) proofs $\pi$, the verifier $V$ accepts $\pi$ with probability at most 0.8. Of course, if 0.8 ought to be 0.501, then 0.8 is true too, but I don't see any justifiable reason why the 0.8 is there.  How I got the number 0.501: Let $\pi$ be an incorrect proof of satisfiability for an unsatisfiable $A, b$.  If $f$ and $g$ are not 0.999-close to linear functions, then $V$ rejects $\pi$ with high probability. So assume Step 1 passes. Also, if $\tilde{g}$ does not encode $\mathbf{u} \otimes \mathbf{u}$, then $V$ rejects $\pi$ with probability greater than 0.9. So assume Step 2 passes. Let $I$ be the event that $V$ acepts $\pi$, and let $L$ be the event that local decoding of $\tilde{g}$ from $g$ in Step 3 works. Then $\text{Pr}(I) = \text{Pr}(I \cap L) + \text{Pr}(I \cap \overline{L}) = \text{Pr}(I | L)\text{Pr}(L) + \text{Pr}(I | \overline{L})\text{Pr}(\overline{L})$ which is bounded above by \begin{align} (1/2)\text{Pr}(L) + \text{Pr}(\overline{L}) &= (1/2)[\text{Pr}(L) + \text{Pr}(\overline{L}) + \text{Pr}(\overline{L})] \\ &= 1/2 + (1/2)\text{Pr}(\overline{L}) \\ &\leq 1/2 + (1/2)(1 - 0.998)\\ &= 0.501 \end{align}

Nina siri $ n $ -dimensional vector $ \ mathbb {s} \ in \ mathbb {z}^n $. Sijui $ \ mathbb {s} $; Lengo langu ni kukadiria $ \ mathbb {s} $. Nina Oracle kwa kazi $ f_ \ mathbb {s}: \ mathbb {z}^n \ to \ mathbb {z} $, iliyofafanuliwa na $ $ f_ \ mathbb {s} (\ mathbb {x}) = \ mathbb {s} \ cdot \ mathbb {x} $ $ (bidhaa ya dot ya $ \ mathbb {s} $ na $ \ mathbb {x} $). Pia, najua kuwa $ \ mathbb {s} $ ni laini, kwa maana fulani: $ \ mathbb {s} _i $ inatofautiana polepole kama kazi ya $ i $. Niko wazi kwa njia nzuri za kurekebisha hiyo, lakini uundaji mmoja ni kwamba tunaweza kudhani kuwa $ || \ mathbb {s} '|| _2 $ ni ndogo sana, ambapo $ \ mathbb {s}' $ ni vector ya Derivatives ya kwanza ya mpangilio, ambayo ni, $ $ \ mathbb {s} '_ i = \ mathbb {s} _ {i+1} - \ mathbb {s} _i. $ $ Kusudi ni kukadiria/takriban $ \ mathbb {s} _i. S} $: i.e., kutoa vector $ \ mathbb {t} $ kwamba $ || \ mathbb {t}-\ mathbb {s} || _2 $ ni ndogo. Mtu anaweza kupona $ \ mathbb {s} $ hasa alipewa maswali $ $ $ kwa $ f $, kwa kutumia algebra ya mstari (hata bila kuhitaji laini laini constraint).  But given knowledge that $\mathbb{s}$ is smooth, is there a more efficient way to estimate $\mathbb{s}$, using fewer queries?  In other words, the algorithm task is as follows:  Input: $n$, an oracle for $f_\mathbb{s}$, an upper bound on $||\mathbb{s}'||_2$ Output: $t \in \mathbb{Z}^n$ such that $||\mathbb{t}-\mathbb{s}||_2$ is small  In my application, $n$ is large (say, around 10,000) but $\mathbb{s}$ is very smooth, so I'm hoping it might be possible to estimate $\mathbb{s}$ with many fewer than $n$ queries.  It would be fine to assume we are working over $\mathbb{R}^n$ if that's easier.  In practice I have $\mathbb{s} \in \{0,1,\dots,255\}^n$.  I'm not wedded to this exact definition of smoothness or of approximation of $\mathbb{s}$ (e.g., some sparsity constraint or other norm might also be a reasonable formulation).  Are there any techniques for this type of problem?

Kulingana na Guraswami et al, FOCS '08, dhana ya kipekee ya michezo itamaanisha kuwa hakuna algorithm ya makadirio ya makali ya juu ya acyclic ya digraph bora zaidi than the one that randomly permutes the vertices and includes an edge when it goes from an earlier to a later vertex in the permutation (with approximation ratio 1/2).
Nitasema kwa bluntly iwezekanavyo. Mtindo wa mikoba ya kushughulikia a bicycle has absolutely no bearing on its suitability for winter conditions.

Rafiki yangu alipata Peugeot ya zabibu na mkanda wa asili wa kasi 5 (gia 2 za mbele) na shina za shina za msuguano (na bar ya gorofa). Anapambana na kuhama. Ninazingatia visasisho vifuatavyo: Badilisha mabadiliko ya shina na vibadilishaji 5 vya kasi. Je! Ningehitaji pia kuchukua nafasi ya derailer ya nyuma katika kesi hiyo? Badilisha tu derailer ya nyuma (na labda nyaya) na uone ikiwa hiyo inafanya iwe rahisi kutosha kwake kujifunza kubadilika kwa msuguano. Vinginevyo, ningeweza kwenda na new 6-speed parts: shifter and derailer. But would that mess up the shifting since the cassette is still 5-speed? Replace the front derailer as well, but not the front shifters. So I'd have twist (indexed) rear shifters and stem (friction) front shifters. Is there any reason that wouldn't work?   Which of these would you recommend? Are there any important things I should be aware of/look out  for (I've not done a bike project like this before)?

Unacheza mchezo ufuatao. Una bajeti ya $ B $ dola. Kuna $ N $ siku. Kila siku $ D $, lazima ufanye zabuni $ b_d \ geq0 $ ambayo haizidi bajeti yako. Baada ya kutengeneza zabuni, bidhaa inaonekana na bei $ p_d \ leq b $ dola. Ikiwa zabuni yako ni kubwa kuliko bei, unununua bidhaa, i.e., $ b_d \ geq p_d $, na unapoteza $ b_d $ kutoka bajeti yako. Vinginevyo, utaachwa na bajeti sawa na hapo awali lakini haununua bidhaa, i.e., ikiwa $ B_D <P_D $. Siku inayofuata jambo hilo hilo hufanyika na kadhalika. Unasimamisha mchezo wakati unatumia bajeti yako yote au siku $ n $ kufikiwa. Kusudi lako ni kununua bidhaa nyingi iwezekanavyo na budget $B$.   Can we find a policy that competes against an adversary and buy a "good" number of products? Good here means, for example, a policy with low regret, so the difference between what the adversary bought and what you bought is not large. If we can't, what assumptions could we make to make the regret low?  My policy so far is:   For each day $d=1..n$, bid $b_d=B_r/(n-d+1)$, where $B_r$ is your remaining budget.   I was trying to find an input sequence that makes my policy perform badly but I didn't succeed (for large $n$). I think if $n$ is large, then we may reach a low regret with this policy. I am still trying to prove this.

Kwa kusema ukweli, sikuweza kuweka hisa nyingi katika makadirio yaliyonukuliwa kwa motors. Kabla sijanunua baiskeli yangu ya umeme, nilijaribu kitu kama aina na nane au tisa tofauti na mifano, iliyo na vifaa tofauti vya motors (Bafang, Bosch, Brose, Yamaha, labda wengine), wengine na katikati ya gari, wengine na Hub kuendesha. Wapanda farasi wangu wote ni pamoja na kupanda mlima mwinuko. Tofauti kubwa ambayo niligundua ni kwamba baiskeli ambazo zilikuwa na sehemu kubwa zilikuwa rahisi kwenda juu ya kilima, na hii ni kwa sababu iliwezekana kwenda juu ya kilima bila kusongesha kabisa. Miongoni mwa baiskeli ambazo zinahitaji kusanya kwa kuongeza motor, hakuonekana kuwa na uhusiano wowote wa moja kwa moja kati ya torque ya motor iliyonukuliwa na kuongezeka. Ninadai hii kwa kuwa na anuwai nyingi zinazohusika. Kwa mfano, hata ndani ya mstari mmoja wa baiskeli zilizo na Motors za Utendaji wa Bosch, kulikuwa na chaguzi za kuendeleza (Nuvinci, sasa Enviolo, vs Rohloff) na chaguzi kwa kasi ya max (Amerika, 20 mph vs 28 mph) . Tofauti ya kujiandaa, pamoja na mpangilio wa gari kwa kasi ya max, ilimaanisha kuwa hata kwa ukadiriaji sawa wa torque, baiskeli tofauti zilipanda vilima tofauti. Kwa mfano, baiskeli 20 mph zilikuwa bora kupanda kuliko baiskeli 28 mph. Hiyo ilisema, baiskeli zote zilifanya yote lakini vilima vyenye mwinuko bila bidii kupanda (hadi kiwango cha juu cha kasi ya baiskeli), na hata kwenye vilima vyenye mwinuko ningeweza kuongeza kasi yangu mara mbili kwa kulinganisha na kupanda baiskeli ya kawaida (k.m. a. kilima I'd normally take at 4-5 mph, I could go up at 8-10 mph on an electric bike). These tests were ridden entirely on paved surfaces, in a city where the steepest hills are about a 20% grade. Most of the test rides were in neighborhoods where the steepest hills available to me were in around 10-15% grade. Below 10% grade, most of the bikes provided enough power that I could reach the bike's maximum speed going uphill; the main exception being the 28 mph bike that I tried, which didn't have as much power going uphill as the other bikes. Beyond the fact that the quoted torque for a motor won't tell you very much about how that bike compares to another, I will also suggest that you probably shouldn't care very much anyway. There is a vast difference between climbing a hill with an electric bike as compared to a conventional bike, and only very minor differences in effort climbing a hill comparing one electric bike to another. In addition, there are a number of other aspects about an electric bike that IMHO should take much higher priority in terms of selection, including battery size and cost, drive configuration (mid- vs hub-drive), motor controller (I found the cadence-sensing motors very annoying, and the torque-sensing motors very natural to ride), and of course cost. And those aspects are overshadowed by the most important, which is simply how the bike feels to you when you ride it. How do you like the handling, how comfortable is the rider position between seat and handlerbars, etc.

Ninasoma vifaa vya muundo wa data ya hali ya juu na ningependa kutekeleza muundo wa data ya matengenezo ya faili. Nina maswali machache ili kuanza. Karatasi hutegemea mtazamo wa tuli, ambapo muundo wa data tayari una vitu, lakini ninahitaji kuanza kutoka mwanzo. Muundo wa data huweka safu ya vitu vya $ n $ (circa) ndani ya vitu vya $ \ logi n $, na kila chunk imeamriwa. Wakati wa kuingiza, ninahitaji kuchagua chunk na kuingiza kwenye eneo tupu, ikiwa nitajaza chunk, ninahitaji kusonga na uwezekano wa kupanga upya vitu kulingana na wiani katika a binary tree fashion.   At the beginning how many chunks do I have? I suppose one.  When the array is full according to the target density, do I need to grow the array and how? I suppose yes, always by a power of two (number of chunks). Is there a possibility that a tree is impossible to rearrange according to the density? I hope not. Is there any source code that I can take a loot at?  When $N$ changes do I need to change the chunk size accordingly? I think so.   Thanks!

Kwanza. Mtu anaweza kufanya vizuri zaidi kama sampuli - angalau ikiwa $ d $ ni kubwa - $ o (\ frac {kd \ logi k} {\ epsilon} \ logi \ frac {1} {\ epsilon}) $ inapaswa kufuata kwa urahisi Kutoka kwa makadirio ya jamaa http://sarielhp.org/p/06/relative/ na kuchanganya nafasi anuwai za mwelekeo wa VC (ikiwa utanitumia barua pepe ningekutumia barua pepe ya PDF iliyo na matokeo haya unayohitaji - inayojulikana, lakini mimi sijui ref kwa hiyo). Pili, sampuli ya ukaribu wa jamaa katika kesi hii, inahakikisha kwamba ikiwa sampuli itashindwa, basi $ K $ ni ndogo sana. Kwa hivyo, utafute utaftaji wa thamani sahihi ya $ k $, haswa, anza na $ k_i = 2^i $, na wacha $ r_i $ iwe sampuli ya $ i $ ya saizi $ n_i = o (\ frac {kd \ logi k} {\ epsilon} \ logi \ frac {i} {\ epsilon}) $ ($ i $ sio typo). Acha $ \ alpha $ iwe chini ya $ i $ ambayo sampuli inafanikiwa kutumia sanduku nyeusi. Sasa, tumia nguvu ya brute (kwenye sampuli) kupata chini ya $ k \ leq k_ \ alpha $ ambayo sampuli inafanya kazi. Na hii is your desired $k$. You need to carefully account for the probability of success, but thats why the $i$ is there - its one of these standard geometric summation stuff.   The $i$ can be avoided -- indeed, the probability that $\alpha$ is bigger by $\Delta$ than its correct value is smaller than $2^{-\Delta}$. If you do that, then the sample you are going to use is of the right size with good probability. That is, if the minimum $k$ for which you can cover more than $(1-\epsilon)n$ of the points is $\kappa$, then the sample the algorithm uses is $O\left( \frac{\kappa d \log \kappa}{\epsilon} \log \frac{1}{\epsilon} \right)$.  There is some added fuzzyness in the answer of this algorithm. The returned answer $\kappa$ is the minimum such that any value of $k < \kappa$, is say $(1-\epsilon/2)$-far from from being k-clustered. I assume this is OK.   In practice you would do something different. Hmm. Something to think about....

Labda hautapata sehemu hii bila kushinikiza mkono wa kutosha wa kuvunja. Sehemu unazoweza kupata mbadala bila kuwa na mkono wa dhabihu kwa V-brakes (*) ni: noodle boot kuweka bolt bolt brake/cartridges ikiwa unahitaji kuchukua nafasi/kukarabati sehemu nyingine yoyote ya V-BRAKE, wewe ni bora mbali (na uwezekano wa kuwa) kununua mpya. (*) for most V-brakes; check the service manual for your particular model, though even if it is serviceable, you're unlikely to find the parts.     That being said, you might be able to make a suitable replacement on your own for the part in question with a bit of PVC tubing or some other plastic tubing cut to size and shaped appropriately.

Ningeanza kwa kuangalia fani zote na kuzirekebisha. Katika uzoefu wangu (mdogo) na baiskeli za bei rahisi, watu wanaokusanyika hawajali kabisa ikiwa watafanya vizuri. This means that when people ride the bikes, the bearings wear out quickly.  Same thing for the headset (steering bearings), although probably not as critical, but easier to adjust.

Niliandika utekelezaji wa algorithm ya Kuhn-Munkres kwa shida ya kiwango cha chini cha uzani wa bipartite kulingana na maelezo ya mihadhara ambayo nimepata hapa na pale kwenye wavuti. Inafanya kazi vizuri, hata kwenye maelfu ya wima. Na ninakubali kwamba nadharia nyuma yake ni nzuri kweli. Na bado ninajiuliza kwanini nililazimika kwenda kwa urefu kama huo. Ninaona kuwa maelezo haya ya hotuba hayaelezei kwanini hatuwezi tu take the primal linear program and pass it to the simplex method. Of course I suspect that it's a question of predictable performance, but since I haven't seen it explicitly stated, I'm not too sure. The polytope's extreme points of the primal are proven to be in 0-1, so it seems that we can feed it directly to a simplex implementation without even formulating the dual. Or am I being simplistic?

Kuweka: Acha $ x $ iwe seti laini na $ c = \ {0, 1 \}^x $ familia ya classifiers kwenye $ x $. Rekebisha $ f \ in \ {0, 1 \}^x $ sio kwa $ C $, (labda nasibu na adaptive) mwanafunzi $ a $ ana ufikiaji wa hoja ya ushirika Oracle $ ex (f) $, ambayo kwa pembejeo ya pembejeo $ x $ jibu na $ f (x) $. Kwa $ H \ katika C $, fafanua $ r (h) = \ frac {1} {| x |} \ jumla_ {x \ in x} \ mathbb {i} (h (x) \ neq f (x) ) $. Lengo la mwanafunzi ni kwa $ f \ notin c $ na $ \ epsilon \ in (0, 1) $ kutoa mwanafunzi $ h_a \ katika C $, kwamba $ \ mathbb {e} [r (h_a)] \ le \ min_ {c \ in c} r (c) + \ epsilon $ mradi inaweza kuuliza maswali ya kutosha hadi $ ex (f) $. Hapa ubinafsishaji ni kwa heshima na coind ya ndani flip of $A$.  Question: Is there any known lower bound to the number of queries needed by any algorithm to achive the above $\epsilon$ approximation? (Even a reference to such a similar results would be very helpful!)   This setting resembles classical agnostic PAC learning where there are lower bound of the form $\Omega(d/\epsilon^2)$ with $d$ beign the VC dimension of $C$, but it differs in not having a distribution on $X$ and in allowing the algorithms to freely choose the queries, even in an adaptive fashion. Another setting that came to my mind is that of exact learning with membership queries (e.g. Queries revisited by Angluin) but here the difference is in that $f\in C$.

(Hii ni ndefu sana kwa maoni.) Fikiria mchezo ufuatao: staha ina ACE na kadi zingine tisa kutoka 2 hadi 10. Kadi zinaanza kugawanywa kwa usawa kati ya mikono ya wachezaji, na inabadilika. Wakati wa zamu ya kila mchezaji, mchezaji huyo anaweza kuchagua (na kufunua) kadi kutoka kwa mikono yao. Wakati wowote kadi inapochaguliwa (na kufunuliwa) kwa njia hiyo, ikiwa kadi hiyo ni Ace basi mchezaji ambaye alifunua anashinda. Sentensi iliyotangulia ndiyo njia pekee for the game to end.  In that game:  Every position is a winning position for the player who has the Ace in their hand.  In particular, there are no "tied" positions, and every position with the  Ace in the computer's hand is a winning position for the computer.  From any such position, the answer of not choosing a  card takes the position to a losing one for the player.  If the computer always does that, then the computer will never win.

Ninavutiwa na baiskeli kama dakika 30 kufanya kazi. Itakuwa umbali wa maili 5. Nina baiskeli nzito ya baiskeli (Schwinn). Itakuwa safari ya burudani. Nilikuwa na mapumziko ya miaka 5 kutoka kwa baiskeli. Kabla ya kukusanya 100km baada ya mapumziko, nilifanya safari kadhaa za> 20km. Kubwa zaidi ya safari hizi ilikuwa 28km. Chini ya masaa 2. Kabla ya mapumziko ya miaka 5, mara kwa mara nilifanya wapanda farasi 50km. Safari kama hiyo ni masaa 3. Walakini, singeshauri kufanya wapanda farasi 50km kufanya kazi, kwani nilifanya safari moja tu kwa siku. Umbali wa kilomita 50 ni 100km kwa siku. Sababu ya mimi enjoyed such long rides and could do a 28km ride after 5-hour break? It's three-fold:  My bike fit was excellent. My dimensions didn't grow or shrink during the 5-year break, so bike fit is still excellent. The bike is a drop bar bike with handlebers at the saddle level. The bike is fitted with narrow high performance slick tires.  Throw away your current bike if the distance grows to over 5 miles. I'm sure you're limited to 5 miles with a heavy cruiser bicycle. There are bicycles better than heavy cruiser bicycles, and with those better bicycles, a distance of 20 miles may be feasible.

Nina shida ifuatayo: Kwa kuzingatia seti ya uwepo wa njia/kutokuwepo kwa C (sio lazima kwa jozi zote za vertices) na seti (iliyowekwa) ya vertices V, toa DAG isiyo ya kawaida, s.t. Kwa kuzingatia seti ya $ n $ $ e_1, ... e_n $ ambapo kila kitu $ i $ inahusishwa na nambari mbili chanya $ \ alpha_i $ na $ \ beta_i $. Kwa kuzingatia nambari nyingine $ \ lambda $, lengo ni kupata $ s $ ya vitu kama kwamba $ (\ lambda - \ jumla_ {e_i \ katika s} \ alpha_i)^2 + \ jumla_ {e_i \in S}\beta_i$ is minimize (for $\sum_{e_i \in S}\alpha_i < \lambda, a_i >0, b_i >0$). i'm looking for an exact or an approximate polynomial solution (my tries shows that a greedy solution (with respect to $\beta$ or the additional cost does not yield good approximation).

Hennie-Stearns Theorem inasema kwamba $ k $ -tape mashine za kuchora na $ k \ ge 2 $ ni intertranslatable na loglinear blowUp ($ o (t \ mara \ logi {(t)} $). Hii inaweza kufafanua darasa la usawa la mifano, isipokuwa kwamba blowup ya loglinear haijafungwa chini ya muundo. Kwa hivyo ikiwa tunataka kabisa kujiondoa kutoka kwa mashine za ujaribu, itabidi tuzingatie angalau quasilinear ($ t \ mara \ logi {(t)}^{o (1 )} $) BlowUp, ambayo imefungwa kwa njia ya kawaida. Walakini, pia tunayo kufungwa kwa njia ya msingi chini ya blowup ya kimsingi ($ t^{1+O (1)} $). Madarasa yote mawili yanahifadhi sehemu ya algorithms ya wakati wa polynomial na the Msingi wa algorithms ya wakati. Mfano ambao unaweza kutafsiri kwa mashine ya aina nyingi kwa wakati wa kimsingi lakini sio wakati wa quasilinear, au kwa upande mwingine? Ninajua tunaweza kuunda moja kwa kubadilisha ufafanuzi wa hatua ya wakati, lakini ninatarajia kitu ambacho kinatoa ufahamu zaidi. Mfano mmoja nilikuja nalo unaonyesha tofauti ni algorithm ambayo inahesabu kamba zote za $ n $ -bit zinazoridhisha mtihani wa wakati wa polynomial. Hii inaendesha kwa $ 2^n \ mara n^{o (1)} wakati wa $, ambayo huhifadhiwa na blowup ya quasilinear, lakini baada ya tafsiri ya wakati wa kimsingi ambayo inakuwa $ 2^{n} \ Times 2^{o (n) } $, ikimaanisha kuwa inachukua zaidi ya polynomial kujaribu kila kamba kidogo kwa wastani, ingawa katika mfano huo huo bado tunaweza kujaribu kamba moja kwa wakati wa polynomial. Ninafikiria hii imeelezewa na mashine ambayo hupata makosa ya bahati nasibu na inatarajiwa tu kuwa sawa zaidi ya nusu ya wakati; Ili kawaida kudhani hesabu inayofaa, italazimika kuwa na hakika juu ya uwepo au kutokuwepo kwa kila kamba ya $ 2^n $, ndiyo sababu hutumia wakati mwingi kwa kila kamba kwa wastani kuliko mtihani wa wakati wa polynomial ambao tu Lazima iwe sawa $ 51 \%$ ya wakati. [Hariri: Nadhani kuna makosa mengi sana katika hapa chini ili iwe muhimu. Bado ninajaribu kukuza wazo lile lile, mashine ambayo ina shida sana kuweka wimbo wa hesabu kuwa wa kutafsiri kwa wakati wa quasilinear.] Acha niongeze juu ya hilo kwa sababu inaonekana kuwa inakaribia kile ninachotafuta. Tuseme error-prone machine is one such that, with a fixed probability $p$, an attempt to change a value on any working tape fails. If it writes the existing value back that always works. Halting with an output means halting strictly more than half the time with the same output, and halting within a certain time means always halting within that time. The latter definition means that if we write each bit by sitting in a loop until it is correct, then the time becomes unbounded; this lets us simulate an ordinary Turing machine, but not with any time translation.  But we can simulate an ordinary machine on the error-prone machine up to $t$ steps by writing every bit $b(t)$ times, making its probability of being incorrect $p^{b(t)}$.  There is a $b(t) \in O(\log{(t)})$ sufficient to operate perfectly for $t$ steps more than half the time, and $t \times b(t)$ is only loglinear, but for a time translation we need a universal machine and in that situation we're not given $t$ in advance. So what I'm curious about now is how tightly we can constrain the time translation factor and still be correct half the time, and whether we can use something like this to characterize essentially linear time translations vs. quasilinear ones.  I believe I can demonstrate that this model has a time translation in $O(t^k)$ for every $k>1$.  Dedicate a working tape to keeping track of the number of times our universal machine is to repeat each emulated step.  It contains a string of ones delimited by blanks at the ends.  The outer loop of the universal machine walks the list of ones from left to right, attempting to repeat the same emulation step in between movements.  When it reaches the end, it attempts to write another one, and then resets itself by walking back to the left end, finally advancing to the next emulation step.  This seems like more than enough repeats to be half-correct, and we're effectively taking $b(n) \approx (1-p) \times n$ resulting in an essentially quadratic time translation.  We can generalize this by adding another counter tape to control the extension of the first one, bringing the time translation down to $O(t^{\frac{3}{2}+o(1)})$, and repeating this gives us any superlinear polynomial bound. Is it possible to bring this down to quasi- or essentially linear?

Kuna aina nyingi tofauti za matembezi ya bahati nasibu (discrete dhidi ya kuendelea, uzani dhidi ya mara kwa mara, classical vs quantum) kwa hivyo njia halisi itatofautiana nini katika kila kisa, lakini nitajaribu kuelezea njia ya jumla hapa. Kawaida uvumbuzi wa mfumo huo utapewa na $ a^t $ kwa matrix $ $ $, ambapo $ t $ ni wakati. Asili halisi ya $ A $ itategemea aina ya matembezi ya nasibu unayo akili, lakini kwa hali yoyote, tunatarajia mfumo huo kuwa katika hali $ a^t v $ baada ya muda $ t $, ambapo $ v $ inaashiria hali ya kuanzia. Swali basi inakuwa: Kwa kuzingatia seti ya nyakati za kupiga $ \ {t_i \} $, inasema $ \ \ {u_i \} $, na kugonga zaidi $ \ {p_i \} $, tunaweza kupata matrix $ ambayo inaridhisha $ u_i^\ dagger a^{t_i} v = p_i $ kwa $ yote $? Hakika hii haitakuwa hivyo kila wakati (kwa kuwa tunaweza kuwa na migogoro ambapo majimbo ya orthogonal yanahitajika wakati huo huo), kwa hivyo nadhani una nia ya jinsi ya kupata $ A $ wakati kuna $ $ ya kuridhisha uhusiano huu . Hariri: Jibu langu la zamani lilikuwa sio sahihi zaidi ya hatua hii, kwa hivyo nimebadilisha sehemu hiyo. I am not 100% sure of the most efficient way to find $A$. You have a system of equations in the enteries of $A$, and these can obviously be solved numerically using, for example, Buchberger's algorithm. However, this approach is not computationally efficient, and there may exist a more straight forward approach.  If you simply want find a transition matrix which approximates this, then you can use any number of optimization strategies, though these too may be inefficient.  Note, here I have assumed a very general model which should be true for all random walks, but it makes it hard to say anything concrete about how hard long it will take to numerically find a solution. If you have more information (i.e. is this a discrete time walk? Is it classical (I assume so)? Are weighted transitions probabilities allowed or do they have to be constant? Is this associates with some lattice (1d, 2d, or an arbitrary graph)?) Then you can possibly do much better. In the worst case, though, this problem seems to be NP-hard (since you get an integer programming problem if you restrict the transition probabilities to be multiples of some constant).

Swali Ni nini kipya katika miundo ya data inayofanya kazi tangu Okasaki ?, Na Jibu la Jbapple, lililotajwa kwa kutumia orodha tofauti katika programu ya kazi (tofauti na programu ya mantiki), ambayo ni kitu ambacho nimekuwa nikipendezwa hivi karibuni. Hii iliniongoza kupata Utekelezaji wa orodha tofauti kwa Haskell. Nina maswali mawili (nisamehe/unisahihishe ikiwa ninapaswa kuwafanya maswali mawili tofauti kwenye stackexchange). Swali rahisi ni kwamba, je! Kuna mtu yeyote anayejua uzingatiaji wa kitaaluma wa orodha tofauti katika programu ya kazi na/au utekelezaji badala ya ile iliyo kwenye maktaba ya Haskell? Jibu la Jbapple halikutoa mfano wa orodha tofauti (orodha tofauti katika programu za mantiki zipo kwenye lore na katika vyanzo kadhaa ambavyo nina karibu hapa mahali pengine (TM)). Kabla ya kupata utekelezaji wa Haskell sikujua kuwa wazo lilikuwa limeruka kutoka mantiki hadi kazi programming. Granted, the Haskell difference lists are something of a natural use of higher-order functions and work quite differently from the ones in logic programming, but the interface is certainly similar.  The more interesting (and far fuzzier-headed) thing I wanted to ask about is whether the claimed asymptotic upper bound for the aforementioned Haskell difference list library seems correct/plausible. My confusion may be because I am missing something about obvious about complexity reasoning with laziness, but the claimed bounds only make sense to me if substitution over a large data structure (or closure formation, or variable lookup, or something) always takes constant time. Or is the "catch" simply that there's no bound on the running time for "head" and "tail" precisely because those operations may have to plow through an arbitrary pile of deferred computations/substitutions?

Je! Tunaweza kuhesabu lango la kizingiti cha $ n $ -bit na ukubwa wa polynomial (fan-in) duru ya kina cha $ \ frac {\ lg n} {\ lg \ lg n} $? Vinginevyo, tunaweza kuhesabu idadi ya 1s kwenye bits za pembejeo kwa kutumia mizunguko hii? Ni $ \ mathsf {tc^0} \ subseteq \ mathsf {alttime} (o (\ frac {\ lg n} {\ lg \ lg n}), o (\ lg n)) $? Kumbuka kuwa $ \ mathsf {tc^0} \ subseteq \ mathsf {nc^1} = \ mathsf {alogtime} = \ mathsf {alttime} (o (\ lg n), o (\ lg n)) $. Kwa hivyo swali linauliza kimsingi ikiwa tunaweza kuokoa $ \ lg \ lg n $ sababu katika the depth of circuits when computing threshold gates.  Edit: As Kristoffer wrote in his answer we can save a $\lg \lg n$ factor. But can we save a little bit more? Can we replace $O(\frac{\lg n}{\lg \lg n})$ with $o(\frac{\lg n}{\lg \lg n})$? It seems to me that the layered brute-force trick doesn't work for saving even $2 \lg \lg n$ (more generally any function in $\lg \lg n + \omega(1)$).

Tuseme ninajaribu kujifunza kazi $ F $ kwa lengo la kiwango kama: Ramani: nafasi ya sehemu moja juu na iliyobaki chini. Zaidi rasmi, fikiria kila mfano wa pembejeo $ i_i $ ina vitu kadhaa: $ $ i_i = \ {1, 2, \ cdots, k \} $ $ Matokeo ya kila mfano ni $ y_i $ ($ y_i \ in \ { 1, 2, \ cdots, k \} $) ni faharisi katika mfano. Kwa hivyo ramani ya pembejeo ni: $ $ i_i \ kulia y_i $ $ Kujifunza ramani: Tuseme tunataka kujifunza ramani hii. Kwa kila index $ j $ kwa $ i_i $, tunatoa vector ya kipengele $ x_i^j $. Kwa hivyo tutakuwa na mkusanyiko wa veta $ x_i^1, ...., x_i^k $. Shida ya kujifunza inaweza kutengenezwa kama ifuatavyo: $ $ \ j\neq y_i \Rightarrow f(x_i^{y_i}) > f(x_i^{j})  $$  Now the question is, whether it is possible to reduce this problem to the existing well-known problems (e.g. linear classifiers $f(x) = w^T x$):   Here is a proposal:    Training: first, form the difference representations:    $$ \forall j \neq y_i \Rightarrow z_i^j \triangleq x_i^{y_i} - x_i^j $$  I argue that we can use traditional linear-classifier frameworks to learn mappings from $z_i^j \rightarrow +1$:   $$ \max_f   \sum_{I_i} \sum_{j \in I_i} \ell ( f(z_i^j), +1)  $$   Prediction: given an instance $I_i$, select the best scoring index:  $$ \hat{y}_i = \arg\max_{j \in I_i} f(x^j_i) $$    Please let me know if you have thoughts supporting/contradicting this proposal

Wasaidizi wengi wa dhibitisho wana muundo wa dhana ya "seti ya laini". Hizi rasmi, hata hivyo, zinatofautiana vibaya (ingawa mtu anatarajia kuwa wote ni sawa!). Kile sielewi kwa wakati huu ni nafasi ya kubuni inayohusika, na ni nini faida na hasara za kila utaratibu. Hasa, ningependa kuelewa yafuatayo: Je! Ninaweza kuweka seti za laini (i.e. aina zinazokaliwa na idadi laini ya wenyeji) katika nadharia ya aina rahisi? Mfumo F? Je! Ni nini shida za kuifanya hivi? ninaijua can be done 'elegantly' in a dependently typed system.  But, from a classical point of view, the resulting definitions seem extremely alien.  [I am not saying they are wrong, far from it!].  But I do not understand why they are 'right' either.  I understand that they pick out the correct concept, but the deeper reason for 'saying it that way' is what I do not fully grasp.   Basically, I would like a reasoned introduction to the design space of formalizations of the concept of 'finite set' in type theory.

Ndio, nasema inawezekana kabisa. Kwa kweli nimefanya kitu sawa mara mbili katika maisha yangu. 1 - saa 28 niliamua kuanza baiskeli kufanya kazi. Nilipanda burudani mara kwa mara lakini hii ilikuwa mabadiliko makubwa. Kusafiri ilikuwa karibu km 14 kila njia na kwa ujumla kupanda njiani kwenda kufanya kazi asubuhi na kuteremka njiani kurudi nyumbani. Tofauti ya urefu kati ya kuanza na kumaliza ilikuwa karibu mita 140 kwa hivyo safari ilikuwa na gradient ya jumla ya karibu 1%. Kumbuka kuwa hii ilihisi kama changamoto 'sahihi' wakati huo na kadri unavyofikiria safari yako ni karibu 5%, kwamba umbali/gradient inaendelea kwa kitengo cha 1/HC (Alpe d'Heuz ni 8% zaidi ya 14 km) kwa hivyo ningedhani safari yako ni nzuri kidogo kuliko hiyo! Unaweza kuangalia mwinuko katika maeneo ya ramani na zana kama hii kupata wazo sahihi zaidi. Kwa hivyo kupanda kwako itakuwa changamoto nzuri, busara ya usawa. (Imesasishwa baada ya ufafanuzi wako!) Sikuwa sawa au haifai wakati huo lakini nilisimamia safari hii bila shida nyingi. Ya kuu ilikuwa ikifika kwa jasho hadi usawa wangu wa jumla umeboresha kidogo. Baiskeli niliyotumia ilikuwa GT Palomar - sio baiskeli ya kushangaza (au kweli!) Ilidumu vizuri ingawa na labda niliweka kilomita 3,000 juu yake kuanza wakati huo. Inafaa kuashiria kuwa nilikuwa nikitumia baiskeli tu katika hali nzuri, ama kuchukua basi au gari wakati mvua/theluji/barafu ilikuwa mbaya sana. 2 - Hafla ya pili ilikuwa hivi karibuni wakati, saa 41, niliamua ningejaribu na mzunguko kila siku kwa mwezi. Tena, mbali na safari chache za burudani ambazo sikuwahi kuwa kwenye baiskeli yangu kwa miaka. Kwa bahati mbaya nilichukua karibu Januari Wete kabisa ambayo Uingereza imewahi kuona kujaribu hii. Nilikuwa kwa kiasi kikubwa less fit than I was at 28 and probably carrying about an extra 5 or 6 kg too. I rode almost every day in January, averaging about 10-15 km a day for a total of about 400 km and lost most of the extra weight I was carrying. That I live in quite a hilly area helped as the overall gradient for all my January rides was over 1% (i.e. I climbed over 4,000 m in January).  Initially it was easy as I had a lot of motivation, despite the torrid conditions. Within about a week I was already noticing significant improvements in my segment times but then the weather worsened and it was a real struggle just getting out - there were so many flooded roads - but I persevered. Tracking my improvements helped a lot as I was able to see my personal best times tumble, in some cases I'm now doing some climb segments over twice as fast as I was in January and am in the top 20% on Strava - not bad for an old bloke on a XC MTB!  The bike I used was a Specialized Hardrock, a bit lighter than the GT but still nothing special.  I didn't suffer any real physical problems as I was careful to warm up/down and do lots of stretching. Padded shorts helped avoid any saddle sores. My thighs ached constantly for about five weeks, but I could almost watch the muscle being gained so it's no surprise.  I know that this isn't the recomended way to train and it is sub-optimal if pure fitness/training was the aim, but my goal was more of a holistic 'challenge to myself' and as such I knew what I was doing and that I could get 'fitter' by scheduling in rest days etc.  Now I've scaled my riding back a bit, but my month in the saddle taught me a lot about myself.

Mtu anaweza kuongeza jozi zote $ g, b $ ambapo $ g $ ni picha ya planar na Treewidth kwa $ k $ zaidi, $ b $ ni begi la ukubwa $ k $ kwamba kuna kupunguzwa kwa mti wa $ g $ na $ B $ kama begi. Sasa kwa kila jozi $ g, b $ ambapo $ g $ ina $ n-1 $ vertices tunaunda graph mpya $ g '$ kwa kila subset $ s $ ya $ b $ kwa kuongeza vertex $ v $ na $ s $ kama majirani na wacha $ b '$ iwe saizi $ k $ subset ya $ b \ kikombe V $. Ongeza $ g ', b' $ ikiwa $ g '$ ni sayari na sio isomorphic kwa jozi yoyote iliyopatikana tayari. Kufungwa rahisi juu ya viingilio vingapi one need to store is $n \choose k$ times the number of enumerated graphs but this is a pessimistic bound. For most graphs of treewidth k, most subsets of size k can not b a bag, e.g. a $k \times n$ grid has only $n \cdot 3^{k-1}$ possible bags.  I believe this will perform as well as the algorithm for non planar graphs since for every pair G,B we get a graph by making B a clique, most of these graphs will be non isomorphic.  There are several tricks one can apply to speed up this, I would suggest looking into: http://www.siam.org/meetings/alenex04/abstacts/HBodlaender.pdf

Je! Kuna kazi yoyote juu ya algorithms ya kukaribia (au algorithms halisi) ya kupata kifuniko cha mgawo wa grafu ya kiholela kwa kutumia sehemu kamili za K-sehemu? Nadhani shida hii ni NP-ngumu. Je! Ni? Je! Kuna neno bora kwa sehemu kamili ya k-sehemu (kama multiclique au kitu)? Hariri: K haijarekebishwa. Vifunguo vya kufunika vinaweza kuwa na maadili tofauti ya k. Hariri 2: Wakati I say "cover", I mean a cover over all the edges of the graph (not over all the vertices).  Furthermore, by "subgraph" I actually mean subgraph, not induced subgraph. k=1 no-edge subgraphs are useless and can be removed from the solution since they cover zero edges. By assignment-minimum, I mean find the solution which minimizes the number of assignments of vertices to subgraphs (as in http://dl.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=2275596)

Mali inayotaka inashikilia kwa seti huru (na labda shida zingine) kwenye picha za upana wa mti uliowekwa vizuri. Rekebisha $ yoyote ya $ \ epsilon> 0 $ na uzingatia shida ya kuweka huru iliyozuiliwa kwa picha za upana wa mti kwa zaidi ya $ n \ log_2 (1+ \ epsilon) = \ theta (\ epsilon n) $, ambapo $ n $ ndio nambari ya nambari ya wima. Piga shida hii $ \ pi_ \ epsilon $. Lemma 1. Shida $ \ pi_ \ epsilon $ ina algorithm inayoendesha kwa wakati $ o ((1+ \ epsilon)^n n^{o (1)}) $. Uthibitisho. Hii ni corollary moja kwa moja ya matokeo katika [1] --- kwamba seti huru ina algorithm inayoendesha kwa wakati $ o (2^{\ maandishi {tw} (g)} n^{o (1)}) $, ambapo $ \ maandishi {tw} (g) $ ni upana wa mti wa picha iliyopewa $ g $. $ ~ ~ \ Sanduku $ lemma 2. Kuzingatia ETH, hakuna algorithm kwa $ \ pi_ \ epsilon $ ambayo inaendesha kwa wakati $ 2^{o (n)} $. Uthibitisho. Per [2] Theorem 3.3, kudhani ETH, hakuna $ 2^{o (n)} $-algorithm ya wakati kwa seti ya kujitegemea. Tuseme kwa kupingana kuwa kuna algorithm $ A $ kwa $ \ pi_ \ epsilon $ inayoendesha kwa wakati $ 2^{o (n)} $. Jenga algorithm $ b $ kwa seti huru kama ifuatavyo: algorithm $ b $ kwenye pembejeo $ g $, grafu ya kiholela na vertices $ $: wacha $ g 'iwe graph iliyopatikana from $G$ by adding artificial vertices, each with no edges, to bring the total number of vertices to $n'=n/\log_2(1+\epsilon)$.   Run the algorithm $A$ for $\Pi_\epsilon$ on $G'$ to find a maximum independent set $I'$ in $G'$. Let $I$ be $I'$ minus all artificial vertices.  Return $I$.   Graph $G'$ has tree width at most $n'\log_2(1+\epsilon) = n$ because $G$ has tree width at most $n$.  So $A$ returns a maximum independent set $I'$ for $G'$ in time $2^{o(n')} = 2^{o(n)}$. $I'$ must consist of a maximum independent set $I$ in $G$ together with all the artificial vertices.  So $B$ returns a maximum independent set in $G$ in time $2^{o(n)}$, contradicting Theorem 3.3 of [2]. $~~~\Box$  Note: Edited 12/30/2019 to correct an error in the lower-bound argument.  [1] Invitation to Fixed-parameter Algorithms. Rolf Niedermeier. Oxford Lecture Series in Mathematics and its Applications, Vol. 31. Oxford University Press, Oxford  [2] Lower bounds based on the exponential time hypothesis. D Lokshtanov, D Marx, S Saurabh - Bulletin of the EATCS no 105, pp. 41 71, October 2011

Kwa kuzingatia kuweka $ [n] $, chini ya hali gani ya vigezo $ a, b, c $ je! Familia ya subsets $ \ mathcal {f} \ subseteq 2^{[n]} $ na mali ifuatayo ipo? . . . Kama ilivyoelezwa hapo chini na Aryeh, a trivial case can be $\mathcal{F}=\{S_1,S_2\}$ with $S_1=[n/2]$ and $S_2=[n]-S_1$, where we have $a=c=n/2$ and $b=n$. Basically the problem asks under what condition of $a,b$ we can get $c=o(n)$.  Any known results or related ideas about nontrivial sufficient (no need to be necessary of course) condition of $a,b,c$ is appreciated.  This combinatorial problem rises from a communication game, and may have concrete connection with error-correcting codes.

Acha $ f = (f_1, \ ldots, f_n) $ kuwa mlolongo wa polynomials ya multivariate $ f_i: \ mathbb {r}^d \ kwa \ mathbb {r} $, na $ g: \ {0,1 \^^ n \ kwa \ {0,1 \} $ kazi ya boolean. Sema muundo $ $ h (x) = g (f_1 (x)> 0, \ ldots, f_n (x)> 0) $ $ anajibu swali muhimu la jiometri (k.v. ni makutano ya duru mbili ndani ya tatu?) . Acha $ \ deg (f) = \ max_i \ deg (f_i) $ iwe kiwango cha juu cha polynomials yoyote. Swali: Je! Kuna algorithm ya kuangalia whether $\deg(F)$ can be reduced without changing $h(x)$?  Are there practical implementations of such (perhaps in Mathematica or Sage)?  I believe this is essentially a question of polynomial irreducibility, and the answer may be as simple as checking whether the highest degree $f_i$s factor.  However, since the answer may be simply be "yes, it's minimal", I want to be sure before I publish such a claim.

Taa nyingi za kisasa hutumia betri za lithiamu za rejareja. Hizo huja katika sababu tatu za fomu: seli za mkoba, seli za silinda na seli za sarafu. Seli za mkoba huja katika vipimo vingi tofauti ambavyo vinawapa wazalishaji kubadilika sana wakati wa kubuni bidhaa. Pia zina nyaya zilizowekwa moja kwa moja na ni dhaifu kabisa. Nzuri kwa uzani na saizi lakini mbaya kwa kushughulikia na mtumiaji. Seli za cylindrical kama 18650 zina ganda lenye nguvu la chuma. Wakati mwingine huweza kubadilishwa lakini kwa njia hii hii haijawahi kushikwa. Wakati mwingi huuzwa moja kwa moja au kujumuishwa kwenye pakiti ya betri (betri za zamani zaidi za kompyuta ni ganda la plastiki na umeme kadhaa karibu na seli 18650). Seli za sarafu kawaida huuzwa moja kwa moja kwa bodi ya mzunguko. Nadhani unaweza kutengeneza mmiliki wa seli ya sarafu lakini hiyo huongeza tu saizi na uzito na inaleta hatua nyingine ya kutofaulu. Kwa hivyo tu seli za silinda zinaweza kubadilishwa na mtumiaji wa kawaida wa mwisho. Jambo lingine ni malipo ya sasa na voltage. Betri za Lithium ion hutofautiana kidogo katika malipo ya voltage ya malipo na malipo ya sasa. Wengine wanaweza kushtakiwa hadi 4.3V, wengine hadi 4.1V tu. Malipo ya seli ya 4.1V up to 4.3V can cause it to go up in flames. So if the device has a built-in charger you’d somehow have to make sure that a cell with the correct charging cutoff voltage is inserted or that the correct voltage is selected. I guess yet another factor is that a battery charge level indicator can be directly integrated into the device’s circuit board instead of being a separate circuit inside the battery. Charge level indicators either estimate the level via battery voltage (which again, varies slightly between LiIon batteries) or by measuring the energy going in and out of the battery (Coulomb counters) Apart from that there are generally some advantages in not having a hatch and battery holder for user-replaceable batteries.  Less complexity (more robust, cheaper) Easier to make dust and waterproof Smaller Lighter More flexibility in the case design Product only lasts about 5 to 10 years. Of course that’s only an advantage for the manufacturer because they can sell you a new one.  There is simply no easy way to make a tiny, water-resistant, 40g light like this with a 420mAh Li-Ion battery and have it user-replaceable:

Kudumisha msimamo wa kuendesha gari na kasi iliyoamriwa na barabara na hali ya hewa. Kuwa na ufahamu wa baiskeli lakini usisikie kukimbilia kuvuta ikiwa unataka kuwaruhusu kupita, ni juu ya baiskeli kungojea barabara salama ya kupita. Ifananishe kama vile ungefanya wakati wa kuendesha nyuma ya trekta (au yoyote slower moving vehicle), you should (and likely do) wait patiently for the tractor to find a suitable place to pull over and relieve trailing traffic or for a clear stretch of road to execute a safe overtake.  The cyclist was arrogant and rude so for that, as a cyclist, I apologise on behalf of the rest of us.

Jibu la maswali yako inategemea ni aina gani ya kupungua unayotumia kwa wazo lako la ugumu. Ikiwa unatumia kupunguzwa kwa nafasi ya polynomial, basi naamini jibu la Daniel ni sawa. Ikiwa unatumia kupunguzwa kwa wakati wa polynomial, hata hivyo, tofauti tu ni kweli. Yaani, kudhani $ exp \ neq pspace $, kuna shida katika $ exp $ ambayo sio $ pspace $ wala ngumu kwa $PSPACE$ under polynomial-time reductions. This can essentially be constructed by diagonalizing against all possible polynomial-time reductions to $QBF$ (preventing the constructed language from being in $PSPACE$) and from $QBF$ (preventing the constructed language from being $PSPACE$-hard).  Also, by the general version of Ladner's Theorem, if $EXP \neq PSPACE$ then there are problems in $EXP \backslash PSPACE$ which are not $EXP$-hard under polynomial-time reductions.

Mbali na kuanzisha kusimamishwa kwake na shinikizo lake la tairi (karibu 27-29psi ikiwa unazungumza juu ya baiskeli za kuteremka, zilizopo na matairi), hawezi kufanya mengi ... yote ni juu ya ustadi wake. Nitapewa nambari chanya $ Z $, na ninataka kupata msingi mzuri $ B $ ambayo ni nzuri kwa $ Z $. Msingi $ B $ ni multiset ya nambari chanya. Msingi $ B $ inachukuliwa kuwa nzuri kwa $ z $ ikiwa, kwa nambari zote zisizo za hasi $ x, y $ kama kwamba $ x+y = z $, tunayo yafuatayo: kuna multisets $ b_x, b_y $ kama hiyo $ x = \ jumla_ Inaongeza kuzidisha kwa vitu vya kawaida, na operesheni ya chini inakagua kwamba kuzidisha ni ndogo sana). Kwa maneno mengine, kwa kila njia inayowezekana ya kuamua $ z $ kwa jumla ya nambari mbili zisizo na hasi, kila moja ya nambari hizo lazima ieleweke kama jumla ya vitu kutoka msingi, na lazima kuwe na vitu vya msingi vya kutosha katika $ B $ ambayo "hauwezi" kumaliza "ya vitu. Unapotumia kipengee cha msingi kutoka $ B $ kusaidia kuelezea $ x $, basi hutumika na huwezi kutumia kitu hicho cha msingi kwa kuelezea $ y $ (lakini ikiwa kuna nakala nyingine katika $ b $, wewe ni wewe bure kutumia nakala ya pili kwa $ y $). Natumahi hii ina maana. Saizi ya msingi $ B $ ni idadi ya vitu katika multiset $ b $ (counting multiplicities).  Smaller is better.  An optimal basis is one that is as small as possible.  My question: is there a feasible algorithm that, given $z$, computes an optimal basis $B$ that's good for $z$?  Or, an approximation algorithm that computes a basis that's reasonably close to optimal?  How small can we make the basis, on average?  A naive algorithm: one simple approach is to use the basis $B=\{1,1,2,2,4,4,8,8,\dots,2^k,2^k\}$ (for $k=\lfloor \lg z \rfloor$), so the basis contains two copies of each power of 2 smaller than $z$.  This is certainly good for $z$: we can express $x$ in binary, express $y$ in binary, and since we have two copies of each power of two, we won't run out of basis elements (even if some power of two is common to both binary expressions, that's OK, since we have two copies, one for $x$ and one for $y$).  Its size is approximately $2 \lg z$, so it is pretty small.  However, it is not optimal in general: this basis could be up to a factor of two larger than optimal, depending upon $z$.  Can you do better?  If it helps, in my application I would expect $z$ to be no larger than 1000 or so.

Mabadiliko: Aliongeza Lemmas 2 na 3. Hapa kuna jibu la sehemu: Unaweza kufikia nafasi $ n $ katika $ n $ hatua kwa kutumia nafasi $ n^{o (\ epsilon (n))} $, ambapo $ \ epsilon (n) = 1/\ sqrt {\ logi n} $. . Pia, tunachora kizuizi cha chini (Lemma 3): Kwa darasa fulani la suluhisho zinazojulikana kama zenye tabia nzuri, Lemma 1 ni ngumu (hadi sababu za mara kwa mara kwenye kiboreshaji), na hakuna suluhisho kama hilo kwa kutumia nafasi ya logi inayoweza kufikia Nafasi $ n $ kwa wakati $ o (n \, \ maandishi {polylog} \, n) $. LEMMA 1. Kwa $ n $ zote, inawezekana kufikia nafasi $ n $ katika $ n $ hatua kwa kutumia nafasi $ $ \ exp (o (\ sqrt {\ logi n}) ~ = ~ n^{o (1 /\ sqrt {\ logi n})} Uthibitisho wa $ $. Mpango huo unarudiwa, kama inavyoonyeshwa kwenye takwimu hapa chini. Tunatumia nukuu ifuatayo: $ k $ ni idadi ya viwango katika recursion $ p (k) $ ndio suluhisho linaloundwa (na viwango vya $ k $ ya kujirudia). $ N (k) $ ni nafasi ya juu iliyofikiwa na $ p (k) $ (kwa wakati $ n (k) $). $ S (k) $ ni nafasi inayotumiwa na $ p (k) $. $ L (k) $ ni idadi ya tabaka zinazotumiwa na $ p (k) $, kama inavyoonyeshwa hapa chini: Katika picha, wakati unaendelea kutoka juu hadi chini. Suluhisho $ p (k) $ haachi kwa wakati $ n (k) $, badala yake (kwa matumizi katika kujirudia) inaendelea hadi wakati $ 2 \, n (k) $, inabadilisha hatua zake, ili kurudi kwa kokoto moja kwa wakati $ 2 \, n (k) $. Mistari thabiti ya wima ya $ L (k) $ $ $ p (k) $. Katika picha, $ l (k) $ ni tano, kwa hivyo $ p (k) $ ina tabaka 5. Kila moja ya $ l (k) tabaka za $ p (k) $ (isipokuwa kulia kabisa) ina shida mbili ndogo, moja juu ya safu na moja chini, iliyounganishwa na mstari wa wima (unaowakilisha Pebble ambayo ipo kwa muda huo). Katika picha, kuna tabaka tano, kwa hivyo kuna subproblems tisa. Kwa ujumla, $ p (k) $ inaundwa na $ 2 \, l (k) -1 $ subproblems. Kila subproblem ya $ p (k) $ ina suluhisho $ p (k-1) $. Uchunguzi muhimu wa kufunga nafasi ni kwamba, wakati wowote, tabaka mbili tu zina "kazi" ndogo. Wengine huchangia kokoto moja tu kila kwa hivyo tuna $ s (k) \ le l (k) + 2 \, s (k-1) $, na $ n (k) = l (k) \ cdot n (k- 1) $ Sasa, tunachagua $ l (k) $ ili kuamua kikamilifu $ p (k) $. Sina hakika kama chaguo hili ni bora, lakini inaonekana karibu: chukua $ l (k) = 2^k $. Halafu marudio hapo juu hutoa $ s (k) \ le k \ cdot 2^k $, na $ n (k) = 2^{k (k+1)/2} $ hivyo, kutatua kwa $ n = n (k (k ) $, tuna $ k \ approx \ sqrt {2 \ logi n} $ na $ s (k) \ approx \ sqrt {2 \ logi n} \, 2^{\ sqrt {2 \ logi n} = \ exp (o (\ sqrt {\ logi n})) $. Hii inachukua nafasi zote $ n $ katika seti $ \ {n (k): k \ in \ {1,2, \ ldots \} \} $. Kwa kiholela $ n $, punguza chini ya suluhisho $ p (k) $ kwa $ ndogo k $ na $ n (k) \ ge n $. Kilichohitajika kinashikilia kwa sababu $ s (k) / s (k-1) = o (1) $. Qed Lemma 2. Kwa $ \ delta yoyote> 0 $, kwa $ n $ zote, inawezekana kufikia nafasi ya $ n $ katika $ n^{1+ \ delta} $ Moves kutumia nafasi $ o (\ delta 2^{ 1/\ delta} \ logi n). $ Uthibitisho. Rekebisha ujenzi kutoka kwa uthibitisho wa Lemma 1 kuchelewesha kuanza kila sehemu ndogo hadi sehemu ndogo iliyomalizika, kama inavyoonyeshwa hapa chini: Acha $ t (k) $ iashiria wakati wa suluhisho lililobadilishwa $ p (k) $ kumaliza. Sasa kwa kila hatua ya wakati, safu moja tu ina subproblem ambayo inachangia zaidi ya kokoto moja, kwa hivyo $ s (k) \ le l (k) + s (k-1) $, $ n (k) = l (k) \ cdot n (k-1) $, $ t (k) = (2 \, l (k) -1) \ cdot t (k-1) \ le 2 \, l (k) \ cdot t (k- 1) \ le 2^k n (k) $. Chagua $ l (k) = 2^{1/\ delta} $, tunapata $ s (k) \ le k 2^{1/\ delta} $, $N(k) = 2^{k/\delta}$, $T(k) \le 2^k N(k)$.   Solving for $S = S(k)$ and $T=T(k)$ in terms of $n=N(k)$, we have $k=\delta \log n$, and   $S \le \delta 2^{1/\delta} \log n$, and $T \le n^{1+\delta}$.     This takes care of all positions $n$ in the set $\{N(k) : k\in\{1,2,\ldots\}\}$.  For arbitrary $n$, trim the bottom of the solution $P(k)$ for the smallest $k$ with $N(k)\ge n$.  The desired bound holds because $S(k) / S(k-1) = O(1)$.  QED    The solutions in the proofs of Lemmas 1 and 2 are well-behaved, in that, for sufficiently large $n$, for each solution $P(n)$ that reaches position $n$ there is a position $k\le n/2$ such that only one pebble is ever placed at position $k$, and the solution decomposes into a (well-behaved) solution $P(N-k)$ for positions $k+1,k+2,\ldots,n$ and two (well-behaved) solutions $P(k)$, each for positions $1,2,\ldots,k$, connected by the pebble at position $k$.  With an appropriate definition of well-behaved, let $V(n)$ denote the minimum pebble volume (the sum over time of the number of pebbles at each time) for any well-behaved solution. The definition implies that for sufficiently large $n$, for $\delta=1>0$, $$V(n) \ge \min_{k<n} V(n-k) + \max(n/2, (1+\delta) V(k)).$$  I conjecture that for every sufficiently large $n$ there is a well-behaved solution that minimizes pebble volume.  Maybe somebody can prove it?  (Or just that some near-optimal solution satisfies the recurrence...)  Recall that $\epsilon(n) = 1/\sqrt{\log n}$.  Lemma 3. For any constant $\delta>0$, the above recurrence implies $V(n) \ge  n^{1+\Omega(\epsilon(n))}$.  Before we sketch the proof of the lemma, note that it implies that any well-behaved solution that reaches position $n$ in $t$ steps has to take space at least $n^{1+\Omega(\epsilon(n))}/t$ at some step.  This yields corollaries such as:   Lemma 1 is tight up to constant factors in the exponent (for well-behaved solutions). No well-behaved solution can reach position $n$ in $n\,\text{polylog}\, n$ time steps using space $\text{polylog}\, n$.  (Using here that $n^{\Omega(\epsilon(n))} = \exp(\Omega(\sqrt{\log n})) \not\subseteq \,\text{polylog}\, n$.)   Proof sketch.  We show $2 V(n) \ge f(n)$ where $f(n) = n^{1+c\epsilon(n)}$ for some sufficiently small constant $c.$  We assume WLOG that $n$ is arbitrarily large, because by taking $c>0$ small enough, we can ensure $2 V(n) \ge f(n)$ for any finite set of $n$ (using here that $V(n)\ge n$, say).  The lemma will follow inductively from the recurrence as long as, for all sufficiently large $n$, we have $f(n) \le \min_{k<n} f(n-k) + \max(n, 2 f(k))$, that is, $f(n) - f(n-k) \le \max(n, (1+\delta) f(k))$ for $k<n.$  Since $f$ is convex, we have $f(n) - f(n-k) \le k f'(n)$.  So it suffices if $k f'(n) \le \max(n, (1+\delta) f(k)).$  By a short calculation (using $f(n)/n = e^{c\sqrt{\log n}}$ and $f'(n)=(f(n)/n)(1+c/(2\sqrt{\log n})),$ and using a change of variables $x = \sqrt{\log k}$ and $y=\sqrt{\log n}$), this inequality is equivalent to the following: for all sufficiently large $y$ and $x\le y$, $e^{cy}(1+c/(2y)) \le \max(e^{y^2 - x^2}, (1+\delta) e^{cx})$.  Since $1+z\le e^z$, and $e^z\le 1+2z$ for $z\le 1$, it suffices to show $e^{cy + c/(2y)} \le \max(e^{y^2 - x^2}, e^{2\delta+cx}),$ that is, $$cy + c/(2y) \le \max(y^2 - x^2, 2\delta+cx).$$  If $y \le x + 0.1\delta/c$, then $cy+c/(2y) \le cx + 0.2\delta$ (for large $y$) and we are done, so assume $y\ge x + 0.1\delta/c$.  Then $y^2-x^2 \ge 0.1y\delta/c$ (for large $y$), so it suffices to show $$cy + c/(2y) \le 0.1 y\delta/c.$$ This holds for sufficiently small $c$ and large $y.$  QED

Shimano 11 kasi ya MTB na derailleurs za barabara na vibadilishaji haziendani. Cable kuvuta kwa mabadiliko na uwiano wa uelekezaji wa derailleur ni tofauti. Tazama ukurasa huu wa mzunguko wa sanaa] (https://www.artscyclery.com/science-behind-the-magic/science-behind-the-magic-drivetrain-compatibility/). Vikundi vya MTB hutumia kuvuta kwa cable ndefu kuwa ya kuaminika zaidi katika hali chafu. Wakati uwiano wa nyuma wa derailleur/uwiano wa uelekezaji umeandikwa vizuri, zile za mbele are not, but I have to assume 11 speed MTB and road groups use different pulls and are not compatible.  MTB double cranks typically have a 10 tooth difference between rings whereas roads cranks have a 16 tooth difference. Cages on MTB front derailleurs are therefore smaller and will not work with road cranks.

PhD is a testimony of ones ability to pursue relevant and significant research on his or her own.

Ujenzi kamili wa Hash (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/perfect_hash_function#construction) itatumika kwa kesi yoyote ya matumizi na funguo za tuli au zisizobadilika (k.m. majina ya kiwango cha juu kwenye ruta, maneno katika washirika, au majina ya kazi Katika maktaba za kawaida) lakini mara ya mwisho niliangalia sikuweza kupata utekelezaji wowote. Utaftaji wa parametric unaweza kutatua shida nyingi za uboreshaji, pamoja na zingine ambazo zinaweza kuonekana kama zinapaswa kuwa np-ngumu, kwa wakati wa polynomial. Utaftaji wa karatasi uliopewa jina vizuri made practical implements a variant of parametric search, but still I do not think it has been implemented in practical software.  The optimal algorithm for line segment intersection by Chazelle and Edelsbrunner finds all $k$ intersections of $n$ line segments in $O(n \log n + k)$ time, but is complex. CGAL is a sophisticated geometry algorithm library, but implements a simpler algorithm that is $O((n+k) \log n)$.

Kanuni hiyo hiyo pia inatumika kwa mavazi ya kutafakari usiku. Taa za kung'aa, pia huongeza sana nafasi za kuonekana na dereva wa gari linalokaribia. Je! Kuwa na sura ya baiskeli katika rangi mkali pia hupunguza sana uwezekano wa kupigwa na gari?
