Given that I will be using the bicycle mainly in the country side, and not in cities, I am expecting fast moving, but not very dense traffic, and few intersections. I am most worried about the cars over-taking me from the rear.)

Maoni tu yaliyopanuliwa kujaribu kutafsiri swali. Kwa kuzingatia mashine ya Kujaribu $ m $ ambayo imeahidiwa kusimamisha juu ya kamba zote za pembejeo; $ M $ inaitwa haieleweki ikiwa na tu ikiwa ni kwa angalau nambari moja chanya ya semidefinite nambari halisi $ r $ $ ifuatayo ya uamuzi wa swali $ q_ {m, r} $ haiwezekani (i.e. haiwezekani kujenga algorithm moja ambayo inaongoza kila wakati Kwa jibu sahihi la Yes-au-No): Chaguo 1 $ q_ {m, r} (n) $ = "Je! $ m $ halts kwa chini ya $ n^r $ hatua kwa pembejeo zote za urefu wa $ n $?" Inaweza kuamuliwa (Finite $ 2^n $ kamba na $ m $ daima inasimamia na hypothesis) $ \ kulia no incomprehensible TMs  OPTION 2  $Q_{M,r}$ = "Is $M$ running time $O(n^r)$ ?"  Trivially decidable (1 or 0) $\Rightarrow$ there are no incomprehensible TMs  And if you ask: "Ok, but can we calculate the value 1 or 0 to build the algorithm that answer the question of Option 2?", then we fall back to this:  $Q_{r}(M)$ = "Is $M$ running time $O(n^r)$?" which is undecidable (using the standard definition of undecidable) as showed by Emanuele. But in this version M is an input of the problem and not the fixed $M$ for which you are defining the notion of "incomprehensible".

Nakubaliana na Jarrett - mimi pia hujifunga kwa kugeuza kisigino ndani na pia ni mantiki kwa kuwa mguu wako uko facing slightly away from the bike on release, just seems to make more sense and going the other way seems un-natural for me.

Je! Kuna kufungwa kwenye saizi ya mti wa BSP kwa polygon rahisi? Ninajua matokeo ya Toth ambayo hutoa $ \ theta (n \ logi (n) / \ logi (\ logi (n))) $ iliyofungwa kwenye saizi ya BSP inayojumuisha $ n $ disjoint, lakini Nashangaa ikiwa it is possible to do better given some of the special properties of simple polygons.  For example, it is trivial to show that convex polygons can be represented by BSP trees using at most $O(n)$ nodes.  Is it possible to represent simple polygons in linear space as well?

Kukosa kujilimbikizia hufanyika kwa hesabu fulani ($ \#\ mathsf {p} $) mali, na labda kwa wengi wao. Mfano rahisi ni idadi ya subgraphs za spanning ($ 2^m $). Idadi ya kingo za grafu isiyo ya kawaida hubadilika na $ \ pm \ theta (n) $ kwa hivyo idadi ya vijidudu vya spanning hubadilika kwa sababu ya $ 2^{\ theta (n)} $, mbali na $ (1+ \ Epsilon) $ sababu unayotumia katika ufafanuzi wako wa mkusanyiko. Kuonyesha kuwa hii sio mfano wa pekee, hapa kuna hoja (sio ngumu kabisa lakini ikiwezekana kufanywa kuwa ngumu) kwa nini kushindwa kujilimbikizia inapaswa pia kuwa kweli kwa idadi ya mizunguko ya Hamiltonia. Thamani inayotarajiwa ya nambari hii ni wazi $ (n-1)!/2^{n+1} $: kila moja ya $ (n-1)!/2 $ mlolongo wa mzunguko wa vertices ina $ 1/2^n $ nafasi ya actually being a Hamiltonian cycle. By a similar argument, the expected amount of change to this number caused by introducing a new edge would be $(n-2)!/2^{n-1}$, smaller by a linear factor. If the number of Hamiltonian cycles were strongly concentrated, most edge flips would cause an amount of change to this number that is close to its expected value. But then the $\Theta(n)$ fluctuation in the number of edges would cause a fluctuation in the number of Hamiltonian cycles that is proportional to its expected value, contradicting the assumption of strong concentration.  Other plausible candidates for failure to concentrate include the number of colorings (partitions of the vertices into independent sets), number of matchings or perfect matchings, or number of spanning trees.

Katika "aya ya mwisho" ya "ukurasa wa kwanza" wa karatasi ifuatayo: Vikraman Arvind, Johannes Köbler, Uwe Schöning, Rainer Schuler, "Ikiwa NP ina mizunguko ya ukubwa wa polynomial, kisha Ma = Am," Sayansi ya Kompyuta ya nadharia, 1995. Nilikutana na madai fulani ya kukabiliana na uvumbuzi: $ (\ sigma^p_2 \ cap \ pi^p_2)^{np} = \ sigma^p_3 \ cap \ pi^p_3 $ Nadhani kitambulisho hapo juu kimetolewa kutoka kwa zifuatazo: $ . {Np} = np^{np^{np}} $, ambayo ni isiyo ya kawaida! Hariri: Kwa kuzingatia maoni ya Kristoffer hapa chini, ningependa kuongeza maoni yafuatayo kutoka kwa Kitabu cha Ugumu wa Goldreich (mash. 118-119): Inapaswa kuwa wazi kuwa darasa $ C_1^{C_2} $ inaweza kufafanuliwa kwa mbili Madarasa ya ugumu $C_1$ and $C_2$, provided that $C_1$ is associated with a class of standard machines that generalizes naturally to a class of oracle machines. Actually, the class $C_1^{C_2}$ is not defined based on the class $C_1$ but rather by analogy to it. Specifically, suppose that $C_1$ is the class of sets that are recognizable (or rather accepted) by machines of a certain type (e.g., deterministic or non-deterministic) with certain resource bounds (e.g., time and/or space bounds). Then, we consider analogous oracle machines (i.e., of the same type and with the same resource bounds), and say that $S \in C_1^{C_2}$ if there exists an adequate oracle machine $M_1$ (i.e., of this type and resource bounds) and a set $S_2 \in C_2$ such that $M_1^{S_2}$ accepts the set $S$.

Fikiria mchezo wa kadi ufuatao (unaojulikana nchini Italia kama "Cavacamicia," ambayo inaweza kutafsiriwa kama "stripshirt"): wachezaji wawili waligawanyika kwa nasibu katika dawati mbili za kadi za kawaida. Kila mchezaji anapata staha moja. Wacheza hubadilisha chini kwenye stack kadi inayofuata kutoka kwa staha yao. Ikiwa mchezaji (A) anaweka kadi maalum, i.e. A, II, au III, mchezaji mwingine (B) lazima aweke chini mfululizo idadi inayolingana ya kadi. Ikiwa kwa kufanya hivyo B huweka kadi maalum, hatua inarudi, na kadhalika; Vinginevyo, ikiwa b places down the corresponding number of cards but no special card, A collects all the cards that were put down and adds them to their deck.  A then restarts the game by placing down a card.   The first player to run out of cards loses the game.  Note: The outcome of the game depends exclusively on the initial partition of the deck.  (Which may make this game look a bit pointless ;-)  Question: Does this game always terminate? What if we generalize this game and give any two sequences of cards to each player?

Acha $ g = (v, e) $ iwe graph. Acha $ m (g) = | e | $ na $ n (g) = | v | $. Kuna ufafanuzi mbili tofauti za wiani kwa $ g $: $ $ d_1 (g) = \ frac {m (g)} {n (g)} $ $ na $ $ d_2 (g) = \ frac {m (g)} {n (g) -1}. $ $ Acha $ h^* \ subseteq g $ kuwa ndogo ya $ g $ kama kwamba $ $ d_1 (h^*) \ geq d_1 (h) $ $ kwa subgraph yoyote $ h \ subseteq g $. Swali langu ni: Je! Ni kweli kwamba kwa subgraph yoyote $ h \ subseteq g $ bado tuna $ $ d_2 (h^*) \ geq d_2 (h)? $ $ Maoni yoyote yanakaribishwa! Sasisha 1: J.G ilionyesha kuwa taarifa hiyo sio kweli kwa kutoa mfano wa hesabu. Fikiria pembetatu mbili ambazo hazijaunganishwa na makali moja. Bila kuangalia pia rasmi, $^*$ ni grafu kamili na thamani ya $ 7/6 $ chini ya ufafanuzi wa kwanza, lakini ama ya pembetatu ina thamani ya $ 3/2 $ chini ya ufafanuzi wa pili wakati grafu kamili ina tu value $7/5$.  Update 2: I found that a maximum density subgraph (with the definition $d_1(G)=\frac{m(G)}{n(G)}$) can be found efficiently by using algorithms provided in references:  A. V. Goldberg. Finding a maximum density subgraph. Technical Report UCB/CSD-84-171, University of California at Berkeley, 1984. G. Gallo, M. D. Grigoriadis, and R. E. Tarjan. A Fast Parametric Maximum Flow Algorithm and Applications. SIAM Journal on Computing, 18(1):30–55, 1989.  However, I didn't find any reference for computing a maximum density subgraph (with the definition $d_2 (G)=\frac{m(G)}{n(G)-1}$). As pointed by J.G, a maximum $d_1$-density subgraph may not be a maximum $d_2$-density subgraph. My new question is: Is there any efficient algorithm for computing a maximum density subgraph (with the definition $d_2 (G)=\frac{m(G)}{n(G)-1}$)?

Ninaweza kuona pande zote mbili za hoja ya baiskeli zilizowekwa dhidi ya baiskeli ambazo hazikusudiwa. Kwa upande mmoja, una nguvu zaidi katika eneo la ardhi/kasi/urahisi wa kusonga, wakati uko kwa uzuri wa unyenyekevu. Kujibu swali lako, waendeshaji wengi wa SS (kasi moja) wanasema kwamba kwa sababu una gia moja tu, una matengenezo kidogo na baiskeli yako. Hii inamaanisha kuwa hauna nyaya za kuhama kwa lube au kurekebisha/tune, na sio lazima kuwa na wasiwasi juu ya kuharibu derailleur kwani hakuna moja. Derailleur iliyoharibiwa mara nyingi ni matokeo ya kuacha baiskeli au kuipiga dhidi ya kitu. Pia una unyenyekevu wa kutokuchagua kati ya gia mbali mbali. Kwa mpanda farasi mpya kwa baiskeli, hii inaweza kuwa na faida kwani una uwezekano mdogo wa "kushuka" mnyororo off the chain ring, or be stuck in between gears, or end up in a gear that is either too high or low. The only maintenance one might foresee-ably have is cleaning and relubing the chain every other week to keep it in good working order, and checking the chain tension to make sure that the chain stays on properly.  An SS set up can also be helpful in strength training and cadence training, as it is likely that one won't have it geared perfect for every slope. It may be too big to climb hills easier, therefore strength training, and it may be too small to go all too fast on flat ground, therefore cadence training.  I hope that this was enough of an objective opinion for you to make a decision

Inajulikana kuwa shida nyingi za NP-kamili zinaonyesha mpito wa awamu. Ninavutiwa hapa katika mpito wa awamu kwa heshima na kontena katika lugha, badala ya ugumu wa pembejeo, jamaa na algorithm. Ili kufanya wazo lisiwe ngumu, wacha tufafanue rasmi kama ifuatavyo. Lugha $ l $ inaonyesha mabadiliko ya awamu (kwa heshima na kontena), ikiwa kuna paramu ya agizo $ r (x) $, ambayo ni wakati wa polynomial computable, kazi halisi ya mfano. Kuna kizingiti $ t $. Labda ni ya kawaida, au inaweza kutegemea $ n = | x | $, ambayo ni, $ t = t (n) $. Kwa karibu kila $ x $ with $r(x)<t$, we have $x\in L$. (Almost every means here: all but vanishingly many, that is, the proportion approaches 1, as $n\rightarrow\infty$). For almost every $x$ with $r(x)>t$, we have $x\notin L$. For almost every $x$, it holds that $r(x)\neq t$.  (That is, the transitional region is "narrow.")    Many natural NP-complete problems exhibit phase transition in this sense. Examples are numerous variants of SAT, all monotone graph properties, various constraint satisfaction problems,  and probably many others.  Question: Which are some "nice" exceptions? Is there a natural NP-complete problem, which (probably) does not have a phase transition in the above sense?

Grafu za chordal zinaweza kufafanuliwa kama picha ya makutano ya subtrees ya mti wowote. Kwa hivyo jibu la swali lako la uamuzi ni kweli ndio. Kwenye upande wa ujenzi, kwa kila subtree $ t_v $ of bags (it's convenient and conventional to call the nodes of the tree as bags), you'll have a unique new vertex $v$, which is put into all bags of the $T_v$.

Utegemezi ni wa kuvutia kwa sababu ya usawa, na usawa ni pamoja na contraction. Kama matokeo, calculi ya muundo (ambayo kwa ujumla omit contraction) haina maoni dhahiri ya usawa. Katika lugha ya nadharia, usawa unaonyeshwa na sheria ifuatayo ya uelekezaji [*] kuwa halali katika pande zote mbili (juu-chini na chini-juu): $ $ \ kuanza {safu} {l} \ gamma, x, x : \ tau, y: \ tau \; | \; \ Theta, x = y: \ tau \ vdash p \\ \ hline \ gamma, z: \ tau \; | \; [z/x, z/y] \ theta: \ tau \ vdash [Z/x, z/y] p \\ \ mwisho $, na dhana ni sawa, ambayo hukuruhusu kupata vitu sawa vinabadilisha zote mbili kwa $ Z $ $. Kumbuka kuwa kutoka juu kwenda chini ni contraction - idadi ya matumizi ya $ Z $ itakuwa jumla ya matumizi ya $ x $ na $ y $. Kama matokeo, kutafsiri maana ya usawa katika calculi ya mstari ni gumu. Jambo la dhahiri kufanya ni kuzuia umakini wako kwa aina ambazo zina mikataba, lakini zinageuka kuna njia nyingi ambazo hazilinganishwi za kufanya hivyo! Wazo moja, linalotokana na kazi kwenye mstari wa LF na cervesato na pfenning, ni kwa only permit dependency on exponential types.   I, with Nick Benton and Pierre Pradic, gave another calculus based on another version of this idea, which exploited Benton and Wadler's characterization of linear logic in terms of an adjunction between a cartesian closed category and a monoidal closed category. Basically, we just made the CCC part dependent, so that linear types could be dependent on intuitionistic types, but not vice-versa. (However, you could be dependent on closed linear terms, since they are duplicable.)   In his PhD thesis, Matthijs Vákár gave a denotational model of Linear LF. His semantics was based on Benton-Wadler adjoint models, so it should also interpret our calculus.  The other main idea is due to Conor McBride, with subsequent refinements by Bob Atkey. His idea is based on resource interpretations of linear logic, with the idea that if you forget the resource usage information on a linear term, you are left with a nonlinear term approximating it. Then, you can depend on that nonlinear term.     [*] This inference rule is for the case of first-order logic. The dependent case is more complicated, but the underlying issues are the same.

Niliuliza swali kama hilo (au angalau swali ambalo linazua maswala kama hayo) hapa miezi michache iliyopita: kusonga mbele kwa Shimano 9- hadi Shimano 10- kasi ya suala sio safu tofauti za Shimano kwa sekunde, inakwenda kutoka 9 hadi 10 kasi. Unaweza kufikiria kuwa vibadilishaji vya kasi 10 vitakuwa vinatarajia kaseti ya kasi 10 upande mwingine wa waya-mambo haya yameorodheshwa baada ya yote. Shida nyingine ya kwenda kutoka kwa kaseti ya 9- hadi 10 ni mnyororo. Utahitaji mpya, nyembamba. Na kwa bahati mbaya hii inamaanisha derailleur mpya halisi pia. Kwa kweli, hii inagonga tena kwenye derailleur ya mbele. Na minyororo. Lakini kwa upande wa usanidi wa mbele, nilishauriwa kwamba niweze kupata na usanidi wangu uliopo. Isipokuwa unataka kwenda kwa kasi 10, unaweza kuwa na bahati nzuri kufanya kile mimi did - jump over 105 altogether and head for the old Ultegra 6500 range.....which was 9-speed. I suspect if you could find shifters from this range, it would do the trick. Alternatively you could go not quite as far and upgrade to Tiagra - I believe the current Tiagra range is now 10-speed, but its not so long ago that it was 9-speed. (The bike I raised my question about was a 2011 model.) Obviously Ultegra will give you better quality but you'll still find Tiagra shifters a noticeable step up from Soras.   If you really do want to go to a 10-speed 105 setup, well I think I costed it as something like GBP400 or more...not a lot less than buying the whole 105 groupset (which can be bought as a single product). But I seem to remember the biggest single cost was the shifters, so take that as an indication.

Bashrings nyingi za 104 za BCD za aina ambazo hazina kukatwa kwa mkono wa crank zinaweza kuingiliana na mkono wa crank wakati ulipoweka nje ya kutosha kwenda "juu" ya pete kwenye crank ya 1x. Kuna pia swali la spacers kuongeza ufikiaji ambao tabo za buibui huishia kupokea, nk Ikiwa crank yako ina uwezo wa kuweka pete upande wa pili wa tabo, unaweza kujaribu kuiweka hapo na kupima mnyororo ili kuona Ni mbaya sana. Cranks ambapo mnyororo wa hisa sio kamili kama ua dhidi ya maswala ya kibali cha sura ni ya kusikitisha common anyway, so it might be fine, and if it's borderline than it's probably only your smallest cog where it really matters anyway, which might be another thing to weigh. Crank-mounted bashguards do have a long history of encouraging people to ride crossgears; it's essentially what you're signing up for when you put one on a 2x.  Frame (ISCG) mounted ones have become way more popular. There's a certain logic to that in how once you're hitting stuff that's too much for the inherent strength of a steel chain on a 1x ring, maybe you don't want it hitting your cranks at all, and certainly not via extra long spaced-out chainring bolts.

Tunajua kutoka kwa nadharia ya Kanisa kwamba kuamua kuridhisha kwa utaratibu wa kwanza haiwezekani kwa jumla, lakini kuna mbinu kadhaa ambazo tunaweza kutumia kuamua kuridhisha kwa agizo la kwanza. Kilicho dhahiri zaidi ni kutafuta mfano wa laini. Walakini, kuna idadi ya taarifa katika mantiki ya mpangilio wa kwanza ambayo tunaweza kuonyesha kuwa na mifano laini. Kwa mfano, kikoa chochote ambacho kazi ya sindano na isiyo ya kufanya kazi haifanyi kazi. Je! Tunaonyeshaje kuridhisha kwa taarifa za agizo la kwanza ambapo hakuna mifano laini au uwepo wa mifano ya laini haijulikani? Katika nadharia ya kiotomatiki inathibitisha tunaweza kuamua kuridhisha njia kadhaa: tunaweza kupuuza sentensi, na kutafuta utata. Ikiwa mtu atapatikana, tunathibitisha uhalali wa kwanza wa taarifa hiyo na thus satisfiability. We use saturation with resolution and run out of inferences. More often than not, we will have an infinite amount of inferences to make, so this isn't dependable. We can use forcing, which assumes the existence of a model and also the consistency of the theory.   I don't know of anyone implementing forcing as a mechanized technique for automated theorem proving, and it doesn't look easy, but I'm interested if it's been done or attempted, as it's been used to prove independence for a number of statements in set theory, which itself has no finite models.   Are there other techniques known for searching for first order satisfiability that are applicable for automated reasoning or has anyone worked on an automated forcing algorithm?

Ningependa tu kuandika toleo fulani la hoja ya padding kama ilivyoelezewa kwenye maoni. Sioni kwa nini pengo linahitajika. Tunataka kuonyesha kuwa ikiwa NP haijapatikana katika P/Poly basi kuna shida ya NP-intermediate isiyomo katika P/Poly. Kuna kazi isiyozuiliwa $ f $ kama kwamba SAT haina mizunguko ya ukubwa chini ya $ n^{f (n)} $, na kwa hivyo kuna kazi $ g $ ambayo haijazuiliwa, inaongezeka, na $ g (n (n ) = o (f (n)) $. Acha sat 'ieleze lugha iliyopatikana kwa kamba za sati za urefu wa $ n $ hadi $ n^{g (n)} $. Halafu: Sat 'iko katika NP (tazama hapa chini!) Sat' haiko katika p/poly: mizunguko iliyopewa ukubwa wa $ n^k $ kwa sat ', tunapata mizunguko ya ukubwa $ n^{g (n) k} $ Kwa SAT, lakini hii ni chini ya $ n^{f (n)} $ kwa $ n $. Hakuna kupunguzwa kwa P/Poly kutoka SAT hadi SAT ': Tuseme kwa kupingana kwamba kuna mizunguko $ C_n $ ya ukubwa $ n^k $ kwa SAT, ikiruhusu milango ya Sat'. Chagua $ n $ kubwa ya kutosha kwamba $ g (\ sqrt {n})> 2k $ na acha $ n> n $. Kila lango la SAT 'katika $ C_N $ ina pembejeo zaidi ya $ n^k $. Kwa kuondoa pembejeo za padding tunaweza kupunguza milango ya SAT katika $ c_n $ kwa lango la SAT na pembejeo chini ya $ \ sqrt {n} $, ambayo tunaweza kuiga kwa kutumia $ c _ {\ sqrt {n} $ - the resulting SAT' gates have at most $n^{k/2}$ inputs. Repeating this and treating $C_N$ by hand, SAT would have circuits of about size $O(n^k n^{k/2} n^{k/4} \dots) \approx O(n^{2k})$ which is less than $n^{f(n)}$ for some $n$.   Edit:  The choice of $g$ is slightly fiddly. If you are happy putting SAT' in the promise version of NP, this bit is unnecessary.  Define $f(n)$ to be the maximum integer such that there is no circuit of size $n^{f(n)}$ for length $n$ strings for SAT. Define $g(n)$ by an algorithm that calculates $f(m)$ for $m=1,2,\dots$ and stops after time $n$ or when $m=n$, and returns the floor of the square root of the highest value found in this time. So $g(n)$ is unbounded and $\liminf g(n)/f(n)=0$ and $g(n)$ can be computed in time $n$. Now note that the above arguments only rely on SAT having no circuits of size $n^{f(n)}$ for infinitely many $n$.  I'd also find it interesting to see a proof by blowing holes in SAT as in http://blog.computationalcomplexity.org/media/ladner.pdf. Without the NP requirement this is fairly easy: there is a sequence $n_1<n_2<\dots$ such that no circuit os size $(n_k)^k$ detects SAT strings of length $n$; restrict SAT to strings of length $n_{2^{2^i}}$ for some $i$.

Nilianza kusoma karatasi ya Avi Wigderson $ \ Mathcal {p} $, $ \ mathcal {np} $ na hisabati - mtazamo wa ugumu wa computational (kiunga). . $ n $.) Katika ukurasa wa 7, anafafanua darasa la ugumu $ \ mathcal {p} $: kazi $ f: \ {0, 1 \}^\ ast \ kwa \ {0, 1 \}^\ ast $ iko katika $ \ mathcal {p} $ ikiwa kuna algorithm (i.e. mashine ya kuamua ya kuamua) ambayo inajumuisha $ f $, na pia $ c c> 0 $ kwamba idadi ya hatua inachukua kuhesabu $ f (w ) $ kwa $ W \ katika \ {0, 1 \} _ n^\ ast $ ni $ o (n^c) $. Mara tu baada ya hapo anasema sisi kwamba tutazuia umakini wetu kwa kazi za boolean $ f: \ sigma^\ ast \ kwa \ {0, 1 \} $, kwani "kazi iliyo na matokeo marefu inaweza kutazamwa kama a Mlolongo wa kazi za Boolean, moja kwa kila pato kidogo. " Nadhani hapa anatarajia kusema kitu kama hiki: $ f: \ {0, 1 \}^\ ast \ kwa \ {0, 1 \} Kazi $ f_i: \ {0, 1 \}^\ ast \ kwa \ {0, 1 \} $ inayolingana na $ i $ th pato kidogo ni katika $ \ mathcal {p} $ kwa $ yote $. Ninaona hii inachanganya kidogo. Kwa wanaoanza, tunaangalia $ i $ th pato kidogo, ambayo ni ya $ \ {0, 1 \} $, na hatuna alama ya tatu ya kutafsiri kama "kidogo hii ni tupu". Hii ni kudhani, kwa kweli, kwamba mlolongo kama $ 0 $ na $ 000 \ CDOTS0 $ ni tofauti. Anyways ... ikiwa $ f: \ {0, 1 \}^\ ast \ kwa \ {0, 1 \}^\ ast $ ni katika $ \ mathcal {p} $, basi yote ya $ i $ th kidogo Kazi ni katika $ \ mathcal {p} $ (kusahau juu ya shida tupu kwa sasa). Kwa $ w $ $ ya urefu wa $ \ leq n $, tunahesabu $ F (w) $ kwa $ o (n^c) $ hatua, na kutoa $ i $ th kwa $ o (i) $ hatua, kwa hivyo Imefungwa kwa $ f_i $ ni $ o (n + i) $. Kwa kweli tunaweza kufunga $ i $ s ambayo itatoa pato. Mashine ya Kujaribu ambayo inajumuisha $ F (w) $ itafanya kwa hatua zaidi ya $ o (n^c) $, na kwa hivyo matokeo yatakuwa ya urefu wa $ o (n^c) $. Kwa hivyo $ i $ imefungwa hapo juu na $ o (n^c) $. For the other direction... Here is what I have thought about: Let $f : \{0, 1\}^\ast \to \{0, 1\}^\ast$ be such that each of its $f_i$ functions are in $\mathcal{P}$. There is nothing saying their complexity have a uniform bound on their polynomial growth, that is, the time complexity for $f_i$ can be $O(n^{c_i})$ with no bound on the $c_i$, or the number of functions that will produce an output (for the time it will take to put all those bits side by side; that still counts, I think).  Any how, so why can this paper focus on complexity for boolean functions only?  EDIT 1: I just noticed something else: In the definition of $\mathcal{NP}$ (definition 2.3), the verifier function $V_C$ is a function $\{0, 1\}^\ast \times \{0, 1\}^\ast \to \{0, 1\}$ not $\{0, 1\}^\ast \to \{0, 1\}$. I can think of ways to make this work (like encoding $(x, y)$ as an element of $\{0, 1\}^\ast$. For instance, $(x, y) \mapsto 1111110xy = 1^{|x|}0xy$, where the number of $1$s gives the length of $x$. The length of the encoding is $2|x| + |y| + 1 \leq |x|^k + 2|x| + 1$, so we are still fine.)  EDIT 2: Thinking about it some more, the verifier function is a relation $V_C \subseteq \{0, 1\}^\ast \times \{0, 1\}^\ast$ (satisfying the conditions that make it a function). The set $\{0, 1\}^\ast \times \{0, 1\}^\ast$ can be encoded as the subset $C_{\{0, 1\}^\ast \times \{0, 1\}^\ast} = \{1^{|x|}0xy \mid x, y \in \{0, 1\}^\ast\}$, and the indicator function $1_{C_{\{0, 1\}^\ast \times \{0, 1\}^\ast}} : \{0, 1\}^\ast \to \{0, 1\}$ computes the output in linear time. (It exactly includes all the strings of the form $1^n0z$, with $n \geq 0$, and $|z| \geq n$.) A Turing machine can extract $x$ and $y$ from the valid strings belonging to $C_{\{0, 1\}^\ast \times \{0, 1\}^\ast}$ in polynomial time, and follow that with whatever (polynomial) procedure that computes the verifier function. Anyways, the $\mathcal{NP}$ class can be defined building on a definition of the $\mathcal{P}$ class that only involves $\{0, 1\}^\ast \to \{0, 1\}$ functions.

Assume $NP\subset P/poly$ holds, assume $coNP=NP=RP
eq P$ holds and assume $VP=VNP$ holds and in this scenario is there any hope to prove $P

Je! Haukuhesabu zile ulizoziondoa? Hiyo ni ya msingi ... pia, hakikisha kuchukua michache ya zamani kwenye duka ili waweze match the size; most are standard but some bikes have odd-ball sizes. And be sure to buy new bearings; they are cheap and most authorities recommend that old ones not be re-used.

Ikiwa athari ya upinzani wa upepo ilikuwa ya mstari kwa heshima na kasi, basi ndio, vikosi vingesawazisha. Hiyo ni kusema: ikiwa kuingia kwenye upepo wa 20 mph ilikuwa ngumu mara mbili tu kama kusonga kwa upepo wa 10 mph, vikosi vingesawazisha. Lakini hii sio hivyo, kama @Daniel anavyosema. Jaribio la kushinda upepo wa 20mph ni zaidi ya mara mbili ambayo inahitajika kwa upepo wa 10mph. Ikiwa tutarahisisha kitanzi chako kuwa nje-na-nyuma (nusu moja kwa moja kwenye upepo, nusu na nyuma yako), sema upepo ni mara 10 mph, na kwamba unazunguka ili kudumisha 20mph, unaweza kupata wazo la angavu ya jinsi hii inavyofanya kazi. Kwa mawazo hayo, kwa nusu ya safari yako ungekuwa ukipigana na kichwa cha 30mph (upepo 10 + 20 kutoka kwa kasi yako mwenyewe). Nusu ya pili "kichwa" itakuwa 10mph tu (20 kutoka kwa kasi yako mwenyewe - 10 kutoka upepo). Hii inalinganishwa na a day with no wind, in which the whole trip would have a headwind of 20mph. The jump from 20mph to 30 requires much more energy (what is the last time you hit 30mph?) than the energy saved from dropping from 20 to 10mph.  Drag varies as the square of velocity. This means that velocity is the dominant factor in the equation (as opposed to drag coefficient).  From wikipedia:     For high velocities (or more precisely, at high Reynolds number) drag will vary as the square of velocity. Thus, the resultant power needed to overcome this drag will vary as the cube of velocity. The standard equation for drag is one half the coefficient of drag multiplied by the fluid mass density, the cross sectional area of the specified item, and the square of the velocity.   For an excellent treatment of the forces affecting a cyclist, see Rainer Pivit's article. The graphs are especially helpful.

Jibu la Kevin juu ya msingi linatumika kushikilia msimamo ni sawa, lakini nilitaka kuongeza ufafanuzi kadhaa juu ya mambo ambayo yanaweza kuathiri jinsi unavyoshiriki misuli yako ya msingi wakati uko katika nafasi ya fujo: jumla ya nguvu ya pato la nguvu ya jumla ya kubadilika kwa jumla (k.v. Hamstring). 1) Pato la nguvu wakati unapanda katika nafasi ya mbio za fujo, kawaida uko kwenye pato la nguvu ya nomino. Utagundua kuwa wakati wa kusukuma kwa bidii kwenye misingi, kwa kawaida unataka kupunguza mwili wako wa juu kupingana na nguvu (sheria ya tatu ya Newton). Njia bora ninayoweza kuelezea ni kwamba unaanguka mbele, lakini viboko vyako vya kanyagio vinaendelea kupendekeza mwili wako. Wakati kila kitu kiko katika usawa utahisi kama unagusa vifungo vya kushughulikia, vya kutosha kudumisha udhibiti tu. Unahitaji misuli yako ya msingi kupinga vikosi, lakini nguvu yake ya msingi ya msingi, hakuna kitu cha kutamani sana. Angalia jinsi viwiko vya waendeshaji ni, huwezi kuunga mkono uzito mwingi kwa muda mrefu na mikono yako imeinama. Ikiwa unapanda nafasi za uvumilivu polepole (jumla ya nguvu ya nguvu), utahitaji kufupisha ufikiaji na kuinua stack kwani hakuna nguvu ya kutosha ya kuunga mkono mwili wako wa juu katika nafasi ya fujo. Hapa utagundua uzito mwingi juu ya mikono yako ikiwa stack yako ni ya chini sana. Hauwezi kuangalia pro na kwenda polepole pia bila kuingia kwenye maswala yanayofaa. Urefu wa chini hufanya kazi tu kama kifafa cha utendaji. 2) Nafasi ya Hip Najua wengi hawafikirii sana juu ya msimamo wa kiboko wakati wa kupanda msimamo wa fujo, lakini unahitaji kubadilika vizuri kwa hip ili uweze kusonga kiuno chako mbele ili kufurika nyuma yako (Blue Rider pichani hapa chini ni mfano mzuri). Hii inafanya iwe rahisi kushirikisha misuli yako ya msingi bora kusaidia mwili wako wa juu. Jaribu kukaa in a chair, bending forward a bit (while keeping your feet off the ground) and see how easy or hard it is to support your upper body when rolling the top of your hips forward or backwards.     This passage from "Bike Fit" by Phil Burt (lead physiotherapist for British Cycling and a consultant physio for Team Sky) describes pelvis position.     POSTURE      Posture is the maintenance of a certain body position and requires appropriate joint mobility, joint/muscle coordination and muscular endurance.  Limits in any of these elements can result in postural irregularities.  Good posture on the bike required good flexibility through the hamstrings and the glutei muscles:  this allows the pelvis to roll forward, keeping the back in a straight position while reaching the handlebars.      One major factor limiting the back's ability to remain relatively straight while on a bicycle is thoracic immobility: lack of movement in the middle of the spine normally results in the spine flexing too much.  Excessive spinal flexion while on a bicycle will limit breathing and compromise your ability to stability your spine for torque production to the pedals   Note that not all the pros do this as young healthy bodies can get a way with bad position. For example, some rotate the top of their hips  towards the back of the bike.  This can cause some extreme spinal bends which could lead to back pain down the line.   3) General Flexibility  If you lack good general flexibility this position will be hard even if you can do 1) and 2). For example, if you lack hamstring flexibility you may not be able to get your hips into the proper position. In this case you may need to lower your saddle a bit (losing power) to make up for the lack of flexibility.

Sijui "jibu", lakini maoni kadhaa yanakuja akilini: Badilisha kutumia bomba kwenye tairi hiyo, ikiwezekana na mjengo. Tumia kiraka cha bomba ndani ya tairi na endelea kukimbia bila bomba. Kuwa na kiraka ndani inamaanisha kuwa shinikizo la hewa kwenye tairi husaidia kuishikilia mahali. Kuweka kwenye bomba hubadilisha jukumu la tairi kutoka kwa chombo cha hewa hadi kiboreshaji cha bomba. Kata hiyo haionekani kuwa mbaya sana - lakini angalia ndani ili kuona ni uharibifu kiasi gani. Ikiwa nyuzi za casing zimekatwa nadhani you may have trouble keeping the cut from growing.  I think the biggest problem you'll run into here is that the sidewalls are going to flex a lot and it may be necessary to have some kind of mechanical patch to prevent the cut from reopening if you continue running the tires without tubes.  If that is your front tire, I'd think about moving it to the back if you try patching it. The consequences of a blowout on the front are much worse that the rear.  BTW - clever move to put the bike on its side to get the sealant to work.

Kutoka kwa picha yako, nadhani ni kitunguu saumu, na unayo picha ya yule kutoka upande mwingine. Maoni ya "Njoo Chimba katika sehemu zetu -bin" ni nzuri - duka lolote ambalo linakusaidia kama hii linastahili biashara yako. Chukua gurudumu lote na wewe kwa upimaji. Chaguo la pili ni kununua axle kamili ya nyuma. Kwa kweli ni mengi zaidi kuliko unahitaji au unataka, lakini spares ni nzuri. Seti nzima ya axle itaonekana kama hii. Locknuts zimeandikwa hapa chini. Mbali na baiskeli yako sasa iko chini ya vifuniko viwili, fani za gurudumu zinaweza kuwa huru kabisa. Ili kuweka upakiaji wa kuzaa (kukazwa) kwa usahihi inaweza kuwa fiddly lakini inafanikiwa kabisa. Chombo pekee kinachohitajika ni spanner ya koni kutoshea mbegu zako. Ikiwa una shida na ukaguzi huu na swali mpya. (Siwezi kupata swali lililokuwepo "how to adjust wheel bearings")    As for finding/identifying a good LBS; generally speaking, bike shops fall into one of two categories.     Those that feel sparse or "empty" , tend to have lots of clothing, and very few bikes.  These seem to focus on only selling the latest-and-greatest and won't be able to help you with a vintage bike.  And they're expensive. The LBS, or Local Bike Shop.  May be hard to find because they're not necessarily high-street stores.  Will often feel as cluttered as Grandad's shed.  Also often have a whiff of oil and rubber, and will have a LOT of bikes on display... often so many that they flow outside.   This is the kind of store you want.   How to find a LBS?  Ask around - anyone who's a committed cyclist in your area  will likely have some advise.  Neighbours and coworkers are good examples.

Mfano zaidi, zaidi kutoka kwa lugha za programu: K-CFA (uchambuzi wa mtiririko wa K-kudhibiti) ni kamili (Van Horn & Mairson 2008), lakini programu za programu nzima kama Mlton zinafanya hivyo. Nyakati za kukusanya ni ndefu, lakini mara chache mbaya. Kutatua (nguvu) upakiaji kwa ujumla ni NP-kamili (Palsberg 2012). Lakini basi sio shida katika ulimwengu wa kweli. Ugawaji wa kujiandikisha ni wa polynomi-kupunguzwa kwa kuchorea kwa k-graph (ambapo $ k $ ndio idadi ya rejista), ambayo ni kamili. Lakini tena sio shida katika ulimwengu wa kweli. Utatuzi wa SMT kwa ujumla ni kamili, lakini utatuzi wa kibiashara wa SMT (kama Z3 na CVC4) kawaida ni nzuri. Sifanyi kazi moja kwa moja na suluhisho za SMT, lakini nimetumia Z3 moja kwa moja kutoka kwa Liquid Haskell na Dafny, na nyakati za kuangalia zinaonekana kuwa sawa. Shida ya uamuzi kwa hesabu ya Presburger ni ngumu sana (Fischer & Rabin 1974), lakini uamuzi wa Bill Pugh, mtihani wa Omega (Pugh 1991), unaendesha kwa jumla ndani ya wakati wa polynomial. Remember that big-$O$ (and thus complexity classes) is about asymptotic behavior, i.e., when $n$ grows. However, in many real-world problems, $n$ is usually small. Moreover, these cases usually don't induce worst-case behavior. To get worst-case behavior in Hindley-Damas-Milner, for example, you would need to write some pretty bad code.     References:  [1] David Van Horn and Harry G. Mairson. 2008. Deciding kCFA is complete for EXPTIME. In Proceedings of the 13th ACM SIGPLAN International Conference on Functional Programming (ICFP '08). ACM, New York, NY, USA, 275-282.  [2] http://web.cs.ucla.edu/~palsberg/paper/dedicated-to-kozen12.pdf  [3] M. J. Fischer and M. O. Rabin. 1974. SUPER-EXPONENTIAL COMPLEXITY of PRESBURGER ARITHMETIC. Technical Report. Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Cambridge, MA, USA.  [4] William Pugh. 1991. The Omega test: a fast and practical integer programming algorithm for dependence analysis. In Proceedings of the 1991 ACM/IEEE Conference on Supercomputing (Supercomputing '91). ACM, New York, NY, USA, 4-13.

Shida ya kuhesabu ni: Kwa kuzingatia mkondo wa vitu $ x_1, \ dots, x_n $ ambayo ina nakala mbili, pata idadi ya vitu tofauti kwa kutumia nafasi ndogo. Ninataka pia mali ifuatayo: Kwa kuzingatia mito miwili au zaidi $ S_1, \ dots, s_k $ tunaona mito moja baada ya nyingine. Baada ya kuona mito, tunapewa mito miwili kwa $ s_i $ na $ S_J $ na tunauliza kurudisha idadi ya vitu vya kipekee katika $ S_I \ Setminus S_J $. Tunapenda kutatua shida hii kwa kutumia kiasi kidogo cha kumbukumbu iwezekanavyo; Kwa kweli hatuwezi kumudu kukumbuka vitu vyote kwenye mito yote kabla ya swala la $ S_I \ SetMinus S_J $. Shida hii inaweza kutatuliwa kwa kutumia algorithm ya hyperloglog. Walakini, algorithm hii inafanya kazi tu wakati $ | s_i | $ kwa $ i $ ni karibu the same length. This is because the error probability is given by $O(1/\sqrt{m})$ where $m$ is the amount of memory used to store the hash values of the HyperLogLog algorithm. Suppose we care about small space $m = \log(n)$ where $n = \max_{S_i} (|S_i|)$. Then, suppose the query asks for $S_i$ and $S_j$ where $|S_i| < (1/\sqrt{\log n}) |S_j|$. In this case, we would not achieve a good error bound on $|S_i \setminus S_j|$ (by the inclusion-exclusion principle $|S_i \setminus S_j| = |S_i \cup S_j| - |S_j|$) since the error bound on $S_j$ could mask the number of elements in $S_i$. Are there any other existing data structures that can handle this when the sizes of $S_i$ differ by more than a $(1/\sqrt{m})$-factor? Please do comment if any part of this question is unclear.

Hakuna kitu kama kipindi cha papo hapo cha wimbi. Kanuni ya kutokuwa na uhakika ya Heisenberg inahakikishia hii. Ah unaweza kupata seti ya makadirio ya makadirio ya dirisha fulani juu ya ishara, lakini hiyo ni masafa kwa dirisha lote, sio kwa papo hapo. Unahitaji kujua ni ukubwa gani wa dirisha la mzunguko wa wakati unaokidhi mahitaji yako na kisha kuhesabu kitu ambacho Nne nne hubadilisha kwa dirisha hilo juu ya ishara nzima (na labda utafute masafa yanayosababishwa kwa kilele). Vitu viwili vya kukumbuka, kubwa zaidi dirisha, juu ya azimio la frequency (ni masafa mangapi unaweza kuona), lakini ndogo wakati wa azimio la wakati (wakati kitu kilitokea-na hii ni ngumu kuelezea kwani imekuwa miaka michache Kwa kuwa nimelazimika kujifunza na kukabiliana nayo sana ili nisije nikasema vizuri). Jambo lingine ni kwamba amplitude (kuzidisha katika kikoa cha wakati) ni uamuzi katika kikoa cha frequency. Kuondoa mabaki kadhaa ya ambayo unaweza kulazimika kufanya kuchuja (ambayo ni, uamuzi katika kikoa cha wakati au kuzidisha katika kikoa cha frequency.) Inaweza kuwa na maana kuchuja na saizi moja ya mjane kisha uchanganue na saizi nyingine ya dirisha. Kuna biashara nyingi nzuri linapokuja kwa ishara ya sampuli. Hariri: Sawa, this "Heisenberg uncertainty principle" with regard to signal sampling is not some random thing I pulled out of my ear one day.  It is, AFAIK, a well established concept within Wavelet literature.  (Wavelets involve a whole family of mathematical non-Fourier techniques to analyze a signal)  "The World According to Wavelets: The Story of a Mathematical Technique in the Making" by Barbra Burke Hubbard (ISBN 1-56881-072-5) devotes at least one (if not two) chapters to the subject and has a proof in the Appendices.    According to her, (I'm going to have to paraphrase as my attempts to translate to Mathjax/TeX/LaTeX are failing, please also forgive as it's been years since I've looked at this anyway)  For every $f(t)$ ($t$ a real number) such that the integral (from negative infinity to positive infinity) of $|f(t)|^2$ with respect to $t$  equals $1$, the product of the variance of $t$ and the variance of $\tau$ (the variable of $\hat f$) is at least $1/(16*\pi^2)$, and then gives a large, explicit inequality to state what exactly she means with further non mathematical explanation throughout the chapter.  I will make no attempt to explain further, partially for fear I'd likely mess up. But if you want, you can read that and/or its references and see that, yes, the Heisenberg uncertainty principle does indeed apply here.

Swali hili kwa safari ya ndege.se lilinifanya nihesabu kuongeza kasi ya baiskeli iliyowekwa nje ya ndege ikiwa kamba zilivunjika. Kama wewe. Sikuweza kupata takwimu ya CDA ya baiskeli bila mpanda farasi mahali popote, na inaonekana kwangu kuwa mwili wa mpanda farasi utatawala mfumo wa CDA. A more realistic situation for most of us would be consdering the forces on a bike on top of a car, again from the point of view of secure attachment (e.g. tryiong to fit an unusual bike with home-made brackets).  So are there published figures for the CdA of bikes (any type) without riders?

Kulingana na vielelezo vilivyoorodheshwa kwenye kiunga chako kwa baiskeli yako, kibadilishaji chako cha kushoto ni 2x tu, ikimaanisha kuwa itafanya kazi tu na crankset ya mbele mara mbili. Kuna toleo la 3x la mabadiliko haya (M315). Shimano Front Derailleur yako ndio inayoitwa "Double Front derailleur" maana imeundwa kufanya kazi na 2x crankset. Wakati kuna hacks ambazo zinaweza kuwezesha mbele mara mbili kufanya kazi kwenye crankset ya mnyororo wa tatu (aka 3x), ni mdogo na ukweli imeundwa kwa mnyororo mkubwa wa meno 36. Kutumia na crankset kubwa-- haswa 3x-- itatoa shida zinazobadilika na kusugua kwa mnyororo: Soma ya kufadhaisha na ya kukasirisha. Na ukweli huu mbili peke yake, mtu anaweza kuhakikisha kuwa ikiwa uwiano mkubwa wa gia unahitajika, zaidi ya kubadilisha tu crankset itabidi kutokea. Kuhusu crankset, minyororo ya minyororo imekamilika na kwa hivyo, haiwezi kubadilishwa mmoja mmoja. Uboreshaji wako wa Shimano uliopendekezwa kwa FC-M315 haifanyi chochote kwa kuongeza uwiano wa gia yako, kwani toleo la 2x ni hesabu ya jino 36-22 pia, na milo hii pia imekamilika. Baiskeli yako ina bracket ya chini ya mraba (mkutano wa kuzaa ambao crankset inafaa) na urefu wa spindle ya 123mm. Hii ni muhimu kwa sababu crankset yoyote unayobadilisha lazima pia iwe mraba wa mraba na uwe na mnyororo mzuri wakati kwenye spindle 123mm (ili kuweka bracket yako ya chini ya sasa. Unaweza kuweka cranksets nyingi kwenye baiskeli yako kwa muda mrefu kama wewe pia kuwa na au kusanikisha chini inayolingana bracket). All said, upgrading to a higher gear ratio will involve more than a change of chainrings.  At least a different front derailleur for sure and possibly a different front shifter if you go to 3x up front.  Regarding the "speed" listed for your crankset (7/8 speed) and any potential replacements: you can utilize a 9 speed crankset within your current set up and retain the same quality of performance as 7/8 speed (the above noted hurdles still exist, but being "9 speed" wouldn't really be an additional one). While writing this I referred a few times to Shimano's latest Specification and technical document which outlines several details of their current lines of componentry.  I noted a listing for a crankset, model FC-TY501-2, which is a double chainring crankset sporting 46 & 30 tooth rings and fits on to a square taper spindle 123mm in length. IF clearance isn't a problem with the larger chainrings, this would be a viable option for you as you could retain your current 2x shifter.  You would need a more capable front derailleur (although I would certainly determine how unhappy the current FD became with the larger rings before installing a properly spec'd one). At any rate, front derailleur's are being heavily discounted at many retailers (especially online) as demand for them plummets with the rise of the 1x systems.  If all that is required to successfully raise your gear ratios on that bike is a larger crankset and a different front der, that is about as good as you can do from an economical and ease of installation standpoint.

Kwa miaka mitatu iliyopita, SoCG imejumuisha hafla ya satelaiti inayoitwa Jukwaa la Watafiti wa Vijana, ambayo ni mahali pa wanafunzi wa mapema na wageni wengine kwenye jiometri ya computational ili kuwasilisha utafiti wa awali au unaoendelea. Haimaanishi mahsusi kwa wahitimu, lakini undergrads ni certainly welcome.  Most major theory conferences have been able to attract funding from NSF to support student travel.  Again, undergraduates are eligible for this funding, although students speaking at the conference (including the Young Researchers Forum at SOCG) generally have higher priority.

Hatua ya kwanza ni kuchukua nafasi ya pedi za kuvunja na mpya. Hata kama hawajavaliwa, pedi za zamani zinafanya ugumu na kuvunja vibaya. Ninapenda zile za kool - ni nyeusi au aina ya pedi ya rangi ya salmoni. Unapaswa kuwa na uwezo wa kubonyeza kijipicha kwenye uso wa kuvunja na kuacha alama wazi. Baada ya hayo, angalia maelewano yako, na hakikisha pads sit near to the rim with no pressure on the lever.  A little lever movement should be all it takes to start braking, and then increased hand pressure increases the pad pressure.  Upshots - your rims need to be true, which means no wobbles as you spin them.  I try to true wheels to within 0.5mm of completely flat, but 1mm of wobble is workable.

Kama baiskeli mwenye uzoefu na uzoefu mdogo wa tandem: ndio, inawezekana. Inachukua kurekebisha ingawa. Inafaa kupanda kitu na wewe mwenyewe kupata hisia za jiometri, gia, breki na kuanza na kuacha kabla ya kuongeza stoker. Kila mtu lazima aanze wakati mwingine! Lakini inategemea kuwa na kichwa cha baiskeli. I have seen fairly experienced cyclists who struggled. Everything gets easier with a more experienced stoker too.  I would add ... It is important to agree on verbal and non-verbal signals, especially for starting and stopping. If my four year old daughter kept pedaling it was really hard to stop at traffic lights! (Yes, she was (and is) quite strong).

Kwa kawaida uma wa 9mm zinafaa 3/8 "bila suala. Kuna tofauti, kawaida uma wa barabara, ambapo inafaa 9mm pia kwa 3/8 kuingia. Kawaida tofauti haitakuwa kamili .525mm. Inafaa kila wakati itakuwa simu ya uamuzi wa hatari-yako mwenyewe, lakini kwa ujumla ni sawa kabisa juu ya kuacha chuma au alumini. Jaribu kutumia hata shinikizo, kwa lengo la kubadilisha dropout and fork alignment as little as possible, and keeping everything symmetrical. It's important to understand that you really want to avoid inadvertently making one dropout deeper than the other one, because the fork can't really be aligned properly if that happens. It's still a good idea to put dropout alignment tools on afterwards, but if you don't have them, just be careful with how you do it and go slow, particularly on aluminum dropouts. I wouldn't tend to recommend doing any such thing to carbon dropouts.

Wakati $ F $ ni ya kawaida, hata ikiwa haina fomu iliyofungwa, unaweza kutumia njia za utaftaji (kwenye kikoa kilichofungwa) kupata uhakika kama vile unavyopenda kwa kiwango cha chini, ambacho pia kitakuwa pia Kiwango cha chini cha ulimwengu - Hii itafanya kazi kupata the minimum of the sum, as the sum of convex functions is also convex.    There are many other better numerical methods with varying guarantees (depending on the properties of the function) for optimizing convex functions -- this book is a good (and free!) reference.

Kubadilika kutoka barabara ya kasi 9 hadi 11 Speed Mountain huongeza maswali mengi, lakini kujibu swala lako maalum: Kaseti 11 ya Mlima wa Kasi itafaa kwenye kitovu cha '9 Speed'. Upana wa mwili wa burehub unaotumiwa ni sawa kwa mlima 11 speed and below and road 10 speed and below. Road 11 speed cassettes generally requires a slightly wider freehub body. The mountain 11 speed cassette will fit because the larger sprockets can overhang the hub and spokes a little.
Nilipata hii kutoka kwa nyongeza ya mwisho ni perfect for my needs and waterproof.  http://www.amazon.co.uk/ULTIMATEADDONS-Bicycle-Motorbike-Resistant-iPhone/dp/B004BAVJLO

Nyuso za crank taper zimeharibika na mkono unahitaji kubadilishwa. Hakuna marekebisho mengine. Kawaida spindle ya chini ya bracket ni sawa katika kesi hizi, lakini sio kamili na inapaswa kutazamwa. problem typically originates from the crank being under-torqued initially.  Left replacement cranks are available and not expensive. You need to get the correct length, profile, hole orientation, and color permutation. There are several questions here about this.

Hii ni baiskeli.se, tunakusudia zaidi kukusaidia kushinda shida za vitendo. Kwa kuwa ni baiskeli nzuri inayoonekana, why not fix it?  Please tell us more about the problem/damage, with photos of the broken parts.

Natafuta sura nzuri ya ujenzi wangu unaofuata na kutafuta maoni. Hii itakuwa baiskeli ya kusafiri. Ninataka breki za disc zilizo na ax-axles, jiometri ya barabara-ya kawaida iwezekanavyo, kibali cha matairi mapana na viboreshaji na rack ya nyuma. Ah na chuma ni kweli :) Nitaiweka pia na baa za gorofa na drivetrain 1x (labda SRAM mpinzani 1x). Kufikia sasa, nina: -Monsoon ya jiji lote inaonekana kuangalia masanduku yote lakini ni ghali sana! Ambapo vidole vyako vinaanguka sio vya matokeo na vitakuwa tofauti sana na misingi kadhaa. Hekima ya kawaida ni unataka mpira wa mguu wako, sehemu ya bony mbele ya arch yako na nyuma your big toe, to be bearing all the load, so that none is borne by tendons, muscles, etc. Typically how it feels is the final determinant of whether you have it right or not.

Sidhani kama kuna mkutano wowote wa TCS ambao unaweza kuwa wimbo wa haraka kwa kazi ya kudumu. STOC, FOCS, na SODA ndio mikutano ya ushindani zaidi, na karatasi katika hizo hakika zitaonekana sana good in your CV, but just one paper won't help that much with the career. To really stand out, you will need something more than that (say, lots of papers in STOC, FOCS, and SODA).

Utaweza kuwa na taa chache za taa. Pia, unaweza kupata "Kompyuta za Kompyuta" kwa misingi ya Shimano. Jina sahihi ni mielekeo ya mwelekeo na nambari ya mfano ni SM-SH56. Hizi zitaacha kwenda ikiwa utavuta ngumu sana in any direction. I used them for around 4 months when I first went clipless. Saved me some skinned knees.  After switching to Crank Brothers' Eggbeaters I've only had one SPDisaster, the only thing really hurt was my pride though.

Je! Kuna mtu yeyote aliyeandaliwa rasmi, katika msaidizi wa dhibitisho (kwa njia nzuri!) Usahihi wa hesabu ya umbali wa Levenshtein? Q & A inayohusiana hapa ni juu ya uthibitisho wa karatasi. Kutafuta karibu hakukuja na mwongozo wowote. Kumbuka kuwa ninavutiwa sawa in correctness as that of a proof of optimality, i.e. knowing that an algorithm returns a correct sequence of edits, from which the distance is trivially computed, is quite interesting too. That the sequence is optimal can be a second step.

Toleo la "Offline" la swali hili linashughulikiwa katika karatasi yangu ya soda 2014 na Huacheng Yu, ikipata veti za orthogonal katika miundo ya discrete. Kwa kesi ya $ \ mathbb f_2 $, tunatoa $ o (nd) $ wakati algorithm ya kuamua, kwa kupewa seti mbili za $ n $ vectors $A$ and $B$, whether there is a vector in $A$ and vector in $B$ with zero inner product.   I'm sure you can modify our algorithm appropriately, and get an interesting preprocessing/query version; we did not consider this question.

Acha $ g $ iwe grafu yenye uzito, na wacha (s, v-s) iwe jozi inayowezekana ikiwa s ni seti kubwa ya kujitegemea. Uzito wa jozi inayowezekana inakadiriwa na kupata kwa kila kipengele cha V-S makali nyepesi zaidi kuiunganisha na S, na muhtasari wa gharama (makali kama hayo lazima yapo tangu S kubwa). Lengo ni kupata jozi ya chini ya uzito. Shida hii ni NP-ngumu na ina uwezekano wa kuwa ngumu sana kukadiri (inashughulikia kifuniko cha vertex angalau). Tunaangalia urithi ambao unaweza kuwa mzuri katika mazoezi, na wazo moja ni kufanya aina fulani ya aina ya Metropolis-Hastings walk on the space of all independent sets (since given an independent set, computing the weight is easy).   I know that there's a fair bit of study of sampling over independent sets (for example, this). My question is:     Are there good sampling procedures   that can be adapted to this weighted   case ? I suspect I'd like some kind of   procedure that does a   metropolis-hastings-type step to   decide whether to move or not, and so   the question really is: what are good   local moves  ?

Katika karatasi yake ya 1936 "kwa nambari zinazoweza kubadilika, na maombi kwa entscheidungsproblem", Alan Turing aliandika: "Tunaweza kulinganisha mtu katika mchakato wa kuweka nambari halisi kwa mashine ambayo ina uwezo wa idadi ndogo ya masharti Q1, Q2 , .... QR ambayo itaitwa "usanidi wa M" kwa hivyo alisisitiza ukweli kwamba mashine hiyo ina idadi ndogo, isiyo na mwisho) ya majimbo au idadi. Kwangu, ni kumbukumbu ya neno quanta linalotumiwa katika fizikia kuashiria matukio kutofautisha sio kuendelea lakini kwa "kuruka" au "quanta". Katika nakala yake ya 1950 "Computing Machinery and Intelligence" Alan Turing is more explicit about "leaps" speaking of "sudden jumps":      "The digital computers considered in the last section may be   classified amongst the "discrete-state machines." These are the   machines which move by sudden jumps or clicks from one quite definite   state to another."   So I think that Alan Turing used q instead of s to denote a machine state to stress the fact that the state machine can be only in a set of discrete and finite values like the quanta in physics. And since then, the same notation is generally used.

Nina Voodoo Bizango 2016 na hivi karibuni nilinunua gurudumu mpya la nyuma kwa hiyo kwani mimi ni mpanda farasi mkubwa na niliendelea kueneza. Ni gurudumu la Halo Vortex 29 "na Shimano HG FreeHub. Ninajaribu kuanza kufanya kazi kwenye baiskeli mwenyewe and just finished swapping over the cassette and brake disc when I noticed that there was no space for the quick release skewer to go into.   Do I need to just purchase a new axle and skewer? How do I get the correct size?

[Ifuatayo ni maoni yaliyopanuliwa zaidi na vidokezo kuliko jibu la kweli.] Ikiwa ungekuwa Ufaransa, jibu zuri lingekuwa fizikia ya mchanganyiko. Ninasema "ikiwa ungekuwa Ufaransa" kwa sababu, kwa sababu ambazo zinanitoroka lakini hiyo lazima iwe ya kihistoria zaidi, huko Ufaransa Combatinatorics inachukuliwa kuwa sehemu ya sayansi ya nadharia ya kompyuta :-) Katika ulimwengu wote, viunga vinachukuliwa kuwa tawi ya hisabati, kwa hivyo nadhani ni sahihi zaidi kusema kwamba fizikia ya kujumuisha ni juu ya mwingiliano kati ya fizikia na hesabu za discrete, badala ya CS. Kwa hivyo, katika maabara yangu (ambayo ni maabara ya CS) kuna kikundi cha utafiti ambacho kinazingatia mambo kadhaa ya viunga, haswa fizikia ya pamoja. Hii sio kwa njia yoyote only example in France of a combinatorics group in a CS lab whose research overlaps with physics; another example off the top of my head is this one in Bordeaux. Some of the members of these groups are theoretical physicists.  The "official" recognition of combinatorial physics as a research field of its own is very recent, as you may read in this blog post, which contains some pointers and basic info about it.  Computer science is explicitly mentioned a couple of times, although maybe not exactly in the sense you would expect, but I am sure that my colleagues from those research group would be able to give you more precise answers.  Maybe you can start checking out their web pages for additional info.

Nilijaribu GoPro kwa muda mfupi na kuna mambo kadhaa ambayo sikupenda juu yake, au ambapo nilihisi yamepungua. Sasa ninaangalia kununua moja ya kamera "ngumu" zinazozalishwa na karibu wazalishaji wote wakuu wa kamera ambazo zina faida kadhaa juu ya kitu kama GoPro au ATC3K. Vitu ambavyo sikupenda juu ya GoPro ni ... - Uzito kichwani mwangu wakati unatumiwa kwenye kofia (inaweza kusababisha kofia yangu kuhama). - Hakuna skrini, kwa hivyo unaweza kukagua tu picha mara moja kuhamishiwa kwenye kompyuta. Kuhamisha pia inachukua muda mrefu. Unaweza kupata skrini ya kuongeza sasa, lakini hii itaongeza wingi na uzito. - Hakuna zoom, kwa mfano, pembe pana haiwezi kuonyesha hata wakimbiaji nyekundu-nyekundu, kwani taa kwenye upande wa mbali wa makutano (perpendicular kwa mwelekeo wangu), ziko mbali sana kuonyesha kwenye video. - Menyu ni ngumu kutumia na lazima ukumbuke muhtasari wanaotumia. - Sura ya mraba ni kubwa. Sikujaribu kushikwa kwa mkono wangu kwa sababu itakuwa mbaya sana wakati baiskeli. - Milima ya kushughulikia ni aina ya bulky na inaweza kuwa fiddly kutoshea. - Iliingiliana na kasi yangu isiyo na waya wakati imewekwa karibu na hiyo (nambari za kasi zilikwenda haywire). - Ufunuo unaweza kuhitaji ununuzi wa, na kugongana na, kuingiza-fog. Olimpiki, Panasonic, Sony, Canon, Nikon, Fuji na Toshiba wote hutoa kamera "ngumu" ambazo ni sugu kwa maji, mshtuko, vumbi na kadhalika kwa digrii tofauti. Kwa kweli mifano hutofautiana lakini kwa kawaida wana faida hizi juu ya video ya GoPro au ATC3K HD (ama 720p au 1080p)! Muhimu sana kwa kukagua kabla ya kuhamisha kwa kompyuta (ambayo inaweza kuchukua muda mrefu time), but also for framing the shot! The screen also means you can use the camera for other things such as holidays, snorkelling etc. The GoPro is limited in that sense. Optical zoom (not the Toshiba) Optical image stabilisation (each model differs). Far greater customisation of shooting settings (except for lower end like the Toshiba). Usually slimmer form factor. Not so bulky. No need for external enclosure that can fog up. Longer record times (than ATC3K). (check each model for differences). Typically better lens, sensor and image processing quality from the larger photographic companies. (this is a bit of a blanket statement, so make your own judgements about quality, or check trusted reviews). Quite a few have GPS now if you're interested in Geotagging or mapping.   I haven't bought one of these yet (but I will be) so check the reviews and specifications and make your own decisions of course.   I may post a table of comparison specs here if I do my own comparison table. The come for a variety of budgets from about $100 for the Toshiba, up to $400 or more for the Panasonic.  My interest is for problems with motorists but also recording interesting stuff while touring. It is not always possible to stop and take photos or video. Another application is for contributing to Open Cycle Map which is a whole other topic in itself, but is a brilliant project. Check it out!  Next is, how to mount it to the bike? I found http://www.rigidmount.com/ which have some mounts that allow you to mount a standard digital compact to your bike using the tripod mount found on almost all compact digital cameras. They also have some general information about what to look for in a camera, how to edit video and remove shake etc. See the "Information" menu on that site.

Nimekuwa nikitumia spds/clipless misingi kwenye baiskeli yangu ya barabara kwa zaidi ya mwaka mmoja. Je! Ningewahi kufikiria kubadili nyuma kwenye jukwaa au mabwawa ya vidole? Kamwe! Binafsi nilikuwa nikisita sana kuwapata baada ya kusikia watu kutoweza kutolewa haraka na kuanguka - bado nimeunganishwa na baiskeli, lakini nimekuwa mmoja wa bahati na sikuwahi kuwa na bahati mbaya (bado!). Ili kujibu swali lako na kutoa maoni yaliyotolewa na mtumiaji mwingine - hakikisha unaweka mvutano kwa mpangilio wa chini. Ikiwa unajitahidi kupiga nje basi labda umeweka mvutano wa masika juu sana. Kutoa mvutano huo utakusaidia kugawanyika kwa urahisi na unapaswa kuweza kupiga nje wakati bado unaendelea kusonga (haupaswi kuhitaji kupiga nje miguu yote, mguu wako kuu '(yule unayepiga picha ya pili na Yule unayetegemea wakati unafikiria unaweza kupoteza usawa wako nk). Mara tu ukizoea zaidi kuokota unaweza kuanza kuongeza mvutano wa chemchemi kwenye kiatu hadi utapata mahali pazuri ambapo you feel like the shoe is firmly secured to the pedal whilst still being able to unclip with little effort.   I've had a few near misses when my own rear wheel has slipped while going uphill and it's a pretty scary feeling thinking that if you don't unclip you're gonna fall so I can completely sympathize.  If you're still having problems with the clips and especially for higher gradient trails, then maybe think about switching to flats for specific trails?    A few extra general pointers I've picked up - if you do ride in traffic and come to traffic lights/junctions - pedal a little harder to give you a little momentum, then unclip a foot prior to reaching the junction.  If there are pedestrian rails near the junction and it's reachable from arm level then don't bother unclipping and just hold yourself and the bike up with one hand on the railing for support (this makes it easier to get going when the lights turn green as you won't need to clip back in).  Just read the road ahead and plan for anything you might need to beforehand.

Hivi sasa nimepata baiskeli ya barabara ya fixie na matairi kadhaa ya barabara ya hisa. Wao ni wasifu wa chini, kama ilivyo, sio knobby, na wana kukanyaga kwa hali ya chini. Kwa sababu uma wangu na unakaa kuwa na kibali cha kutosha kwa hiyo, ninajadili kwa kutumia matairi kadhaa ya CX angalau mapema wakati wa msimu wa baridi, kabla ya kupanda huwa karibu kabisa. Hatari mbili kubwa za mazingira ningekuwa nikijaribu kufanya kazi karibu itakuwa cold (I want to try and stay on the bike down to about -10 or -15 ºC) and slush, which is extremely abundant where I am even fairly early on in the season.  I'm not looking to avoid ice; at that point I'll probably look for another means of transportation.  Are CX tires generally alright for winter riding? What road conditions would limit their effectiveness?

Wakati wa kusoma karatasi juu ya kutumia njia za algebraic kugundua sehemu ndogo zilizosababishwa, inaonekana kuwa Edge Bora ni zana muhimu ya kuunganisha algebra ya kawaida na nadharia ya graph. Kwa kuwa sijui hesabu za vitu vya algebra, ni there any good references or books on this topic? Particularity in representing a ring R on a Turing machine, and the complexity of deciding basic properties on R (say, the height of an prime ideal in R.)

Nilimaliza kuitatua kwa njia hii: muundo wangu wa data umetengenezwa kwa kamusi inategemea, kutoka kwa kitambulisho cha node hadi orodha ya nodi ambazo hutegemea (km. Wafuasi wake kwenye DAG). Sijahesabu ugumu wa hiyo, lakini ilimeza picha yangu ya maelfu kadhaa kwa sekunde ya mgawanyiko. _Transitive_Closed_Cache = {} def transitive_closed (kibinafsi, node_id): "" "Hurejesha seti ya node zote (vitambulisho) vinavyoweza kufikiwa kutoka kwa node iliyopewa (_id)" "" Global _Transitive_Closure_Cache ikiwa node_id katika _transitive_closed_cache: reture _Transitive _Transitive _Transitive _Transitive _TRANSITIVE . _transitive_closure_cache[node_id] = c     return c  def can_reduce(self, source_id, dest_id):     """returns True if the edge (source_id, dest_id) is redundant (can reach from source_id to dest_id without it)"""     for d in dependents[source_id]:         if d.id == dest_id:             continue         if dest_id in transitive_closure(d.id):             return True # the dest node can be reached in a less direct path, then this link is redundant     return False  # Reduce redundant edges: for node in nodes:           dependents[node.id] = [d for d in dependents[node.id] if not can_reduce(node.id, d.id)]

Kutumika. Unaweza kupata baiskeli zingine zinazotumiwa katika anuwai hiyo. Mseto unaweza kuwa chaguo nzuri. Unapata watu ambao walilipa $ 800 - $ 900 kwa baiskeli hawakuwahi kutumia na itakuwa sell used as low as $300.  Be patient and low ball.  Learn how to inspect a bike.  If you are on a budget you need to learn how to maintain a bike.

Nadhani jibu ni $ \ theta (\ logi n) $ na dhibitisho ni sawa na dhibitisho la kawaida la Ramsey-theorem. Kwa upande mmoja, huwa na subgraph kamili au tupu na wima hizi nyingi. Kwa upande mwingine, grafu isiyo ya kawaida haitakuwa na kifungu kikubwa cha $ C_4 $ -free. Kwa mwisho huu, alifunga idadi ya vijidudu vilivyochochewa kwenye vertices $ $ $ na $ n^t $ na kwa kila uwezekano wa kuwa $ c_4 $ -free na $ c^{t^2} $ ambapo $ c <1 $ $ ni mara kwa mara. Hii tunaweza kufanya kwa sababu a complete graph on $t$ vertices contains $\Omega(t^2)$ disjoint $K_4$'s.  In more detail, divide the $t\choose 2$ possible edges among any $t$ vertices into $\Omega(t^2)$ disjoint cliques of four vertices. In any such clique of four vertices, the probability that the edges among them will not form a $C_4$ is some constant $p<1$. Therefore the probability that there won't be a $C_4$ in any of the cliques is $p^{\Omega(t^2)}$. This is clearly an upper bound for the random graph to be $C_4$-free.

Jibu bracket yako ya chini imejaa. Urekebishaji wa bei rahisi na sahihi ni kuibadilisha wazi. Nilichopata kwenye wavuti ni kwamba baiskeli hii ina "mfumo wa nje wa kuzaa" bracket ya chini, ambayo inaweza kuwa yoyote ya viwango 9 tofauti. Uingizwaji lazima ufanane na kigeuzio cha crank pia, ambayo inaweza kuwa ISIS, pweza, au mraba wa mraba. Zana maalum kwa hii - unaweza kuhitaji dondoo ya crank, ambayo inalazimisha mikono miwili ya crank mbali na spindle ya chini ya bracket. Basi unahitaji wrench maalum to undo the visible round bits poking out the side.  They may be threadded or they may be pressed in.  Lastly you may require a press to push the two halves together or you may get away with using the special wrench to thread them back in.  You'll also need grease or copperslip, and standard workshop tools.  Would be cheaper to get a LBS to do this if you don't own or want to own the tools.  And a BB should last you at least 10,000 km.

Grafu isomorphism ni ngumu kwa det, darasa la shida ambazo ni $ nc^1 $ kupunguzwa kwa uamuzi. Tazama "Kwenye Hardness of Graph Isomorphism" by Jacobo Toran. http://epubs.siam.org/sicomp/resource/1/smjcat/v33/i5/p1093_s1?isAuthorized=no  It seems this is the strongest hardness result to date.

Sayansi ya kompyuta ya kinadharia ni uwanja mpana na umuhimu wa programu inategemea kile unachofanya katika TCS. Nitataja njia mbili ambazo programu inaweza kukusaidia, bila kuashiria kuwa hizi ndio njia pekee. Kwanza, ikiwa unabuni algorithms kwa shida za umuhimu wa vitendo, kutekeleza algorithms yako na kufanya nambari hiyo kupatikana kwa wengine inaweza kuwa kubwa zaidi. Kwa mfano, shida ya koni inatokea katika nyanja nyingi, na watu hutumia vifurushi vya programu kama vile CDD na Komei Fukuda na LRS na David Avis kutatua shida hii. Ikiwa wangechapisha algorithms zao tu kwenye karatasi, labda watu wachache wangetumia algorithms yao. Watumiaji zaidi wanamaanisha maoni zaidi na labda fursa zaidi za kushirikiana, ambayo ni muhimu sana. Pili, hata ikiwa haufanyi kazi katika algorithms, kuandika nambari ya wakati mmoja hukusaidia kujaribu dhana rahisi wakati dhana hiyo inafaa kwa hesabu ya hesabu. Kwa mfano, ikiwa unajiuliza ikiwa bidhaa ya matawi matatu mazuri yana kila wakati a positive trace, it is easy to write a code to test it for some random choices of 2×2 or 3×3 positive definite matrices and find a counterexample.  Although you do not advertise that you wrote any program to test the conjecture, programming can save the time which would have been spent in vain trying to prove a false statement.  The programming language to choose depends on what you want to do with programming, and it can be a topic for a whole book in my opinion.  But if you design algorithms and want to implement your algorithms so that other people can use the implementation, then one important factor is availability.  Although you can expect that most potential users of your code have access to a C compiler, you cannot expect that the same people have access to a Haskell compiler.  For one-time programs, the choice is more based on available libraries, and includes the environments such as Matlab.  By the way, programming can also be fun.

Tarp ni wazo mbaya kwa sababu inaweka fidia ndani. Ni bora kupata eneo lililofunikwa la kufunikwa. Lazima kuwe na kitu karibu na kazi yako. Angalia sana mahali pa kazi ili kuweka baiskeli yako. This is by far the best option for both security and keeping your bike in nice shape.  If this isn't practical, get the best lock you can afford and google up on how to use it properly.

Acha $ (\ mathcal {x}, \ rho) $ iwe nafasi ya metric (sema, $ \ mathcal {x} = [0,1] $ na metri ya Euclidean). Acha $ \ alpha: \ mathcal {x} \ hadi [0,1] $ isijulikane. Tuseme kwamba $ \ mathcal {x} $ imewekwa na usambazaji $ \ mu $ ambayo $ (x_1, \ ldots, x_n) $ ni sampuli iid. Zaidi, kwa kila $ x_i $, tunazingatia $ y_i \ sim \ mathrm {Bernoulli} (\ alpha (x_i)) $. Lengo letu ni kupata $ \ alpha $ kutoka kwa sampuli ya laini, chini ya kazi fulani ya upotezaji (mimi hupendelea upotezaji wa $ \ ell (\ hat \ alpha, \ alpha) = $ $ $ kl (\ hat \ alpha || \ alpha) = \ hat \ alpha \ logi (\ hat \ alpha/\ alpha) + (1- \ hat \ alpha) \ logi [(1- \ hat \ alpha)/(1- \ alpha)] ,$$ but other loss functions can be considered also.)  Obviously, there is no hope of recovering $\alpha$ without some regularity condition, such as Lipschitz continuity.  Does this problem fall under some known framework?  Edit: Following Clement's comment, a clarification. The loss I defined above is pointwise, at each $x$ --- so it should really be $\ell(\hat\alpha(x),\alpha(x))$. The overall risk is then  $$R(\alpha)=E_X[\ell(\hat\alpha(X),\alpha(X))].$$

Hili ni swali rahisi sana, lakini sikuweza kupata kumbukumbu na nilitaka tu kuangalia ukweli wangu. Nilitafuta mashine ya serikali inayofanana na kusukuma automata lakini mahali ambapo stack imezuiliwa kwa kitu kimoja (i.e. rejista). Ilinitokea kwamba ikiwa rejista ina alfabeti isiyo na mwisho (ya maadili iwezekanavyo) itakuwa sawa na PDA. Kila configuration of the stack could be represented by a single element of the register's alphabet. (E.g. let's say that the register's alphabet is the set of natural numbers). Is this correct?  Furthermore, a DFSM is equivalent in strength to a NFSM. However, I assume that (DFSM + 1 register) would not be equivalent to a (NFSM + 1 register) since DPDA and NPDA are not equivalent?

Natafuta matokeo na karatasi zinazohusiana na (katika) kukadiriwa kwa shida ya chini inayotawala katika grafu za chordal. Hasa, ni nini bora approximation ratio achievable in polytime here ? The problem was shown to be $W[1]$-hard for the natural parametrization by Liu and Song in 2009.

Najua nimechelewa kwenye uzi huu lakini jaribu kuteleza saruji yako nyuma na sio mbele. Uwezekano wa mbele sana juu ya bracket yako ya chini na inasababisha pelvis yako to pull forwards. If you have your pelvis further back the pressure from just your pedaling alone will help to keep you seated further back on the saddle.

Baiskeli mbali? Unaweza kujaribu mazoezi ya plyometric. Plyometric inaweza kukusaidia kuboresha agility yako na nguvu. Kwa kuongezea, labda unataka kufanya kazi kwa nguvu ya msingi. Nadhani plyometrics inaweza kusaidia kwani jamii za BMX ni fupi na hutegemea sana juu ya nguvu na nguvu ya kueneza. Pia unataja kuwa wimbo huo ni matope sana kwa wanaoendesha. Kwa hivyo, unaweza kufanya vipindi vya Sprint kwenye barabara. Vipindi vya Sprint vitaboresha nguvu yako and speed. An example would be something like this:   Ride easy for 10 minutes Sprint for 30 seconds and work your way up to 2 minute sprints Ride at a comfortable pace for 3 minutes Repeat the sprint/comfortable pace cycle 4 to 6 times Finish up by riding at an easy pace for another 10 minutes Do this 2 or at most 3 times a week but NOT on consecutive days

Ikiwa kazi ya umbali inatokana na kawaida ya Euclidean ($ L_2 $ -norm), basi mchoro wa Voronoi wa $ n $ alama katika sehemu ndogo ya $ \ mathbb {r}^d $ ina seli ambazo ni polytopes. Katika kesi hii, idadi kubwa ya nyuso kutoka kwa seli ni $ n (n-1)/2 $. Ni nyuso ngapi a cell have when the distance changes from the $l_2$ to the $l_1$-norm? I know already  that the Voronoi cells in this case are not convex sets. What can I do if I want a bound for the VC dimension of a Voronoi diagram under the $l_1$-norm ?
Nilifurahia sura hiyo juu ya muundo wa data ya Cache-Obivious in the Handbook of Data Structures and Applications.

Hii ni bracket maalum ya chini kwa crankset. Sina hakika kwa nini unaweza kufikiria kuwa huu ni mfumo wa PF, kwani BMC haiorodhesha kama hiyo. Shimano anaorodhesha BB inayoambatana na crankset kama Hollowtech-2 system. Many(but not all) PF BB are significantly larger in diameter (30mm), while the hollowtech2 system is 24 mm for the crankset spindle. The hollowtech2 system is an external cup system and a very good one at that.

Ndio, meza ya hashi au ramani ya hashi inahitaji kazi ya njia moja. Pia kugundua mara mbili (tazama hii na hii) inaweza kufanywa sana efficiently using one-way functions. Both cases require "good" (with low chances of collision) one-way functions while cryptographic strength is usually not required.

Kujifunza Q ni algorithm inayojulikana katika kujifunza kwa kuimarisha ambayo inafurahiya mafanikio makubwa lakini bila uelewa wa kinadharia. Katika mpangilio wa tabular, inajulikana kuwa ikiwa kila jozi ya hatua ya $ $ (s, a), \ form s \ in \ mathcal {s}, \ forAll a \ in \ mathcal {a} $ imetembelewa kwa idadi isiyo na kipimo nyakati. Katika mpangilio wa makadirio ya kazi, hata hivyo, algorithm is not known to be convergent. There are some counterexamples where it diverges, under various assumptions. I was wondering if Q-learning with nonlinear function approximation could converge if each state-action pair is visited for infinite times. If not,  I wonder if there is any convergent variation of Q-learning algorithm that uses nonlinear function approximation.

Kile unachoelezea kinaitwa shida ya kawaida ya sarafu na imeanzishwa katika [1]. Njia moja ya kufanya hivyo ni kuchagua kiongozi na kisha kumruhusu kiongozi huyo aangushe sarafu, kwa mfano, kwa kutumia itifaki ya bin nyepesi [2]. Kwa kusema, hii inafanya kazi kama ifuatavyo: Tuna michakato ya $ n $ (= vyama) na uchague $ m = n/\ logi n $ bins. Katika kila raundi, kila mchakato unaoshiriki huchagua moja ya bins hizi za $ m $ kwa bahati nasibu na hutangaza chaguo hili. Michakato mibaya huchagua baada ya kuangalia uchaguzi wa michakato mizuri. Kwa hivyo mwisho wa pande zote kila mchakato unajua ni mchakato gani ulichagua ni bin gani. Michakato yote ambayo ilichagua bin nyepesi zaidi (i.e. ile iliyo na washiriki wachache) inaendelea hadi raundi inayofuata, wakati wengine wote huacha kushiriki. Ujanja ni kuweka uwiano wa awali wa michakato mizuri kuwa mbaya processes. How can the adversary try to prevent this? Clearly, the adversary's strategy is to make many bad processes survive until the next round, i.e., many bad processes are in the lightest bin. But since the good processes will be distributed almost uniformly among the bins, the adversary cannot place too many bad processes into the lightest bin, otherwise it will no longer be the lightest! (Once you have reached a constant number of participants you switch to $m=2$ bins.)  This protocol elects a good process as the leader with constant probability as long as a majority of processes is good, i.e., you will get an unbiased common coin with constant probability.   [1]: M. Ben-Or and N. Linial. “Collective coin flipping”. In Advances in Computing Research, S. Micali, ed., vol. 5: Randomness and Computation, JAI Press, Greenwich, CT, 1989, 91–115.  [2] Uriel Feige: Noncryptographic Selection Protocols. FOCS 1999: 142-153

Maoni yangu yatakuwa kuangalia kwa uangalifu katika nadharia ya Courcelle, kwamba shida zinaonekana katika (upanuzi fulani wa) mantiki ya pili ya mpangilio wa monadic ina algorithms ya FPT wakati parameterized na TreeWidth. Tuhuma yangu ni kwamba hii inashughulikia mifano mingi au mingi inayojulikana ya shida za FPT kwa picha hizi. Kwa maoni haya, tofauti yako ya ndani/ya ulimwengu inaonekana kuwa inahusiana sana na tofauti between problems expressible in existential MSO vs problems that have higher levels of quantification in their MSO formulations. To return to your actual question, lack of an MSO formulation (which can be proven unconditionally in many cases using ideas related to the Myhill–Nerode theorem) would be evidence towards lack of an FPT algorithm (harder to prove without complexity theoretic assumptions).

Hili sio jibu kamili na sina uzoefu sana katika nyavu za neural, lakini labda inasaidia. NNS kimsingi hupewa pembejeo na hutoa majibu. Halafu hufunzwa kupitia mazoezi ili kutoa majibu sawa juu ya pembejeo "zinazofanana" kwenye kikoa, kwa mfano, lebo sawa na picha za mnyama yule yule, au viwango vya juu vya "nafasi nzuri" za chess ambapo njia nzuri za kushinda. Kwa hivyo kama nilivyotoa maoni, NET za neural ni mfano usio sawa wa hesabu ambayo inafanya kazi kwa njia tofauti kabisa kuliko hatua za hatua kwa hatua zinazoendeshwa kwenye mashine za Kujaribu. Badala yake, fikiria kama mizunguko "laini" ambayo hutumia hesabu inayoendelea badala ya Boolean na inaweza kuunganishwa au kufunzwa, na inaruhusiwa kupotea. Kwa nini kucheza chess ni rahisi kuliko Dijkstra au graphisomorphism? Kwa sehemu, ni tofauti kati ya kumuuliza mtu kujibu swali kwa uwezo wao wote, na kuwauliza jibu moja sahihi pamoja na uthibitisho kwamba ni sawa. Kwa sehemu, ni tofauti kati ya kutatua shida ya ukubwa wa kudumu, na kutatua wakati huo huo the problem for all possible input sizes.  Each time Dijkstra's is run on an instance, which may be of any size, it implicitly proves that its output is the one true answer and no other. In chess and image recognition, one gives the best answer one can and errors are tolerated. Furthermore, one only trains networks to solve these problems of one size at a time. I don't think we know yet how to generalize such a neural net solution to, say, problem instances of entirely different sizes and shapes.  I don't think we should assume that neural nets can't solve shortest-paths or similar algorithmic problems, but they solve problems in a fundamentally different way than a step-by-step algorithm that is always correct.  Going back to the similarity between neural nets and circuits, note that circuits have been studied for decades, yet judging by the lack of answers to (5) of my previous question, we know almost nothing about how to construct fully correct circuits for a given problem except via transforming a uniform algorithm (Turing Machine) into a circuit.

Najua inasikika ni rahisi sana, lakini mifuko hii imetengenezwa kusafishwa (ikidhani yako haijawekwa. Ikiwa imewekwa, hautawahi kuiondoa). Kwanza, jaribu sabuni ya sahani na maji. Harufu za machungwa zinaonekana kukata harufu bora, lakini hiyo inaweza kuwa upendeleo wa kibinafsi. Ikiwa hiyo haitoshi, basi chaguo bora zaidi ni kutumia suluhisho lililoongezwa la kitu kama Pine Sol au bafu nyingine, jikoni na safi ya tile. Nimetumia Pine Sol katika uwiano wa 1: 4 na maji, na ilifanya kazi ambayo sabuni ya sahani haingefanya. Jambo lingine la kuzingatia: muhuri bidhaa unazobeba bora. Don't take fish just wrapped in newspaper like the fish market gives them to you. Ask for, and insist on if necessary, a ziplock or similar plastic bag or wrap to keep the fish oil off of your bag.   For Gym clothes, pack them in vacuum storage bags like you get for packing luggage tightly. Push the air out of the bag, and it will keep the nasty sealed in well enough to keep your bag form smelling.   They come large enough to put most anything that will fit in your panniers or messenger bag, (even newspaper wrapped fish), and they don't take up much room when empty.
