Aina za mstari na mantiki ya kujitenga ni kubwa, lakini inaweza kuhitaji juhudi kidogo za programu. Kuandika orodha salama iliyounganishwa katika kutu inaweza kuwa ngumu sana, kwa mfano. Lakini kuna njia mbadala ambayo inahitaji juhudi ndogo za programu, ingawa na dhamana kali. Mtiririko wa kazi (wa zamani) ni kuhakikisha usalama wa kumbukumbu kwa kutumia (kawaida stack ya) mikoa. Kutumia uelekezaji wa mkoa, mkusanyaji anaweza kuamua kitabia ni kipande gani cha data iliyotengwa inapaswa kuingia, na kusambaza mkoa wakati itatoka kwa wigo. Uingilizi wa mkoa ni salama (hauwezi kusambaza kumbukumbu inayoweza kufikiwa) na inahitaji kuingiliwa kwa programu ndogo, lakini sio "jumla" (i.e. bado inaweza kuvuja kumbukumbu, ingawa ni bora zaidi kuliko "kufanya chochote"), kwa hivyo kawaida hujumuishwa na GC in practice. The MLton ML Kit compiler uses regions to eliminate most GC calls, but it still has a GC because it would still leak memory otherwise. According to some of the early pioneers on regions, region inference wasn't actually invented for this purpose (it was for automatic parallelization, I think); but it just turned out it could be used for memory management as well.  For a starting point, I would say go for the paper "Implementation of the Typed Call-by-Value λ-calculus using a Stack of Regions" by Mads Tofte and Jean-Pierre Talpin. For more papers on region inference, look for other papers by M. Tofte and J.-P. Talpin, some of Pierre Jouvelot's work, as well as Greg Morrisett, Mike Hicks, and Dan Grossman's series of papers on Cyclone.

Ndio, kuna seti kama hizo, chukua $ \ mathsf {np} $-seti ya kati (seti yoyote ambayo ni $ \ mathsf {np} $-kati ya kudhani $ \ mathsf {p} \ neq \ mathsf {np} $) , n.k. Jenga moja kutoka SAT ukitumia nadharia ya Ladner. Kumbuka kuwa $ L $ yako inahitaji kuzingatiwa $ \ mathsf {np} $-shida ya kati, kwani iko katika $ \ mathsf {np} $ lakini sio kamili kwa hiyo. Kumbuka pia kuwa unadhani kuwa $ \ mathsf {p} \ neq \ mathsf {np} $ vinginevyo hakuna $ l $ kwani kila shida isiyo ya maana itakuwa kamili kwa $ \ mathsf {np} $ ikiwa $ \ mathsf {Np} = \ mathsf {p} $. Kwa kuongeza masharti ambayo umetoa haimaanishi ukamilifu kwa hivyo swali katika sehemu ya kwanza sio sawa na swali juu ya ujenzi wa ukamilifu. Kuhusu swali katika kichwa, i.e. "Je! $ \ Mathsf {np} $-ugumu lazima uwe wa kujenga?". Jibu linategemea kile tunachomaanisha na "kujenga". Kimsingi, shida ya uamuzi $ a $ hufafanuliwa kuwa $ \ mathsf {np} $-ngumu iff $ $ \ forAll b \ in \ mathsf {np} \ b \ leq^\ mathsf {p} _m $ $ ambayo inamaanisha $ $ \ forAll b \ in \ mathsf {np} \ \ inapatikana f \ in \ mathsf {fp} \ \ forAll x \ in \ {0,1 \}^* \ (x \ in b \ leftrightarrow f (x) \ katika a) $ $ na kwa nadharia ya Cook hii ni sawa na $ $ sat \ leq^\ mathsf {p} _m a $ $ ambayo inamaanisha $ $ \ inapatikana f \ katika \ mathsf {fp} \ \ form x \ in \ {0,1 \}^* \ (x \ katika sat \leftrightarrow f(x)\in A)$$  How can we make this definition constructive? It is already seems very constructive to me. I guess what you want to ask is if we can prove this for some $A$ without knowing what is $f$ explicitly. I don't remember seeing any such hardness proof.   Classically even when we don't have a specific function there is a function, saying that it is impossible that no function is a reduction is equivalent to saying that some function is a reduction. To talk about constructiveness we need to be more considerate. For example we can talk about statements which are provable classically but not constructively (e.g. intuitionism where different state of mathematical knowledge makes sense, Google for "ideal mathematician" or check this).  Intuitively it seems plausible to me that we can prove such a statement using a proof by contradiction and without giving any explicit reduction function. But it won't mean that there is no constructive proof of the statement. To be say more that no constructive proof exists we have to be more specific: proofs in which theory/system? what do we mean by a constructive proof?

Feigenbaum katika, mifano ya shida ya usimbuaji, inapendekeza ufafanuzi (def. 1) ya kazi ya usimbuaji kwa shida kamili za NP ambazo zinakidhi mahitaji yako. Anathibitisha kuwa NP-kamili problem Comparative Vector Inequalities admits such encryption function. She concludes with the main theorem that all NP-complete problems that are p-isomorphic to CNF-SAT are encryptable.

[Kwa kweli hii ni maoni, lakini ni muda mrefu sana kutoshea kwenye uwanja wa maoni.] Unaonekana kuwa tayari kabisa ukilinganisha na wanafunzi wengi mwishoni mwa mwaka wako mpya. Na sina hakika unamaanisha nini kwa "utafiti" au "uchapishaji". Lakini, kwa maana ya kawaida ya maneno katika CS ya nadharia, ningesema kwamba lengo la PhD ni kujifunza kufanya utafiti wa kujitegemea unaosababisha kuchapishwa, na kwamba, kama sheria, kufikia lengo hilo inahitaji bidii nyingi, Wakati, na kawaida husaidia kutoka kwa mshauri, kuenea zaidi ya miaka nne ya masomo ya kuhitimu. Hii ndio sababu REU ya kawaida (uzoefu wa utafiti wa undergrads) haina lengo hili, lakini badala yake itakuruhusu kufanya kazi kama mshiriki wa timu katika kikundi kikubwa, au labda na mshauri juu ya mradi mdogo, na lengo ndogo zaidi la kupata mfiduo wa awali wa mchakato. . Wanaweza kuwa katika shule nyingine. mimi not sure what to say about "depth" vs "breadth".  I would guess that, at your stage, your fastest way to develop is to complete your undergraduate TCS courses, and take some graduate-level TCS courses if you can.  You may be able to work through some of the undergraduate material on your own in the summer (maybe that's your "studying broadly").  Meanwhile, if there is some degree of TCS community in your school, or nearby, you could try to connect with it.  Find students (including grad students) and a few faculty to cultivate relationships with, and find out what kind of research projects are going on nearby.  A big part of learning to do research is becoming part of the TCS community, learning its norms, and what is currently of interest.  Over the years I've known a small number of students who had an idea they wanted to pursue, and tried to start research on their own, and while I'm sure some have enjoyed the experience, the usual outcome (by an academic / professional standard) is to fall short, for all kinds of reasons.

Kwanza, mimi ni mtoto Roadie. Kusafiri kwangu mara nyingi huishia kama jamii, lakini mimi hufanya 300+km kwa wiki, kwa hivyo nina hii chini sana sasa. Ninatumia pakiti ya nyuma kama paneli kwenye baiskeli ya barabara ya ngozi ni mbaya tu. Ninaacha viatu kazini isipokuwa ninachukua likizo. Suruali mimi hua vizuri na huwa navaa zile zile kwa wiki (isipokuwa ajali za wakati wa chakula cha mchana). Nachukua mashati 3-4 nami Jumatatu na ninawakunja pande zote za kadibodi au gazeti. Hizi basi huenda kwenye sehemu ya mbali ya mkoba wangu (Laptop inakaa kazini, na nina njia zingine za kufanya kazi kwa mbali). Mimi pia carry enough underwear/socks for the week. I take the used ones home in an unused bidon or my jersey pockets if I do not feel like taking even the smaller backpack. The socks I cycle in or not the ones I wear during the day.  Mondays mornings and Fridays evenings suck, but the rest of the week I can don the lycra and fly :-) If I am organised enough, I give my bag to a colleague who lives in a nearby hamlet and collect it from his place.  Finally, I always ensure I leave a complete set of clothing at work. I have previously had to stop to buy trousers on the way to work :-(

Kwa kuwa jibu la Steven Stadnicki halionekani kuwa limekubaliwa na mtu anayeuliza, nilifikiria bado inaweza kuwa na msaada kutoa sasisho: Nina kupunguzwa kutoka 3SAT hadi mchezo wa anuwai. Sijaangalia jibu la Steven kwa uangalifu au kufuata kiunga alichotoa, lakini kwa kuzingatia kupunguzwa kwafuatayo sitashangaa ikiwa mchezo wa aina nyingi umekamilika. Nipate kusumbua kupanua matokeo haya zaidi ya ugumu wa NP, hata hivyo. Mfano wa 3SAT una vifungu $ C_1, \ dots, c_m $, kila kifungu kuwa cha fomu $ c_i = l_ {i1} \ vee l_ {i2} \ vee l_ {i3} $ ambapo kila $ l_ {ik} $ ni $ ni Ama moja ya vigezo vya $ x_1, \ dots, x_n $ au negation ya moja ya vigezo. Kwa kuzingatia mfano wa 3SAT kama hiyo, kupunguzwa kunaunda mfano wa mchezo wa aina nyingi unaojumuisha michezo ya $ N + 1 $-moja kwa kila tofauti na mchezo mwingine unaotumika kama kuzama kwa mtaji zaidi. Kwanza tutafafanua muundo wa grafu kwa kila mchezo, kisha angalia mfano na ujadili wazo la msingi, halafu tutagundua ni gharama gani za kupeana kingo ili kufanya kupunguzwa kushikilia. Kwanza, grafu ya mchezo inayobadilika $ G_J $ kwa kila $ X_J $ $: Unda vertex iliyoandikwa $ x_j $ iliyowekwa alama na (i.e. vertex ya kushinda kwa Alice). Chip kwa $ g_j $ huanza kwenye vertex $ x_j $. Unda vertex iliyoitwa $ t $ na vertex iliyoandikwa $ F $, kila alama na B (i.e. zote ni nafasi za kushinda kwa Bob). Unda kingo zilizoelekezwa kutoka $ X_J $ hadi $ t $ na $ F $, zote mbili na gharama ya $ 1 $. Kwa kila $ $ l_ {ik} $ ya kifungu $ c_i $, ikiwa $ l_ {ik} = x_j $ au $ l_ {ik} = \ neg x_j $, unda vertices iliyoandikwa $ c_ita $ na $ c_ifa $ iliyowekwa alama na a na Vertices zilizoandikwa $ c_itb $ na $ c_ifb $ alama na B. ongeza edges $ (t, c_ita) $ na $ (f, c_ifa) $ na gharama zote zilizowekwa kwa $ l_ {ik} $. . Ikiwa $ l_ {ik} = x_j $, kisha weka $ (c_ita, c_itb) $ 's $ hadi $ l_ {ik} - 1 $ na $ (c_ita, c_itb) $ gharama ya $ l_ {ik} $. Vinginevyo kuweka $ (c_ita, c_itb) $ $ $ hadi $ l_ {ik} $ na $ (c_ita, c_itb) $ $ kwa $ l_ {ik} - 1 $. Mchezo wa Kuzama kwa Capital: Unda vertex iliyoandikwa $ C $, iliyowekwa alama na B. Kwa kila kifungu $ C_I $, tengeneza vertex iliyoandikwa $ c_ia $ iliyowekwa na A, na vertex iliyoitwa $ C_IB $ iliyowekwa alama na B. Unda makali $ . Hii ni mengi kuchukua, kwa matumaini mfano mfano hufanya hii kuwa digestible zaidi. Mfano wetu wa 3SAT ni kama ifuatavyo: $ c_1 = x_1 \ vee x_2 \ vee \ neg x_3 $ c_2 = x_2 \ vee x_3 \ vee \ neg x_4 $ c_3 = \ neg x_1 \ vee \ neg x_3 \ vee x_4 $ Inabadilisha mfano huu kuwa grafu 4 za mchezo tofauti na 1 mtaji wa kuzama graph. Katika michoro hapa chini, wima nyekundu ni alama na (i.e. ni nafasi za kushinda kwa Alice), na vertices za cyan zimewekwa alama na B (ni nafasi za kushinda kwa Bob). Grafu kwa $ x_1 $: Grafu kwa $ x_2 $: Grafu kwa $ x_3 $: Grafu kwa $ x_4 $: Grafu kwa Capital Sink: Wazo ni kama ifuatavyo: Bob analazimishwa kufanya hatua ya kwanza ya $ N $ ili kupata Kati ya kupoteza nafasi katika michezo ya kutofautisha ya $ N $. Kila hoja kama hiyo inasimamia mgawo wa kweli au wa uwongo kwa kutofautisha sambamba. Basi Alice atakuwa na mtaji wa kutosha kufanya hatua 4 haswa, ambayo kila mmoja Bob atahitaji kuwa na mtaji wa kutosha kulinganisha ili Bob kushinda. Thamani za $ c_i $ na $ l_ {ik} $ $ inapaswa kuchaguliwa ili mkakati wa kushinda tu wa Alice ni kama ifuatavyo, kwa kifungu fulani $ C_I $: Kifungu cha Alice $ C_I $ Mkakati: Acha $ C_I = L_ {i1 } \ vee l_ {i2} \ vee l_ {i3} $. Kwa kila $ k \ katika \ {1, 2, 3 \} $, ikiwa $ l_ {ik} = x_j $ au $ \ neg x_j $, songa hadi $ c_i? $ Katika mchezo wa kutofautisha kwa $ x_j $. Pia nenda kwa $ C_IA $ katika mchezo wa Capital Sink. . Kisha Alice kuchagua $ C_I $ na kutekeleza mkakati hapo juu gharama ya Alice $ l_ {i1} + l_ {i2} + l_ {i3} + c_i $ mtaji wa kutekeleza, na bob sawa kwa kupiga; Ikiwa kwa upande mwingine $ C_I $ imeridhika, basi counterplay ya Bob inapata punguzo la angalau $ 1 $. Lengo letu katika kuweka $ C_I $ na $ l_ {ik} $ na viwango vya Alice na Bob vya kuanza ni kuhakikisha kwamba punguzo lilisema ndio sababu ya kuamua ikiwa Alice au Bob atashinda. Kwa maana hiyo, weka $ b = m + 1 $, na weka $ l_ {ik} = 2b^{10} + ib^{2k} $ kwa kila $ k \ in \ {1, 2, 3 \} $, $ c_i = 3b^{10} + b^8 - \ jumla $ 9b^{10} + b^8 + n - 1. $ kumbuka kuwa all of these values are polynomial in $m$, so the MULTI-GAME instance outputted by the reduction has size polynomial in the size of the 3SAT instance even if these costs are encoded in unary.  Note also that for each clause $C_i$, $l_{i1} + l_{i2} + l_{i3} + c_i = 9b^{10} + b^8$ is Alice's starting capital. (Which is also $1$ greater than Bob's capital after making the first $n$ moves.)  First of all, it is immediately clear that if Bob's opening defines a truth assignment that leaves a clause $C_i$ unsatisfied, then Alice wins using her clause $C_i$ strategy given above.  If Bob's opening satisies all clauses, we can argue constraints on Alice's options which rule out any other possibility of Alice winning. Note that the order in which Alice makes her moves is irrelevant, as Bob's responses are forced and the total capital Bob will require to respond to Alice's moves is unchanged by the order of Alice's moves.   Alice can't make more than 4 moves: if Alice makes 5 or more moves, then her moves have a total cost of $\ge 5b^{10}$, which exceeds her budget. Alice must make 4 moves: if Alice selects 3 moves from the capital sink game then her total cost is $\ge 9b^{10} + 3b^8 - 3b^7 > 9b^{10} + 2b^8$ which is over budget. If she selects even one move of 3 from a variable game, then her total cost is $\le 8b^{10} + 2b^8 + b^7$ which is is substantially less than Bob's post-opening capital, so Bob can easily afford the counterplay. Alice must select a move from the capital sink game: if she doesn't, then she selects 4 moves from variable games, with total cost $\le 8b^{10} + 4b^7$, and again Bob can easily afford the counterplay. (Note that if there were a separate capital sink game per clause, we could even show that Alice must play in exactly one such game.)   From this stage we can disregard the $b^{10}$ and $b^8$ terms in the move costs chosen, as they will always sum to $9b^{10} + b^8$. Since Alice must choose exactly one move in the capital sink game, assume that move is to $C_iA$. Then Alice has (ignoring $b^{10}$ and $b^8$ terms) $\sum_{k=1}^3 ib^{2k}$ capital remaining, and Bob has $1$ less than this amount remaining.   Alice must select at least one move costing $l_{j3}$ for some clause $C_j$: if she doesn't, then her moves cost (again lower-order terms) $\le 3b^5$, and Bob has more than enough capital for counterplay. Said move costing $l_{j3}$ must be the move costing $l_{i3}$: it can't be a move costing $l_{j3}$ for $j > i$, otherwise this move alone costs $\ge (i+1)b^6$ which is greater than Alice's remaining budget. If it's $l_{j3}$ for $j < i$, then the $l_{(i - j)3}$ cost move must also be chosen by Alice to exhaust the $b^6$-order term in Bob's remaining budget. But then Either the $b^2$-order term in Bob's remaining budget or the $b^2$-order term doesn't get exhausted, so Bob wins handily.   Similar arguments should establish that Alice must select the moves costing $l_{i2}$ and $l_{i1}$. If Bob's truth assignment satisfies $C_i$, then even this strategy doesn't work, as the discount Bob gets on one of the $l_{ik}$-based costs makes up for the $1$ less capital he has after his opening.    A remark on my previous answer: it's obvious in hindsight that, for the TABLE-GAME variant of MULTI-GAME I defined in the comments of that answer, a knapsack-style DP suffices to determine which player has a winning strategy. You can argue that Bob's best strategy is to always respond to a losing state in a given game table with the minimal investment possible (this can't cut off a subsequent move for Bob that he would have otherwise), and from there that the order of Alice's moves doesn't matter. It then becomes a matter of choosing a split of Alice's capital among the games such that the sum of Bob's minimal winning responses over those games exceeds his budget, which can be reframed as a knapsack-style problem, which has a polynomial-time DP due to the unary representation of costs. (My recurrence actually would've worked for TABLE-GAME if I framed it in terms of Alice.)  It turns out that even a simple tree structure for each game, with constant depth and really only one meaningful fork per game (namely those at the start which force Bob to choose a truth assignment) is sufficient to get NP-hardness. I had some ideas for getting rid of that initial fork, which stalled out at somehow forcing Bob to invest a relatively large fixed amount of capital in $n$ games without Alice having to precommit to those games in advance, but obviously since TABLE-GAME is in P this is not possible without the fork.  I haven't thought much about your special case from UPD3. I suspect it's also NP-hard, for the reason that my variable gadgets seem at a glance like they may be adaptable to those constraints, but I probably won't look into it further.

At some point it was maintained by Nachum Dershowitz and Ralf Treinen, but it seems to have not been updated in a while.

MIP* = RE inaonyesha kuwa washirika wawili wenye nguvu wa kiholela wanaweza kushawishi uthibitisho wa matukio ya shida ya kusimamishwa. Sasa fikiria kuwa tunayo viboreshaji viwili ambavyo vina uwezo wa kutatua shida katika lugha fulani $ l $ (sema lugha kamili kwa NEEXP, NEEEXP, nk). Swali: Je! Ni vikwazo gani kwa $ l $ huruhusu watoa huduma kushawishi uthibitisho wa suluhisho kwa $ l $? Mfano wa nonquantum ni kwamba sio tu ip = pspace, lakini ip '= pspace ambapo ip' promers are only able to solve PSPACE level problems.  In particular, L = PSPACE works for the MIP* question.  Moreover, provers that are limited to any level of the polynomial hierarchy $\Sigma_k \textrm{P}$ can establish $\Sigma_k \textrm{P} \subset \textrm{PSPACE}$. (Unfortunately, looks like this doesn't work lower in the polynomial hierarchy.)  (I'm blurring over some definitional subtlety here about function problems vs. decision problems; in the above one probably needs the provers to be able to solve $\textrm{FP}^L$ rather than just L.)

Kwa ujumla, unaweza kuzingatia kitambulisho $ $ f (g (x)) = g^{(n)} (x), $ $ ambayo inaongeza vitambulisho vyako, ambayo $ n = 3,1,2 $ (mtawaliwa) . Kwa kazi fulani $ G $, kitambulisho hiki kinasema kuwa $ F $ inahitaji kupewa maadili kwa $ \ operesheni {RAN} G $, na ni bure vinginevyo. Maalum value of $n$ doesn't matter, in fact we can put whatever we want on the right-hand side as long as it doesn't involve $f$. Using inclusion-exclusion, you can come up with an explicit formula for the number of solutions, but I'll leave that to you.

Nilikuwa na hamu ya kujua ikiwa kitu kama hicho kinajulikana au kilisomewa. Wacha tuite kazi rahisi ikiwa inaweza kushughulikiwa na $ AC_0 $ mzunguko wa kina $ \ leq d $ na saizi $ \ leq n^k $ kwa $ k k, d $. Sasa hebu tufikirie mizunguko ya jumla: milango ni $ \ {\ vee, \ wedge, \ neg \} $ ya kufurahisha kwa $ 2 $, hakuna vizuizi vya kina. Wacha tuite mzunguko nice if in all gates it computes only simple functions. That immediately implies that if a function is not simple it can not be computed by a nice circuit.  My question is: do we know some simple function that is not computable by linear-size nice circuit? How about other definitions of simple or different models, like arithmetic circuits?

Msalaba tu ikiwa unatembea na kusukuma baiskeli yako. Ikiwa unapanda, wewe ni gari na kwa ujumla unahitajika kutii vifaa vyote vya kudhibiti trafiki kwa njia ile ile ya mwendeshaji mwingine wa gari. Kuna tofauti, kama Idaho Yield laws, but generally you have to behave like a car.  The other thing to think about is that the more you behave like a vehicle, the more predictable you are, and the more predictable the behavior of other vehicle operators will be.

Virginia Vassilevska Williams alijadiliwa kwenye bootcamp (kiunga cha muhtasari) katika Taasisi ya Simons, na inawasilisha ambayo inaweza kuwa kumbukumbu yako katika video ya utangulizi. Warsha nzima inafaa; Muhtasari na viungo vya video za mazungumzo yote vinaweza kupatikana hapa. Anaelezea (kuanzia saa 42:30 kwenye video) kwamba ikiwa kuna $ o \ kushoto (n^{2- \ varepsilon} \ kulia) $ algorithm kwa $ \ varepsilon> 0 $ kwa shida ya orthogonal, basi, basi Strong Exponential Time Hypothesis (SETH) is false. This would not immediately imply $P=NP$, but it would show an $O\left(2^{n-\epsilon}\right)$ algorithm for every $k$-SAT, which would be better than what we have right now; right now we have algorithms which solve $k$-SAT in $2^{n-O\left(\frac{1}{k}\right)}$, so these algorithms tend to $2^{n}$ for large $k$.  The proof is originally by Ryan Williams, and is quite elegant; I do recommend the lecture.

Fikiria nambari $ x_1, ..., x_n \ in \ mathbb {r} $ iliyotolewa na tms $ m_1, ..., m_n $ kama kwamba $ m_i $ inakadiriwa $ x_i $ kwa usahihi wa kiholela (kwa kuiruhusu kukimbia muda mrefu zaidi na muda mrefu). Ninavutiwa na shida ifuatayo: Amua ikiwa $ x_1, ..., x_n $ ni huru. Ni wazi hii haiwezekani, kwani hata kuamua ikiwa $ x_i = 0 $ haiwezekani. Walakini, ikiwa tumepewa oracle kwa shida ya kuamua ikiwa $ x_i = 0 $, basi shida hapo juu inatambulika: inaongeza polynomials zote zilizo na coefficients ya nambari (k.v. kwa mpangilio wa minlex), na kwa kila polynomial $ P $ compute A TM $ M_p $ that approximates $p(x_1,...,x_n)$ arbitrarily. Then, use the oracle to check if this number is $0$.  So the question is:     Is the problem also decidable under a zero-test oracle? i.e. is it co-recognizable?   Remarks:   This question relates (but is not directly connected/reducible to) my question here. I see that a lot of questions regarding real-numbers encounter issues with encoding. I think the encoding here is well defined (comment if I'm wrong, and I'll revise). Note that not all numbers are of course representable in this model.

Ikizingatiwa TRS tuiite iwe juu-inayoweza kupunguka au inayoweza kupunguka ikiwa hakuna upande wa mkono wa kulia uliomo katika upande wowote wa mkono wa kushoto upande usio wa kawaida. Neno A liko ndani ya moja B moja ikiwa wataingiliana na mizizi yao n.k. 2 (y) iko katika 1 (2 (x)) non-trivially while 1(y) is contained in 1(2(x)) trivially) (I also don't know if this 'containment' has a name)  E.g.   A TRS with a single rule 1(2(x)) -> 2(x) is not top-reducible. A TRS with rules 1(2(x)) -> 3(x), 4(3(5(x,y))) -> 1(5(x,y)) is not top-reducible.

Does anyone know why this would be a desirable modification? I'm really curious.

Ikiwa mnyororo wako ulipimwa na huvaliwa, basi kwa njia zote badala yake. Utasababisha kuvaa zaidi kwa baiskeli yako ukitumia mnyororo uliovaliwa kuliko kuwa na sprockets zilizovaliwa kidogo. Mlolongo uliovaliwa husababisha kuvaa kwa usawa kwenye meno ya minyororo yako na cogs za kaseti, mwishowe hii inaweza kusababisha maswala na kuhama na 'kunyonya mnyororo'. Mlolongo mpya uliochagua unaonekana mzuri. Kabla ya kuisakinisha, tafadhali safisha grisi yoyote na grime from your front chainrings and cassettes.  It should be good without re-lubing for a couple hundred miles with the factory lube, after that you should make sure that you keep it clean and lubed regularly.    The life of your chain is proportional to how you maintain it, a good chain poorly maintained will last a couple thousand, well maintained I don't doubt it could last 10k.  More info on chains: http://sheldonbrown.com/chains.html

$ (k, j) $-Kuingiliana kwa projective ni jumla ya jumla kwa k-clustering, ambayo mtu anahitaji kupata $ k $ $ j $ -flats katika $ \ mathbb {r}^d $ ambayo hupunguza kazi ya gharama kama inavyofafanuliwa Chini: Kwa kuzingatia $ j $ -Flat $ f $ kwa $ \ mathbb {r}^d $, na uhakika $ x $ katika $ \ mathbb {r}^d $, fafanua $ dist (x, f) = \ min_ {q \ in f} {|| x-q ||} $. Kwa kuzingatia seti ya $ k $ $ j $ -flats $ f $ katika $ \ mathbb {r}^d $, na uhakika $ x $ katika $ \ mathbb {r}^d $, fafanua $ dist (x, f ) = \ min_ {f \ in f} {dist (x, f)} $. Kwa kupewa seti $ p $ ya $ n $ alama katika $ \ mathbb {r}^d $, seti ya $ k $ $ j $ -flats $ f $ in $\mathbb{R}^d$, define the cost function as $cost(P,F) = \sum_{p\in P}dist(p,F)^2$.  This paper gives a PTAS for this problem with a running time $O(d(\frac{n}{\epsilon})^{\frac{jk^3}{\epsilon}})$. Further research also gives bicriteria approximation for this problem. A very general framework is given in this paper that achieves better bounds (but not a PTAS).  It would be very nice to have some input from the cs theory community. Some reference to recent paper regarding this problem would be greatly appreciated.   Thanks

Vipuli vya kurekebisha crankarm ni kawaida, mkono wa kulia umefungwa, kwa hivyo kuondolewa ni anticlockwise. Wanatoa wito kwa torque muhimu (43-48 n-m, moja ya picha zako). Ufunguo rahisi wa "l" wa allen unaotumiwa na mkono hauwezi kutoa torque ya kutosha kuvunja bolt ya kurekebisha. Kutumia wrench ya ratcheting na tundu ambalo linaisha katika kichwa cha hex 8mm inaweza kuwa suluhisho rahisi. Kuna miundo kadhaa tofauti ambayo hupata kichwa cha hex pamoja na zana ya kunyoa, na kitu chake kando ya mstari huo ambao utakupa nguvu ya kutosha ya kufungia bolt ya kurekebisha crankarm. Unaweza au haujui that after the fixing bolt is removed, a specialty tool called a "crank puller" will be needed to get the crank arms off the bottom bracket's spindle. Here is Park Tool's crank puller with an instructional video on its use.  If in fact your bottom bracket spindle is ISIS drive splines, you'll use the larger business end in the crank puller to remove the cranks. Here is a link to a metric hex head socket set as an example of what I'm referring to in the first paragraph.  Using these with a ratcheting wrench should allow you to deliver the power necessary to loosen the fixing bolts.

Matokeo ya angavu kutoka kwa nadharia ya ugumu ni Theorem ya PCP: Kwa kawaida, inasema kwamba kwa kila $ np $ shida $ $, kuna mashine bora ya ujaribu ambayo inaweza kuthibitisha usahihi wa uthibitisho (uthibitisho wa ushirika katika $ A $) kwa kutumia logarithmic number of random bits and reading only constant number of bits from the proof. The constant can be reduced to 3 bits. Therefore, the randomized verifier needs to read only three bits from the proclaimed proof.

Nadharia haswa kompyuta $ f (w, t) $ ni #p-ngumu. uthibitisho. Punguza kutoka kwa toleo la kuhesabu jumla, shida ya jumla ya #subset, iliyofafanuliwa kama ifuatavyo. Kuingiza ni seti $ w = w_1, \ ldots, w_n $ ya nambari zisizo za hasi, na nambari ya $ t $. Kazi ni kuhesabu idadi ya vifaa vya $ w '\ subseteq w $ ambayo inaongeza hadi $ t $. Shida hii inajulikana kuwa #p-ngumu, hata wakati kwa $ wote $, $w_i \leq t$ and $t = 2^{O(n)}$. In particular, the $w_i$'s are $O(n)$ bit integers.    Suppose now we could compute F in polynomial time. Then we could solve the #Subset Sum problem by outputting:  $$2^n \cdot \left( F(\frac{W}{t}, 1-\frac{1}{t}) - F(\frac{W}{t}, 1) \right) = 2^n \cdot P\left[\sum_{i=1}^n \frac{w_iX_i}{t} = 1 \right],$$ which is precisely the number of subsets of $W$ that add up to $t$.

Ninajua angalau njia mbili tofauti za nadharia za kuelewa hifadhidata za uhusiano: algebra/hesabu ya CODD, na nadharia ya kitengo. Je! Kuna uhusiano wowote kati ya njia hizi mbili? Je! Kwa maana ni sawa? Je! Kuna kazi yoyote ya utangulizi inayoelezea jinsi mifumo hii yote inaelezea hifadhidata za uhusiano? Asili: Wakati uliopita nilisoma nadharia ya kitengo cha David Spivak kwa wanasayansi ambayo ilitumia muda mwingi kujadili jinsi nadharia ya kitengo inaweza kutumika kuelewa nadharia ya hifadhidata ya uhusiano. Walakini, kuwa na uzoefu mdogo wa kibinafsi juu ya hifadhidata ya uhusiano ni nini au kwa nini ni muhimu, wakati huo sikuthamini kabisa kina cha ufahamu kilichopatikana kwenye kitabu hicho. Walakini, hivi karibuni nimekuwa nikijifunza juu ya maswali ya SQL na vifurushi viwili vya R kwa ujanjaji wa data: DPLYR na data.table. SQL inaweza kuonyesha maoni mengi ya algebra/mfano wa CODD, lakini sio yote. Kwa kuongezea, mwandishi wa DPLYR, Hadley Wickham, alisema wazi kuwa falsafa yake iliyo chini ya kifurushi hicho inategemea kazi ya CODD juu ya algebra ya uhusiano, na amri za msingi za data.Table Ramani vizuri kwa amri katika SQL na DPLYR. Mimi pia know that category theory influences a lot of programmers using functional programming languages like Haskell. However, I am not really aware of there being any use of functional programming for data manipulation or data science, besides Hadley Wickham's purrr package for R, the fact that Apache Spark is written in Scala, and technologies related to MapReduce.  All of this sort of suggests to me that there should be some sort of relationship between category theory and Codd's relational algebra/calculus, but I have never heard of anyone making such a connection explicit or explain how it underlies the design decisions in popular data manipulation and relational database technologies. So I also suspect I could be entirely wrong.  EDIT: Apparently David Spivak has worked on a "functorial query language (FQL)". This sounds like it might be an application of such a theoretical connection, provided it exists.  Note: I am not sure if "relational-structures" is the appropriate tag for discussion of relational databases or relational algebra/calculus. This Wikipedia article suggests they might be connected, but ultimately I don't know what the phrase "relational structure" means. Please feel free to re-tag.

Wakati ninaelewa swali ambalo unajaribu kuuliza, mimi hupata uwasilishaji mdogo. Hii inaweza kuwa mimi tu, lakini mimi hupata sauti ya swali ikipungua kidogo. Nina hakika hii sio kile ulichokusudia kufikisha - ninakuambia tu jinsi inanipata. Kwa hivyo, naweza kujaribu kujibu maswali yako. Acha nianze na jozi ya maoni potofu: Dhana potofu 1: usawa sio katika AC0 inasema kwamba "haiwezekani kujenga mizunguko ya kina ya kila wakati ya polynomial ili kutekeleza usawa katika ulimwengu wa kweli." Hii sio kweli hata kidogo. Matokeo yake yanadai nini hufanya: haiwezekani kutekeleza usawa kwa kutumia mzunguko wa ukubwa wa polynomial wa kila wakati ulioundwa na (na hii ndio sehemu muhimu) sio Gates, na shabiki wa ndani na au au milango. Dhana potofu 2: Inaaminika kuwa kwa sababu tu na, au na sio milango huunda msingi kamili, AC0 ni nguvu chini ya kubadilisha milango hii kwa milango yoyote. Kama ulivyosema, hii sio kweli. Ikiwa ulitumia Xor Gates isiyo na mipaka, basi ni wazi kwamba usawa una mzunguko wa kina-1. Darasa ambalo limepunguza shabiki-katika Xor Gates kwa kuongeza kawaida, na na au milango inaitwa AC0 [2]. AC0 sio nguvu chini ya kubadilisha seti ya lango (tofauti na madarasa mengine kama NC0, ambapo msingi wowote kamili utafanya kazi hiyo). Kwa mfano ikiwa tunaruhusu lango la wengi kwa kuongeza na, au na sio milango, tunapata darasa linaloitwa TC0, ambalo ni kubwa zaidi kuliko AC0. Swali la kufurahisha ambalo linatokea, na ambalo umeuliza wazi, ni yafuatayo: "Ufafanuzi wa AC0, na kizuizi cha kutumia tu na ∧, au ∨, na sio ¬ gates, seems arbitrary. What is the fundamental basis for this restriction?"   This is a nice question. It also has a good answer. I don't think I can answer this satisfactorily myself, so I'll let someone else do it. I'll try answering it myself if no one else chooses to do so. But note that the answer is not  "AC0 models real world circuits."  This question also immediately leads to the question "Why is this result interesting?" I'm not sure if this is what you meant to ask, but some good answers are given on the complexity theory blog.  So if we look at your your claimed "subtle and unstated" assumptions, you'll find that most of them are very clearly stated. For example, the fact that you can only use AND, OR and NOT is in the definition of AC0. I can't imagine anything being stated more explicitly than that!  Answer to revision 4  In revision 4 it seems like the question really is "Why don't we allow AC0 to have NAND gates also (because those are the gates used in real life by EE folks)?"  The answer is simple. Adding unbounded fan-in NAND gates to AC0 does not make AC0 more powerful. So you can interpret PARITY not in AC0 as saying that "PARITY cannot be computed by constant-depth circuits with unbounded fan-in AND, OR, NAND and NOT gates."  An unbounded fan-in NAND gate is just an unbounded fan-in AND gate with the output negated. So every NAND gate can be replaced by an AND gate and a NOT gate. Then, all the NOT gates can be pushed down to the inputs using standard techniques. At the end, the depth remains the same, and the size might increase by something like a factor of 4.

Fikiria alama 1 za ukubwa $ x_1, \ dots x_n, x_i \ in \ mathbb {r} $ ambapo umbali kati ya alama mbili hufafanuliwa kama $ d (x_i, x_j) = \ vert x_i - x_j \ vert $. Lengo ni kuongeza jozi zote za $ N^2 $ katika kuongeza mpangilio wa umbali. Algorithm isiyo na maana inachukua $ o (n^2 \ logi n) $ wakati lakini tunaweza kufanya vizuri ikiwa tunaruhusiwa kujenga muundo wa data katika awamu ya usindikaji kabla. Ni rahisi kuona kwamba mtu anaweza kujenga muundo wa data ambayo inachukua $ O (n \ logi n) $ wakati na $ o (n \ logi n) nafasi ya $ kwa njia ifuatayo - tunapanga alama zote za pembejeo na uhifadhi mgombea wa karibu zaidi kwa kila nukta kwenye chungu. Halafu, na kuchelewesha $ O (\ logi n) $, naweza kupata kipengee cha pato. Kwa uhakika which was popped from the heap, we can add the next closest point using binary search over the input and inserting into the heap (both operations take $O(\log n)$ time). Although this method is better, it still takes $O(n^2 \log n)$ time in total.  Question 1 - My question is whether there is a known lower bound that total enumeration cannot be done in $o(n^2 \log n)$ time. This was listed as an open problem here. I am looking for references that prove a lower bound or a more recent paper that confirms this is still an open problem.  Question 2 - What happens if I replace distance function to $d(x_i, x_j) = x_i + x_j$? Does this make the problem easier and admit $o(n^2 \log n)$ time algorithm?

Muktadha fulani: Ninaishi karibu na barabara kuu iliyokusanyika, na kila mtu hupitia vijiji wakati wowote imezuiliwa. Ikiwa mimi ni baiskeli, nina mkondo wa magari unaoendelea kunipitisha, hata ikiwa hawawezi kuona barabara mbele. Kwa hivyo kuwazuia kuzidi (zaidi kwa usalama wao kuliko wangu) mimi hutoka zaidi kuelekea kituo hicho. Nimeona kuwa jibu hili linasema kuwa ni sawa kuchukua njia kamili wakati njia hiyo haitoshi for a car to pass safely (to discourage dangerously close passing)   But my situation isn't about close passing, it is about passing that is dangerous to others, and consequently could be dangerous to be me.  Should I be "taking the lane" to stop people doing this, or is this not the right way to deal with it?  Just for reference, this is the road I am riding along, the worst point is half way, there is a sharp left then right.

Karibu wewe ni bora kutumia pesa hizo kwenda kutembelea. Ningeenda mbali kusema kwamba hadi umefanya utalii wa kutosha kuwa na orodha ya vitu ambavyo unataka kutoka kwa baiskeli yako ya utalii ambayo huwezi kupata kutoka kwa baiskeli yoyote ya uzalishaji, usijisumbue kufikiria juu yake. Kweli, isipokuwa hobby yako nyingine inatumia pesa, kwa hali ambayo ninapendekeza kununua moja kutoka kwa kila mjenzi wa kawaida na kuona jinsi wanavyolinganisha. Faida kuu ya sura maalum ni kwamba imejengwa ili kukufaa na ina kile unachotaka juu yake. Watalii wa muda mrefu mara nyingi huendeleza mahitaji maalum na hakuna baiskeli inayozalishwa kwa wingi itawaridhisha. Hata vitu rahisi kama racks zilizojengwa ndani ni nadra sana katika baiskeli za utalii wa soko kubwa, achilia vitu maalum zaidi kama vipeperushi vya kufunga vitu. Lakini tena, isipokuwa tayari unayo orodha hiyo ya mambo unayopoteza pesa yako kupata baiskeli ya kawaida. Hatari kuu ni kwamba unatumia pesa nyingi kisha uamue kuwa sio kile ulichotaka baada ya yote. Hii ndio hasa kwa watu ambao hawajafanya utalii mwingi, na najua angalau mjenzi mmoja ambaye anakataa tume kutoka kwa novices kwa hii reason. Every unhappy customer they've had has been a newbie to whatever they wanted the bike for. The solution is to put them on a cheap bike and wait a year.  With S&S couplers you're likely to need those added after you buy a mass-market bike, which is an opportunity for you to get the framebuilder who does the work to add any little extras you want. It'll very likely be cheaper to buy a new mass-produced bike and have the couplers added than get a customer bike. But it's likely to be cheaper to pay a freight company to ship the bike around the world a couple of times than to get the couplers fitted.  As Alan says, you can tour on any bike. I've done a 5Mm trip through northern Australia with people who rode BSOs (bicycle shaped objects), one of whom did the last couple of megametres with no balls in their bottom bracket (and hence, no front derailleur). They didn't enjoy the riding as much as they could have, but they did it.  As far as comfort goes, you will very likely be more comfortable on the cheapest recumbent you can find than the most expensive upright bike.

Kwenye mifano takriban 5 ya breki za Shimano disc ambazo nimeshughulikia zaidi ya miaka, bolts za kurekebisha caliper ni M6 x 18.7mm, na ni screws za kichwa cha kichwa kwa usawa wa baiskeli. Urefu huu wa kurekebisha bolt itakuwa ikiwa unatumia rotors 160mm kwenye usanidi wa mlima wa posta. Kwa mifumo inayotumia rotors 180 au 203mm, utahitaji urefu wa 40mm kwenye bolts zako za kurekebisha caliper ili kupata caliper na adapta inayohusika. Kwenye shamba, nyumbani, au duka za vifaa kwenye vifungo vyao vya bolt utapata katika sehemu yao ya metric, "Socket Head Cap" screws (watakuwa na mwisho wa blunt kama bolt, lakini ni screws kwa sababu hutumiwa kwa kuwachapa kwenye zilizopo zilizopo Threads, sio na lishe inayohusika. That's then a bolt.) The closest length you'll get is 20mm, though some places may have 18mm M6 socket heads in stock. They'll also have 30 and 40mm lengths typically. While you're there, purchase some blue Loctite 242 (aka, threadlocker blue) and follow the instructions for that using it on the caliper fixing bolts (well, they're screws, but Shimano calls em bolts) when you go to mount your caliper.  And tighten to the recommended torque value range of 6-8 Newton-meters (50-73 inch-pounds). Properly torqued fasteners with threadlocker will not "come loose" without mechanically assisted human effort.  It's still a good idea to check the fastness of your calipers before every ride and recheck with a torque wrench every so often, especially after the first ride or two after install.
Naamini FP ni what you're looking for.

Kama ulivyoona, kupata traction nzuri kwa kujaa (haswa kwenye mvua) misingi lazima iwe na grippy. Ili kuweza kuzunguka ili kuwezesha kutolewa kwa viatu visivyo na picha, kujaa lazima ziwe za kuteleza. Kufanya misingi ya grippy itamaanisha kutolewa bila kuaminika wakati wa kutumia clipless. Chochote unachofanya, usijaribu kuirekebisha na suluhisho za DIY kama mkanda wa mtego, kuweka sahani kwenye misingi au kwenye kingo zinazoongoza (kushikamana) - utaboresha shida uliyonayo, lakini uwezekano wa kuunda mbaya zaidi - unaweza Pata vizuri yourself under a B-Train or off the side of a trail and down a bluff when you cannot release in a hurry.   Solutions are to accept the compromise solution, try the combination flats one side, clips the other which solves this problem (but generates others such as the pedal is never the right way up.), or commit to either flats or clipless.   Personally I think the commitment to one or the other is the best solution.   This question (and many others) is worth reading if you want to consider other options.

Ford Econovan Ikiwa huu ni safari yako ya kwanza ya umbali mrefu, basi unapaswa kufanya safari inayoungwa mkono. Rafiki /mwenzi wako katika van angebeba matairi ya vipuri, sehemu za vipuri, baiskeli ya vipuri, vifaa vya matibabu, na zana. Na chakula cha mchana au chakula cha jioni na maji. Wanaweza kubeba hema zako na mifuko ya kulala ikiwa unataka kuweka kambi chini ya stars.   They'd help ferry you to the next motel if you bonk in the middle of the Arizona desert and give you shelter in a sudden thunderstorm or tornado. They can hit the antique shops or casinos between segments while you're pedaling away.   I can't think of a better (faster, safer) upgrade for a newbie long distance rider.

Wacha kikundi kijue kuwa, katika suala la faida ya mafunzo, kupanda vilima ni Workout bora: hapa ndipo unapounda nguvu, na mahali ambapo faida za maendeleo zinaweza kunifanya. Kimsingi, fanya kikundi kuamini kuwa kweli inakuwa rahisi: kwamba ni nini milima leo itakuwa molehill kesho. Chunguza vifaa vya kila mtu ili kuhakikisha kuwa imewekwa vizuri kwa saizi yao kwa nguvu nzuri ya kanyagio kutoka kwa nafasi ya kukaa. Labda wengine hawapendi kupanda zaidi kuliko wanavyopaswa, kwa sababu baiskeli yao haijawekwa kwa ajili yake, na kuwafanya kutoa juhudi zaidi kuliko lazima ili kushinda kilima kilichopeanwa. Vivyo hivyo, kila mtu achunguze shinikizo la tairi. Wapanda farasi walio na shinikizo la chini la tairi na usanidi duni wa urefu wa kiti wanapanda vizuri kilima kirefu kuliko their companions with harder tires and more optimal configuration of bike.  Encourage the group to use a higher gear than what is comfortable, at least for a portion of the climb, as a form of resistance training.  Encourage the group to gain more power from standing up, and to develop the endurance in the supporting muscles to maintain the standing position over longer climbs.  Support those who want to take one or more rests along the incline: this is interval training in disguise.  If there is a steeper and less steep path to reach a point, divide the group into two: those who want to challenge the incline, and those who want a more gradual incline. If the steepsters reach the join point first, wait for the graduals before continuing.

Je! Mashine kama hizo zinaweza kujengwa kwa mazoezi? Ndio. Na "Mashine", Schmidhuber inamaanisha tu "Programu ya Kompyuta". Je! Angalau zinawezekana katika ulimwengu wetu? Sio katika hali yao ya sasa - algorithms haifai sana. Kwa mtazamo wa mita elfu kumi, Jürgen Schmidhuber (na wanafunzi wa zamani, kama Marcus Hutter) wamekuwa wakichunguza wazo la kuchanganya utaftaji wa Levin na hoja za Bayesian kufanya algorithms kwa utatuzi wa jumla wa shida. Wazo la msingi nyuma ya Utaftaji wa Levin ni kwamba inawezekana kutumia nambari za kuweka na Goedel kutoa algorithm moja ambayo ni, kwa sababu za kila wakati, bora. Kwa urahisi, unarekebisha usimbuaji wa Godel wa programu, na kisha unaendesha mashine ya Kujaribu ambayo inaendesha $ n $ -th program once every $2^{n}$ steps. This means that if the $n$-th program is optimal for some problem, then Levin search will "only" be a constant factor of $2^n$ times slower.   They have done a fair amount of work on making the constant factors less stupendously, horrifically awful, and are optimistic that this kind of scheme can work in practice. I am (based on my experience in automated theorem proving) very skeptical, since good data structures are critical to theorem proving, and Goedel encodings are terrible data structures.   But you don't know it can't work until you try to make it work! After all, we already live in a world where people solve problems by reduction to SAT.

"Uboreshaji katika hali ya msingi wa serikali" na Lamport. Rafiki yetu, ambaye alikuwa mtaalam wa hesabu mzuri, amelazwa hospitalini kwa sababu ya unyanyasaji wa muda mrefu wa dawa za hallucinogenic. Tunaamua kumpa dijiti clock for his room. However, his doctor suggests that the hour and minute displays together might be too confusing. So, we put tape over the minute display, turning our gift into a digital hour clock.

Katika mwongozo huu, wanasema torque ya eneo kubwa la Defy la Defy inapaswa kuwa karibu 50kgf-cm (5nm). Najua hii ni kwa sura ya kaboni, lakini inapaswa kuwa sawa. Unaweza kununua wrench ya torque kwa karibu $ 30, which you should, because otherwise there is a high chance you will under or over tight it. I know $30 is a pain in the ass, but think this will keep your $1000 bike running smoothly for a long time.

Ikiwa ninaelewa shida vizuri, jibu linapaswa kuwa $ 2 \ log_2 (n) $: tengeneza grafu na $ \ log_2 (n) + 2 $ tabaka, ambapo safu ya kwanza ni $ A $, safu ya mwisho ni $ tu $ B $, na tabaka za kati zina node $ $ 2 kila moja; basi tunaweka directed edge from each node to the node(s) in the next layer.  We then have $2^{\log_2(n)} = n$ paths from $A$ to $B$, and the union of these paths contains $2 \log_2(n)$ intermediate nodes.  Does this fit the constraints of your problem?

Wakati ni mbali na bora kwa kazi hiyo, nimefanya mengi ya changarawe kwenye baiskeli ya barabara. Wakati huo, nilikuwa nikipanda Rim-Brake Scott Foil (mfano wa 2017) na magurudumu ya kaboni. Sijawahi kugundua kuwa sura au sehemu ilikuwa katika hatari yoyote ya kunishindwa wakati wowote. Labda utapata idadi ya chips ndogo za jiwe kwenye kazi ya rangi, lakini hiyo ni mapambo tu badala ya wasiwasi wa muundo. Suala kuu ambalo nilikuwa nalo lilikuwa utendaji wa kubomoa kwenye nyuso za bure ilikuwa mbaya tu. Nilikuwa nikiendesha rims za kaboni, na matairi ya 24mm, kwa hivyo nilihitaji kuanza kuvunja muda mrefu kabla ya zamu yoyote. Katika safari moja, nilikuwa na tairi gorofa wakati riding down a very steep gravel descent and was unable to come to a stop for several hundred meters because my rear tyre had even less traction once it went flat. The issue of traction on narrow tyres is a major consideration that you will need to learn to handle through every corner.   Speaking of handling, your road bike is likely to have narrower handlebars than an equivalent cyclocross or gravel bike, which will affect how well you can manoeuvre your bike on very rough terrain. You can swap out the handlebars for something wider and the stem for a shorter one, but road bikes are built to handle well at higher speeds and their geometry is designed around that.

Kweli, kujibu hili, kuna mambo kadhaa ya kuzingatia. 1) Je! Ni masaa gani au uendeshaji wa maduka ya baiskeli? Je! Unapanga kupanda wakati maduka hayajafunguliwa. 2) Je! Una uhakika kuwa maduka yote ya baiskeli daima yatakuwa na saizi yako ya bomba kwenye hisa. Vivyo hivyo, unafikiria kila wakati wangekuwa na 700x32 kwenye hisa, lakini nimepata mara ya kutosha kwamba inakera. Bila kusema idadi ya nyakati ambazo nimekaa kwa kutumia Presta wakati ninastahili kutumia Schraders. 3) Je! Unataka kutembea wapi, na ni nini adhabu ya kuchelewa? Kutembea 800 m (1/2 maili) kunaweza kuchukua karibu dakika 10. Kwa wakati huo unaweza kuwa tayari umebadilisha tairi. Je! Unapoteza malipo ukifika kazini marehemu? Ikiwa hii itatokea sana utaonekana kama usioaminika, na utakata tamaa zako? 4) Je! Kitengo cha kiraka au bomba la ziada na pampu ya sura inakupunguza sana? Kiti cha kiraka kinaweza kwa urahisi be stored in those bags that go under your saddle, or in your jersey pocket.  A pump can be mounted on the frame, and you probably won't even realize it's there.    Personally, I don't think there's much reason not to carry a pump and spare tube.  Although it does seem useless at this point. I ran over a broken beer bottle on the weekend and heard and felt the glass crush underneath my tires. Thanks to gatorskins and tuffy tape, I didn't even have a flat.  I seriously question why I should bother.  But then 3 months ago I had a valve fail.  It's almost never the case that I get a flat from an actual puncture, but usually from pinch flats or other unexpected things.  I don't think I've ever had to use my allen keys on my commute, but I still carry them. That being said, the day you have to walk a mile because you didn't want to carry something as small as a tube and pump is the day you're going to rethink why you don't carry one.

Nadharia za uongozi ni zana za msingi. Idadi nzuri yao ilikusanywa katika swali la mapema (ona ni miiba gani na/au nadharia za uongozi unajua?). Utenganisho fulani wa darasa la ugumu hufuata moja kwa moja kutoka kwa nadharia za uongozi. Mfano wa utenganisho unaojulikana kama huo: $ l \ neq pspace $, $ p \ neq exp $, $ np \ neq nexp $, $ pspace \ neq exppace $. Walakini, sio kila kujitenga hufuata kutoka kwa nadharia ya uongozi. A very simple example is $NP\neq E$. Even though we do not know if any of them contains the other, they are still different, because $NP$ is closed with respect to polynomial transformations, while $E$ is not.   Which are some deeper, unconditional, non-relativized complexity class separations for uniform classes that  do not directly follow from some hierarchy theorem?

Ukiangalia SRAM S350-1 (pete moja ya mnyororo) kwenye wavuti ya SRAM inasema kuwa ni uingizwaji wa moja kwa moja kwa mpinzani 1 na Sambamba with 130, 135, and 142 OLD frames.  Rival 1 should be a straight swap assuming you get the correct axle variant (i.e., GPX).

Wakati silika yangu ya kwanza pia ilikuwa kwamba shida inapaswa kuwa NP-ngumu, inaonekana kama inaweza kuwa karibu na shida katika P, ambayo ni orodha ya kuchorea kwenye grafu ambazo vitalu vyake, au vifaa vilivyounganishwa 2, ni vikundi. Sina hakika ni kwa kiwango gani hii inasaidia, kwa sababu wakati utatatua mfano uliopunguzwa mikutano yote itajazwa kwa uwezo, ambayo ni shida ya ziada kwenye shida yako. Lakini ikiwa hoja iliyobaki inashikilia hii inaweza kuwa na kazi, kwa hivyo nitasema maendeleo ya sehemu. Ikiwa ni ya busara, upunguzaji huu hauitaji kujua ni siku gani mkutano unatokea, kwa hivyo ninatumia nukuu zaidi ya kupumzika (kuacha habari kuhusu siku gani mkutano ulikuwa). Anzisha cap $ _m $ vertices $ $ \ {v_m^{(1)}, v_m^{(2)}, \ ldots, v_m^{(c_m)} \} $ $ kwa kila mkutano $ m $. Acha $ m_r $ iashiria seti ya mikutano yote $ m $ ambayo inahusishwa na shida $ C_R $. Seti ya makali inajumuisha kikundi kikubwa kwenye vertices zote zinazohusika katika kuwakilisha $ m \ katika m_r $, ambayo ni, $ $ e = \ {(v_p^{(i)}, v_q^{(j)}) | p, q \ in m_r \} $ $ $ $ \ rangi {nyekundu} {\ kikombe \ {(v_p^{(i)}, v_q^{(j)}) | p, q \ maandishi {ni mikutano kwa siku hiyo hiyo}) \} \ maandishi {[Tazama maoni hapa chini]}. ya all people for whom the meeting is on their preference list.   A valid list coloring in the graph will fill all meetings to full capacity, and will never assign the same person to similar meetings, and will always give a person a meeting that they wanted to be in.  Some things to note:   The meetings will be filled to capacity, so this is not a completely accurate reduction. The simplest fix is to ask for a partial coloring, but I am not sure about the complexity of this question.  One could make the same copies of every meeting an independent set, and add a complete partite structure across meetings with the same constraint. Now, the color corresponding to a person can be repeated within a meeting. However, I am not completely sure that the graph structure now allows for the Ptime algorithm! The other fix would be to introduce junk colors in the pallette, but then some people may not get assigned to meetings at all. The reduction works with longer preference lists, too. Conflicts within the same day can also be handled with this modelling.    And this paper mentions that list coloring can be resolved in polynomial time when the blocks of the graph are cliques.

Kwa hivyo ikiwa ninaelewa kwa usahihi unataka majirani wa kila vertex kuunda idadi ndogo ya vitalu vya kuagiza? Halafu hapana, unahitaji idadi kubwa ya vitalu kuliko hiyo. Wacha tufikirie tunayo grafu ya bipartite na nambari ndogo $ k $ ya (lebo) vertices upande mmoja na $ n $ kwa upande mwingine. Kila makali kutoka upande mmoja hadi mwingine yanaweza kuwapo au kutokuwepo kwa wengine, kwa hivyo kuna bits $ $ $ za habari zinazohitajika kutaja grafu nzima. Kwa upande mwingine, tuseme unaweza kupata agizo with the neighbors of each vertex forming at most $b$ blocks. Then you could specify the same graph by listing the ordering of the big side of the bipartition (representable in $\le n\log_2 n$ bits of information) and the positions and lengths of the blocks for each of the $k$ vertices on the small side of the bipartition ($\le 2bk\log_2 n$ bits). So to have enough information to specify the whole graph we need $$ n\log_2 n+2bk\log_2 n\ge kn $$ or equivalently $$ b\ge\frac{kn-n\log_2 n}{2k\log_2 n} $$ Setting $k=2\log_2 n$ gives $b=\Omega(n/\log n)$, significantly greater than $\sqrt m=\Theta((n\log n)^{1/2})$.

Unapaswa kujaribu chache kutathmini utendaji wao wa kuhama. Bora zaidi ikiwa unaweza kufanya mtihani wa kipofu. Pia fikiria kutafiti gharama ya sehemu mpya (eg: chains) and the ease of maintenance.  In my opinion weight is overrated and you can spend a lot of money to make a groupset 100g lighter.

Kwa lugha yoyote $ l $, wacha tufafanue lugha nyingine $ tally (l) $, kama ifuatavyo: $ $ tally (l) = \ {1^n \; | \; \ inapatikana x \; \ mbox {na} \ ; x \ katika l \; \ mbox {na} \; | x | = n \} $ $ Hiyo ni, $ tally (l) $ encode ikiwa kuna kamba ya $ n $ -bit katika $ l $ au la. . $ Tally (l) \ katika \ mathsf {np} $. Sababu ni kwamba mtu anaweza kushuhudia $ 1^n \ kwa tally (l) $ na $ x $ na $ | x | = n $ na $ x \ kwa l $, pamoja na shahidi wa ukubwa wa polynomially $ y $ kwa $ x x \ katika l $. Halafu $ (x, y) $ inaweza kutumika kama shahidi wa ukubwa wa polynomially kwa $ 1^n \ katika tally (l) $. Wakati $ l \ in \ mathsf {np} $ ina maana $ tally (l) \ katika \ mathsf {np} $, bado $ tally (l) $ haiwezi kuwa $ \ mathsf {np} $-kamili, hata kama $ l $ ni $\mathsf{NP}$-complete (assuming $\mathsf{P}\neq\mathsf{NP}$). This is because $Tally(L)$ is a unary language, and it is well known that a unary (or even a sparse) language cannot be $\mathsf{NP}$-complete, if $\mathsf{P}\neq\mathsf{NP}$, due to Mahaney's Theorem (the unary version was proved earlier by Berman). At the same time, it also seems unlikely that $Tally(L)\in \mathsf{P}$ for every $L\in \mathsf{NP}$. This would mean that for every $\mathsf{NP}$-property we could decide in polynomial time whether there is an $n$-bit string with the property. Or, similarly, for every graph property in $\mathsf{NP}$, no matter how complicated,  we could always  decide in polynomial time if there is an $n$-vertex graph with the property or not.    Question: Is anything nontrivial known about this?

Hakuna ufafanuzi rasmi wa baiskeli ya jiji au baiskeli ya mseto kwa hivyo swali hili ni ngumu kujibu, haswa kama 'mseto' inaweza kumaanisha mitindo mingi tofauti, ambayo baadhi ni polepole kuliko baiskeli za 'jiji'. Huu ni mtindo unaotambulika zaidi, 'baiskeli ya Uholanzi' mpanda farasi ni sawa, na kuna mnyororo uliofungwa na matope ili kuruhusu nguo za kawaida kukaa safi. Hadi karibu 10mph msimamo ulio wima haukupunguzi kwa sababu upinzani wa upepo ni mdogo kwa kasi ya chini. Baiskeli ya Uholanzi pia inaweza kuwa nzito sana. Kwenye ardhi gorofa hii ni karibu haina maana, lakini haina maana katika maeneo yenye vilima. Kujitayarisha kawaida ni kitovu cha kasi 3. Wakati derailleurs ni hadi karibu 96%, IGH haitakuwa na ufanisi, hata hivyo hii kawaida ni zaidi ya 90%. Wakati Drag inaonekana, hii sio muhimu. Katika hali nyingi kasi ya polepole itakuwa chini ya uchaguzi wa matairi. 'Jiji' la kawaida au baiskeli ya Uholanzi haipaswi kupata punctures kwenye safari ya 2km kutoka kwenye baa, na matairi mazito, ya sugu ni muhimu zaidi kuliko kunyoa 5s wakati wa safari. Ikiwa unastahili baiskeli ya mtindo wa Uholanzi na matairi ya mbio basi kwenye uwanja wa gorofa saa 10mph basi haipaswi kuwa ngumu sana kuliko baiskeli ya mbio. Walakini upinzani wa hewa hukua na mchemraba wa kasi, kwa hivyo kwa 20mph utakuwa unaunda kiwango kikubwa cha upinzani wa hewa. Jambo muhimu zaidi katika upinzani sio hasa 'aero' ya baiskeli, lakini msimamo wa mpanda farasi. Neno linalotumiwa ni CDA, ambayo ni eneo la Drag *. Ikiwa unalinganisha baiskeli ya Uholanzi hapo juu na wakati huu wa baiskeli wa kesi basi eneo lililofunuliwa na upepo ni kubwa zaidi. Kwa kuongezea, ni dhahiri kwamba a slippery lycra-style suit bent over parallel to the direction of travel, and an aero helmet is going to disrupt air flow much less than an almost completely upright cyclist on a Dutch bike. Refer here: https://www.gribble.org/cycling/power_v_speed.html Basically if you are happy to travel around 10-12mph or so then a very upright bike is suitable. If you want to travel sometimes at 20mph then an upright bike is a big waste of effort. It is possible to get a lower position on a flat bar bike with a different handle bar. The Jones H-Bar is one design that allows a crouched position on a flat bar bike.  In addition other modifications such as a lowered stem could help with this. In terms of your question then the geometry of a city bike is going to be much further from a road bike, so not suitable for say 'leaning into corners', and not very 'fast' in handling, but this isn't really what is slowing you down, which is overwhelmingly tyre choice at lower speeds and then body position and clothing at higher speeds. If you just want 'low maintenance', then remember that something like a Rohloff is extremely efficient as much as derailleurs, very low maintenance, and can be fitted to racing-style bikes. This is more a 'gravel' or 'adventure' posture than racing, but it should be faster than your flat bar hybrid (Shand Stoater w/ Rohloff IGH)  It's very expensive of course, but if you have money then you can have your bike built how you want - don't expect to find a cheap racing bike fitted with a cheap 3-speed hub, but if you want a low maintenance bike with IGH and a faster speed than bolt-upright Dutch style, then looking at something like a touring bike might be helpful.

Unaweza kufikiria $ \ epsilon $ kama parametriting familia ya kupunguzwa kwa familia ya shida za ukaribu: shida ya $ \ epsilon $ -th is to compute a $1+\epsilon$ approximation to the underlying optimization problem. The $\epsilon$-th reduction shows that the $\epsilon$-th problem is $\mathrm{NP}$-hard.

Ninapokaribia kona, bila kujali ikiwa juu ya lami au kwenye uchaguzi, ninaangalia kutoka, huzunguka kichwa changu, kifua na viuno towards the exit, stay centered on the bike, but tilt the bike.  My concern is that by rotating my hips I will accidentally unclip, dropping my foot to the ground in the most dangerous part of the turn. Do I need to worry about this, and if so, how to prevent it? Sababu ni kwamba haujapata nishati ya ardhini, unapata ukaribu wa nishati ya ardhini kwa usahihi fulani. Kwa hivyo huwezi kuiona kutoka kwa ufafanuzi moja kwa moja, unahitaji mali ya ziada kutoka kwa kupunguzwa (i.e. chini ya pengo la kuvutia la Hamiltonian katika uthibitisho wa Kitaev's QMA-Hardness). Kuchukua ufafanuzi ufuatao wa $ k $ -Local Hamiltonian Tatizo (tazama ufafanuzi 3 katika karatasi ya Kempe-Kitaev-Regev): Tatizo la (ahadi) $ k $ -Local Hamiltonian hufafanuliwa kama ifuatavyo. Tumepewa $ k $ -Local Hamiltonian kwa $ n $ -qubits $ h = \ sum_ {j = 1}^r h_j $ na $ r = poly (n) $. Kila $ H_J $ ina kawaida ya operesheni $ \ | H_J \ | \ leq poly (n) $ na viingilio vyake vimeainishwa na $ poly (n) $ bits. Kwa kuongezea, tunapewa vifaa viwili $ A $ na $ B $ na $ A <B $. Katika visa vya YES, eigenvalue ndogo zaidi ya $ H $ ni zaidi ya $ A $. Katika hali yoyote, ni kubwa kuliko $ B $. Tunapaswa kuamua which one is the case.   Assume that the spectral gap of $k$-LH is inverse exponential, and the promise gap between $a$ and $b$ is inverse polynomial. Then in the YES case, even you have an approximation of ground energy within an inverse polynomial accuracy, it also could be an approximation of energy of excited states within an inverse polynomial accuracy -- it is an approximation of ground states doesn't mean that it cannot be an approximation of other excited states within the same accuracy!   However, I thought the Hamiltonian in the Kitaev's QMA-hardness proof is lowered bound by some inverse polynomial. Bohdanowicz-Crosson-Nirkhe-Yuen's recent paper showed that for any depth $D$ quantum circuit on n qubits there is an associated spacetime circuit-to-Hamiltonian construction (it is a variant of the construction in the Kitaev's QMA-hardness proof) with spectral gap $\Omega(n^{-3.09} D^{-2} \log^{-6}(n))$. Hence, the constructed Hamiltonian is the QMA-hardness cannot have an exponentially small spectral gap.

Ndio, uzani wa wewe + baiskeli yako + mzigo wako unapaswa kuwa sababu. Katika 200 + 28 + 30 lbs, kuangalia kwako karibu na lbs 300. Fikiria 32h mbele na 36h nyuma. Kwa matairi 32mm, tafuta rims ambazo ni 15-19mm kwa upana ndani, and for 35mm tires look for 17-21 mm wide. Nitachukua risasi kwa swali lako la kwanza: Je! Kuna mifano ya familia za kazi za asili ambazo kompyuta za kiasi zinaweza kujifunza haraka kuliko kompyuta za classical zilizopewa mawazo ya cryptographic? Kweli, inategemea mfano halisi na rasilimali inapunguzwa. Chaguo moja ni kulinganisha ugumu wa sampuli (kwa usambazaji-huru wa kujifunza PAC) wa mfano wa kawaida wa classical na mfano wa kiasi ambao hupewa sampuli za kiasi (i.e., badala ya kupewa pembejeo ya nasibu na thamani ya kazi inayolingana, algorithm hutolewa na kiwango cha juu cha pembejeo juu ya pembejeo na maadili ya kazi zao). Katika mpangilio huu, kujifunza kwa kiwango cha juu cha PAC na kujifunza kwa PAC ya kimsingi ni sawa. Kiwango cha juu cha juu juu ya ugumu wa sampuli na kiwango cha chini kilichofungwa juu ya ugumu wa sampuli ni sawa, kama inavyoonyeshwa na mlolongo ufuatao wa karatasi: [1] R. Servedio na S. Gortler, "Kufanana na kujitenga kati ya Quantum na Classical Learnibility, "Jarida la Siam juu ya Kompyuta, Vol. 02138, Uk. 1-26, 2004. [2] A. Atici na R. Servedio, "Mipaka iliyoboreshwa juu ya algorithms ya kujifunza," Usindikaji wa Habari wa Quantum, uk. 1-18, 2005. [3] C. Zhang, " Uboreshaji wa chini uliowekwa juu ya ugumu wa swala kwa kujifunza kwa PAC, "Barua za Usindikaji wa Habari, Vol. 111, hapana. 1, Uk. 40-45, Desemba 2010. Kuhamia kwa ugumu wa wakati, kwa kutumia mfano huo wa PAC wa Quantum, Bshouty na Jackson walionyesha kuwa DNFS inaweza kuwa ya PAC iliyojifunza katika wakati wa polynomial juu ya uniform distribution [4], further improved in [5]. The best known classical algorithm for this runs in $O(n^{\log n})$ time. Atici and Servedio [6] also show improved results for learning and testing juntas.  [4] N. Bshouty and J. Jackson, “Learning DNF over the uniform distribution using a quantum example oracle,” SIAM Journal on Computing, vol. 28, no. 3, pp. 1136–1153, 1998. [5] J. Jackson, C. Tamon, and T. Yamakami, “Quantum DNF learnability revisited,” Computing and Combinatorics, pp. 595–604, 2002. [6] A. Atıcı and R. Servedio, “Quantum Algorithms for Learning and Testing Juntas,” Quantum Information Processing, vol. 6, no. 5, pp. 323–348, Sep. 2007.  On the other hand, if you're interested in the standard classical PAC model only, using quantum computing as a post-processing tool (i.e., no quantum samples), then Servedio and Gortler [1] observed that there is a concept class due to Kearns and Valiant that cannot be classically PAC learnt assuming the hardness of factoring Blum integers, but can be quantumly PAC learnt using Shor's algorithm. The situation for Angluin's model of exact learning through membership queries is somewhat similar. Quantum queries can only give a polynomial speedup in terms of query complexity. However, there is an exponential speedup in time complexity assuming the existence of one-way functions [1]. I have no idea about the second question. I'd be happy to hear more about that too.

Ndio, hata wakati N inajulikana mapema na kila urefu wa kamba ni $ \ lceil $ log2 (n) $ \ rceil $ + 1 na tunajali tu hali kati ya sasisho, sio hesabu inayohitajika kufanya sasisho na Utaratibu wa Sasisha unaweza kuwa usio na kipimo. Kwa nambari zote chanya n na vitu vyote x vya {0,1} n, na [toleo rahisi la Chernoff Bound], uwezekano wa [kipengee cha y cha {0,1} n tofauti na x juu zaidi ya 4 zaidi ya 4 zaidi ya 4 /9 ya nafasi] ni zaidi (-(2/324) $ \ cdot $ n), ambayo ni chini ya 2- (1/113) $ \ cdot $ n. Kwa hivyo, kwa kuchagua subset ya {0,1} n ambayo vitu vya jozi hutofautiana zaidi ya 4/9 ya nafasi hizo, kila chaguo huondoa chini ya 2n/113 ya uwezekano wa asili, kwa hivyo kuna sehemu ndogo zaidi ya zaidi ya zaidi ya zaidi ya zaidi ya zaidi ya zaidi ya zaidi ya 2N/113 Vipengee vya 2N/113. Kudhani n ni nambari ambayo ni kubwa kuliko 2, na wacha iwe sehemu ndogo ya {0,1} n-2 na vitu zaidi ya 2 (n-2)/113 ambavyo ni kwamba vitu tofauti vya S vinatofautiana juu ya zaidi ya 4 /9 ya nafasi hizo, na uzingatia algorithm yoyote ya awali ya nasibu ambayo uwezekano wa kosa utakuwa saa 1/6 wakati pembejeo zinachaguliwa kama ifuatavyo: Chagua S sawa kutoka kwa S, na tuma (0, S0), (1, S1) ,. . Chagua M kwa usawa kutoka kwa {0,1,2,3,4, ..., n-4, n-3} na kisha tuma $ \ nyota $ kwenye mkondo 0 na (m, 1) kwenye mkondo 1 . Thamani inayotarajiwa, juu ya uchaguzi wake mwenyewe wa ubadilishaji kwa kila sasisho, ya uwezekano wake wa makosa (juu ya uchaguzi wa pembejeo) iliyowekwa juu ya ubinafsi wake, ni zaidi ya 1/6, kwa hivyo kuna ubadilishaji wa ndani ambao kosa lake Uwezo (juu ya uchaguzi wa pembejeo) itakuwa zaidi ya 1/6. Rekebisha ubadilishaji kama huo kwa kila sasisho, ukitoa algorithm ya kuamua, ambayo nitaita DSSEA, ambayo uwezekano wa kosa juu ya usambazaji wa pembejeo ni zaidi ya 1/6. Fikiria nadhani G ambayo hutumia [DSSEA and DSSEA's state just before receiving the last pair of strings] as follows:  Let s' be the element of {0,1}n-2 given by  [s'i is DSSEA's output after sending ​ $\star$ , (i,1) ​ along streams 0,1 respectively ]. ​ ​ ​ Output the lexicographically least element of S which differs from s' on a minimum number of positions.  The expected value, over the choice of strings other than the last pair, of DSSEA's  error probability (over the choice of the last pair) conditioned on the other strings,  is at most 1/6, so the probability of that conditional probability exceeding 2/9 is at most 3/4.  Whenever that conditional probability is at most 2/9, s' will differ from s on at most  2/9 of the positions, so G will output s, since other all elements of S differ from s  on more than 4/9 of the positions, and so from s' on more than 2/9 of the positions.  Thus G has probability at least 1/4 of outputting s, so in particular has more  than $\big(\hspace{-0.03 in}$2(n-2)/113$\hspace{-0.03 in}\big)\hspace{-0.03 in}\big/\hspace{-0.03 in}$4 possible outputs. ​ By the choice of G, that means DSSEA  has more than 2((n-2)/113)-2 possible internal states just before the last update.  Hardcording separate randomness for each update does not increase that number, so the initial randomized algorithm must be able to keep at least ((n-2)/113)-2 bits of state between updates.  For all integers n, if ​ 25992 < n ​ then ​ n/114 < ((n-2)/113)-2 .  For constant error rates above 1/6, just reduce the error rate  by taking a majority vote of O(1) independent parallel runs.    For  numbers M of possible strings and positive integers j in o(log(M)) and error probabilities bounded above by ​ 1$\hspace{-0.04 in}\big/\hspace{-0.04 in}\big(\hspace{-0.04 in}$M(1+Ω(1))/j$\hspace{-0.03 in}\big)$  , one can similarly get an asymptotic lower bound of ​ ​ ​ $\big(\hspace{-0.04 in}\lfloor \hspace{-0.03 in}$log2(M choose n-1)$\rfloor$ - 1$\hspace{-0.04 in}\big)$ ​ / ​ (2$\cdot$j - 1) ​ ,  although I have neither tried working out whether-or-not that dependence on j should  be within a constant factor of tight nor tried bounds for other parameter regimes.

Kwa swali la 1: Grafu zilizosababishwa na seti za makali kama hujulikana kama pseudoforests. Kama uthibitisho wako wa ushirika kwa #P unamaanisha, seti ya makali ni picha ya kazi ya uteuzi ikiwa na tu ikiwa grafu iliyosababishwa na makali inaruhusu mwelekeo wa makali ambayo kila vertex ina digrii zaidi ya 1. Grafu ni pseudoforest ikiwa kila sehemu iliyounganishwa ni mti au mti + makali moja. Inajulikana (na rahisi kuona) kuwa grafu ni pseudoforest if and only if it admits an outdegree-at-most-1 orientation.  To Question 2: The problem is #P-hard on general graphs (not sure about bipartite graphs). The family of edge sets of a graph inducing pseudoforests forms the family of independent sets of a bicircular matroid. Counting the number of independent sets of a matroid $M$ is equivalent to computing the Tutte polynomial $t(M;2,1)$. It is shown by Giménez and Noy that computing $t(M;2,1)$ is #P-hard even if $M$ is a bicircular matroid given as a graph.

Sehemu ninayoishi (NE United States) haina miundombinu kubwa sana ya baiskeli. Kuna njia za baiskeli zilizotawanyika na hatimaye wamekamilisha daraja ambalo linaniruhusu kuanza kufanya kazi, lakini hakuna kitu kama hiki huko London au hii huko Denmark. Kwa kweli, wakati mwingi ninashiriki barabara na madereva wa kawaida wa Amerika ("Ooh! Angalia! Baiskeli! Wacha tuingie ndani yake! Sitalazimika kuweka simu ya chini!"). Kwa ujumla, napenda upweke na ukweli kwamba mara nyingi mimi ndiye gari la haraka sana kwenye barabara za jiji lililokuwa na barabara (hakuna kitu kama zipping na mstari wa magari yaliyowekwa nyuma ya dereva asiye na matumaini) lakini nimeanza kujiuliza hivi karibuni ni nini kama kupanda na Kiasi cha juu cha baiskeli wengine barabarani. Kwa ujumla mimi huepuka njia za baiskeli katika eneo hilo mwishoni mwa wiki because there's a disproportionate number of folks who seem ignorant of riding etiquette (slower traffic keep to the right, don't let your children lurch blindly into the path of other cyclists, etc.) but these aren't regular commuters.  Folks who ride in areas with much better infrastructure (doesn't even have to be a bike "superhighway") - do you find that higher volumes of commuters mean a worst commute for you personally? Does having a larger commuter "culture" help with other riders or is it just as frustrating as being stuck behind them in a car as they apply lipstick and chat away on the cel phone?  EDIT: based on some discussion below, an additional (yet related) question - are there considerations built in to the larger bikeways to allow riders to keep a faster pace (i.e., multiple marked lanes)?

(A (λcde. (C (λf. (D (λgh. (G (λij.j) (fgh))) ))) (c(λf.(d(λgh.(g(λij.i)(fgh)))))e)))(λcd.(c(λef.f)d)) (λcd.(c( λefg. (f (ge))) (λe.e) b (c (λefg. (f (ge))) (λe.e) b) d)) (λcd.d))) hii λ-term takes 2 arguments, a church number telling the arity of a church-encoded boolean formula, and the formula itself, and returns "true" if it is satisfiable.
