Kumbuka kuwa licha ya chapa yao, vibanda hivi sio maana kwa mizigo nzito; Badala yake, ni nia yao kwamba, wakati imesimamishwa, mpanda farasi huhamia kwenye gia ya chini ya kutosha kwamba wanazunguka baiskeli hadi kasi, badala ya kusonga hadi kasi kwenye gia kubwa (ambayo ndio jinsi wapanda baisikeli wengi huharibu yao magoti na kuharibu safari zao). Hii ndio nadhani ilifanyika: Ulipata baiskeli yako mpya, lakini kazi ya kulala kwenye nyaya haikufanywa kukamilika. Kama matokeo, wakati wa wapanda farasi wako, cable yako ilikuwa "kunyoosha" ndani ya nyumba, na kusababisha upotovu wa cable ya gia. Wakati LBS yako ilibadilisha gurudumu, ilibidi kuweka upya kaseti ya pamoja na cable, ambayo ingeboresha utendaji, hata hivyo, ikiwa bado ulikuwa na mapumziko ya kushoto kwenye cable hiyo, shida za kuhama zingerudi. Kwa kiwango chochote, kuna uwezekano mkubwa tatu tu: 1) Cable haijaunganishwa vizuri. 2) Wakuu wa ndani wameharibiwa. 3) Unaitumia vibaya. Uwezo wa kwanza ni rahisi kuamuru. Jijulishe na alama za kiashiria kwenye kaseti ya kitovu cha kitovu - sehemu ya kitovu ambacho huzunguka pande zote kubadili gia. Kuna alama mbili za manjano kwenye kando ya kitovu ambacho lazima kiunganishe kikamilifu katika gia ya 4 (kwa 7 na 8 kasi ya Shimano IGHS). Alama zilizo chini ni rahisi kuona kuliko dirisha hapo juu, lakini zinahitaji kusimama kwa kazi au kurusha baiskeli chini. Ikiwa, baada ya kila sehemu ya kuruka, unaangalia cable na alama za kiashiria zinajifunga kikamilifu, basi umefanikiwa kuamuru cable kuwa imewekwa vibaya, ambayo ndio shida ya kawaida na vibanda hivi. Uwezo wa pili hauitaji maelezo. Kwa kweli hakuna njia ya kuamua kuwa kitovu ni kasoro: lazima tu uamuru uwezekano mwingine. Uwezo wa tatu ni wa kawaida sana. Labda duka lako la baiskeli halikufanya prime you for what the hub is actually capable of. Perhaps you're shifting under load (do you stop pedaling immediately before shifting, then resume your cadence only after you've shifted and confirmed the shift by feel?) Perhaps you're simply trying to put too much torque into the hub. Are you a heavy rider who likes to stay in a high gear? If so, you can expect the worst performance from your parts: learn to love low gears and learn when to coddle your parts and when it's ok to put down the watts.  A few other notes:  The tension of your belt is almost certainly irrelevant. However, a loose belt may correlate to skipping/grinding issues because if your wheel has slipped forward in the dropouts (or, as the case may be, your dropouts have shifted forward in the frame), that could affect the tension on the cable (it depends on how the housing is routed; if the housing stops at the cassette joint like it should, it won't have any affect; if, on the other hand, the housing stops at a frame braze-on then your wheel must be exactly in the position that lines up the indicator markings in the appropriate gear. I can clarify this if you think it may be the problem).  Frames, especially steel frames, can have considerable flex in them. You can sometimes see the bike flexing down at the bottom bracket when mashing up a hill, especially on older bikes with thin tubing like Reynolds 531. We see a lot of "ghost shifting" on vintage bikes with friction shifters because the flex of the frame under heavy load physically yanks the cable. You could be simply mashing too hard and pulling the cable - even a millimeter would throw the planetary gears out of alignment and cause problems. The solution to this is to alter your riding style: shift yourself into a nice low gear when at a stop light or beginning an ascent. Gradually increase your gearing until you hit your desired speed.

Nguvu ya juu ya kuvunja inapatikana wakati tairi iko karibu kufungia na kuanza kuteleza kwenye uso wa barabara. Nguvu ya kuvunja inapungua sana wakati tairi inapoanza kuteleza. Ikiwa unafunga magurudumu yote mawili, haupati nguvu kubwa ya kuvunja, kwa hivyo jaribu kurekebisha nguvu unayoweka kwenye levers ili magurudumu hayafungi. Unapaswa be able to apply more force on the front brake lever as the deceleration of your mass pushes the front tire against the road harder, making it more difficult to lock that wheel.  Also be aware that the 23mm road tires have a much smaller contact patch and therefore less grip. Higher tire pressure reduces the contact patch size, so you could try a lower tire pressure.

Shida ya uamuzi CNF-SAT inaweza kuelezewa kama ifuatavyo: Uingizaji: formula ya Boolean $ \ phi $ katika fomu ya kawaida ya kuunganishwa. Swali: Je! Kuna mgawo tofauti ambao unakidhi $ \ phi $? Ninazingatia njia kadhaa tofauti za kutatua CNF-SAT na mashine isiyo ya kuamua ya mkanda mbili. I believe that there is an NTM that solves CNF-SAT in $n \cdot \texttt{poly}(\log(n))$ steps.  Question: Is there an NTM that solves CNF-SAT in $O(n)$ steps?  Any relevant references are appreciated even if they only provide near linear time non-deterministic approaches.

Nadharia ya Barrington inaonyesha kuwa saizi ya polynomial, mipango ya matawi ya upana wa upana hujumuisha lugha haswa katika $ nc^1 $. (Hasa, anaonyesha hii kwa mipango ya matawi na upana angalau 5, na matokeo ya baadaye yanaonyesha kuwa 5 ni muhimu kukamata $ nc^1 $). Walakini, ni rahisi kuona kwamba kazi yoyote inaweza kushughulikiwa na saizi kubwa, mpango wa matawi ya kusoma mara moja (chukua tu mti wa uamuzi ambao matawi juu ya kila kutofautisha na kutoa jedwali la ukweli wa kazi). Ikiwa tunataka kuzingatia, sema, saizi ya polynomial, mipango ya matawi ya mara kwa mara, basi hakuna kitu really known in terms of a standard complexity class. The "bounded replication" classes of branching programs (i.e. branching programs with a restriction on the number of times variables appear) don't really offer themselves well to such characterizations. Rather, the complexity classes for which we do have branching program characterizations are natural, given the model (i.e. like $L/poly$) or given via an algebraic approach, like Barrington's theorem or related results (e.g. this paper).  There is an excellent book by Jukna which studies different types of branching programs in depth.

Milima mingi ya kompyuta huja na spacers za plastiki ambazo zinaweza kuwekwa kati ya mlima ngumu wa plastiki na kichungi. Ikiwa yako haikuja na that, I have used Athletic tape to build up the bars to the point where the mount will grip the bars adequately.

Ukanda wa Rim ya Rubber ni vitu vya kunyoosha-na unataka iwe sawa! Kwa hivyo, ikiwa kununua mpira kipenyo cha kamba yako ya mdomo sio muhimu kama upana. Inapaswa kufunika chuchu zote zilizoongea na/au shimo kubwa zilizochimbwa kwa spika, na zinafaa vizuri kando ya mdomo. Hiyo ilisema, duka lako la ndani linapaswa kuwa na saizi ambayo inafaa 26 "rims bora. Alternatively, there are brands of rim strip which are not one continuous piece and are not rubber, but instead are similar to thick tape. It's important to note the thickness--electrical tape may work in a pinch (and after a couple layers) but it's not nearly as resilient. This type of rim strip is basically one-size-fits all and is generally considered higher quality that the rubber type.

Safi kutoka kwa oveni: algorithm ya wakati wa polynomial ya kupona kwa idadi ya watu waliopotea na: Ankur Moitra, Michael Saks akinukuu kutoka kwa karatasi: "Hapa tutathibitisha kanuni isiyo na shaka iliyoainishwa katika previous section using tools from complex analysis. Perhaps one of the most useful theorems in understanding the rate of growth of holomorphic functions in the complex plane is Hadamard’s Three Circle Theorem..."

Ushuhuda fulani wa kihistoria: kwa ufahamu wetu $ \ pi (n) $ inaonekana kama kazi rahisi iliyorekebishwa na kushuka kwa thamani. Kwa hivyo ninatarajia mashine ya wakati wa aina nyingi na $ \ pi (n) $ oracle kuwa isiyo na nguvu kuliko vile machine with a random oracle, and w.r.t. a random oracle $X$ adding a separate random oracle $Y$ to $\mathsf{P}$ gives $\#\mathsf{P}^X \not\subset \mathsf{P}^{XY}$ with probability 1 (here $Y$ corresponds to $\pi(n)$ and $X$ is an independent random oracle).

Sijibu swali kamili lakini ni sehemu yake tu (sina nia ya wakati wa matawi). Ufafanuzi wako wa $ \ mathit {hata} $ ungesoma vyema $ \ mathit {hata} (p) \ equiv \ ipo q. (Q \ ardhi \ sanduku (q \ leftrightArrow \ mathsf {x} \ lnot q) \ ardhi \ Sanduku (Q \ RightArrow P)) $. Unaanzisha $ Q $ tu kukumbuka ikiwa uko kwenye nafasi isiyo ya kawaida au hata, lakini habari hii ya $ Q $ haiko kwenye mfumo wako kwa hivyo haifai kuwa tofauti ya bure ya formula yako (vinginevyo mfumo wako na formula yako imefafanuliwa kwenye alphabets tofauti). Mfumo kama huo ni formula ya LTL yenye sifa (EQLTL kwa kifupi). Fomula ya EQLTL inaweza tu kuwa na $ \ inapatikana $ $ kwa kiwango cha juu. Na wao ni wazi kama Büchi Automata. Kwa mfano kutafsiri formula ya eqltl $ \ inapatikana q. (Q \ ardhi \ sanduku (q \ leftrightarrow \ mathsf {x} \ lnot q) Tafsiri tu formula ya ltl $ q \ ardhi \ sanduku (q \ leftrightarrow \ mathsf {x} \ lnot q) \ ardhi \ sanduku (q \ kulia P) $, na kisha futa kutofautisha $ $ $ kutoka kila mahali kwenye automaton. Kinyume chake automaton yoyote ya Büchi inaweza kubadilishwa kuwa formula ya EQLTL kwa urahisi: Tangaza existential variables for all the states $\exists s_1.\exists s_2\ldots$, and use these to encode transitions and acceptance states (e.g. $\exists s_1.\exists s_2.(s_1\land\Box(s_1\rightarrow a\land \mathsf{X}s_2)\land\Box(s_2)\rightarrow b\land\mathsf{X}(s_1))\land\Box\Diamond s_2\land\Box(\bigwedge_i (s_i\rightarrow\bigwedge_{j\ne i}\neg s_j)))$ if $s_1$ can go to $s_2$ with $a$, $s_2$ can go to $s_1$ with $b$, and $s_2$ is Büchi-accepting; the last conjunction of implications make sure you cannot be in two states at once).  You might want to read Stutter-Invariant Languages, ω-Automata, and Temporal-Logic on this subject.  Basically the $\exists q$ is used here like some second-order quantifier (there exist a set of states where $q$ hold and such that...).  EQLTL and Büchi automata are equalivent to S1S, and LTL is equalivent to F1S.  $even$ is the typical S1S formula that cannot be expressed by F1S.  QPTL, which you mentioned, adds $\exists$, $\forall$ (not only at the top-level), and past operators.  It contains EQLTL but is not more expressive (since QPTL can be converted to Büchi automata and Büchi automata can be converted to EQLTL).  CTL is about branching time, so it's a different world.  A CTL formula like $\mathsf{EF}\mathsf{AG}p$ which is reasoning on the tree of all possible futures have now equivalent in LTL which is reasoning on all possible scenarios.

Ninavutiwa na ugumu wa shida ya chini ya kuweka (MDSP) katika darasa fulani la graph. Grafu ni grafu ya njia isiyoelekezwa ikiwa ni picha ya ndani ya familia ya njia katika mti fulani ambao haujaelekezwa (hii ni sehemu ndogo ya picha za chordal). Inajulikana kuwa MDSP ni NP-ngumu wakati wa kuzingatia grafu za njia ambazo hazijaelekezwa (tazama hapa). Swali langu ni: Ni nini kinachojulikana juu ya (katika) ukaribu wa MDSP katika grafu za njia ambazo hazijaelekezwa? Hasa, je! Kuna sababu ya mara kwa mara (polynomial-wakati) algorithm ya shida hii? Vidokezo: 1) I could not find a reference for this question, including in this standard textbook about domination, where Chapter 8 is devoted to the complexity of the (decision problem) dominating set. 2) It is NP-hard to approximate the MDSP within $o(log(n))$ in another subclass of chordal graphs, split graphs. This follows from an easy reduction from minimum set cover (see here). 3) I think the original NP-hardness reduction for undirected path graphs from the above reference can be used to show that the MDSP admits no PTAS in this class of graphs. But would this be tight?

Fenders/matope ni muhimu zaidi kwenye baiskeli ya kusafiri kuliko mtindo mwingine wowote wa baiskeli. Hiyo ni kwa sababu inasaidia kukuweka safi kwa popote unapoenda. Kwa hivyo vipengee unavyotafuta kwenye matope / fender ni urefu - matope ya nyuma yanapaswa kuzuia maji na kurusha tairi ya nyuma kukupiga au mifuko yako. Ili kufanya hivyo, matope ya nyuma yanapaswa kuwa ya muda mrefu kumaliza kumaliza-au-juu ya kiwango cha axle yako ya nyuma. Mlinzi wa mbele anaweza kuwa mrefu zaidi kwa sababu kazi yake pia ni kulinda eneo la BB ya baiskeli kutoka kwa barabara ya barabara. Sio kawaida kuona walinzi wa mbele wakishuka hata chini. Wengine wana ngozi au "pazia" la mpira au matope ambayo yanaendelea chini ambapo walinzi huacha, na kuongeza urefu wake mzuri. Pia, mbele ya matope ya nyuma inapaswa kumaliza chini ya BB yako. Mbele ya mbele inazuia maji ya barabara kutoka kukupiga usoni wakati unageuka. Mfano wa muundo bora wa jumla wa matope. Mabano ya fedha L hapo juu huenda kwenye stackup ya breki zako za mdomo, iwe kwenye nati au upande wa kuvunja. Kwa hivyo watahitaji sura ya baiskeli na daraja la kuvunja. Pia tazama viwili viwili kwenye pembetatu. Wanasaidia kuunga mkono mlinzi. Baadhi ya miundo inaingia tu kwenye hewa ya hewa, ambayo inawaruhusu kusugua matairi lakini haionekani kuwa ya michezo zaidi. Mlinzi pia ni mahali pazuri kuongeza viboreshaji, tafakari za stika, au taa nyepesi. Mfano mzuri wa walinzi wa mbele (kumbuka haijafungwa vizuri kwa baiskeli hii, kwa sababu makazi yamepindika, na kuna pengo lisilo sawa kati ya tairi na walinzi, na iliyowekwa kwa hivyo makali ya mbele ni ya juu sana ... inapaswa kuinama zaidi juu zaidi Mfumo wa Kuongoza.) Mfumo wa kushinikiza - Unahitaji kukagua kuacha kwako na utafute shimo la vipuri kwa kuweka makazi. Mifano: Shimo mbili za manjano upande wa kushoto ni kwa kukaa. Baadhi ya baiskeli zinaweza kuwa na shimo moja, mbili, au hata tatu. Wengine wana none.   For your bike, I can't see any but they may be hidden by the trailer mount.  If you don't have holes for mounting, you'll need either P Clips which look like this:    Or you may need to limit your mudguards to those which attach to the stays.  Downside of these is there's a lot more unsupported length so they flap a bit, and don't last as long.  Notice this one is too short in the front, and should have a second piece that goes from the brake bridge down to the bottom bracket.    Width - a wider tyre needs wider guards.  You should have guards that go further sideways than your tyre so they can catch water flung. Material and colour - its completely up to you.  Steel, Aluminium, and plastic are the two common materials for guards, and you can get combinations like "chromoplast" which is a chromed plastic, being lightweight.  Some people have made wooden guards, but they tend to have one curve whereas a good guard is curved in two directions to follow the tyre. As for Colour, whatever suits your bike.  Black, bright chrome, and matt chrome are common, but you can paint them any colour you want.  Matching or contrasting your frame to suit your taste.     Less-good mudguards there are times where compromise is required.  You should avoid "ass savers" because while they're better than nothing, they're not anywhere near as good as a full guard.      There are some designs that attach to your saddle - I have one and road water still drenches the back of my thighs.  Motor-cross style - these are intended to stop mud from packing up between the tyre and the fork bridge on a MTB.   Instead they help ease mud through the gap to be thrown off.  No practical use on your commuter.     Further information and reading here:   Very basic mudguard question and https://www.sheldonbrown.com/fenders.html

Mifano inayojulikana ya hesabu iliyoongozwa na uzushi wa asili ni kompyuta za kiasi na kompyuta za DNA. Kinachojulikana juu ya uwezo na/au mapungufu ya kompyuta with Maxwell's laws or gravity?  That is, incorporating nature's "quick" solutions to Maxwell's equations or the n-body problem directly into a general-purpose algorithm?

"Maana", au "semantics" kutumia neno la kiufundi zaidi, ni uelewa tu ambao unataka kuhusishwa na maandishi ya mpango. Inaweza kuwa kazi ya kihesabu ambayo inabainisha waziwazi mpango huo (semantics za kuashiria), au inaweza kuwa maelezo rasmi ya jinsi hesabu hiyo inafanywa na mashine iliyofafanuliwa rasmi (semantics ya utendaji). Kwa kweli ni suala la kile unachopenda kuelezea. Programu hiyo ni formula kubwa, na kuna njia nyingi ambazo unaweza kutaka kuitafsiri. Unaweza hata kupendezwa na kinachojulikana kama tafsiri isiyo ya kawaida ambayo inaweza kuelezea mali maalum ya mpango, kama vile uchapaji. Hata mrembo, ambayo inakupa safu ya wahusika sambamba na toleo lililowasilishwa vizuri la maandishi ya programu linaweza kuonekana kama tafsiri, maana yake (hata hivyo ni ndogo). Ni mengi machoni pa mtazamaji. Walakini, ufafanuzi wa maana hauwezi kuwa wa kiholela. Inatarajiwa kutii sheria kadhaa ili iweze kutumiwa kwa njia nzuri. Hasa, mpango au formula hutolewa na muundo, kwa kutumia waendeshaji rasmi kujenga formula kubwa kutoka sehemu ndogo. Maana, au semantiki inatarajiwa kufuata sheria hizi za utunzi, ili uweze kufafanua maana ya yote kutoka kwa maana ya vifaa. Matumizi ya kazi ya hali ya juu hufanya kizuizi kinachoweza kudhibitiwa kuliko inavyoonekana. Wazo linatumika kwa miundo mingine rasmi. Kwa mfano, syntax ya lugha ya programu kawaida hufafanuliwa na sarufi. Sarufi inaweza kuwa na maana ambayo ni seti ya mpango (kamba) ambayo inaweza kuandikwa kulingana na sarufi hiyo. Inaweza pia kuwa seti ya miti ya parse kwa programu hizo. Sasa maana ya kawaida ya mpango ndio inajumuisha, au jinsi inavyofanya (tena, kwa sababu ya msimamo, tofauti mara nyingi huwa machoni pa mtazamaji, kulingana na kile unachofanya na maana hiyo rasmi). Kurudi kwa mfano wako: Kazi $ ijayo $ inafafanua ni nini kutekeleza hatua moja ya mpango. Maana yake ni kazi (kwenye kikoa cha hisabati of states) that gives you the next state after a step of computation given the current state. By applying this function repeatedly,  starting from the initial state of your computation, you will ultimately get to a final state that gives you the result ... or computes indefinitely (depending on whether that computation is supposed to terminate).  This means that the effect of running your program is to apply the function :  $ next \circ  next \circ next \circ next \circ ...$ this composition being as long as necessary for all steps of the calculation at hand, possibly infinitely many.  This is better expressed by the fixed-point equation:  $P = next \circ P$ since from it you can derive :   $P = next \circ next \circ P$ $P = next \circ next \circ next \circ P$ $P = next \circ next \circ next \circ next \circ P$ and so on   It shows that any function $P$ satisfying this equation will provide as many steps as needed, applying the function $next$, to get the computation you want to describe.  Now, this requires a minimum of mathematical apparatus to work properly, for the equation to have a mathematical meaning.  The mathematical domains used are supposed to allow you to talk about approximating a function. For example a finite composition of $n$ application of the function $next$ is an approximation of $P$ for when the program needs no more than $n$ steps to do its work. Typically, a lattice of ever better approximations will do that (this is what monotonicity is about: getting ever better approximations, as you increase the number of applications). Furthermore, you need this lattice to be continuous, so that the monotonically increasing infinite sequence of approximations of $P$ will have a limit, which is actually the meaning of $P$.  In practice, all this is usually described in a more formal mathematical way, as done for example in the answer of @tathanhdinh.  This technique of approximations can be used as well to describe data structures that contain loops, actually implemented with pointers, though the semantics may not want to know about pointers.

Kuhusu nukuu katika zifuatazo, kazi $ \ ell (b) $ inarudisha urefu wa bitstring $ b $, na uaminifu wa $ s $ inaonyeshwa na $ | s | $. Bitstring $ B $ hutolewa kwa kuchora 0s na 1s kutoka kwa usambazaji sawa na ni ya urefu wa $ n = \ ell (b) $. Ugumu wa Kolmogorov kwa bitstring $ B $ ni urefu wa mpango mfupi $ B^*$ ambayo hutoa $ b $, $ k (b) = \ ell (b^*) $. Kawaida $ b $ ni ngumu kufafanua haswa. Intuitively, ni aina ya bitstring ambayo itatolewa wakati mwingi kwa kuchora nasibu 0s na 1s. Walakini, wazo linaweza kufafanuliwa kwa kuchunguza mali. Mali $ P $ inatumika kwa $ B $ s ya kawaida ikiwa sehemu ya $ b $ s kuwa na mali hiyo inakaribia 1 kama $ \ ell (b) $ imeongezeka, \ kuanza {align*} \ underset {n \ kulia \ infty } {\ lim} \ frac {| \ {b: p (b) \ wedge \ ell (b) \ leq n \} | RightArrow 1. \ mwisho {align*} Kwa mfano, $ B $ ya kawaida ina mali ambayo $ k (b) = \ ell (b) $. Kwa maneno mengine, kawaida $ B $ sio ngumu. Kumbuka: Hii sio hali ya kutosha kwa hali ya kawaida. Inawezekana kwa $ B $ kuwa ya atypical na isiyoeleweka. Kuna atypical $ b $ s ambayo inaweza kushinikizwa, na kwa hizi $ k (b) <\ ell (b) $. Ugumu wa masharti ya Kolmogorov, $ K (B_2 | B_1) $, ni urefu wa mpango mfupi ambao hutoa $ B_2 $ wakati unapewa $ B_1 $ kama pembejeo. Habari ya Algorithmic Mutual ni $ i (b_1: b_2) = k (b_2) - k (b_2 | b_1^*) = k (b_1) - k (b_1 | b_2^*) $. Usemi huu ni sahihi kwa ndani ya huru ya $ B_1 $ na $ B_2 $. Muundo wa muundo wa Kolmogorov kwa bitstring $ B $ ni mpango wa kutengeneza $ p_b $ kwamba $ b $ iko kwenye $ s_b $ iliyotengenezwa na $ p_b $ wakati inapewa $ n $ kama pembejeo. $ Fupi zaidi ya $ p_b $, kwamba $ \ ell (p_b) + \ log_2 (| s_b |) \ leq k (b) $, inaitwa kazi ndogo ya muundo wa Kolmogorov, iliyoonyeshwa na $ p^*_ b $. $\log_2(|S_B|)$ is close to the "randomness" in $B$ that cannot be captured by $P^*_B$.    In the case of a typical $B$ the length of $P^*_B$ is minimal, since knowing $n$ we can enumerate all bitstrings of length $n$ with a constant size program $C$.  On the other hand, in the case of atypical $B$s, the length of $P^*_B$ may be significantly larger than $C$.  My question: is the algorithmic mutual information between a typical $B$ and a $P^*_{B'}$ for any bitstring $B'$ ever larger than $C$?  Although $\ell(B')$ is not constrained by $\ell(B)$, the $P^*_{B'}$ is provided with $n=\ell(B)$ in this case, since the goal is to generate $B$.  However, this does not mean that $B\in S_{B'}$, since $\ell(B)$ does not necessarily cause $P^*_{B'}$ to generate a set that contains $B$.  Note in the case of a typical $B$ that trivially $I(P^*_B:B)=\ell(C)$ since $\ell(P^*_B)=\ell(C)$.  However, this does not mean that there is not another $P^*_{B'}$ from an atypical $B'$ such that $K(B|P^*_{B'}) < K(B)-\ell(C)$, and thus $I(P^*_{B'}:B) > \ell(C)$.  I think the answer is always $I(B:P^*_{B'}) = \ell(C)$ for a typical $B$. If $K(P^*_{B'}|B) < K(P^*_{B'})-\ell(C)$, then part of the randomness of $B$ describes $P^*_{B'}$, so $P^*_{B'}$ is not a minimal structure function for $B'$. I don't know how to prove this formally.  To provide context for this question, I am trying to derive a law of minimal Kolmogorov sufficient statistic nongrowth, based on  Leonid Levin's conservation independence in "Randomness Conservation Inequalities; Information and Independence in Mathematical Theories". Levin's law states $I(z:y) > I(x:y)$ where $x$ is the result of applying a Turing machine $U$ to $z$, so $x=U(z)$. I would like to similarly prove $\ell(P^*_z) > \ell(P^*_x)$, and am using $I(B:P^*_{B'})=\ell(C)$ for typical $B$ as one of the premises in my proof.

Pointi zako: Je! WD-40 inafaa kwa minyororo ya baiskeli? Ndio. Inaweza kuwa sio nzuri kama bidhaa zilizojitolea katika hii au sehemu nyingine lakini inajaribiwa na wengi na inafanya kazi. Je! Mbadala ingetoa maisha marefu ya mnyororo? Labda. Bidhaa zilizojitolea zitafanya kazi vizuri katika hali waliyoundwa. Lubes kavu katika hali kavu, lubes mvua katika hali ya mvua. Kuna bidhaa nyingi zinazopatikana, zingine zitakuwa bora, zingine zitakuwa mbaya zaidi. Wakati wa ununuzi kuzunguka kwa lubricant, ni vitu gani muhimu zaidi kutafuta? Kavu dhidi ya lubes za mvua. Hii ndio tofauti muhimu zaidi. Je! Unatumia nini na kwa nini? Kura ziko nje ya mada. Sitataja bidhaa zilizojitolea lakini mimi hutumia lubes kavu za kauri. Vumbi ni adui wangu mkubwa katika miaka hii kavu sana na ninahitaji mnyororo wangu kuvutia vumbi kidogo iwezekanavyo. Kwa wakati wa sasa nilibadilisha kwa muda kwa mafuta ya madini ya bei rahisi zaidi kwani bidhaa yangu ninayopenda haipatikani. Pia inafaa vizuri, labda bora zaidi, lakini mnyororo ni mbaya zaidi na huvutia zaidi. Swali lako maalum kuhusu WD-40: Hii haipendekezi sana kwenye wavuti hii na hakika itashushwa kwa usahaulifu, lakini watu wengi wanaripoti mafanikio wakati wa kutumia WD-40, ile ya zamani, kama mnyororo wa pekee na degreaser wakati huo huo . Umma zaidi wa them likely being Simon Richardson, a former professional racer (also a cyclocross racer) and now a presenter of GCN - the Global Cycling Network. For example, but not only, here                                Also, while WD does really stand for "water displacement" it is actually a lubricant at the same time. The vendor's page says:  Myth: WD-40® Multi-Use Product is not really a lubricant. Fact: While the “W-D” in WD-40® stands for Water Displacement, WD-40® Multi-Use Product is a unique, special blend of lubricants. The product’s formulation also contains anti-corrosion agents and ingredients for penetration, water displacement and soil removal.  I used to use it too, but now I mostly use other lubes, ceramic ones or other dry ones. My last encounter with a wet one (green Finish Line) was very unpleasant because although it was somewhat wet outside, it did not straight-out rain and it left my chain in a horrible mess, noisy in an unusual way, and was very hard to get off even using a chain washing tool. Think twice before using when it is not straight-out raining. Perhaps a small bottle of a thin oil with you in case of a rainshower would be better. Even re-lubing mid-ride might be better (for long rides, especially multi-day ones).

itachukua nafasi ya schema ya kawaida ya kujirudia: $ $ f (0, \ vec x) = c (\ vec x) \\ f (n+1, \ vec x) = g (f (n, \ vec x), n, \ vec x) $ $ na the form: $$ f(0,\vec x) = c(\vec x)\\ f(n+1,\vec x) = g(f(n,\vec x))  $$  lead to the same class of primitive recursive functions?

Bactine ni antibacterial na formula ya misaada ya maumivu ya aina fulani ndani yake. Nitaapa kwa hilo, kwani nilipata upele mrefu wa wachache weeks ago and after using it once or twice a day for a few days i don't even feel it anymore and it healing faster than normal.

Kutupa lever ni kiasi gani lever inasonga kwa jumla. Cable Slack ni jinsi slack cable ni, n.k. Ni kiasi gani cha kuvuta kabla ya pedi za kuvunja kuanza kusonga. Chombo cha Hifadhi kinasema: Punguza lever ili kujaribu kuvunja kwa caliper. Kurekebisha mpangilio wa moduli ya lever kwa kusonga pedi za ndani au nje kutoka kwa rotor kwa kutumia visu vyote vya kurekebisha pedi. Ili kudumisha uwiano wa 2: 1, geuza kisu cha kurekebisha pedi twice as many clicks as the moving pad-adjusting knob. For example, if a looser modulation is desired, turn the inner pad-adjusting knob counter-clockwise 4 clicks and the outer pad adjusting knob counterclockwise only 2 clicks.   The throw will be controlled by the total gap between pads and disc. For a short throw, a small gap, pads screwed a long way in, for a longer throw pads further apart, pads screwed out.

Lycra ni kitambaa cha nguo cha kushangaza kwa hali ya hewa yoyote iliyo juu ya 55 ° F. Inatoa joto haraka, hupunguza unyevu mbali, na huvunja unyevu haraka sana. Hivi majuzi nilimaliza saa 12, safari ya 190mi kwa joto la 90 ° F vizuri kabisa na kavu. Ninampa changamoto mtu yeyote kupata nyenzo za mavazi ambazo zinaweza kuja karibu na ufanisi wa Lycra katika suala hilo. It's also an excellent in the rain, as long as temperature is not a factor. Again, moisture evaporates surprisingly quickly, so as soon as the rain stops, you're dry again.  The only time I wouldn't wear only lycra is during the cold, especially if it's raining as well. I still wear it under more protective clothing, though.

Lakini baiskeli za msafara sio mdogo 26 ". Salsa hufanya mbili: Vaya Fargo sioni faida kwa gurudumu 26" 700/29 ni bora zaidi (wote 622 ISO) 29 mbali barabara bora kuliko 26 wanafanya nguvu 700/29 sasa . Baiskeli za kuteremka hutumia 29. Na disc Brake uzoefu wangu ni bora upatikanaji wa gurudumu kuliko 26 ". Uzoefu wangu ni upatikanaji zaidi wa matairi 700/29 kuliko 26" hadi ujenzi: Ikiwa utaanza kutoka kwa barabara 700 ya barabara ambayo haijatengenezwa kwa Matairi mapana unayotaka barabarani. Na haitakuwa na kibali cha ardhi unachotaka kwa barabara. Ningesema mwisho wa juu tourer is rugged enough.  You are going to get a bike that is designed to carry a load. If you start with a 29 mtn bike then you get all the off road characteristics you want.  You can put large tires on it that go from street to trail.   The problem there is you are not going to get a bike that was designed to carry a load.  Many will have braze on for a rear rack.  Most likely no mounts for a front rack.   And it was not designed for more inclined road touring position.  If you just put mtn drop bars on it then it is going to be low.  You need a frame that was designed for mtn drops.

Mara nyingi nimekuwa nikitaka kujaribu na muhtasari wa kila mwelekeo wa $ \ lambda $ -cube na kile wanachowakilisha, kwa hivyo nitampa hii risasi. Lakini kwanza, mtu anapaswa kujaribu kutenganisha maswala anuwai. Mchanganyiko wa nadharia ya maingiliano ya COQ ni msingi wa nadharia ya aina ya msingi, wakati mwingine huitwa kwa upendo hesabu ya ujenzi wa kuvutia na ulimwengu. Utagundua kuwa hii ni ya mdomo kuliko tu "hesabu ya ujenzi", na kwa kweli, kuna mambo mengi zaidi huko kuliko COC tu. Hasa, nadhani umechanganyikiwa juu ya ni vipengee vipi ambavyo viko katika COC sahihi. Hasa, tofauti ya seti/prop na ulimwengu hauonekani katika COC. Sitatoa muhtasari kamili wa mifumo safi ya aina hapa, lakini sheria muhimu (kwa PTSEs za kazi kama COC) ni $ $ \ frac {\ gamma \ vdash a: s \ qquad \ gamma, x: a \ vdash b: k} {\ gamma \ vdash \ pi x: a.b \: \ k} \ (s, k) Jozi $ (s, k) $ iko katika seti ya $ r $ ya jozi ya $ S $, inayoitwa Sheria. Ufahamu muhimu ni kwamba chaguzi za uangalifu za $ S $ na $ r $ hufanya tofauti kubwa katika kile aina ya bidhaa $ \ pi x: a.b $ kweli inawakilisha! Hasa, katika hesabu ya ujenzi, seti ya aina $ S $ ni $ $ \ {*, \ mraba \} $ $ mara nyingi huitwa prop na aina (ingawa istilahi hii ni ya kutatanisha kwa mtumiaji wa CoQ kwa sababu mimi ' ll zungumza baadaye), na seti kamili ya sheria: $ $ r = \ {(*,*), (\ mraba, \ mraba), (\ mraba,*), (*, \ mraba) \} $ $ Na kwa hivyo tunayo sheria 4 ambazo zinahusiana na madhumuni 4 tofauti: $ (*,*) $: Aina za kazi $ (\ mraba, \ mraba) $: familia za aina, au aina zilizo na vigezo $ (\ mraba,*) $: Polymorphic Aina $ (*, \ mraba) $: Aina tegemezi nitaelezea kila moja kwa undani zaidi. Kwanza kumbuka kuwa nitaandika $ a \ kulia B $ badala ya $ \ pi x: a.b $ wakati $ x $ haionekani katika $ b $. Ujumbe huu ni wa kupendeza zaidi, lakini unaweza kuficha uvumbuzi muhimu. Aina za kazi: Vipengele vya aina ya $*$ ni aina "za kawaida" na maoni. Ingejumuisha $ \ mathrm {nat} $, $ \ mathrm {bool} $, na vitu kama pendekezo $ x = y $ kwa $ x $ na $ y $ ya aina fulani. Katika COC. "Aina za msingi" na maoni yote yamechanganywa pamoja, kwani bado ziko kwenye mifumo kama AGDA. CoQ huelekea kuwatenganisha katika aina mbili, mara nyingi huitwa seti na prop au aina na prop. Hii inawezesha uchimbaji, na inaruhusu sisi kuchukua uthibitisho wa dhibitisho kwa vitu katika prop ikiwa tunataka (kwa kweli hatutaki kwa vitu vilivyowekwa ). Uwezo wa kuunda aina ya PI-aina kwa $*$ hutupa kazi za kawaida za mpangilio unaofurahiya katika lugha yoyote ya mpango wa kazi, i.e. uwezo wa kupitisha kazi katika kazi zingine. Aina ya Familia: Hii inakupa uwezo wa kuzungumza juu ya $ \ mathrm {orodha} $ peke yake, kwa kweli kama neno lililochapishwa $ \ mathrm {orodha}: *\ kulia *$, badala ya matukio tu $ \ MATHRM {orodha} _ {\ mathrm {nat}}, \ mathrm {orodha} _ {\ mathrm {bool}} $, nk Kumbuka kuwa kuunda tu aina ya $ *\ kulia *$ inahitaji kutumia $ (\ mraba, \ mraba) $ sheria. Polymorphism: Hii ni ya ubishani, lakini ni muhimu sana, na chanzo cha nguvu kubwa katika COC. Motisha ya kawaida ni the desire to write the type $$\Pi t:*.\ t\rightarrow t $$ to be able to type the polymorphic identity $\lambda (t:*)(x:t).x$. Here the quantification $\Pi t:*.\_$ is possible thanks to the $(\square, *)$ rule (though the $t\rightarrow t$ only uses the $(*,*)$ rule).  But it's an interesting fact that we can express all the usual logical operators using this quantifier! Here are a few: $$A\wedge B := \Pi t:*.\ (A \rightarrow B\rightarrow t)\rightarrow t$$ $$A\vee B := \Pi t:*.\ (A \rightarrow t)\rightarrow(B\rightarrow t)\rightarrow t$$ $$\bot := \Pi t:*.\ t$$ $$\top := \Pi t:*.\ t\rightarrow t$$ $$ \exists x:A.\ P(x):= \Pi t:*.\ (\Pi y: A.\ P(y)\rightarrow t)\rightarrow t$$ That last one actually also uses dependent types (the $(*,\square)$ rule), but this should give you an idea of the power of polymorphism.  In fact, polymorphism is so powerful, that adding inductive types with "large elimination" (the ability to define things in $*$ by recursion) implies the excluded middle is inconsistent with the excluded middle! That's why in Coq, Prop (the analogue of $*$) has some restrictions: no large eliminations, and datatypes should live in Set or Type, which don't have the analogue of the $(\square, *)$ rule. Prop without large eliminations is consistent with the law of excluded middle.  Useful to note: in the presence of $(\square,\square)$, you can even write things like: $$\Pi c:*\rightarrow *.\ \ c\ \mathrm{nat}\rightarrow c\ \mathrm{nat} $$ if you like, which is useful for, say, writing generic code over a monad, as often happens in Haskell.  Dependent types: This is how you get the propositions-as-types paradigm to work. Indeed, you want to have a type that represents all possible proofs of, say $0=1$. To make sense of this, you want equality to be of type $$ =\ :\ \mathrm{nat}\rightarrow\mathrm{nat}\rightarrow *$$ or you might want to be polymorphic $$ =\ :\ \Pi t:*.\ t\rightarrow t\rightarrow *$$ In any case, you can't write $\mathrm{nat}\rightarrow\mathrm{nat}\rightarrow *$ without the rule $(*,\square)$.  Ok, but what about universes? It turns out that in the CoC, you can't actually write things like $\square \rightarrow \square$, because there are no types to give $\square$ and a fortiori no rules involving those types. A pretty natural thing to do is to index $\square$ by a natural number, getting $\square_i$ for $i=1,2,3,\ldots$ and having $\square_i:\square_{i+1}$.  What rules do we want for this? One natural rule is $(\square_i, \square_i)$, but that rule isn't very useful in the absence of the subsumption rule $$ \frac{\Gamma\vdash A:\square_i}{\Gamma\vdash A:\square_j}\ i\leq j$$  With these extra sorts and rules, you get something that is not a PTS, but something close. This is (almost) the Extended Calculus of Constructions, which is closer to the basis of Coq. The big missing piece here is the inductive types, which I won't discuss here.  Edit: There's a rather nice reference that describes various features of programing languages in the framework of PTSes, by describing a PTS which is a good candidate for an intermediate representation of a functional programing language:  Henk: A Typed Intermediate Language, S. P. Jones & E. Meijer.

Nadhani David Eppstein anafukuza sana eneo la nadharia ya automata na lugha rasmi. Madai kwamba "kuichapishwa katika mikutano ya kiwango cha juu na kumshawishi mtu kukuajiri mara tu utakapohitimu inaweza kuwa shida" inaonekana kuwa kile Haldane aliita nadharia ya shangazi ya Jobiska: "Ni kweli ulimwengu wote unajua." Kwa kweli, kuna nzuri conferences (such as STACS and ICALP) that routinely publish results in automata theory and formal languages; there are well-attended conferences (such as DLT) that focus on the area; it is a very active area in Germany, France, and Italy; there are great open problems in the area; and I know many students that have had no problem getting jobs.

Kama kijana rafiki alipata vifurushi vya nyuma vya nyuma vya pikipiki ambavyo vilikuwa na aina sawa ya upanuzi wa lishe kama baiskeli yangu na tulilazimika kuwajaribu; Hushughulikia ziligusa tu mbele ya saruji wakati wa kugeuka sana - na aina yoyote ya kasi, sivyo. Jambo ni kiasi cha nguvu ambayo inaweza kutumika kwa misingi ilikuwa kubwa, kwa sababu kuvuta juu ya mikono ilikuwa karibu na kuambatana na nguvu chini. However, if a bike were designed to achieve that in line pull on handlebar/push on pedals, would performance, especially uphill/against the wind be improved?  I think recumbent designs may use this effect.

Tuseme tumepewa jumla (iliyounganishwa) isiyo na msingi wa $ g = (v, e) $. Jalada la makali linauliza $ s \ subseteq e $ ya idadi ya chini ya kingo, kwamba kila vertex $ V \ katika V $ ni tukio la angalau makali moja $ S \ kwa S $. Kumbuka kuwa hii inaweza kutatuliwa kwa wakati wa polynomial. Sasa ningependa kuongeza jumla ya shida hii kupata $ S $ ya vifungu vilivyounganishwa vya vertex-ikiwa ambayo inashughulikia kila vertex $ V \ katika V $, lakini kila subgraph $ S \ katika S $ ina zaidi ya wakati mwingi (or exactly) 3 vertices (The goal is still to minimize $|S|$). Of course, the topology of a connected subgraph with 3 vertices is fixed (the only way is to form a line with 2 edges connecting them). In other words, we need to find a minimum path cover but the length of each path is at most (or exactly) 3.  Is this problem still poly-time solvable or it's NP-hard? Is it related with 3d matching or steiner tree?

You can test this just by plugging the valve in the pump, does it fills the barometer? If not, the reading you are getting when pumping up is from air trapped (And pressurized)somewhere else than the tube.

Muda wa baiskeli ni muhimu tu kama jinsi unavyotunza mwili wako mbali na baiskeli pia. Chakula cha afya (tazama 'eneo la kulisha' na Thomas Liju na Allen Lim, na kumbuka kuwa wanariadha sio maalum, na unahitaji kula chakula cha kawaida cha afya, lakini zaidi yake na kuongezeka kwa kiwango katika mafunzo), - Epuka kusimama kwa miguu yako kwa muda mrefu ikiwa unaweza; Ukipata fursa, pata miguu yako. -Say hydrate-akili yako kwamba hydration sio tu kung'oa galoni ya maji kwa siku: Makini na viwango vya elektroni, na rangi ya mkojo wako ni kiashiria kimoja tu na sio dhahiri, -do kile unachoweza kuinua HR yako kwa Dakika 30. Kila siku vile vile-kwangu, kutembea kufanya kazi kwa nguvu hutimiza hiyo. Hiyo ni kitu tu ambacho hunisaidia kibinafsi zaidi ya yote, fanya kile unachoweza kuzuia DOMS (kucheleweshwa kwa maumivu ya misuli) kwenye future by easing your way into volume and intensity if your body reacts to it poorly, and eat right all the while.  When you get back on the bike, do the following in addition to the above:  -Getting a recovery snack within 30 min. after riding that's primarily carbs, and a decent amount of protein (endurox claims the    magical formula is 4:1 carbs:protein, but anything roughly close will    do)    -Eat 'complete' proteins. I can't tell you everything that's a complete protein (has the correct combination of ALL amino acids your    body needs to build muscle), so just google for some suggests: I    usually go with red beans and rice, or eggs. The latter is supposedly    good at preventing DOMS.  I'm also assuming that whether through a professional fitting or not, you fit on your bike: regional pain is a sign that your bike is not fit for you/. Acute pain should send you to get a fit right away. Generalized pain (my legs/exhaustion/etc) is to be expected. Something about 'pain and gain' or something something...

Vyombo vya habari maarufu mara nyingi hutoa maoni kwamba msingi, ikiwa sio pekee, sababu za kompyuta zinafanikiwa kwa kazi zaidi na zaidi (kumpiga Kasparov huko Chess, kumpiga Jennings huko Jeopardy, nk) ni nguvu ya usindikaji mbichi. Maendeleo ya algorithmic kawaida hayapewi deni hilo kubwa. Walakini, mimi nina nia juu ya kama nikisisitiza kwamba maendeleo ya algorithmic yapewe zaidi weight is "pedantry."  On the one hand, I think that those of us who are more theoretically inclined can sometimes overstate the importance of algorithmic advances and only grudgingly admit the importance of increased processing power.  On the other hand, I do think the public should be better informed about the role of theoretical advances in solving practical problems.

Heuristics bora ni algorithms ya ukaribu. Algorithms nzuri zaidi ya kukadiri ni tu "kijinga" heuristics inayofanya kazi. Kwa mfano, utaftaji wa ndani wa nguzo, nguzo zenye uchoyo (Gonzalez), moja kwa bei ya algorithms mbili zenye tamaa, nk, nk, nk Kwa hivyo kusoma algorithms ya ukaribu ni juu ya kuelewa ni nini mrithi wa uhakika wa makadirio. Matumaini ni kwamba utafiti juu ya algorithms ya ukaribu huunda aina mbili za mbolea: hoja maoni ambayo hufanya kazi kutoka kwa heuristics kuwa zana za muundo wa algorithms. Vivyo hivyo, hoja maoni kutoka kwa muundo wa algorithm ndani ya heuristics/algorithms ambayo inafanya kazi vizuri in practice. cross fertilization between a person that just graduated and a position.   In short, the world is not exact, inputs are not exact, target functions optimized by various algorithm problems are not exact and at best represent a fuzzy approximation to what one wants, and computations are not exact. Why would anybody learn exact algorithms?  (Answer: Because exact algorithms are just really good approximation algorithms.)  In the real world, there are very few exact algorithms - you need to use approximation to be remotely relevant...

Ni ngumu kusema kwa hakika jinsi Threadlocker inavyotumika mapema kwenye viwanja kwenye viwanda (uwezekano mkubwa sio kwa mkono, lakini ni nani anayejua). Walakini, upolimishaji wake hufanyika baada ya kuwasiliana na chuma, sio kwa sababu ya kukausha hewani. Kutoka kwa nakala ya Wikipedia: Njia nyingi za kufunga nyuzi ni msingi wa methacrylate na hutegemea shughuli za umeme of a metal substrate to cause polymerization of the fluid.   A somewhat counterintuitive property of threadlocker is that it "dries" in airless conditions.      Typically, thread-locking fluids are methacrylate-based, and cure anaerobically.    If the fluid is left in an open container without any contact with metals, it will remain liquid.

Hii ni kupunguzwa kutoka kwa kikundi kwenda kwa shida yako. Tunaanza na mfano wa Clique: graph $ G $ na nambari $ k $, acha $ V = \ {V_1, V_2, ..., V_n \} $. Clique inabaki NPC hata chini ya kizuizi kwamba $ max (deg (v_i)) \ leq 2 (k-1) $ (mchoro wa dhibitisho: ikiwa $ max (deg (v_i)> 2 (k-1) $ kisha ongeza $ k_t $ ambapo $ t = 2 (k -1) - max (deg (v_i)) $ na unganishe kwa node zote za $ g $ na uulize kikundi cha ukubwa $ k '= k + t $ kwenye graph mpya) . Kwa hivyo tunadhania kuwa katika $ g $, $ max (deg (v_i)) \ leq 2 (k-1) $. Kwa kila node $ v_i $ ambayo $ deg (v_i) <2 (k-1) $ sisi Unda kikundi "cha nje" $ C_I $ ya ukubwa $ 2 (k+1)+1 $ (kila nodi ya $ c_i $ clique ina angalau $ 2 (k+1) $ majirani) ikiwa $ deg (v_i) ni $ digrii ya $ v_i $, tunaunganisha $ v_i $ hadi $ 2 (k-1)-deg (v_i) $ nodi za $ c_i $. Katika $ g '$, kila $ v_i $ ina digrii $ 2 (k-1) $; hivyo $ | a | \geq k$ because at least one vertex must be selected.  It is clear that if one of the vertex of $C_i$ is included in $A$ then at least $2(k+1)/2 = k+1$ nodes must also be inserted in it. Note that if an original node has $deg(v_i) < k-1$ then at least one node of the linked $C_i$ must be included, leading to $|A| > k$.   So we can build a set $A$ of minimum size $|A| = k$ if and only if $G$ contains a clique of size $k$.  An example of the reduction in which we ask if the graph $G$ represented by the yellow nodes and bold edges contains a clique of size $k = 3$ (a triangle).    The blue nodes (grouped for better readability) are $K_9$, the red edges are the links between nodes of $G$ with $deg(v_i) < 2(k-1)$ .

Ninaamini kuwa picha za ulimwengu za miti iliyojengwa na Chung na Graham 1983 zina Treewidth $ \ theta (\ logi n) $. Au kwa mfano rahisi lakini mfano kama huo fikiria kufungwa kwa miti ya binary yenye usawa. Walakini, kuna matokeo hasi hapa, pia. Yote examples you give of interesting graph families are minor-closed, or very closely related to minor-closed families. But a minor-closed graph family either contains all planar graphs (and hence has maximum treewidth $\Theta(\sqrt n)$) or has a forbidden planar minor (and hence has bounded treewidth).

Unaweza kubadilisha sarufi ya LR (k) kuwa sarufi ya LR (1) (chanzo) Hii sio kweli kwa sarufi ya LR (*) (k = inf). Walakini, taarifa hiyo haimaanishi kuwa hakuna sarufi kama hiyo kwa lugha moja. Unaweza tu kuhitaji kuandika tena sarufi. Sarufi zipo ambazo haziwezi kubadilishwa, hata hivyo. Lugha za sarufi nyeti za muktadha zinaweza kuwa wazi zaidi kuliko sarufi zisizo na muktadha (zinaweza kutambuliwa tu na automata zilizofungwa). Kwa hivyo, tafsiri yako inayotarajiwa is possible for just a subset.  Update for clarification:  There are languages that can not be represented by LR grammars but do have a grammar that is not LR (the language requires something more powerful than LR). There are also grammars that are not LR that recognize a language that can be recognized by an LR grammar (the language just happens to have a complex grammar, but it is not required).

Nadhani hii ni njia sawa na tabia ya Shnor ya Martingale ya ubinafsi wa algorithmic, nimekutumia an email with more info, but it is a potential nice non-overfitting test and also alternative characterisation.

Je! Ni nambari gani bora (i.e., kiwango cha juu) nambari za binary zilizo wazi na urefu wa block $ n $ na umbali wa chini $ d $, katika serikali $ d = n^{1 - o (1)} $? "Upungufu" wa nambari ni tofauti kati ya urefu wa block na urefu wa ujumbe. Kwa kweli, ni rahisi kuonyesha kuwa kuna nambari za binary zilizo na umbali wa $ D $, urefu wa $ n $, na upungufu wa $ o (d \ logi (n/d)) $. Wakati $ d \ leq n^{1 - \ omega (1)} $, iliyofungwa ni $ o (d \ logi n)$, which can be matched explicitly using e.g. Reed-Solomon codes. When $d = \alpha n$ with $\alpha$ a sufficiently small positive constant, the nonexplicit bound is $(1 - \Omega(1)) \cdot n$, which can be matched explicitly using e.g. Justesen codes.  What about in the middle? E.g., what if $d = n / \log n$? The nonexplicit redundancy bound is $o(n)$. Is there an explicit code matching it up to a constant?

Acha mraba $ n \ mara n $ real matrix $ {\ bf a} $ na vectors mbili $ {\ bf x} $ na $ {\ bf b} $ ya urefu wa $ n $, kwamba $ $ {\ bf a } Walakini, kuna visa ambapo kutatua (au $ \ epsilon $-takriban kutatua) kwa $ {\ bf x} $ gharama $ o (n \ log^\ rho n) $, kama vile systems where ${\bf A}$ is a symmetric and diagonally dominant matrix (e.g., a Laplacian) [1].  Which other families of linear systems (i.e., matrices) admit linear (or nontrivial poly(n)) time solutions?  If we consider finite fields instead of real matrices, are there any families of matrices there that admit nearly linear time solutions?  [1] http://www.cs.yale.edu/homes/spielman/Research/linsolve.html

Ndio, kwa sababu ulifanya makadirio hayana maana. Punguza kutoka K-Sat: Kila kutofautisha huchangia kipengee kimoja hadi $ \ Mathcal {U} $ na kila kifungu kinachangia vitu vya K+1 hadi $ \ Mathcal {U} $, moja kwa kila halisi na moja zaidi. Kila halisi inachangia seti moja kuwa $ \ mathcal {s} $ - vitu ni [[kipengee cha $ \ mathcal {u} $ kutoka kwa kutofautisha kwa kweli] na [vitu kutoka kwa vifungu] ambavyo ni [kwa hiyo kwa hiyo kwa hiyo [kwa hiyo ni [kwa hiyo kwa hiyo [kwa hiyo ni [hiyo kwa hiyo kwa hiyo [kwa hiyo ni [hiyo kwa hiyo kwa hiyo [kwa hiyo halisi]]]. Kila kifungu kinachangia seti ya 2K-1 hadi $ \ Mathcal {S} $-moja kwa kila sehemu isiyo kamili ya seti ya fasihi, lakini kitu kingine kutoka kwa kifungu lazima kiwe katika kila moja ya hizo Vipengee vya 2K-1 vya $ \ Mathcal {S} $. Kwa sehemu ndogo ya $ \ Mathcal {s} $ kuwa disjoint, haiwezi kuwa na seti kutoka kwa fasihi tofauti na haiwezi kuwa na zaidi ya seti moja kutoka kwa kifungu chochote. Kwa subset ya $ \ Mathcal {s} $ kufunika $ \ mathcal {u} $, lazima iwe na seti moja kutoka kwa kila kutofautisha na angalau seti moja kutoka kwa kila kifungu. Kwa hivyo vifuniko halisi lazima iwe na seti moja kutoka kwa kila kutofautisha na kutoka kwa kila kifungu. Kila kitu cha $ \ mathcal {s} $ ni kutoka [[hakuna vifungu na moja haswa variable] or [no variables and exactly one clause]],  so all exact covers have exactly ​ ​ ​ number of variables ​ + ​ number of clauses ​ ​ ​ elements of $\mathcal{S}$.  For any assignment which does not satisfy the k-SAT formula, the subset of $\mathcal{S}$ induced by that assignment is disjoint from at least one clause's set of k+1 elements of $\mathcal{U}$, no other clauses' sets intersect any of those sets of k+1 elements of $\mathcal{U}$, and no single element of $\mathcal{S}$ covers all of those k+1 elements of $\mathcal{U}$. ​ Thus non-satisfying assignments have zero extensions to exact covers.  For any assignment which does satisfy the k-SAT formula, each clause has exactly one element  of $\mathcal{S}$ from the set of that clause's literals which are false, one can trivially find the set of those elements of $\mathcal{S}$, and using that set to extend [the subset of $\mathcal{S}$ induced by the assignment]  gives an exact cover. ​ Since elements of $\mathcal{S}$ from clauses do not have any elements of $\mathcal{U}$  from other clauses, satisfying assignments have no other extensions to exact covers.    Therefore your problem is ETH-hard under strongly parsimonious reductions.

Kudumu kunaweza kuonekana kuhitimu, angalau kwa masharti (ambayo ni, kudhani $ \ mathsf {vp}^0 \ neq \ mathsf {vnp}^0 $). Kumbuka kuwa toleo la Boolean la kudumu ni kuamua tu ikiwa grafu ya bipartite iliyopewa ina kulinganisha kamili, ambayo ina mizunguko ya ukubwa wa aina nyingi. [Kwa muhtasari wa maoni hapa chini:] Licha ya mfano huu kuwa wa masharti, hakuna kitu zaidi ya pengo la logarithmic linaweza kuwa expected unconditionally at the moment, since $\Omega(n \log n)$ is still the best known lower bound on general algebraic circuits. As pointed out by Stasys, this logarithmic gap is achieved by the function $\sum_{i=1}^n x_i^n$ (requires algebraic circuits of size $\Omega(n \log n)$ by Baur-Strassen), whose Boolean-ized version is just $x_1 \vee x_2 \vee \dotsb \vee x_n$.
Hapa kuna zile zinazofaa: $ PSPACE \ subseteq p/poly $. $EXP \subseteq P/poly$. $NP \subseteq P/log$.

Swali unalouliza limejadiliwa sana na linajadiliwa sana chini ya kichwa "isipokuwa kukaguliwa au tofauti zisizosimamiwa?". Hapa "Isipokuwa" inamaanisha mfano wa Java ambapo njia zote zinazowezekana zinaweza kutupa lazima kutangazwa wazi. Nadhani inakubaliwa zaidi kuwa wakati wa kukaguliwa wanaweza kuonekana kuwa wazo nzuri wakati walipoangalia kutoka kwa mtazamo wa aina ya kawaida ya nadharia, ni mbaya kwa uhandisi mkubwa wa programu, kwa sababu mabadiliko rahisi ya nambari katika sehemu moja yanaweza kusababisha mabadiliko katika Uingiliano wa ubaguzi wa idadi kubwa ya nambari inayoonekana kuwa isiyohusiana. Kama Neel anavyoonyesha, na mifumo ya kisasa ya kuandika (kawaida viongezeo vya FΩ), inaelezea zaidi kuliko ya Java, baadhi ya shida hizi zinaweza kuwa alleviated, although not always without introducing new problems (such as making type-inference harder). This is the main reason why modern, and otherwise strongly typed languages such as Scala and Ocaml don't have checked exceptions.   In my opinion, the last word on this issue has not been spoken, because with increasing use of logic-based specification and verification techniques, it's increasingly useful to let the type-checker infer as many (basic) program properties  as possible. OTOH, most exception usage is simple (when something goes wrong, throw an exception, and catch it in the outermost loop, printing "sorry, please restart" or some variant thereof), using unchecked exceptions is not that big a software engineering problem in practise.

Acha $ a = xy^t $ iwe kiwango- $ 1 $ matrix, na tuseme kila kiingilio cha $ A $ ni katika $ [0,1] $. Tunaweza kuunda matrix ya binary $ a _ {\ rm pande zote} $ kwa kuweka $ $ [a _ {\ rm pande zote}] _ {ij} = \ kuanza {kesi} 1 & \ mbox {na uwezekano} a_ {ij} \ \ 0 & \ mbox {na uwezekano} 1-a_ {ij} \ mwisho {kesi} $ $ inawezekana kupata $ x $ kwa kuangalia eigenvector mkuu wa $ a _ {\ rm mviringo} $? Kwa maneno mengine, tuseme $ V $ ndiye Eigenvector mkuu wa $ A $; Je! Ni kweli kwamba, baada ya kuokoa $ V $ na $ x $ kuwa na kawaida ya kitengo, veta mbili ni sawa? Hasa, mtu anaweza kuonyesha kuwa $ p (|| \ frac {x} {|| x || _2} - \ frac {v} {| geq \ epsilon) $ huenda kwa sifuri kwa $ \ epsilon> 0 $ kama $ n \ kulia \ infty $? Niliandika simulizi ya haraka ya MATLAB inayoonyesha jibu ni ndio. Hapa kuna nambari yangu: n = 20000; ukubwa wa matrix %kutoa matrix; x = rand (n, 1); y = rand (n, 1); A = x*y '; toa matrix iliyo na mviringo B = zeros (n, n); kwa i = 1: n kwa j = 1: n if rand>A(i,j)          B(i,j)=0;      else          B(i,j) =1;      end  end       end      %eigendecomposition of B      [v,d]=eig(B);      %figure out the index of the principal eigenvector;      m = max(abs(d));      mm = max(m);      i = find(m==mm);      %compare principal eigenvector to true answer      y = v(:,i)/norm(v(:,i)) - x/norm(x);        norm(y,inf)   Running this code with matrix size of 20,000 took me a few hours and returned $|| v/||v||_2 - x/||x||_2 ||_{\infty} \approx 0.02$, suggesting that the answer is positive. Since the answer is likely yes, is this something that is present in the literature? And is there a simple argument to see that recovery is possible, in this or a related model?   (I previously asked this question on MO without receiving an answer.)

Samahani nimechelewa - ni swali nzuri! Kama wengine wamesema tayari, ndio sababu niliuliza swali kwenye karatasi yangu ya BQP dhidi ya PH, na kwa nini nilitumia miezi 4 au 5 kufanya kazi bila mafanikio mnamo 2008. Njia moja ya kujibu swali ingekuwa kudhibitisha Taarifa ya jumla zaidi ambayo niliita "jumla ya dhamana ya nishati"-lakini kwa bahati mbaya, that conjecture turned out to be false, at least for circuits of depth 3 and higher.  (I still think it's probably true for depth-2 circuits, which would at least yield an oracle separation between BQP and AM.)  For more recent ideas (the latest, as far as I know) toward an oracle separation between BQP and PH, see the nice followup paper by Fefferman, Shaltiel, Umans, and Viola.

Je! Unajaribu kusafisha nini? Ikiwa unafikiria vimumunyisho nadhani ni grisi ya mnyororo badala ya matope. Napendelea kutumia degreaser inayotokana na maji kama kijani rahisi na mswaki wa zamani. Ikiwa ni mbaya sana nitaiondoa baiskeli na kuiondoa. Uzi huu kwenye baiskeli una maelezo zaidi juu ya jinsi unavyoenda juu yake. Haraka na chini effective approach is to squirt some penetrating oil like WD40 on to loosen the grease then wipe it off. That will get you running again in a hurry but it's not good for the bike.  Traditionally people have used organic solvents like kerosene but they're toxic and degreaser is just as effective. Petrol is the worst, it contains contact poisons as well as having poisonous vapour.

Kuna mengi ya kufungua hapa na sijui kuhusu taasisi za Goguen. Lakini labda naweza kutoa jibu la swali lako. Wacha tuanze na "tafsiri rahisi" za RDF, kama inavyofafanuliwa na maalum, kusahau juu ya lugha tajiri kama RDFS au OWL. Ikiwa tutapuuza iris na fasihi, kama ilivyo katika sehemu ya kwanza ya swali lako, basi mfano wa RDF ni kitu rahisi: picha iliyo na alama, ambayo wima ni rasilimali, kingo ni tatu, na lebo za makali ni za mapema. Ili kuona mifano ya RDF kama jamii ya mifano, tunaweza kutumia tofauti za kitengo cha kuorodhesha picha, kama ilivyojadiliwa, kwa mfano, katika kitabu cha David Spivak juu ya nadharia ya Sayansi. Fafanua kitengo $ \ mathbf {rdf} _0 $ na vitu vitatu $ t $, $ r $, na $ p $, inayowakilisha tratu, rasilimali, na mali, na morphisms tatu $ subj: t \ hadi r $, $ pred : T \ hadi p $, $ obj: t \ hadi r $, inayowakilisha mada, utabiri, na kitu cha mara tatu. Mfano wa RDF ni functor $ m: \ mathbf {rdf} _0 \ kwa \ mathbf {set} $. Kuna jamii ya kufurahisha ya mifano yote kama hii, ambayo morphisms ni mabadiliko ya asili. Chini ya ufafanuzi huu, morphism ya RDF models is just a label-preserving graph homomorphism.  IRIs and literal can be incorporated within this general approach. Define a new category $\mathbf{RDF}$ consisting of the objects and morphisms of $\mathbf{RDF}_0$, plus two additional objects $IRI$ and $L$, representing the IRIs and literals, and two additional morphisms $iri: IRI \to R + P$ and $lit: L \to R$, representing interpretations of the IRIs and literals as resources and/or properties. Here the sum of objects ($+$) is a coproduct (disjoint union). We can handle the sum in multiple ways. We can say that $\mathbf{RDF}$ is the free cocartesian category generated by the above objects and morphisms. Or we can think of $\mathbf{RDF}$ as a sketch.  On this definition, an RDF model, as defined by the "simple interpretations" of the RDF 1.0 spec, is a (coproduct-preserving) functor $M: \mathbf{RDF} \to \mathbf{Set}$. As before, morphisms of RDF models are natural transformations between such functors.  That's all I have time to say right now. If you're interested, I can describe a different way of thinking about this problem that lends itself better to richer systems like RDFS or OWL.

Niligundua kuwa angalau hapa nchini Ujerumani, madereva wengi wanachanganyikiwa kwa kujaribu kuwashawishi. Sawa huenda kwa madereva katika trafiki inayokuja ambayo inataka kwenda kushoto (kwenye njia yangu) ambayo ninajaribu kutikisa wakati taa zangu za trafiki zinageuka kuwa nyekundu. Mkakati wangu ni kuchukua "msimamo wa msingi" au hata karibu na mstari wa kati wakati kuzidi sio wazo nzuri au ikiwa kuna nafasi ya kutosha (labda njia ya ziada) ambayo ingeruhusu kuzidisha rahisi. Ninaelekea tu the curb when the road is visible for a longer stretch and overtaking safely is definitely possible. This is to avoid being pushed against the curb when an overtaking car has to terminate its manoeuvre prematurely due to oncoming traffic. However, most drivers seem to ignore this signal as well, either overtaking regardless of the traffic situation or not overtaking at all.  Note though that I mostly ride a velomobile, so the UFO effect is far more pronounced than with any other type of bicycle.

Natafuta jina la / fasihi kwa shida ya algorithmic kama ifuatavyo: Kwa kupewa nafasi ya metric $ (m, d) $, sehemu ndogo ya $ x = \ {x_1, \ dots, x_n \} \ subset m $ na a RADIUS Zisizohamishika $ r> 0 $, pata kiwango cha juu cha alama zilizowekwa na mpira wa radius $ r $. Vinginevyo, pata $ n $, kwamba $ n = \ max_ {x \ katika m} | x \ cap b_r (x) | $ Najua tu juu ya shida ya kituo 1 hadi sasa. Lakini hii inajaribu kutatua shida kwa kupunguza radius ya mpira ulio na alama zote ndani ya seti. Pia nilipata karatasi moja inayojadili $ \ Mathcal {o} (| x |^2) $ suluhisho kwa ndege ya Euclidean. Huko imekuwa ikiitwa upeo-enclosing-disk-shida. Habari yoyote kuhusu generalizations for $\mathbb{R}^D, D > 2$ or different metrics, would be helpful.   I am not very experienced with computational geometry and the theory of algorithms, but I need to find current literature on this problem. Having a name, or a similar problem, on which this problem can be reduced, would be help me a lot. Also, if you know literature or keywords regarding approximation attempts.  Thank you for your answers.  Edit: As discussed in the comments, an arbitrary metric space might not even computable. However, as I didn't want to restrict the solution on real euclidean spaces (e.g. the space of strings provided with the edit-distance should be an option), I decided for the very general formulation of the problem.

Nilikuwa najiuliza ikiwa kuna matokeo yoyote juu ya ugumu wa kesi ya wastani ya algorithm rahisi. Acha $ a \ in \ mathbb {r}^{m \ mara n} $ iwe matrix katika kizuizi cha mstari. Ninajua kuwa Smale alifanya kazi katika miaka ya 80 ambayo inasema kwamba ikiwa tutarekebisha $ M $, basi ugumu wa wastani ni wa $ N $ wakati $ N $ inakwenda kwa infinity. Walakini, kwa nadharia ya pande mbili, $ m $ na $ n $ are symmetric in LP. Also in the 80's, Adler et al. showed that the expected number of pivots is quadratic in $\min \{ m, n\}$. (See ``A Simplex Algorithm Whose Average Number of Steps Is Bounded between Two Quadratic Functions of the Smaller Dimension '') And they even showed a quadratic lower bound.  I was wondering if there are any recent development on such average-case analysis.

Jibu la Peter Shor ni nzuri sana, lakini kuna njia nyingine ya kujibu hii: kuthibitisha kuwa TreeWidth imefungwa juu na mara mbili ya amplitude (toleo la vertex). Kwa kuwa tunajua kuwa wapanuaji 3 wa kawaida wana mstari wa miti, tumekamilika. See the construction of a tree decomposition given a BFS tree, it's slide 15 of this presentation: http://www.liafa.jussieu.fr/~pierref/ALADDIN/MEETING2/soto.pdf  It's easy to see that the size of every bag is upper bounded by two times the widest level.

Kwa grafu rahisi, unganisho la makali ya ndani ya vertices $ x, y $ ambapo $ x \ neq y $ ni $ \ lambda (x, y) $ na hufafanuliwa kama idadi kubwa ya njia za kutofautisha kutoka $ x $ hadi $ y $. Mtu anaweza kupata hii kwa hesabu ya kiwango cha juu cha mtiririko. Fafanua kuwa $ \ lambda (g) = \ min_ {x, y \ katika v (g), x \ neq y} \ lambda (x, y) $ kuwa (min) unganisho la makali. $ \ bar \ lambda (g) = \ max_ {x, y \ katika v (g), x \ neq y} \ lambda (x, y) $ kuwa kuunganishwa kwa makali. Kwa sababu ya nadharia ya kukatwa ya max-mtiririko, shida ya kwanza ni rahisi zaidi. Tunahitaji tu kupata min-kata ya kimataifa, ambayo ni kizigeu $ (s, v \ backslash s) $, kwamba idadi ya kingo kutoka $ s $ hadi $ v \ backslash s $ imepunguzwa. Kukatwa kwa min-kimataifa kwa picha zote mbili ambazo hazijaelekezwa na zilizoelekezwa zinaweza kutatuliwa kwa $ O (nm) $ kupitia algorithm ya Hao-Orlin. $^1 $ max makali kuunganishwa inaonekana kuwa ngumu zaidi. Ninafanya not know of any algorithm that does less work than find all $\Omega(n^2)$ possible $\lambda(x,y)$ and take the max. This means $\Omega(n)$ max flow computation in undirected graphs by constructing the Gomory-Hu tree, and $\Omega(n^2)$ max flow in directed graphs.  Is there an algorithm that solves this problem faster? It seems that $\Omega(n)$ max flow is required. Since for each component we need to compute at least one $\lambda(x,y)$ for $x,y$ in the component. Or something equivalent. There are graphs with $\Omega(n)$ components, and one must determine which component contains the largest local edge connectivity. (although in that case, most max flow computation would incur constant cost. )   Hao, Jianxiu X.; Orlin, James B. (1994). "A Faster Algorithm for Finding the Minimum Cut in a Directed Graph". Journal of Algorithms 17 (3): 424. doi:10.1006/jagm.1994.1043.

Ndio lakini sio bora/iliyorudishwa. Kitaalam, lever atasukuma bastola za caliper, lakini viboreshaji vya diski ya Magura, kama vile MT5, kushinikiza kiwango tofauti cha maji kuliko viboreshaji vyao vya kuvunja, kama vile HS11. Na Washirika wa Shimano wana kushinikiza sawa na Magura Disc Levers. Kwa hivyo haitakuwa sawa. Katika majaribio ya majaribio, wanasema haifai kuchanganya viboreshaji vya disc na walinzi wa mdomo kwani kuna nafasi kubwa ya kuvunja kushindwa (hata ikiwa ni momentary minimal slip) when you need them the most. In normal, non action sport, conditions it will probably be ok. It just won't feel as good as matching the road levers to the disc caliper. If you choose this method, (same goes for the MT5 caliper) make sure that you choose the correct fittings for each end, otherwise you risk fluid leaking and no more braking. As a little side note, Magura did release drop levers for rim brakes called HS66.

Hii ni maoni yaliyopanuliwa ya kukamilisha jibu la Ryan, ambalo linashughulika na vizingiti ambapo idadi ya vifungu inakuwa kubwa ya kutosha kwamba mfano hauwezekani. Mtu anaweza pia kuhesabu vizingiti vikubwa zaidi ambapo idadi ya vifungu hulazimisha kutoridhisha wakati inazidi kazi ya $ N $. Kumbuka kuwa maswala kadhaa ya kiufundi yanahitaji kushughulikiwa. Ikiwa vifungu vinavyorudiwa vinahesabiwa kwa $ M $, basi $ M $ inaweza kufanywa kuwa kubwa kama inavyotaka bila kubadilisha $ N $. Hii inaweza kuharibu uhusiano mwingi kati ya $ m $ na $ n $. Kwa hivyo fikiria kuwa $ m $ ndio idadi ya vifungu tofauti. Tunahitaji kuamua juu ya maelezo mengine, ikiwa matukio yamefungwa ili mpangilio wa fasihi ndani ya kifungu au agizo la vifungu ndani ya jambo la mfano. Tuseme hii sio muhimu, kwa hivyo visa viwili vinachukuliwa kuwa sawa ikiwa vina vifungu sawa, na vifungu viwili ni sawa ikiwa vina fasihi sawa. Kwa mawazo haya sasa tunaweza kufunga idadi ya vifungu tofauti ambavyo vinaweza kuonyeshwa na vijiti vya $ N $. Kila kifungu kinaweza kuwa na kila kutofautisha kutokea kwa kweli au vibaya, au sivyo, na kisha $ m \ le 3^n $. Kwanza fikiria SAT without a restriction on $k$. What is the largest $m$ such that the instance is satisfiable? Without loss of generality we can suppose that the all-zero assignment is a solution. There are then $3^n-2^n$ different clauses consistent with this solution, each containing at least one negated literal. Hence $m\le 3^n-2^n$ for any satisfiable instance. The instance consisting of all clauses that each contain at least one negated literal has this many clauses, and is satisfied by the all-zero assignment. Further, by the pigeonhole principle any instance with at least $3^n-2^n+1$ clauses is unsatisfiable.  This yields $2^{3^n-2^n}$ different subsets of such clauses, each representing a distinct instance which is satisfied by some assignment.  In comparison, the total number of different instances is $2^{3^n}$.  Now modifying the above for instances in which each clause has at most $k$ literals, there are $\sum_{i=0}^k \binom{n}{i}2^i$ distinct such clauses, and $\sum_{i=0}^k \binom{n}{i}$ clauses in which there are no negative literals, so $m\le \sum_{i=0}^k \binom{n}{i}(2^i - 1)$ for satisfiable instances, and any larger $m$ is unsatisfiable. There are then $2^{\sum_{i=0}^k \binom{n}{i}(2^i - 1)}$ instances satisfied by any particular assignment, out of the total of $2^{\sum_{i=0}^k \binom{n}{i}2^i}$ $k$-SAT instances.

Trek hufanya baiskeli nzuri, za kuaminika katika safu yao ya bei. Nina 25 ya 'em katika baiskeli yetu ya "baiskeli" kwa sasa. 6000 imekaguliwa vizuri, lakini imeundwa na kutolewa kama mashine ya barabarani. Itakuwa chini ya Optimum wakati imejaa barabara. Ikiwa ungetumia wakati wako mwingi kupanda on pavement, then a simple change of tires would be of considerable benefit. Not that you can't ride a mountain bike on the road, thousands do so all the time.  It's just that those knobby tires will squirm and wear rapidly, and the riding position is not the best for long stretches on the road.

Je! Ni mapungufu gani ya programu ya jumla ya kazi? Sio kukamilisha, lakini bado inasaidia sehemu kubwa ya programu zinazowezekana. Je! Kuna mambo muhimu ambayo unaweza kuandika kwa lugha ya kukamilisha, lakini sio kwa lugha ya kazi jumla? Je! Ni sawa kusema kwamba programu zilizoandikwa kwa jumla ya lugha za kazi zinaweza kuchambuliwa kabisa, wakati uchambuzi wa tuli katika lugha kamili ni mdogo na vitu kama shida ya kukomesha? Na hiyo simaanishi kuwa katika lugha kamili ya kazi kila kitu kinaweza kuamuliwa, because some things are only known at runtime, but I mean that in theory, programs written in an ideal total functional programming language, can be analysed so that everything that could in theory be determined statically can be determined statically. Or are there still undecidable problems inherit in total functional languages that make static analysis incomplete? Some problems will always be undecidable, no matter in which language they are written, but I am interested in such problems that are inherit to the language, like the halting problem in Turing-complete languages.

Ili kufanya hivyo unahitaji kubadilisha mabadiliko na derailleur pia. Bidhaa tofauti, na idadi tofauti ya cogs kwenye nyuma zinahitaji kiwango tofauti cha kuvuta kwenye cable ya gia kuhama gia moja, na cogs, mnyororo nk zote ni saizi tofauti. Hii pia inamaanisha kuwa cable jumla iliyohamishwa kutoka kutoka juu hadi gia ya chini kwa ujumla pia ni tofauti. Kumbuka kuwa kawaida imeainishwa katika sehemu ya kumi ya a millimetre (0.1mm), so everything has to be quite precise. Otherwise the bike won't stay in gear. While you can change everything over like this it's generally more expensive than selling your bike and buying a newer or higher spec one with the new groupset on it. If you can find a damaged bike with the necessary parts intact that's likely to be the only cheap way to make the change.

Karatasi hii inachunguza mashine ndogo za Universal za Universal. Je! Ni mifano gani ya mashine ndogo za Universal Monotone Turing, kama ilivyoelezewa na Schmidhuber? Je! Ni ipi kati ya hizi ambazo ni nzuri (wakati wa polynomial) simulators za mashine za Kujaribu? Mashine za Monotone ni mashine za kutafuta na mkanda wa kuingiza njia moja tu, bomba zingine za kazi, na mkanda wa pato la njia moja tu. Mkanda wa kuingiza una mlolongo usio na kipimo wa 0 na 1 na mwanzoni kichwa cha pembejeo scans the leftmost bit. The output tape is written one symbol at a time, and the output is defined as the finite binary sequence on the output tape if the machine halts, and the possibly infinite sequence appearing on the output tape in a never-ending process if the machine does not halt at all.   From page 276 of An introduction to Kolmogorov complexity and its applications by Li and Vitanyi.

Tunashuku kufuatia uhusiano: $ $ tc^0 \ subsetneq nc^1 \ subsetneq l \ subsetneq nl \ subsetneq ac^1 \ subsetneq nc^2 \ subsetneq p \ subsetneq np \ subsetneq pH \ subsetneq pspace $ Mfano wa ugumu. Je! Ni madarasa gani ya ugumu wa analog katika mfano wa BSS na ugumu wa hesabu ya Valiant model?  What are known relations and implications among complexity classes in these models?  What surprise would counter intuitive results such as $P=NP$ have on these hierachies and vice versa?

Nadhani kuna machafuko hapa kwa msingi wa uwakilishi wa binary dhidi ya unary. Taarifa hiyo 'Kamba nyingi hazieleweki' inamaanisha kuwa ugumu wa Kolmogorov $ k (n) $ ni takriban $ | n | $ (ambayo ni, takriban $ \ log_2 n $) kwa $ n $ zaidi. Kwa kweli, kila nambari ya asili $ n <2^k $ ina uwakilishi wa $ k $ -bit. Ni katika uwakilishi wa unoa tu kwamba kila natural number $n$ has complexity approximately $n$.  Now, you may find alternative representations, possibly exotic ones, such as your busy beaver example, which achieves the same bound as the binary representation (i.e., every number $n$ has a representation of size approximately $\log_2 n$) but these do not 'compress' numbers more than the binary representation does.
Kuna takriban 5mm ya pedi ya gel, juu ya msingi rahisi unaobadilika the Flite Gel. I would not consider it an especially rigid saddle.

Kwa kazi ya Klivans na Van Melkebeek (ambayo inakubali), ikiwa E = dtime ($ 2^{o (n)} $) haina mizunguko na milango ya PP ya ukubwa $ 2^{o (n)} $ basi pH iko katika Pp. Contrapositive inasema kwamba ikiwa pH haiko katika pp basi e ina mizunguko ya ukubwa wa chini PP gates. That is consistent with the fact that an oracle proof of PH not in PP gives a relativized lower bound for PP. No reason to think it implies any upper bound for PP, or any strength for circuits without PP gates.

Nina shaka sana hii, lakini inawezekana kwamba unaendesha usanidi wa mnyororo wa kompakt kwenye cranks asili iliyowekwa kwa pete za mnyororo wa tatu. Nilijifunga pande zote na hii hapo awali, na nikagundua kuwa mnyororo huo ungeteleza kutoka kwa pete kubwa ndani ya utupu kati ya pete mbili na kukufanya uzunguke bila mwisho, na kuunda kelele ya kusaga kwa sauti kubwa na ya aibu. Labda ni 100% sio hii, lakini for other people with this same problem, check this. Make sure the gap is not more than or equal to the chain, otherwise you could have a triple crank with a double chain-ring set-up x3  AGAIN, highly unlikely. Not joking, this is probably impossible for you given what you said, but it's something possible for others, plus quite amusing for some readers to hear about a few derps.
