Kwa wote mechanics huko nje nina hakika unachukia mambo haya. Kofia za vumbi ni bane ya uwepo wangu. Ni nafuu na kuinama kwa urahisi. Nataka kupata better sturdier one for a bike I am working on. What do I want to look for? Is it just the sizing of the crank that matters or are there other factors?

Tuseme $ l $ ni lugha ya parameta kwa heshima na alfabeti fulani $ \ sigma $. $ K $ -slice ya $ l $ ni $ l_k = l \ cap \ {(x, k) \ katikati x \ in \ sigma^{*}} $, seti ya matukio katika $ l $ ambayo ina parameta $ k $. Darasa la ugumu $ \ mathsf {xp} $ ina lugha zilizowekwa $ l $ kama kwamba $ l_k \ katika p $ kwa kila $ k $, ikiwezekana na algorithm tofauti na wakati wa kukimbia wa polynomial kwa kila $ k $. Kila lugha inayoweza kufikiwa ya parameta iko katika $ \ mathsf {xp} $, na kuna lugha katika $ \ mathsf {xp} $ ambayo sio katika $ \ mathsf {fpt} $; Hii ni Pendekezo 27.1.1 katika Kitabu cha Downey & Fellows 2013. Walakini, $ \ mathsf {xp} $ inaonekana kuwa na muundo usio na maana zaidi ya hii, kwani mtu anaweza kudhoofisha darasa hili kulingana na jinsi kiwango cha kufunga haraka polynomial grows with $k$: for $\mathsf{FPT}$ the degree is constant, whereas for $\mathsf{XP}$ it can grow arbitrarily. Downey & Fellows does not mention anything about the structure of $\mathsf{XP}$ beyond Proposition 27.1.1, and the discussion in the Flum & Grohe 2006 textbook isn't much more detailed.  Following on from my earlier question Limits of variants of Independent Set? is there a name for the subclass $\mathsf{Q}$ of $\mathsf{XP}$ where $L \in \mathsf{Q}$ if there is a polynomial $g_L$ such that every instance $(x,k)$ in $L$ can be decided in at most $|x|^{g_L(k)}$ steps?  In other words, this class $\mathsf{Q}$ allows only up to $|x|^{\text{poly}(k)}$ time instead of $|x|^{g(k)}$ time for some arbitrary function $g$ as for $\mathsf{XP}$.

Baiskeli ya barabarani haiitaji breki za diski. Mimi hupanda mseto mwepesi wa Marin na tandem ya utalii. Wote hutumia b-brakes kwenye rims. Tandem ina tungsten-carbide rims, lakini hakuna kitu maalum juu ya wale walio kwenye solo yangu. Katika visa vyote viwili, isipokuwa nimebeba mzigo mwingi, naweza kuvunja ngumu ya kutosha kufanya magurudumu kwenye barabara kavu, kwa hivyo nguvu yoyote ya ziada ingepotea, lakini basi mimi ni mwanga. Sababu ya breki za RIM zinaweza kuwa na nguvu sana bila hydraulics is simply because they act further from the pivot point, the hub. This means they get more leverage. It's also the reason that larger disks are more efficient than smaller ones. A larger piece of metal as a braking surface also helps with heat dissipation. In theory you could get the same advantages by having a disk nearly as large as your wheel, but this would be heavy and impractical. Instead it makes sense to use the rim you already have.

Nilitumia bomba fulani, kusimama kwa mwavuli wa simiti ya zamani, na kamba kadhaa za baiskeli ili kufanya hii: imekusudiwa kunyongwa kwa Landrover yangu (sanduku la zana-magurudumu) kwa marekebisho ya jamii. Jambo lote halina maana na inafaa nyuma. Inaweza pia kufunga tarpaulin juu kwa siku za mvua, na hutoa ufikiaji rahisi wa toolboxes and spares in the back.  I also have some old plastic pallets that provide footing if its muddy.  The pictured scene was doing some video testing of freewheeling for a front hub motor compared to a normal front wheel hub.  This conclusively proved that the electric motor freewheels about the same as a normal wheel when unpowered.

Ndio, shida yako ni NP-ngumu, kwa kupunguzwa kutoka kwa kufanikiwa tatu. Utaftaji wa tatu: mfano: Viwango vya Boolean $ u_1, \ ldots, u_n $; vifungu $ C_1, \ ldots, c_m $ ya urefu tatu juu ya $ u_i $ swali: Je! Kuna mpangilio wa ukweli wa $ u_i $ ambayo hufanya vifungu vyote $ u_j $ kweli? Kwa kila boolean kutofautisha $ u_i $, anzisha tofauti halisi ya $ x_i $ pamoja na polynomials mbili $ x_i^2-0.9^2 $ na $ 1.1^2-x_i^2 $. Tunasema kuwa $ x_i $ inawakilisha Boolean kutofautisha $ u_i $, na kwamba $ -x_i $ inawakilisha kutofautisha kwa boolean $ \ bar {u} _i $. Kwa kila kifungu $ C_J $, anzisha polynomial moja inayolingana ambayo ni jumla ya vigezo halisi vinavyolingana na fasihi tatu pamoja na $ 1.1 $. . tu ikiwa kuna hatua nzuri kwa seti iliyojengwa ya polynomials. (Uthibitisho wa ikiwa tu): Consider a satisfying truth setting for the THREE-SATISFIABILITY instance. If $u_i$ is true, then set $x_i=1$, and if $u_i$ is false, then set $x_i=-1$. This makes all polynomials $x_i^2-0.9^2$ and $1.1^2-x_i^2$ positive. Since every clause contains at least one true literal, the sum of the corresponding three real variables is at least $-1-1+1=-1$, so that the corresponding polynomial yields a value of at least $0.1$.     (Proof of if):   Consider a positive point for the constructed set of polynomials. Then $x_i^2-0.9^2>0$ and $1.1^2-x_i^2>0$ enforce that either $-1.1<x_i<-0.9$ holds (in which case we set $u_i$ false) or $0.9<x_i<1.1$ holds (in which case we set $u_i$ true). Suppose for the sake of contradiction that under the constructed truth setting, some clause $c_j$ would contain three false literals. Then each of the three corresponding real variables is $\le-0.9$. Then the polynomial corresponding to that clause has value at most $-0.9-0.9-0.9+1.1<0$; contradiction.

Kwa kudhani f (x, y, d) ni kazi, na tunaweza kuitathmini kwa wakati wa polynomial na pembejeo x, y na d. Fikiria shida p1: na d kama pembejeo, inajumuisha $ (x^*, y^*) = argmax _ {(x, y)} f (x, y | d) $ ambapo x na y ziko two sets of variables.  Another problem P2: With y and D as input, computes $x^*=argmax_xF(x|y,D)$.  If we know P2 is NP-hard, can we infer the hardness of P1? Is P1 also NP-hard?

Ingawa nimechelewa kwenye mchezo, bado ni muhimu kuwa na kumbukumbu. Hii ni tofauti ya shida ya muundo wa bodi ya DART. $ X_i $ s ni alama kwa kila wedge ya bodi ya dart. Lengo ni kuhakikisha ikiwa mtu ataamua kugonga kipande fulani, kutakuwa na adhabu kubwa ikiwa mchezaji atakosa: pengo kubwa katika alama kati ya kabari mbili karibu. Kwa hivyo imeundwa kama kuongeza $ $ \ jumla_ {i = 1}^n | x _ {\ pi (i)}-x _ {\ pi (i-1)} | $ \ pi $ ni kibali na $ \ pi (0) = \ pi (n) $. Toleo lako ambalo linaongeza $ $ \ jumla_ {i = 2}^n | x _ {\ pi (i)}-x _ {\ pi (i-1)} |^p $ $ ni shida ya muundo wa bodi ya hoopla. Curtis have a greedy algorithm for both problems, and it is very close to your algorithm$^1$. The only difference is you are growing the list in only one direction, but Curtis grow the list in both direction: add an element that maximizes the difference to either end of the list.  Update :  Actually, this follows directly from an much older result that keep getting rediscovered: (maximum) TSP problem where the distance matrix is a Supnick matrix.    S.A. Curtis, Darts and hoopla board design, Information Processing Letters, Volume 92, Issue 1, 16 October 2004, Pages 53-56, ISSN 0020-0190, http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.ipl.2004.06.005.

Shida ni kwamba, ikiwa utalazimisha tairi kuwa sura ya mviringo, katikati ya kukanyaga labda ni 3 cm "mrefu" kuliko shanga. Hii inafanya kuwa ngumu kutoshea tire onto the rim, with the tube inside.  Once the tire has been fit and tube inflated the tread "stretches" to a more normal shape, but getting that initial fit is a challenge.

Ninachopata husaidia, ni: Gonga chapisho la valve kidogo ili kutoa mlipuko mdogo wa hewa (baada ya kufungua lishe ya mateka njia yote, kwa kweli). Hiyo husaidia kutuliza vitu na kupunguza shinikizo ndani kidogo ili iwe rahisi kuanza kusukuma hewa ndani. Inachukua tu bomba la haraka. Ikiwa hautafanya hivyo, unaweza kuhitaji kusukuma kidogo zamani shinikizo la tairi ili kuanza kusukuma hewa ndani. Valve ya Schrader ni valve iliyojaa spring ambayo kichwa cha pampu hufungua kwa kusukuma chini kwenye pini. Hiyo inamaanisha kwamba mara tu kichwa kinaposhiriki, shinikizo linasawazishwa kati ya hose ya pampu na bomba la ndani la tairi. Unaposhiriki kichwa, hewa zingine hutoka kwenye bomba ndani ya kichwa cha pampu and hose, and when you work the pump, you're immediately pumping air into the tube/tire.  A Presta valve doesn't have a spring. The valve is kept closed with air pressure, and the captive nut helps ensure nothing bumps the valve open. The pump head generally does not press down to force the valve open, and instead the valve is opened by increasing the pressure in the hose past the pressure inside the tube/tire. You generally have to pump until the pressure in the pump/hose/head matches what's in the tube before any air actually flows into the tube/tire, and sometimes a bit past that.  I suspect that the "pop" you're hearing is when external (hose) pressure overcomes the Presta valve, it opens up, and pressure equalizes suddenly between the pump hose and the tube.

Inajulikana kuwa ikiwa $ e = dtime (2^{o (n)}) $ haijapatikana kwa ukubwa wa $ (2^{\ varepsilon \ cdot n}) $ kwa $ \ varepsilon> 0 $ kisha $ bpp = P $ (https://dl.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=258590). (Kwa kweli, dhana yenye nguvu kidogo inahitajika, yaani, kujitenga kati ya $ e $ na ukubwa wa $ (2^{\ varepsilon \cdot n})$ should hold for almost all input lengths - thanks to Ryan O'Donnel for pointing it out.)  More generally, this paper gives a direct optimal translation of any circuit lower bound into a corresponding derandomization result: http://users.cms.caltech.edu/~umans/papers/SU01-final.pdf

Nadhani shida yako inaweza kutatuliwa kwa wakati wa polynomial isiyo ya kawaida, ikiwa uzani umefungwa polynomially katika saizi ya grafu. Unaweza kutumia mbinu kulingana na algorithm inayolingana ya algebra na Mulmuley, Vazirani, na Vazirani. Imekuwa muhimu kwa matumizi kama hayo hapo zamani, ona kwa mfano pendekezo la 9 na majadiliano yaliyotangulia katika karatasi ya Daniel Marx https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ipl.2003.09.016. Katika wakati wa polynomial bila mpangilio, unaweza kuamua ikiwa kuna kulinganisha kamili ambayo uzito wake ni thamani iliyowekwa, kwenye grafu iliyo na uzani na uzani uliofungwa polynomially kwenye saizi ya graph. Sasa, sema grafu yako ina vertices $ n $ na uzito wa juu ni $ W $. Uzani tena kingo nyekundu za grafu kama ifuatavyo: Ikiwa uzito wa asili ulikuwa X, uzani mpya unakuwa $ (NW + 1) + x $. . ... nW]$, is a perfect matching with 0 red edges. If its total weight is in the interval $[2(nW+1) ... 2(nW+1) + nW]$, then it is a perfect matching with exactly 2 red edges. In general, from the weight range you can infer the number of red edges.   Hence to find a minimum-weight matching with an even number of red edges, it suffices to go over all the weight ranges corresponding to matchings with an even number of red edges, testing for each weight in that range whether there is a perfect matching of that weight, and scaling the weight of each re-weighted matching back based on the number of red edges contained in it, to figure out which of these corresponds to the minimum-weight even-red perfect matching in your original graph. By standard self-reduction techniques, you can then also extract the matching itself rather than just the value, but you might have to boost the success probability by doing multiple trials to get an overall good success probability when doing self-reduction.

Hili ni swali ngumu kujibu, kwa sehemu kwa sababu haijulikani inamaanisha nini kupata kitu "kwa bahati mbaya". Mara kwa mara, hata hivyo, watu huingia kwenye kosa la kutokubaliana kwa ulimwengu wa CoQ, kama googling fulani ya haraka itaonyesha (k.m. hapa). Kwa kweli hii wakati mwingine hufanyika kwa bahati mbaya, wakati mwingine katika jaribio la kuonyesha kutokwenda au kupima mipaka ya prover. Moja ya vyanzo vikubwa vya kutokubaliana kwa ulimwengu bila kushangaza hutoka kwa kujaribu kujaribu formalize category theory in Coq, as is mentioned in this article by Gross, Chlipala and Spivak.  In most cases, it's hard to tell whether the inconsistency comes from an actually inconsistent statement, or just a limitation of the proof checker, which sometimes has counter-intuitive restrictions on universes, particularly in the allowed parameters for inductive types. This is actually a somewhat tricky subject (see the official definition and Chlipala's more accessible discussion).

Lemma ya kukata (a.k.a. mtengano wa seli Lemma) inasema kwamba kupewa $ n $ mistari katika ndege inawezekana kuigawanya katika $ o (r^2) mikoa ya $ (hata pembetatu) kwa $ 1 \ le \ le n $ kama hiyo Kwamba mambo ya ndani ya mkoa wowote yanaingiliana na $ O (n/r) $ $. Kwa more see e.g. Matousek's book Lectures on Discrete Geometry or this post.  My question is whether the plane can be divided by $O(r)$ lines (into $O(r^2)$ regions) such that the interior of any region is intersected by $O(n/r)$ of the original lines.
Lebo hii inapaswa kutumiwa kwa maswali kuhusu the conduct of research in TCS.

Hivi sasa kuendesha cog 18T nyuma na 42T kwenye crank, na uwiano wa 2.333 '. Ningependa kuongeza uwiano na kuwa na kaseti kwenye kitovu cha nyuma, na cog 16T. Ninashuku kuwa washer wa spherical wapo, waliohifadhiwa tu kwa mikono ya kuvunja ili wasisonge (vijiti vya aluminium kwa aluminium). Unaweza kujaribu kutenganisha kabisa mmoja wao kuchunguza washer. Lakini "kutofaulu" kuvaa unaonyesha kwenye picha yako ya kwanza ni kweli hata - ningefurahi na hiyo. Na, kando na milimita ya kwanza au hivyo, "toe-in" haitaathiri kuvaa pedi ya kuvunja sana. If your pads are wearing out rapidly it's likely due to some other issue -- poor quality pads (or just the wrong ones for your use), rough rim surface, etc.  Keep in mind that pads are available in several different hardnesses, from soft and "grabby" to so rock-hard that you have to be a gorilla to squeeze the things.  Generally, the softer the pad, the faster it will wear.

Fikiria grafu ya bipartite $ g = (x, y) $, kwamba kiwango cha node ya kushoto $ x \ katika x $ ni $ l $, na kiwango cha node ya kulia $ y \ katika y $ ni $ r $ . Idadi ya kingo ni $ | e | = | x | l = | y | r $. Chagua nodi za $ W $ katika $ x $ kwa nasibu. Tunachukua kifungu cha $ G $ kwa kuunganisha kwa bahati nasibu $ wl $ soketi za nodi zilizochaguliwa $ W $ ili kutofautisha nodi za kulia $ y '\ subseteq y $. Hiyo ni, nafasi ya mfano ni vibali vyote kutoka kwa $ WL $ soketi hadi soketi kwa $ y $. Katika kifungu halali, angalau soketi mbili za kila $ y '\ katika y' $ imeunganishwa. I want to calculate the probability of a valid subgraph with a particular right-degree distribution. That is, what is the probability of a valid subgraph that has $c_1$ right-nodes of degree $r_1$, $c_2$ right-nodes of degree $r_2$ and so on.  I know how to calculate the probability that a subgraph is valid, which is  $$\frac{{{\rm{coef}}\left( {{{\left( {{{\left( {1 + y} \right)}^r} - 1 - ry} \right)}^{\left| Y \right|}},{y^{wl}}} \right)}}{{{|X|l \choose wl}}},$$ where ${{\rm{coef}}\left( {f\left( x \right),{x^i}} \right)}$ is the $i$th coefficient $f_i$ of $f\left( x \right) = \sum\limits_{i \ge 0} {{f_i}{x^i}}$. However, I am not sure how to proceed.

KUMBUKA: Eigenvalues zote ambazo ningerejelea hapa chini ingekuwa ya matrix ya adhira ya grafu swali langu linatokana na kusoma juu ya picha za kupanua kutoka vyanzo tofauti tofauti. Ufafanuzi wa kawaida wa grafu za kupanua ambazo zimeona ni katika suala la pengo la kuvutia ambalo ni $ d - \ lambda _2 $ ambapo $ \ lambda _2 $ ni eigenvalue ya pili. Walakini vyanzo vingine pia vinapenda kufafanua upanuzi kwa suala la $ \ lambda $ ambayo ni eigenvalue ya pili kwa thamani kabisa. Sasa nimechanganyikiwa kidogo juu ya nini ufafanuzi bora na kwa nini maadili haya mawili yamechanganywa katika fasihi? Kwa mfano usawa wa Cheeger hufafanuliwa kwa suala la $ \ lambda _2 $ na mchanganyiko wa upanuzi Lemma is defined is terms of $\lambda$ (I am not sure if there exist versions of each in terms of the other quantity). Also I have seen versions of the Alon-Bopanna bound in terms of both $\lambda$ and $\lambda _2$.   I guess my question is that is there a fundamental connection between these two quantities and is one more natural than the other to be used to define expansion ?  Also is there something fundamental that $\lambda _n$ (by $\lambda _n$ I mean the smallest eigenvalue) represent ?     I am not sure if I have been able to express my confusion clearly but I am sure I am missing something fundamental in my understanding.  Thanks

Mbele ya mbele sio sehemu muhimu ya kuongeza, kwa maoni yangu, kwani inagusa tu mnyororo wakati wa kuendeshwa (ikizingatiwa imewekwa kwa usahihi ili mnyororo usisumbue). Nina shaka Shimano anauza derailleurs yoyote ambayo "haifanyi kazi" ya kugeuza gia, kwa hivyo wakati mbaya zaidi mbele itakuwa mbaya zaidi na vifaa vitazidi zaidi. You can also switch the derailleur later, and especially the front ones are not particularly expensive (in fact both of the ones you mentioned are such low-end ones that it would make little sense to buy either separately).  So, choose the bike that has the nicest frame, fit, and feel for you. Replace individual components later if you are not happy with some of them.

Baada ya kujadili haya na Michael T. Goodrich, inaonekana kwamba algorithm inayofanana ya Cole kwa Erew Pram hufanya kazi hiyo. Tazama Richard Cole: "Sambamba Unganisha". Siam J. Comput. 17 (4): 770-785 (1988). Katika algorithm hiyo kuna raundi za $ O (\ logi n) na katika kila mzunguko kila kitu kinashiriki katika kulinganisha $ O (1) $. (Moja has to understand the algorithm to see that we do not abuse of making copies of each element.)  An extension of that algorithm for parallel pointer machine is given in    M.T. Goodrich, S.R. Kosaraju: "Sorting on a Parallel Pointer Machine with Applications to Set Expression Evaluation". J. ACM 43(2): 331-361 (1996).

Ni mwaka mmoja baadaye, lakini bado haujakubali jibu, kwa hivyo ndivyo nilivyoweza kuikaribia. Kumbuka kwamba napenda baiskeli barabarani na fikiria baiskeli kwenye mfumo wa kati ni mchezo wa kufurahisha na wa kufurahisha ... Baada ya kuangalia ramani yako na kutumia wakati mdogo na mtazamo wa barabarani, chaguo langu la kwanza litakuwa njia ya barabara kuu dhahiri , angalau kwa sehemu: Eastbound: Avenida Manuel Ordoñez kwa Díaz Ordaz (Hwy 54). Westbound: Chukua baiskeli yako juu ya daraja la watembea kwa miguu na uchukue Díaz Ordaz kwenda Avenida Manuel Ordoñez. Barabara kuu hapa inaonekana kuwa na barabara nzuri (barabarani) pande zote kwa wote au karibu urefu wote unaofaa, kwa hivyo haifai kuwa wazi kwa trafiki. Wasiwasi wangu mkubwa juu yake ni ukosefu wa alama za njia, ingawa hiyo sio wasiwasi mkubwa. Labda ningetumia road, as I see parked cars on the sidewalk at some points.  Going westbound, there are two left lanes onto Av Manuel Ordoñez, take the rightmost of the two and wait for the light to change like everyone else. After you cross the light, though, try to sprint for a few hundred meters, until the point where your lanes shift back over to the right; this section has no shoulders or pavement and so you will probably find yourself a bit squeezed here. As long as you're moving, it shouldn't really be a big problem.    I also think you should try this on a non-work day, when traffic is lighter, at least for practice, so that you can become more accustomed to riding with traffic. Perhaps several such rides before you do it for real on a Monday morning when traffic will be a bit heavier.

Baiskeli yangu ina dynamo ya kitovu kwenye gurudumu la mbele. Hivi majuzi nimebadilisha uma wa zamani na ile iliyotumiwa nilipata kutoka kwa kilabu changu cha baiskeli. Mpya ina vidokezo vya kurekebisha kwa upande mwingine wa uma. Kwa sababu kitovu has only one connector for the wires, it would need to be installed contrary to the indicated running direction.   I  recently saw this question, and it is partially answering my question. To follow up: How, if at all, does the dynamo change the situation?

Nina pampu ya sakafu ya michezo ya Lezyne. Imefanya kazi vizuri kwa miaka kadhaa, na inaishi katika karakana yangu. Ushughulikiaji umehifadhiwa katika nafasi ya chini, kwa hivyo silinda haina kitu kabisa. Pampu inakaa kwenye sakafu ya zege. Mgodi una mtindo wa zamani wa chuck juu yake. Leo nilienda kuitumia wakati nikipiga tairi ya barabarani, na kusukuma kushughulikia ilikuwa ngumu, na hakukuwa na hewa inayoingia kwenye bomba hadi chachi ilipogonga 80psi. Tube haikuwa kwa 80psi - ilikuwa uchi na labda ilifanyika 5-10psi. Niliangalia schrader/presta adapter/pressure release thinking something was stuck in it, but that's just a threadded tube and was clear.  So I checked with the hose nozzle in my and it blew air with no resistance.   BUT it was very cold and my hand got damp.  Imagine a wet sneeze, but cold.  Aiming the hose at a clean dry surface, I gave it a pump and there's moisture visible.   30-40 pumps later the moisture is much reduced.  Questions   Does my pump have water in it?   How did water get in there? How do I get it out?

Mapendekezo maalum ya bidhaa hayana mada hapa. Kwa upande wa wafanyabiashara wa baiskeli, ingawa, kuna mambo kadhaa ya kuzingatia. FIT labda ni muhimu zaidi - watendaji hawapaswi tu lakini kutoa kibali kinachofaa kwa matairi ambayo unaweza kuwa unatumia (ukizingatia kwamba matairi yaliyowekwa wazi yanahitaji kibali zaidi). Baada ya hapo unahitaji kuzingatia urahisi/nguvu ya mfumo wa kuweka, nguvu ya fender kwa ujumla, na chanjo iliyotolewa. Kuhusiana na kibali, jambo moja unahitaji kufanya ni kubaini kipenyo na upana wa matairi ambayo utakuwa ukitumia na kulinganisha hiyo na vielelezo vya fender. The couple of times I've bought fenders online this has worked for me.  Added:  One important thing to consider is toe clearance on the front fender.  Usually any fender will result in some minor toe clearance issues, but there's a difference between your toe occasionally brushing the flexible plastic fender and your foot jamming against an oversized stiff metal fender.  And another thing:  If you have plans to ride in the snow then either avoid fenders entirely or get ones that are easily removed.  In the right connditions snow will quickly become jammed between tire and fender and make you grind to a halt.

With aluminum frames, or frames with odd geometry you may need a different approach.

Fikiria shida ifuatayo: Acha kuwe na seti ya $ n $ vitu $ a = \ {z_1, ..., z_n \} $, na wacha $ w $ iwe nambari nzuri. Kila kitu $ z_i $ ina thamani ya $ v_i $ na uzito $ w_i $. Kupata subset $ kama $ ya $ A $ ili uzito wa $ kama $ ni chini ya $ w $ na thamani ya $ kama $ (jumla ya thamani ya vitu vyake) imeongezwa ni shida ya 0/1 knapsack Sasa, fikiria kupotoka kutoka kwake ambapo vitu vilivyo katika $ A $ vina uhusiano fulani wa utegemezi kati ya kila mmoja, na utegemezi huu unaweza kutekwa na graph ya acyclic iliyoelekezwa $ G (A, E) $. Thamani ya $ $ kama $ sio tena jumla ya thamani ya vitu kwa $ kama $. Kwa kila kitu kwa $ kama $, thamani yake inategemea ambayo vitu vingine pia ni katika $ kama $. Zaidi rasmi, hii ndio jinsi tunavyohesabu thamani ya bidhaa $ V $ kwa $ kama $. Acha $ a $ iwe babu wa karibu wa $ V $ katika $ G $ ambayo pia ni $ kama $. Halafu mchango wa $ V $ kwa thamani ya $ kama $ itakuwa thamani yake mwenyewe, pamoja na thamani ya mababu wote kwenye njia kati ya $ V $ na $ A $. (Kwa kuwa hii ni a DAG, there could be many of these ancestors. See formalization below).  This problem has important applications in computational workflow systems where you have limited storage, and you want to optimize the computational time of running a workflow (represented by a DAG) by storing some of the intermediate datasets for future use.  My questions  The problem is obviously NP-Hard because the Knapsack problem can be reduced to it. I have a feeling that it is likely that no pseudo-polynomial algorithm exists for it. Do you know of a problem that I could use to reduce to my problem to confirm those feelings? Or do you think that it is possible to produce a pseudo-polynomial algorithm for this?  EDIT: FORMALIZATION ON HOW TO COMPUTE VALUE OF $AS$  To succinctly define the value of $AS$ I will add to the notation from above a little bit. Let $v(z_i)$ be equivalent to $v_i$ from above. Then $v(z_i|AS)$ reads: value of node $z_i$ given answer set $AS$.   If $z_i \in AS$, then $v(z_i|AS)=0$.  Otherwise, if $z_i \not\in AS$, $v(z_i|AS) = v(z_i) + \sum_{z_j \in parents(z_i)}{v(z_j|AS)}$   Those two definitions are enough to then say that:  $value(AS) = \sum_{z_i \in AS}{v(z_i|AS-\{z_i\})}$  END OF EDIT

Katika (Sniedovich 2006) "Algorithm ya Dijkstra ilirekebishwa: Nguvu ya programu ya nguvu", Sniedovich inatupatia tafsiri nyingine ya algorithm ya Dijkstra kama utekelezaji wa programu ya nguvu. Kwa udadisi, nilipata Kitabu cha Kihistoria cha Bellman 1954: "Programu ya Dynamic", ambayo Bellman anasisitiza programu ya nguvu juu ya kanuni ifuatayo ya Uadilifu (ukurasa wa 84): sera bora ina mali ambayo hali yoyote ya hali na uamuzi wa awali ni,, Maamuzi yaliyobaki yanaunda bora policy with regard to the state resulting from the first decision.   This is the core of dynamic programming while my feeling is that it's exactly the same as the "Principle of Greed".   So the question is, are DP and Greedy algorithms just two different views of exactly the same thing? Or let's say that they share the same philosophy? If the answer is no, what are the main differences between them?

Karatasi hii inatoa mfano wa GI ya polynomial kwa grafu fulani. Labda mimi sielewi karatasi, lakini inaonekana kwangu inamaanisha polynomial GI kwa ujazo, $ 4 $ -regular na labda kiwango cha juu cha grafu za kawaida. GI kwa grafu za kawaida ni GI kamili. Kwenye uk. 7 Grafu $ H (A, B, C) $ zimefafanuliwa. Wao ni blaw na $ A+B $ majani, $ A $ edges imegawanywa na $ C $ vertices iliyotengwa imeongezwa. Kwenye uk. 8 Theorem 4. Isomorphism ya $ (H (0, B, C), \ Overline {H (0, B ', C'))} $-Grafu za bure ni katika $ P $ wakati: (2.) $c, c′ \le 1$ and $b, b' \ge 1$.  Take $c=c'=1,b=b'=5$.  $H=H(0,5,1)$ is $K_{1,5} + K_1$.  Both $H$ and $\overline{H}$ have degree $5$ vertex, so neither can be induced subgraph of cubic or $4$ regular graph.  By taking larger $b$ this works for higher degree regular graphs.   Does the paper imply GI is in $P$ for cubic and $4$-regular graphs? Does the paper imply GI is in $P$ for higher degree regular graphs (the running time might depend on $b$, not sure)?

Katika kompyuta ya quantum, kuamua umbali wa nambari ya nambari ya utulivu ni sawa na shida fupi ya njia kwenye hypergraph. Kila nodi kwenye grafu itakuwa aina ya ukaguzi wa usawa uliofanywa na nambari, na kila hyperedge itakuwa seti ya usawa huangalia makosa fulani ya mwili. Ikiwa utaunda grafu kwa usahihi, njia kati ya nodi fulani zitalingana na makosa ya kimantiki na umbali wa nambari utalingana na njia fupi kwa sababu njia fupi inalingana na idadi ya chini ya makosa. Kwa hivyo hiyo ndio motisha ya kupendezwa na shida ya njia fupi kwenye hypergraph. Nilifanya utaftaji wa awali wa algorithms zilizopo ambazo zinatatua shida hii. Kwa bahati mbaya, inaonekana kwamba utafiti uliopo unarejelea shida tofauti kidogo kuliko ile niliyokuwa nayo akilini. Hasa, kazi iliyopo inaonekana kuwa na furaha kupita kwenye kingo ambazo zinagusa nodi zisizohusiana na idadi isiyo ya kawaida ya nyakati. Katika muktadha wa hesabu ya umbali wa nambari hii itakuwa wazo mbaya, kwa sababu itasababisha ukiukwaji wa haki mahali pengine katika the graph. The "minimum length path" wouldn't successfully get back into the desired codespace.  The variant of the shortest hyperpath problem that I care about is as follows. Let $n$ and $m$ be the start and end nodes. Let $E$ be a set of hyperedges. $E$ is a hyperpath between $n$ and $m$ if $n$ appears in an odd number of the hyperedges of $E$, $m$ also appears in an odd number of the hyperedges of $E$, and all other nodes appear an even number of times in the hyperedges of $E$. I want $n$ and $m$ to be the only nodes whose corresponding parity check triggers when the corresponding errors from $E$ are applied. The goal is to find the hyperpath with the minimum number of hyperedges.  Has there been previous work on this problem? Note that I'm mostly interested in the case where the hyperedge degree is bounded (e.g. the error graph of the surface code typically has no hyperedges with degree larger than 4, even with circuit level noise and two qubit gate errors).

Kupata neno fupi la kusawazisha kwa DFA, ikiwa mtu yuko (au kupima vizuri uwepo wa neno la kusawazisha kuliko parameta $k$) is NP-complete.  See my paper: Eppstein, David (1990), "Reset sequences for monotonic automata", SIAM J. Comput. 19 (3): 500–510, doi:10.1137/0219033, Theorem 8.

Ninashuku kuwa kuna kitu kibaya na njia yako ya cable. Picha ya pili haswa ni ishara ya hii kwani nyumba inafika kwa caliper saa the wrong angle. Inspect the cable route from lever to caliper, making sure the housing is properly inserted into the lever and caliper, and any frame attachment points.

Hii ilikuwa ndefu sana kuchapisha kama maoni (kujibu maoni yako), kwa hivyo ninaichapisha kama jibu. Uthibitisho wa Turing wa shida ya kukomesha sio ya kihemko. Hapa kuna aya ambayo unaelezea kwa nini uthibitisho unakusumbua: kwa kuwa HALT () inaelezewa kwa nguvu kuwa na uwezo wa kuamua ikiwa mashine ya Kujaribu inasimamia, uchambuzi wowote ambao unafika kwa sababu hiyo unapingana na tabia hii haiwezi, kwa ufafanuzi, thibitisha kwamba halt () haiwezekani. Ufafanuzi wa axiomatic wa HALT () ni nguvu sana kwamba matokeo yoyote ambayo husababisha, au kusababisha, utata wa HALT () ni dhibitisho kwamba nadharia hiyo sio sahihi. Kimsingi, kama uwezekano wa kwanza, hakuna maana ya kuendelea na uthibitisho na chaguo hili kwa sababu tuna jibu letu- haiwezekani kudhibitisha kuwa shida ya kukomesha haiwezekani kwa kutumia mbinu hii kwa sababu imehakikishiwa kuamuliwa. Nadhani naweza muhtasari wa pingamizi lako kama ifuatavyo: Unasema, "Mara tu tutakapopingana na dhana ya awali ambayo HALT ipo, haiwezekani kuendelea na uthibitisho, kwa sababu tumekutana na upuuzi." Sina hakika kuwa ni sawa kusema kwamba shida ya kusitisha is axiomatically guaranteed to be decidable, but the point is that we've assumed that it is decidable, for no reason other than that we want to show that it isn't.  I'm not sure what you think a proof by contradiction (or negation--I admit I use the two interchangeably, even if I shouldn't) is if not this.  This may be qualify as decidedly "non-research level" mathematics, but in the interest of giving you a metaphor that may help I'll say this anyway.  Suppose I claim that I can build a spaceship that will fly to Alpha Centauri and back within ten seconds.  You could say, "Well, let's assume that that's the case.  Then you would have built a spaceship that is capable of traveling faster than the speed of light, which is impossible.  Thus, no such spaceship can exist."  This is (vaguely) similar logic to what is being used in the proof; we claim something can exist, then demonstrate an absurdity, and conclude that this indicates that it cannot exist.  If there's anything unclear about this, let me know and I'll try to re-explain.  Also please see the link I gave in the comments for alternate proofs of the Halting Problem.

Haijulikani kwa watumiaji wengi, wazalishaji tofauti wa kofia hutumia ukungu tofauti kwa helmeti zao. Kama tu bidhaa zingine za kiatu zinajulikana kuwa nyembamba au pana kuliko chapa zingine, helmeti zingine ni za mviringo zaidi, zingine pande zote, na zenye uhakika. Hata kutoka kwa mtengenezaji huyo huyo, mifano yao ya mbio inaweza kuwa tofauti na MTB, aina ya skateboarding, na mistari ya jumla. Na kunaweza kuwa na kofia na shimo la vent mahali pazuri huko nje. Ni muhimu kupata kofia ambayo inafaa kwa usahihi na vizuri. Inaweza kuchukua kwenda kwenye duka tofauti na kujaribu chapa na aina tofauti (au hata duka katika nchi tofauti, ikiwa una nafasi). Hiyo inasemwa, kupitia, if it were my head and I had to decide between a helmet that was partially shaved to fit -- or a larger helmet with some extra padding to fit; I would choose the latter. The helmet manufacturers provide extra padding pads of varying thickness in the box because they know they can't produce a helmet that fits perfectly on everyone's head. As long as the helmet is snug on your head and not uncomfortable, you should be good to go. Remember that many cyclists wear beanies in the winter and cycling caps in the summer under their helmets -- something that is well known to the helmet manufacturers.  Remember the worst helmet is the helmet you don't wear.

Kwa ujumla, kupanda kwa kusimama kunahitaji nguvu zaidi kuliko kupanda kwa kukaa. Katika hatua za mlima, waendeshaji wengi hupanda wakati mwingi wakati wamekaa. Walakini, kuna waendeshaji wengine ambao wanasimama kwa kupanda zaidi. Kwa sababu kusimama kunahitaji miguu kusaidia much of the body weight, therefore require more of the riders energy, bulkier riders are less likely to stand, while the more svelte riders may stand much more often. On flat sections, seated spinning is far more efficient than standing.

Nina suluhisho la sehemu, na ujenzi wa swali la kwanza na kwa swali la pili wakati $ n = 2 \ (\ maandishi {mod} \ 4) $. Hapa kuna ujenzi kwa $ n = 8 $ na $ n = 14 $. Hizi zinajumuisha ujenzi kwa $ n = 0 \ (\ maandishi {mod} \ 4) $ na $ n = 2 \ (\ maandishi {mod} \ 4) $, kwa kuchukua mraba wowote, kwa mfano 1,2,3, 6 Katika ujenzi wa pili, na kuibadilisha na ngazi kama inavyoonyeshwa kwenye picha ya tatu. Kwa swali la pili, ujenzi wa $ 2 \ (\ maandishi {mod} \ 4) $ hauna autorphisms zisizo za kawaida wakati $ n \ geq 18 $, kama we can recover the labeling. First find the added ladder and the pairs 1-2 and 3-6. To discern between them, note that the nodes 1 and 2 are not in any four-node cycle except in the ladder, while 1 and 6 are. Similarly 2 and 3 are not in a four-node cycle except in the ladder, while 1 and 6 are. Then you can uniquely discern 4 (only non-ladder node connected to 1), 5 (same for 6), 8 (only node connected to 3 and 5) and so on.

Sijui jinsi polygons zako zinaonekana, lakini labda toleo rahisi la algorithm ya Ramer -Douglas -Peucker inatosha: kwa kila sehemu ya convex, hesabu eneo $ a_j $ ya pembetatu $ p_i p_ {i+1} p_ {i+2} $ iliyoundwa na alama tatu mfululizo; Kwa kila sehemu ya concave, mahesabu ya eneo $ b_k $ ya pembetatu mbili $ p_i p'_i p_ {i+1} $ na $ p_ {i+1} p '_ {i+2} p_ {i+2} $ iliyoundwa na upanuzi wa alama mbili $ p_i, p_ {i+2} $ na hatua ya kati $ p_ {i+1} $ mahesabu ya $ min \ {a_j, b_k \} $ and delete the corresponding point (and shift points if the operation is done on the concave part); loop until $n-m$ points have been deleted.    The border of the polygon ($A_j$ green triangles, $B_k$ red triangles). On the right, the border after the elimination of two points.  For more complex algorithms you can search for "polygon generalization techniques" though your first condition (points in A are contained in B) implies some additional scaling operations.

Hakikisha unafaa tairi kwa usahihi. Chunguza mkate njia yote kuzunguka ukingo pande zote na hakikisha imekaa sawasawa. Nashangaa ikiwa bomba la ndani halipo vizuri ndani ya tairi karibu na valve. Sehemu iliyoimarishwa karibu na valve inaweza kukwama chini ya bead ya tairi. Kabla ya kuongezeka, kushinikiza valve ndani ya mdomo ili kuhakikisha kuwa bomba liko vizuri ndani the tire.  If you still have problems try marking the tire where it popped off the rim and mounting the it rotated 180 degrees around the rim. If it comes off the bead in the same place the issue may be damage to you rim that the loose fitting tire is revealing. If the same section of tire pops off the tire bead may be damaged at that point.

Labda hauitaji kununua crankset mpya. Unaweza kuondoa pete ambazo hauitaji na kuongeza tu pete mpya. Utahitaji kujua umbali wa mashimo ya bolt ya milo yako ya sasa/crank. Hii inajulikana kama BCD (kipenyo cha mduara wa bolt) na kawaida unaweza kuipata ikiwa imewekwa kwenye mnyororo. Ukubwa wa kawaida ni pamoja na 130mm, 110mm, 94mm, nk Kwa kweli, ungetaka mnyororo iliyoundwa kwa matumizi ya kasi moja. Pete iliyoundwa kwa njia nyingi za mnyororo zina pini, barabara na kukata meno ili kusaidia mnyororo vizuri kutoka kwa pete moja kwenda nyingine. Kwa kuwa mnyororo hautembei, hauitaji. Utafanya also need single speed chainring bolts which are shorter than double ring bolts.  You may or may not need a new bottom bracket. In a perfect world you want the chain to be in a straight line to the middle cog in back. If you mount your single ring in the middle position of a triple ring crankset you'll probably be good to go. If you decide to go with a dedicated single ring crankset you'll likely need a new BB with a shorter spindle length.  Chain needs are more a function of the rear cogs/derailleur than the front. Any chain made for a 7,8 or 9 speed drivetrain will work fine.

If the IPS proof system was a Cook-Reckhow proof system then the existence of polynomial-size proofs for the complement of subset-sum would imply an NP-algorithm for a coNP-complete problem. Natafuta kupunguzwa ambayo hupata grafu $ g = (v_g, e_g) $ na kutoa graph $ h $ ambayo inakidhi mahitaji yafuatayo. Ikiwa $ G $ ina pembetatu, basi $ H $ ina kikundi cha ukubwa 9. Ikiwa $ G $ haina pembetatu, basi $ \ mathrm {maxclique} (h) \ leq 4 $. Upunguzaji unaendesha kwa wakati $ o (| g |) = o (| v_g |+| e_g |) $. Jaribio rahisi litakuwa kuchukua $ H = G \ boxtimes K_3 $, hiyo ni bidhaa moja kwa moja ya $ G $ na $ k_3 $. Hii itatoa 9-VS-6, na sio 9-VS-4 inayohitajika. Jaribio lingine litakuwa kujaribu kuchukua $ h = g \ boxtimes g $ kuwa bidhaa moja kwa moja ya $ g $ na yenyewe. Hii inakidhi mahitaji mawili ya kwanza, lakini running time is quadratic. On the other hand, this construction gives something stronger, namely, if $\mathrm{maxclique}(G)=k$, then $\mathrm{maxclique}(H) = k^2$ regardless of the value of $k$. So maybe there is hope to change this product so that it works only for $k=2,3$ in linear time.    Remark 1: Note that we don't expect to have a linear time algorithm for finding a triangle, so I want a "real" reduction, and not an algorithm that looks for triangles in $G$.    Remark 2: Alternatively, I'd be happy with an explanation why such reduction is unlikely to exist (e.g., because the 9-vs-4 problem can be solved in linear time).

Algorithm ya umoja, ambayo Tarjan1 ilionyesha ilikuwa na ugumu $ n \ alpha (n) $, ambapo $ \ alpha (n) $ ni kazi ya inverse Ackermann, ilichambuliwa hapo awali na watu kadhaa. Kulingana na Wikipedia, ilibuniwa na Galler na Fischer2, lakini hii inaonekana kuwa sio sahihi, kwani hawakuwa na vifaa vyote vya algorithm vinavyohitajika kuifanya iweze kukimbia haraka. Kulingana na alama fupi za makaratasi, inaonekana kwamba algorithm ilibuniwa na Hopcroft na Ullman3, ambaye alitoa (sio sahihi) $ o (n) $ wakati uliofungwa. Fischer4 kisha akapata kosa in the proof and gave an $O(n \log\log n)$ time bound. Next, Hopcroft and Ullman5 gave an $O(n \log ^*n)$ time bound, after which Tarjan1 found the (optimal) $O(n \alpha(n))$ time bound.  1 R.E. Tarjan, "Efficiency of a good but not linear set union algorithm" (1975).  2 B.S. Galler and M.J. Fischer, "An improved equivalence algorithm" (1964).  3 J.E. Hopcroft and J.D. Ullman, "A linear list merging algorithm" (1971). 4 M.J. Fischer, "Efficiency of equivalence algorithms" (1972). 5 J.E. Hopcroft and J.D. Ullman, "Set-merging algorithms" (1973).

Gurevich hutoa ufafanuzi halisi wa nini mantiki ya kukamata ni. Mantiki ya kufikirika $ l $ ina seti ya $ l [\ tau] $-sentensi kwa kila msamiati $ \ tau $, na ramani inayoonyesha mali $ \ mathcal {p} _ \ varphi $ kwa kila $ l [ \ tau] $-sentensi $ \ varphi $. Mantiki ya kufikirika $ l $ inachukua wakati wa polynomial kwa $ \ mathcal {c} $ ikiwa kwa kila $ \ tau $, $ l [\ tau] $ inaweza kuamuliwa, kwa kila mali $ \ mathcal {p} $ ya $ \ tau $ -Uboreshaji ambao unaweza kuamuliwa kwa wakati wa polynomial, kuna $ \ varphi \ katika l [\ tau] $ ambayo inafafanua $ \ mathcal {p} $ kwa $ \ mathcal {c} $, kwa kila msamiati $ \ tau $, sisi inaweza kushughulikia algorithm ambayo inaamua $ \ mathcal {p} _ \ varphi $ kwa kila $ \ varphi \ katika l [\ tau] $. Mantiki ya infinitary $ \ mathcal {l} _ {\ infty \ omega} $ ni upanuzi wa mantiki ya agizo la kwanza S.T. Ikiwa $ x $ imewekwa basi $ $ \ bigvee _ {\ phi \ in x} \ phi \ textrm {na} \ bigwedge _ {\ phi \ in x} \ phi $ $ ni fomu. $ \ mathcal {l}^k _ {\ infty \ omega} $ ni mantiki isiyo na maana na tofauti za $ k $ tu. Mbali na swali ambalo darasa la $ \ mathcal {c} $ ya muundo wa laini (!), $ \ Mathcal {l} _ {\ infty \ omega}^k $ inaelezea mali zote za polynomial zinazoweza kuamuru, nataka kujua ikiwa $ \ mathcal {l} _ {\ infty \ omega}^k $ ni a logic in that sense.  First Question: Is $\mathcal{L}_{\infty \omega}^k[\tau]$ decidable for each $\tau$? We need an encoding for each $\varphi \in \mathcal{L}_{\infty \omega}^k[\tau]$ and a Turing Machine to decide whether $X$ is a set. Is it possible to provide a finite encoding for each $\varphi$?  Problem: If we want to define a Turing Machine which decides whether $\varphi \in \mathcal{L}_{\infty \omega}^k[\tau]$ we need a finite representation of $\varphi$. Approach: Let $\mathsf{FO}[\tau]$ be the set of all first order sentences over $\tau$. It is not possible to define a finite code for each $X \subset \mathsf{FO}[\tau]$ over a finite alphabet like $\{0,1\}$. $X$ is countable. However, $|\mathcal{P}(\mathsf{FO}[\tau])| > |\{0,1\}^*|$. Hence, there can be no bijective mapping from $\mathcal{P}(\mathsf{FO}[\tau])$ to $\{0,1\}^*$ (or any code with finite alphabet).  Second Question: The other thing is a model checking algorithm. Is there a model checking algorithm for $\mathcal{L}_{\infty \omega}^k[\tau]$ on each finite $\tau$ for classes $\mathcal{C}$ of finite structures? Can we make assertions regarding the run time? The basic ideas that on a finite structure it is sufficient to model check a finite $X' \subset X$ to decide.  Any ideas? Any references?

Katika karatasi yangu "Tatizo la muuzaji anayesafiri kwa grafu za ujazo" (J. Graph algorithms na Maombi 11 (1): 61-81, 2007) Nilithibitisha juu ya $ 2^{3n/8} $ kwa idadi ya mizunguko ya Hamiltonian , alifikiria kwamba iliyofungwa inaweza kuboreshwa hadi $ 2^{n/3} $, na ikapata familia ya grafu ambazo zina $ 2^{n/3} $ kuonyesha kwamba, if true, the conjectured bound would be tight. Heidi Gebauer ("On the Number of Hamilton Cycles in Bounded Degree Graphs", ANALCO 2008) improved the upper bound to $1.276^n$.  If one allows multigraphs then a cycle that alternates between single and double bonds has $2^{n/2}$ Hamiltonian cycles, and this is tight.

I got back in to road cycling.  I finished 2014 at 148 pounds with a 28.5" waist after riding 5266 miles mostly at an endurance pace, about 135 a week after ramping up when not dealing with other issues. At 5'10" that's somewhat meatier than climbing specialists in the professional peloton but skeletal by non-athletes' standards.

3-Sat inaweza kuwa shida moja. Hivi sasa bora zaidi ya juu kwa 3-Sat ya kipekee ni haraka haraka kuliko kwa jumla 3-Sat. . Algorithm ya Hertli inajengwa juu ya algorithm muhimu ya PPSZ ya Paturi, Pudlák, Saks, na Zane kwa $ k $ -sat, ambayo naamini bado ni ya haraka sana kwa $ k \ geq 5 $ (tazama pia nakala hii ya ensaiklopidia). Mchanganuo wa asili ulionyesha mipaka bora kwa $ k $ -sat ya kipekee kuliko kwa jumla $ k $ -sat wakati $ k = 3, 4 $; Baadaye, hata hivyo, Hertli alionyesha kwenye karatasi tofauti kwamba unaweza kupata mipaka sawa ya (algorithm ya PPSZ, bila kudhani umoja. Kwa hivyo, labda kipekee husaidia, na inaweza kurahisisha uchambuzi wa algorithms fulani, lakini uelewa wetu of the role of uniqueness for $k$-SAT is still growing.  There is evidence that Unique $k$-SAT is not too much easier than general $k$-SAT. The Strong Exponential Time Hypothesis (SETH) asserts there is no $\delta < 1$ such that $n$-variable $k$-SAT is solvable in $O^*(2^{\delta n})$ time for each constant $k \geq 3$. It was shown in a paper of Calabro, Impagliazzo, Kabanets, and Paturi that, if SETH holds, then the same statement is true for Unique $k$-SAT.  Also, if general $k$-SAT  requires exponential time, i.e. there is some $k \geq 3, \epsilon > 0$ such that general $k$-SAT cannot be solved in time $O^*(2^{\epsilon n})$, then the same must be true for Unique 3-SAT.  See the paper for the most general statement.    (Note: the $O^*$ notation suppresses polynomial factors in the input length.)

Kuna marekebisho mawili ambayo yanaweza kufanywa, kuna adjuster ya pipa (juu kushoto) ambayo itaonyesha mvutano wa cable. Kabla ya kuitumia, unapaswa kufungua cable kutoka kwa chapisho upande wa kulia wa picha hii, kisha vuta kebo hiyo vizuri iwezekanavyo na uimarishe. Ikiwa hiyo inasaidia au inarekebisha shida uliyoinua na unapaswa kuirudisha kwenye utendaji wake wa zamani. Unaweza pia kugeuza ungo upande wa kulia wa picha ambayo hubadilisha bastola kwa sehemu ya majimaji. Kawaida wakati imewekwa cable would be streched from the top left of the image to the top right where it is held in place, and when the lever is pulled, pulling the cable, it cause that plunger, or piston to actuate the brake piston. Turning this will adjust how much the cable cause the piston to plunge.   Just be sure to not pull the brake lever if there is not a rotor or bleed block between the caliper. Knowing how it works now, you should be able to try the above and figure out what works and what doesn't.  If all else fails it needs to be bled, have someone do it if you don't have the tool or knowledge to do it yourself.

Mantiki ya agizo la kwanza huja na vifaa vya aina mbili ya maneno: Kutofautisha: Masharti hayo ya fomu $ x $ kwa $ x $ $, ambayo kuna mipaka. Maombi ya kazi: Masharti hayo ya fomu $ F (T_1, \ dots, t_n) $ kwa $ n $-mahali pa alama $ f $, ambayo kuna mipaka, na baadhi ya $ n $ masharti $ t_1, \ dots, t_n $. Kwa mazoezi, aina moja zaidi ya neno hutumiwa kawaida katika muktadha wa nadharia iliyowekwa: seti ya maelezo ya fomu $ \ {x: \ varphi \} $, ambapo $ x $ ni tofauti, na $ \ varphi $ ni a Agizo la kwanza fomula iliyoundwa vizuri. Neno hili haliwezi kuandikwa tena kama programu ya kazi, kwani $ \ varphi $ sio muda. Neno hili linaunda wigo ambao $ x x $ inafungwa, sawa na njia ya fomula zilizokadiriwa za fomu $ \ forall x \ varphi $ na $ \ inapatikana x \ varphi $ kazi. Njia moja ya kuanzisha maneno ya maelezo yaliyowekwa ndani ya mantiki, ambayo basi hayatakuwa mantiki ya kwanza, kwa hivyo inaiita iweze kupanuliwa mantiki ya agizo la kwanza, ni kwa kuanzisha seti isiyo na mipaka ya waundaji wa muda ambao haujatengwa kutoka kwa mantiki ya agizo la kwanza Msamiati (unaojumuisha mantiki symbols, variables, function symbols, and relation symbols), and a new way of forming terms: $Cx\varphi$, for every binding term constructor $C$, every variable $x$, and every extended first order well-formed formula $\varphi$ (the definition of function application and of a well-formed formula should be modified to accomodate this new kind of term). Let's call such terms binding terms.  We can now set aside one of the new-fangled binding term constructors, say $\sigma$, and interpret every binding term of the form $\sigma x\varphi$ as $\{x:\varphi\}$.  Set descriptors are probably the most familiar example of binding terms, but two others that I know of have been proposed in the past by mainstream mathematicians, likewise in the context of set theory: Hilbert's epsilon operator and Bourbaki's $\tau$ operator, which, though similar, are not the same operator, as they satisfy slightly different axioms.  Note that extending first order logic with binding terms necessitates a corresponding extension of the inference system, say Gentzen's Natural Deduction.  Has the combination of extended first order logic with a corresponding inference system been studied? Where can I read more about it?

Sijawahi kufanya kazi au kusoma nchini Uhispania, siwezi kusaidia sana na habari za kawaida. Walakini, kama nilivyosema katika maoni, chanzo dhahiri zaidi cha ufadhili kama huo katika vyuo vikuu vya Ulaya (kando na vyuo vikuu vya ndani au vyanzo vya idara na halmashauri za utafiti za mitaa) itakuwa ufadhili kutoka Baraza la Utafiti la Ulaya. ERC ina aina nyingi za ruzuku, pamoja na mitandao ya mafunzo na ruzuku ya kibinafsi, ambayo mara nyingi inaweza kutumika kufadhili wanafunzi wa nje ya nchi. Kwa kuongeza, Tume ya Ulaya inatoa funding for postgraduates and postdocs via Marie Curie actions.  Further, there is the China Scholarship Council which also offers support for students wishing to study abroad.   Then there are the industry scholarships: Google, IBM, Microsoft, etc.  If either of the students is female, then there are more options (see Google's Anita Borg scholarship, etc.).  Lastly, many European countries have bilateral agreements with China or Chinese institutions which may be another potential source of funding.

Ikiwa sio hivyo, angalia gurudumu la nyuma kwa hiyo hiyo, haipaswi kuhisi gritty au notchy, na haipaswi kuwa na harakati za kando. Swali nzuri sana. Ni ngumu kujibu kwa sababu wazalishaji hucheza michezo na jinsi katika mwelekeo wote wanaamua wanaweza kuachana na kunyoosha nambari hizo. Wakati mwingine kile wanachoweka msingi wa maamuzi hayo inaweza kuwa kitu cha busara na utaalam kinachoendeshwa ambacho kinahusiana na unene wa ukuta au ujenzi wa mshono au chochote, na nyakati zingine ni bidhaa mbili zinazoita tube moja 700x18-23 dhidi ya 700x18-25 kwa sababu ya mwisho walijua wangeweza kuachana nayo na walitaka kuwa na tube moja ndogo ya kuwa na wasiwasi. Kwa ujumla wewe ni salama kuchagua bomba ambapo mwisho wa juu wa anuwai iliyochapishwa inalingana na saizi iliyochapishwa ya tairi. Hii inaelekea kutoa matokeo ambapo bomba, wakati imechangiwa tu ya kutosha kuipatia sura lakini sio kunyoosha, kujaza tairi kutoa au kuchukua kiasi kidogo cha kunyoosha, na ni rahisi kusanikisha. Hatua hiyo ya mwisho haipaswi kupuuzwa; Uharibifu au milipuko kutoka kwa ugumu wa kufunga bomba ni moja wapo ya njia kuu ambazo mambo yanaweza kwenda hapa, na hufanyika zaidi wakati tairi iko katika mwisho mdogo wa safu ya bomba kuliko kubwa. Mara tu ikiwa ndani, zilizopo hazijali sana juu ya kunyoosha kidogo au kubwa kidogo. Ni kweli kwamba tofauti hiyo sio ya sifuri, na kunyoosha labda ni mbaya zaidi kwa uimara kwa maana hiyo, lakini kwa kweli ni karibu sana na sifuri kwa muda mrefu kama ilivyo ndani ya safu iliyochapishwa, na wakati huo huo mpira wa ziada ni uzito wa ziada na shida ya ziada/ hatari wakati wa ufungaji. Kuwa na mpira wa ziada kwa sekunde haiongezei uimara na haipaswi kutamaniwa. Kwa hivyo jibu halisi labda ni kwamba, kwa kupewa ukamilifu kabisa haiwezekani, ikikosea kwa larger side is marginally more durable, but in practice it's more complicated than that because some much more meaningful percent of tube issues happen as a result of difficulty cramming in a bigger tube, which isn't likely to be an issue in the case of putting, say, a 23-25 tube in a 23, but can come into play in a more major way in some instances. And likewise, in actual practice, having a tube that tops out at the tire size you've got will virtually never cause issues, and has other advantages.  Manufacturers/brands tend to make more falsely optimistic choices when it comes to choosing what to print for the lower end of the range. A tube box that says "2.1-3.0" is a code from the manufacturer to the retailer for, "This may physically work in a 2.1 once you finally get it crammed in there, but it's going to be inconvenient and heavy, and we basically only did this to have fewer SKUs, plus 2.1 is way out of fashion and only needs to be catered to as an afterthought so who cares." Or they may have just put 2.1 on there instead of 2.5 because they thought the appearance of stocking versatility would give them an edge over the competition and they didn't care about damaging their credibility because everyone in the bike industry is always going broke, which encourages short-term thinking. That 2.1-3 is a huge range. If it's going to be an optimal fit for a 3.0, or even if it's optimal in a 2.8 and can be stretched to a 3.0, you're safe inferring they only got the other end of the range down to 2.1 by straight fudging the numbers.

Ninaishi Portland, Oregon, na zamani wa Seattle. Hali ya hewa ya Pacific NW ni sawa kati ya hapa na Redmond na mimi hupanda mwaka mzima. Kwa kweli ni mara chache "frigid", lakini mara nyingi ni baridi/baridi na mvua. Mvua ni muhimu zaidi kuliko baridi; Kwa hivyo unataka kuwa tayari kukabiliana na mvua mara kwa mara. Kama ilivyo kwa uchaguzi na kuvuka nchi, kwa sababu ya mvua zote, utakuwa ukipiga matope kupitia matope mengi wakati wa mvua. (Kwa kweli njia zingine katika mbuga na ardhi zingine za umma karibu katika msimu wa matope.) Kupanda on roads, commuting, paved routes is fine as long as you have the right set-up in terms of clothing and the bike itself.   To your edit about the cold...it's rarely that cold West of the Cascades in the Pacific NW. But, there are cold snaps lasting a week or two when Arctic air moves in.   I don't have an opinion about your bike choice, but matthew does have a good point about warranty and service by an LBS. And the Seattle area is home to quite a few reputable bike shops.

Jibu jipya kwa swali la zamani: sasa ni 2018, na matairi yamehamia kidogo tangu OP iliuliza swali. Hivi majuzi nimepitia mchakato kama huo kwenye 29er yangu, kwani ninakusudia kuitumia kwa likizo ya kupanda barabara mwaka huu. Niliamua kwenda na Schwalble Marathon Supreme (tairi nyepesi ya utalii iliyojengwa na teknolojia ya juu ya tairi) mnamo 700x40c hapa kuna mawazo yangu juu ya mabadiliko wakati wa kulinganisha dhidi ya mwisho wa juu wa XC isiyo na maji @25psi +chini 'bounce' wakati wa kupanda kwa sababu ya shinikizo la juu la tairi +kujiamini zaidi katika pembe barabarani kwa sababu ya kiraka kikubwa cha mawasiliano na hakuna kisu squirm +kuhisi bora wakati wa kushuka barabarani kutokana na kushuka kidogo chini bracket height +Marginal rolling speed increase on road (~0.5mph) -Marginal loss of rolling speed on gravel (~0.5mph) -Significant loss in comfort on gravel -Significant increase in 'skittering' and decrease in cornering ability on gravel -Sacrifices versatility to also tackle more challenging terrain.   I expect some of the new generation of 'gravel' tyres would sit somewhere in the middle in terms of gains/losses.  Overall, if converting a 29er to be used exclusively on road, I would recommend a fast touring tyre.  However for my case at least, i will be swapping back to an XC race tyre as soon as possible as I feel the speed gains on tarmac are no-where near as great as the loss of versatility.

Hii inaweza kuwa sio mahali pazuri sana kuanza kutoka wakati wa baiskeli. Kipimo chako cha inseam ni kutoka juu ya crotch (kiwango cha juu cha inseam) hadi upande wa chini wa ankle (sehemu ya chini ya ndani). Miguu yako huenda njia yote hadi sakafu. INSEAM ni haswa kuamua suruali unayovaa. Ninaweza kusema kwamba suruali na baiskeli hufanywa na ukubwa tofauti kabisa. Kama @DarkCanuck alipendekeza, ni bora kutumiwa kusimamishwa na duka la baiskeli la ndani (LBS) na kuwa na ukubwa. Watu wengi wa mauzo ya LBS watafurahi zaidi kukuweka kwenye baiskeli kadhaa na kukuruhusu uchukue safari ya majaribio, hata ikiwa unasema, "Sina mpango wa kununua chochote leo, ninaanza kununua karibu. " Haitakugharimu chochote na utaanza kupata hisia za jinsi mitindo tofauti ya baiskeli inavyohisi kwa ukubwa tofauti. Kumbuka pia hiyo standover is not the only measure you need to size your bike.  The TOP TUBE length will also come into play--depending on how long your arms and torso are.  Different manufacturers build different bikes with different ratios of top-tube-to-stand-over.    Depending on the bike, you will also want to consider handle-bar width, crank-arm length, etc.  Don't plan to buy a bike off of the internet because it has the right stand-over!  At least, don't be surprised if you do so and then it doesn't feel right.     Try out several actual bikes--even if they aren't ones you plan to actually buy--so you know how those different geometries feel when you're riding.    AND IF YOU'RE LOOKING AT A USED BIKE... it still pays to try out some new ones and know what geometry suits you.  When you are negotiating with a seller of a used bike, show up with tape measure in hand!

Chaitin katika karatasi yake ya 1976 Chaitin, Gregory J., Tabia za nadharia za nadharia ya Recursive Recursive, theor. Kompyuta. SCI. 2, 45-48 (1976). ZBL0328.02029. alisoma seti kama kwamba kuna b ∈ℕ na $ $ \ forAll n \ quad c (a \ upharpoonright n) \ leq C(n)+b.$$  where $C$ denotes the plain Kolmogorov complexity. These sets are known as C-trivial sets. Chaitin showed they coincide with the computable sets.  Interestingly, this is not so for the prefix-free Kolmogorov complexity version, the K-trivial sets.

Sheldon Brown alikuwa na nakala kubwa kwenye wavuti yake kuhusu sifa mbali mbali za tairi, pamoja na baadhi ya sayansi nyuma yao. Kusoma ambayo itakusaidia kuwa na habari bora wakati wa ununuzi wa mpira mpya. Tairi yako ya nyuma haionekani kama inahitaji kubadilishwa, kwa maoni yangu. Labda ina angalau 20% ya maisha yake iliyobaki kabla ya "inapaswa" kuibadilisha. Lakini, ikiwa unataka kuibadilisha, hii ndio ninayofanya: Nunua tairi 1 mpya, na uweke kwenye gurudumu la mbele. Weka tairi ya mbele iliyotumiwa kwenye gurudumu la nyuma. Kwa nini unapaswa kufanya hivi? Kweli tairi yako ya mbele ni "muhimu zaidi" kuliko tairi yako ya nyuma. Ikiwa yako are braking, or cornering, or going over bumps, it is more important for your front tire to maintain "grip" on the road surface. Over time and usage, tire rubber compounds tend to degrade, which decreases the amount of traction they provide. Newer tires will also (in theory) be more resistant to punctures. It is "better" if your rear tire blows out compared to your front.  Your rear tires will probably wear out twice as fast compared to your front tires (due to the heavier load on them), so by always putting the new tire in the front, you can ensure the front wheel always has good traction, which gives you a safer bike.

Tunaweza kufanya uchunguzi mmoja: ufikiaji wa kawaida wa Oracle hausaidii. Unaweza pia kurekebisha mapema seti ya maswali unayopanga kufanya kwa Oracle. Kwa hivyo, hali ni kwamba lazima kuwe na seti ya ukubwa wa polynomial ya viwango vya mgombea wa $ B $, kwamba kuna uwezekano kwamba angalau moja ya hiyo itafanya kazi. Kwa nini ufikiaji wa ufikiaji hausaidii? Hiyo ni kwa sababu unaweza kudhani bila kupoteza nguvu kwamba kila swala la Oracle linarudi 0. Kwa maneno mengine, ukipewa algorithm inayoweza kubadilika ya kutoa maswali, endesha algorithm hiyo na bandia oracle that always returns "no solution", record the list of queries it makes, and there's a list of candidate values of $b$ that a non-adaptive algorithm can use.  This yields a non-adaptive algorithm that performs as well as the adaptive algorithm.  As a consequence, since you want a deterministic algorithm that always succeeds, a necessary and sufficient condition is that there must exist a polynomial-sized, polynomial-time-constructible set $B \subset \mathbb{Z}_{>0}^m$ such that for all possible matrices $A$ there exists at least one $b \in B$ that works for $A$ (i.e., such that there exists $x$ so that $Ax=b$).

Kwanza na Formost: Ikiwa uko nje ya sura, hakuna vifaa vya vifaa ambavyo vitarekebisha hiyo. Ikiwa ndivyo unavyoweza kupuuza salama yote hapa chini na kwenda kufanya kazi ya kupata sura. Wazo kwamba misingi isiyo na picha haina faida sio sawa. Kuna sababu waendeshaji wa pro hutumia misingi isiyo na rangi. Ndio, nguvu nyingi za kusonga mbele zinapatikana katika hali ya chini lakini nguvu zingine pia hutolewa kwa hali ya juu. Tuseme uwiano ni 70% chini, 20% juu na 5% kila moja kwenye safi na kufagia. Sasa fikiria kuwa katika (ushindani) baiskeli tofauti kati ya mbele au nyuma ya pakiti mara nyingi ni suala la chini ya 1% katika utendaji kamili na unaweza kuona haraka kuwa kupoteza 20% kwenye upstroke yako pamoja na 5% juu ya kufagia kwako kunakuweka katika hasara kubwa. Sasa kuzingatia mavazi: kuweka kando usawa wako wa jumla na uwezo wa baiskeli, aerodynamics ndio sababu ya kwanza ya utendaji wako wa baiskeli. Acha nikuelekeze kwa Velominati inayojulikana kwa ufahamu: Sheria #18 // ujue nini cha kuvaa. Usipate machafuko ya kit. Hakuna kaptula za begi na jerseys wakati wa kupanda baiskeli ya barabara. Hakuna lycra wakati wa kupanda mlima bike (unless racing XC). Skin suits only for cyclocross.  By extension, an expensive bike will not make you faster. An aerodynamic bike will make you faster. You don't indicate what you ride now but instead of buying a new bike, have you considered upgrading the one you have now? Alternatively, have you considered buying a used road bike? Road bike components last for ever if well cared for. I ride a 1993 Klein Quantum 2. Last year I finally had to replace the rear derailleur but that is the only replacement I've had to make to date other than routine maintenance (OK, I also swapped out the fork for a carbon one but that was my choice rather than a necessity).  Finally, for the question of how many bikes you should own. To answer that question I offer more wisdom from the Velominati:  Rule #12 // The correct number of bikes to own is n+1. While the minimum number of bikes one should own is three, the correct number is n+1, where n is the number of bikes currently owned. This equation may also be re-written as s-1, where s is the number of bikes owned that would result in separation from your partner.

Hii inategemea mwelekeo ambao wanaingia. Kwa sababu ya baiskeli kuwa kimya, baiskeli kuwa na kipaumbele katika vichochoro vya baiskeli na wakimbiaji kutokuwa na macho nyuma ya vichwa vyao, wanapaswa kuwa wanaendesha 'njia mbaya', badala ya na na na Trafiki ya baiskeli. Kwa njia hiyo wanaweza kutoka njiani of oncoming cycle traffic.  Clearly there is no way short of public service broadcasts on television to inform runners on the correct etiquette for running in bike lanes. However, from a UK 'Highway Code' legal perspective, pedestrians are pedestrians whether they are crawling on all fours, walking with ipod plugged in or running 'narcissus' style.

Inaonekana np-kamili hata na uzani katika $ \ {0,1 \} $. Ninapunguza kutoka kwa shida ya Minsat: Kwa kuzingatia mfano wa SAT, pata mgawo ambao unapunguza idadi ya vifungu vilivyoridhika. Kwa usahihi, mfano ni formula ya CNF, na nambari ya $ k $, na lazima useme ikiwa kuna mgawo wa kuridhisha kwa vifungu vingi vya $ k $. Inaonyeshwa kuwa kamili katika karatasi hii. Anza kutoka kwa mfano wa Mins na vigezo $ x_1 \ dots x_n $ na vifungu $ c_1 \ dots c_m $, tunaunda mfano wa shida yako. Vector ya uzani ina kuratibu $ M $ (idadi ya vifungu). Makali ya kwanza ya grafu huweka kila kuratibu hadi $ 1 $. Halafu tunapitia nodi za $ n $ ambapo lazima uchague the truth value of the variables $x_1\dots x_n$. For instance if you set $x_i$ to true, the corresponding edge vector contains a $0$ for each clause $C_j$ where $x_i$ appears positively and $1$ elsewhere. The idea is that a clause is set to $0$ if the assignment makes it true. Since you use the product to evaluate a path, $0$ is absorbing and corresponding to the wanted disjunction. Finally, you have a path from the source to the target with weight at least $m-k$ if and only if there is an instanciation of variables satisfying at most $k$ clauses.  Reference: The Minimum Satisfiability Problem, Kohli, Krishnamurti, Mirchandani in Journal SIAM Journal on Discrete Mathematics 1994

Angalia ubadilishaji muhimu wa isogeny ya kazi kwa kazi nzuri juu ya diffie-hellman kama ubadilishanaji muhimu kulingana na isogenies kati ya curves za elliptic za juu. Hii itajumuisha ufunguo salama wa jumla. Waandishi wanataja kuwa hata ubadilishanaji muhimu uko salama itakuwa ya kuvutia sana kwa sababu za utafiti/ ufundishaji. Pia kuna utekelezaji wa cython na de feo ssike git. Nisingetegemea hiyo kwa salama ya kihistoria key exchange but it is a good starting point.  Additionally to the wiki page mentioned Adam Smith you might wonna checkout this website for a good overview of literature: pqcrypto. On that page you will also find a link to this document: Post-Quantum Crypto Introduction. Thats the introduction to a book called ''Post Quantum Cryptography''. On pages 6-10 you will find a technical overview of three ''common'' post-quantum cryptosystems.

Mimi ni mpya kwa kazi ndogo na ninasoma utangulizi wa kazi na matumizi ya chini (https://www.ima.umn.edu/optimination/seminar/queyranne.pdf). Katika utangulizi huu, inasema "kazi ya kuweka chini inaweza kupunguzwa kwa wakati wa polynomial. Kumbuka: • Kupunguza kazi ndogo ya f, kulingana na kizuizi cha moyo, kama vile | a | = b, au | a | ≥ b, au | A | ≤ b ni NP-hard when f is a cut function ".  In the remark, it says the problem is NP-hard if 1) there is a cardinality constraint and 2) f is a cut function.  What if only one of the 2 constraints holds, i.e. f is not a cut function but there is a cardinality constraint? Is this problem of minimizing f(A) still an NP-hard problem?

Sijui kuwa mtu yeyote hufanya sensor kama hiyo na siwezi kuona matumizi mengi kwa moja. Sababu ya kuwa na sensor ya gurudumu ni kuwa na kipimo sahihi na cha haraka cha kujibu kasi. Kwa kufuatilia jumla ya mileage, kuna programu za rununu ambazo zinaweza kugundua kiotomatiki kuwa unapanda baiskeli na kufuatilia mileage na kasi kwa kutumia GPS. As a down side, such sensor would require persistent memory to store the mileage data and some extra software to synchronize it and as result, end up costing more to manufacture. You can compare the price of a Suunto smart HR belt that does store few hours' worth of HR data to one that does not.

Hauitaji baiskeli nzito kupata kifafa, unahitaji kupanda mbinu sahihi na uangalie nidhamu inayofaa (mpango mzuri wa mazoezi) na kujitolea. Nadhani hoja mbaya karibu na uzito wa baiskeli iko katika kupuuza hali ya hewa. Kwa wazi, inachukua nguvu zaidi kuharakisha baiskeli 32 lb kutoka 0 hadi 20 mph kuliko kuharakisha baiskeli 15 lb kwa kasi ile ile. Walakini, mara tu kasi hiyo itakapopatikana, kuweka kwa kasi hiyo inahitaji karibu nishati sawa, kwa sababu ya hali ya hewa. Katika hatua hiyo, msuguano na Drag zina uwezekano mkubwa wa kukufanya kuchoma nguvu zaidi au kidogo. Walakini, unaweza kurekebisha kiwango cha nishati inayotumika wakati wa safari, kama vile unaweza kubadilisha njia unayoendesha ili kuokoa mafuta. Kanuni sawa zinatumika. Ikiwa utaendesha bila kupumzika, kwa mtindo wa michezo, kuharakisha na kuvunja sana, utamaliza kutumia mafuta mengi kuliko ikiwa unaendesha kwa njia iliyodhibitiwa zaidi. Ukiwa na baiskeli zenye kasi nyingi unayo njia mbadala ya kurekebisha madhumuni ya kupanda kwako, haswa katika eneo lenye vilima. Unaweza kupanda juu ya kilima kimoja kwa kufanya mambo mawili yaliyokithiri: tumia cog kubwa zaidi unayoweza kuweka, ukitembea kwa kasi sana lakini ukipanda polepole, ambayo itakuwa mazoezi ya moyo na mishipa, itafanya moyo wako kupiga haraka na utaweka pumzi yako haraka na nyepesi , Kufanya hivi mara kwa mara ni nzuri kwa kuchoma mafuta ya mwili, lakini lazima ifanyike mara kadhaa kwa wiki na kwa angalau dakika 40 (aprox) kila wakati. Au unaweza kupanda juu ya mchanganyiko mgumu zaidi wa gia, ukipanda polepole, lakini ukitoa nguvu zaidi katika kila kiharusi cha kanyagio. Utaunda misuli strength. Doing this regularly even only two times a week will quickly build muscular strength, but mostly in the legs only.  I have a lot of friends and know a lot of people who are heavy riders, this meaning they ride in a regular basis, but they are all doing slow uphill pedaling, they all have very strong and muscular legs but a lot of abdominal fat. (I personally am a little bit into this category).  Other riders who climb the same routes as we do, use lower gears and a faster cadence, we can ride side by side, so ground speed is almost the same. They have a better general physical shape, or at least they look so.  Comparing this two "climbing techniques" i can say that: I usually look more tired than they do while climbing, my breathing is slower and deeper than theirs, and my pulse is also slower and deeper (not measured, just felt finger on the wrist). BUT, in the other hand, I can usually keep going further and stay pedaling for a longer period of time.  I also do sporadic commute in a very hilly city, and I have tested both techniques and I can say, pedaling hard with slow cadence works best for me.  Because of this, I have come to the conclusion that slow cadence burns less energy "per minute", so I guess this is the less effective for loosing weight.  I wrote about my experience as a mountain bike rider, riding kind of "all mountain" style. I cannot speak for route riding, but it seems to me that it is a lot more cardiovascular.

Programu ni mashine ya Kujaribu ya Encoded. Na optimizer ya ukubwa wa mpango ni TM $ m_1 $ kama kwamba: kwa pembejeo yoyote $ m $, $ m_1 $ matokeo $ m_ {min} $ kwamba $ m_ {min} $ ni tm fupi ambayo ni sawa na $ M $. If size-optimization is not computable, the above $M_1$ shouldn't exist.    How do we prove this?  Does this also mean a size-optimality decider can't exist? Swali lako lenyewe sio la ujinga lakini aina ya jibu unayouliza ni. Ni nadra kwa mstari wowote wa kazi au uchunguzi wa kielimu kuwa na maelezo ya lami ya lifti. Sio wote wangekubaliana na tabia yako ya hisabati na fizikia kwa sababu wanapuuza kina na nuances ya uwanja huo. Wanasayansi wa kompyuta wa nadharia wanahusika na kusoma na kutumia hesabu. Mtazamo wa computational ni ya kina na yote yanayojumuisha moja kwa hivyo utafiti wa hesabu pia ni ya kina na ina athari kwenye maeneo mengine mengi ya masomo. Kila mchakato mmoja, iwe unatokea katika maumbile au syntetisk, husababisha habari. Wanahesabu. Kama ilivyo katika hesabu, kuna lugha tofauti na aina ya miundo inayohusika katika hesabu, kama ilivyo kwa fizikia, kuna sheria za msingi juu ya hesabu ambayo tunajaribu kugundua, kama ilivyo kwa kemia, mambo ya msingi ya hesabu yanaweza kuainishwa. Sayansi ya kompyuta ya kinadharia ni pana na nguvu ya kutosha kuwa na mtazamo wowote unaoleta. Maswali mengine yaliyosomwa ni: What is computation and how can it be characterized? (Turing machines, lambda calculi, tiling systems, register machines, DNA computers etc.) What is the computational model underlying a process? (Biological, chemical, economic, sociological processes, etc.) What is efficient computation? (complexity via time, space, communication, amortized, smoothed, etc.) What are characterizations of efficient computation? (Turing machines, algebraic notions, logic, type systems, etc.) What is the most efficient way to  compute a solution to a problem? (algorithms) How efficient are existing algorithmic processes (analysis of algorithms, statistical phenomena, market equillibria, etc.)   These are a small and non-representative sample of the questions that one may ask. As in any field, answers to some questions generate new questions and drive enquiry about other questions. You can find a rather dated view of the field by browsing the articles in the Handbook of Theoretical Computer Science.    Handbook of Theoretical Computer Science, Volume A: Algorithms and Complexity, 1990 Handbook of Theoretical Computer Science, Volume B: Formal Models and Sematics, 1990

You'll need parts and some normal bike repair tools:   Spoke nipple tool and probably some spare nipples Cassette removal tools - chain whip and lockring tool Freewheel removal tools - a bench vise and a freewheel tool, OR a grinder with a cutting wheel (mine was a non-removable chinese thing hence power tools) Chain tool Lubes Either a truing stand, or some way to use your bike frame/fork to true the wheel. Aina hii ya kutofaulu kimsingi ndio sababu ya aina ya stika ina sifa ya kutokuwa na kuaminika. Kuweka mchanga kwa uangalifu eneo hilo na kuifanya iwe safi iwezekanavyo (yaani, na pombe au kutengenezea bure, safi kuliko mtu yeyote anaweza kuipata upande wa barabara) wadi ya shida lakini haitoi. Vipande vya aina ya stika kimsingi ni bidhaa mbaya. Hauwezi kuamini bomba la muda mrefu, kwa hivyo unapaswa kuibadilisha wakati utafika nyumbani, kwa sababu ikiwa hautaweza kupata gorofa nyingine mapema au baadaye wakati itashindwa. Patches za kuvua ni bora. Mfumo wa kubeba bomba la vipuri na kitengo cha kiraka cha kutuliza, ukitumia kitch kiraka tu ikiwa utapata kujaa nyingi kwenye safari ile ile (inapaswa kuwa tukio la nadra sana), na kugonga bomba lako lililopigwa wakati unafika nyumbani ili iweze kuwa yako Spare ni maarufu na inaheshimiwa kwa wakati kwa sababu inafanya kazi na ni nafuu. Karibu haujawahi kutumia kit kitcanizing upande wa the road, and when you do it's no big deal because you've developed good technique. Vulcanizing patches make the tube as reliable as new, so it's fine to leave the tube in there and forget about it.  Self-adhesive patches play to peoples' desire for a simple one-step solution, contrasted to how vulcanizing patches do require a degree of technique and care - keeping track of where the puncture is, applying a nice even patch of glue that's the right size and waiting long enough for the it to dry, comprehending at all that you let the glue dry and then apply the patch, handling things carefully so as not to contaminate the patch contact surface or the tube with skin oils, etc. A lot of people running around now just can't and won't jump through those hoops, and in that sense there is a place for self-adhesive patches, but what's unequivocally true about them is they don't save time or hassle once the need to change the tube out again later is factored in.

Kwa kuwa mimi sasa ni mwathirika wa baiskeli ya duka, naweza kuongeza kiashiria kimoja kwamba baiskeli iliyotumiwa ilitoka mahali kama hiyo: kwa wakati ambao umemilikiwa, uendeshaji wake utakuwa umepungua zaidi ya matumizi yote hadi sasa yangehalalisha . Hii ni kwa sababu ya kukata kona katika mchakato wa uzalishaji. DSB zote ni nzuri na nzuri juu ya gorofa, uso wa kiwango (kama katika njia za idara ya toy ambapo baiskeli inauzwa), lakini baada ya matumizi yoyote magurudumu kupata magurudumu, kiti huanza kushuka, kuhama huenda, na na kadhalika. Ishara nyingine ya DSB iliyotumiwa ni kwamba itahitaji kiwango fulani cha TLC kuifanya iweze kufanya kazi. (Ndio, najua, mpya mara nyingi huwa like this...)  This is also a result of the corner-cutting in the production of these bikes.  Many of the features of quality bikes don't make them faster or more durable, but do make them easier to fix and/or maintain (like quick-release axles vs. bolt-on axles).  These features are the first to go when a maker wants to cut corners, and the result is a bike that is much more difficult to repair and/or maintain, so much so that the owner says "screw it" and doesn't bother.  (And unrelated to the question, but it's another lesson I've learned in this:  Never lend your bike to someone who has trouble holding down a job.  It seems that lacking a work ethic, and lacking respect for other people's property, correlate highly.)

Kwa kuzingatia maelezo yako unayo zilizopo mbili tofauti: moja na Presta Valve na nyingine na Schreder Valve. Wote wanapaswa kuwa na kofia za plastiki za kinga ambazo zinapaswa kutoka kwa urahisi. Inawezekana kwamba kofia kwenye valve ya gurudumu la nyuma imekwama ili wachezaji wengine waweze kusaidia kuiondoa. Kuhusu matairi ya kusukuma, pampu yako ya sakafu inapaswa have adapter for both valve types so you should use one that fits.   Maybe, if you have pump for only one valve type, you could consider changing your tubes to be of the same type (that matches the pump). Anyway, it is recommended to change tubes because they get porous and leak air (especially if they are too old).

Nimejifunza kutoka kwa kuzungumza na Ryan Williams (ambaye anastahili sifa kwa kuweza kutuma jibu hili) kwamba inajulikana kutoka kwa Paul na Pippenger kwamba Eval ya mzunguko inaweza kuamuliwa na wakati wa quasilinear multitape na pia hiyo there are reductions from multitape TMs to circuits which give only a quasilinear size blowup. That is, Circuit Eval has circuits of size $(n+s)\log^{O(1)}(n+s)$, as per your formulation.  There is a proof of this here on page 6 (see Theorem 3.1 (Folklore)).

Hili ni jibu la sehemu tu. Nadhani sio ngumu kuonyesha kuwa ikiwa swali la 1 linaweza kufanywa kwa $ o (n^2 \ logi n) $, basi inaweza kuwa swali la 2. Kwa hivyo kulingana na maoni ya Willard Zhan katika swali la OP, yako ya kwanza Swali linapaswa kuwa wazi vile vile. Kupunguza kunaweza kuwa kama ifuatavyo: Fikiria pembejeo yako kwa swali 2 ni $ \ {x_i \} _ {1 \ leq i \ leq n} $. Kisha ujenge pembejeo kwa swali 1 kama ifuatavyo: $ \ {t + x_i \} _ {1 \ leq i \ leq n} \ kikombe \ {- x_i \} _ {1 \ leq i \ leq n} kwa $ ya kutosha Kubwa mara kwa mara T. basi jibu kwa question 1 with these $2n$ points could be easily translated to an answer to question 2, as pairs of the form $(T + x_i, -x_j)$ in the answer to question 1 are easily differentiated from the rest, and correspond directly to the answer of question 2, taking into account that:    $|(T + x_i) - (- x_j) | = |T + x_i + x_j | = T + x_i + x_j > T / 2$ $|(T + x_i) - (T + x_j) | = |x_i - x_j | < T / 2$ $|-x_i - (-x_j) | = |- x_i + x_j | < T / 2$

"Mabwana wa mnyororo" wanaweza kusaidia. Imekuwa ni wakati tangu nimeangalia nakala yangu, kutoka kwa kumbukumbu ililenga zaidi juu ya usawa wa nguvu lakini nakumbuka sehemu ya uchambuzi wa sura ya msingi. Ukweli kwamba watu walitumia muda mrefu kujaribu kuja na hesabu rahisi (ish) kwa vikosi kwenye sura ya baiskeli na kushindwa kurudia kunionyesha kuwa mara tu utakapopata makadirio rahisi sana labda hautafanikiwa. Kwa hivyo umaarufu wa FEA na prototyping ya iterative. Vikosi kwenye sura ni ngumu sana, na sina uhakika kuwa kuna sehemu yoyote ya frame that could be analysed as two force member. The Slingshot bike had a cable downtube but that was an interesting bike to ride (twisting the handlebars visibly moved the front wheel sideways). Remember that there's torsion as well and bending and tension going on in most joints.  Looking at carbon fibre layup patterns will probably give you a better idea of the forces because fibre has very directional strength and is laid to resist the actual forces. Metals are homomorphic and gain a lot of unnecessary strength in a bike frame from being thick enough to deal with highly directional forces.
