Vivyo hivyo, lakini kidogo more expensive, you can easily buy a chainring with fewer than 45 teeth. Either of these (or both of them) will make your ride easier (and therefore ease on your muscles).   A site I like is Velosolo, not so much because they have great prices or anything (although I have bought from them and it was a good experience), but they have a good selection of single-speed/fixed-gear parts, so you can evaluate what your options are.   But make sure you keep your current parts as you'll likely want to put them back on the bike in a month or so.

Hariri: Jibu hili linatumia mfano uliokithiri, labda hauna uwajibikaji, nakubali, lakini ambayo ilijaribu kusema mambo kadhaa ambayo nadhani ni maanani halali kuhusu swali lililoulizwa: Sprockets zinaweza kutumika kwa muda mrefu sana ikiwa unabadilisha mnyororo mara kwa mara; Hiyo inaweza kumaanisha kuna kaseti nyingi zinazoweza kutumika zinazotupwa mbali ambazo bado zinaweza kutoa kilomita zaidi kwa kila pesa ikiwa imesimamiwa vizuri; Kubadilisha sprocket ni muhimu zaidi kwa sababu ya usalama kuliko kwa sababu haifanyi kazi tena, au kwa sababu inaweza kuharibu vifaa vingine (mfano ulioonyeshwa ulivuka suala la usalama wakati bado unafanya kazi vizuri); Kuna kikomo cha jinsi sprocket inaweza kuwa hata ikiwa bado inafanya kazi. Picha iliyoonyeshwa ni mfano uliokithiri (caricatural, kwa njia). Shukrani kwa majadiliano yenye matunda (tazama maoni), sikuweza kuhisi kama kumshauri mtu yeyote atumie sprocket yoyote kwa kiwango ambacho ninaonyesha kwenye picha hii. Mtu yeyote anayefanya hivi atakuwa katika hatari yake mwenyewe, na hiyo ni jambo mbaya. Haipaswi kufanywa. Sikuwa, na sikupendekeza, kupima kuvaa kwenye kaseti, lakini kwenye mnyororo. Ikiwa utaweka mnyororo mpya na kaseti, na haina kuruka, kaseti ni sawa, hata ikiwa meno ni nyembamba kuliko mpya. Hiyo inawezekana ikiwa utabadilisha mnyororo mara nyingi, kila wakati kwa mpya: basi kaseti huvaa polepole, lakini meno hayajaharibika kama njia (meno ya papa). Nilifafanua mengi juu ya hii katika jibu lingine: https://bicycles.stackexchange.com/a/7880/2355 Kwa kweli, wakati wakati wa teeth are SO THIN that they are pointy, or its width is significantly reduced, perhaps it's time to convert the cassette into a set of ninja shuriken (just kidding).  There could be problems with the indexing of gears if you are a fan of ultra-precise shifting, but that usually is not a great problem, and as far as I know don't cause damage to other parts of the shifting system, at least if it is not necessary to force the lever to shift up (could stress the pulleys - usually this is not the case).  At last, the proper way to measure for the CHAIN wear is the distance between pins, that should be exactely half an inch for each consecutive pair of pins. This can be measured in two ways:   With a chain wear measuring gauge/rule. This is very easy and precise. With a regular ruler. You must measure one foot of chain (12 pairs of links) while it is slightly under tension. If the distance increased by more than the thickness of a pin, then it's time to replace it.     Just for the record, this is a current picture of my internal-gear-hub bike with surely more than 25 thousand kilometers with the original cog. I must have used some eight chains on it, always replacing via measuring, either with a gauge or with a ruler. It works without issues (no skipping, no falling off, no grinding sensation). This is too much, I recommend not going so far. I has paid itself a long long time ago.

Sasisho tu juu ya suala: Nadhani shida ya ufanisi wa sababu ya mara kwa mara ni ya ubora, badala ya kuongezeka. Kwa kweli, sababu ya juu ya kila wakati husababishwa na tafsiri isiyofaa ya dhamira ya programu na mtangazaji wa lugha. Kwa maana hii, tunaweza kusema kuwa ni shida zaidi ya lugha za semantic badala ya utekelezaji wa kiufundi tu: na lugha ya kiwango cha chini kama C, lugha ya lugha haifai kufanya nadhani yoyote, kwani una udhibiti wa moja kwa moja wa wengi zaidi Maagizo ya kimsingi, na kwa hivyo huwajibika kwa mtiririko wote wa mpango. Ukiwa na lugha ya kiwango cha juu, unapata udhibiti zaidi wa mtiririko wa programu, ambayo inafanya iwe rahisi na haraka kubuni mpango tata, lakini kwa gharama ambayo unakabidhi muundo wa mtiririko wa programu kwa parser ya lugha: sasa lazima Fanya nadhani juu ya kile ulichomaanisha, na inaweza kuwa ghali sana ikiwa ni aina fulani ya mtiririko wa programu ambayo lugha ya lugha haikufanywa kwa (kama vile algebra ya mstari katika Python). Hii sio kwa sababu ya ukosefu wa uwekezaji wa waandishi wa lugha, lakini badala yake, kama kwa kiwango chochote of abstraction, you choose a balance between the conciseness of your words and their preciseness. A word like "humans" is very abstract and describe a whole specie, but it doesn't account for the particularities and all the culture of each individual in this group. Just like scientific jargon, high-level language parsers are designed to concisely and efficiently describe operations of the targetted paradigm, but they cannot describe as concisely every other paradigms.  However, now it seems that a new class of languages are emerging: annotated languages, such as Julia or Cython or Numba. They are neither really interpreted nor compiled but in-between: you can write high-level code that the "interpreter" will have to guess how to run the most efficiently possible (and correctly of course), or you can almost compile your code by annotation or by using other specialized constructs such as dispatching or semi-automatic unrolling/vectorization of loops, so that your annotations avoid the need to make the language parser to guess what you were meaning to do at lower levels of abstraction: in short, annotations give you the ability to give precisions on your high-level abstraction. We will see in the future if this concept works out.

Kupunguza KARP ni wakati wa polynomial kupunguzwa nyingi na moja kati ya shida mbili za computational. Kupunguza karp nyingi ni kazi za moja-moja. Hii inazua swali ikiwa kila kupunguzwa kwa KARP ni sindano (kazi ya moja-moja). Je! Kuna shida ya asili ya $ np $-ambayo inajulikana kuwa kamili only under many-one Karp reduction and not known to be complete under injective Karp reduction? What do we gain (and lose) if we define $NP$-completeness using injective Karp reduction?   One obvious gain is that sparse sets can not be complete under injective Karp reductions.

Uthibitisho wa msingi zaidi, na dhibitisho kidogo (au angalau huhisi hivyo kwangu). Kwa urahisi, andika $ \ varepsilon = \ frac {\ gamma} {\ sqrt {n}} $, na $ \ gamma \ katika [0,1) $ kwa kudhani. Sisi hupunguza kabisa usemi wa $ \ operesheni ya jina {d} _ {\ rm tv} {(p, u)} $: \ kuanza U)} & = \ jumla_ {x \ in \ {0,1 \}^n} \ kushoto } \ kulia)^{\ lvert {x} \ rvert} \ kushoto (\ frac {1} {2} - \ frac {\ gamma} {\ sqrt {n}} \ kulia)^{n- \ lvert {x x } \ rVert} - \ frac {1} } } \ kulia)^{n -k} - 1} \ kulia \ rvert \\ & \ geq \ frac {1} {2^n} \ jumla_ {k = \ frac {n} {2}+\ sqrt {n} ^{\ frac {n} {2} +2 \ sqrt {n}} \ binom {n} {k} \ kushoto \ kulia)^{k} \ kushoto (1 - \ frac {2 \ gamma} {\ sqrt {n}} \ kulia)^{n -k} - 1} \ kulia \ rvert \\ & \ geq \ frac {c} {\ sqrt {n}} \ jumla_ {k = \ frac {n} \ kushoto (1 + \ frac {2 \ gamma} {\ sqrt {n}} \ kulia)^{k} \ kushoto (1 - \ frac {2 \ gamma} {\ sqrt {n}} \ kulia)^{ n -k} - 1} \ kulia \ rvert \ mwisho {align*} ambapo $ c> 0 $ ni an absolute constant. We lower bound each summand separately: fixing $k$, and writing $\ell = k-\frac{n}{2} \in [\sqrt{n},2\sqrt{n}]$, \begin{align*}   \left( 1 + \frac{2\gamma }{\sqrt{n}} \right)^{k}\left( 1 - \frac{2\gamma }{\sqrt{n}} \right)^{n-k}   &=  \left( 1 - \frac{4\gamma ^2}{n} \right)^{n/2}\left( \frac{1 + \frac{2\gamma }{\sqrt{n}}}{1 - \frac{2\gamma }{\sqrt{n}}}\right)^\ell \\   &\geq \left( 1 - \frac{4\gamma ^2}{n} \right)^{n/2}\left( \frac{1 + \frac{2\gamma }{\sqrt{n}}}{1 - \frac{2\gamma }{\sqrt{n}}}\right)^{\sqrt{n}}    \xrightarrow[n\to\infty]{} e^{4\gamma -2\gamma ^2} \end{align*} so that each summand is lower bounded by a quantity that converges (when $n\to \infty$) to $e^{4\gamma -2\gamma ^2}-1 > 4\gamma -2\gamma ^2 > 2\gamma $; implying that each is $\Omega(\gamma )$. Summing up, this yields \begin{align*}   2\operatorname{d}_{\rm TV}{(P,U)} &\geq \frac{C}{\sqrt{n}}\sum_{k=\frac{n}{2}+\sqrt{n}}^{\frac{n}{2}+2\sqrt{n}} \Omega(\gamma ) = \Omega(\gamma) = \Omega(\varepsilon\sqrt{n}) \end{align*} as claimed.

Bahari sio ya usafi! Hasa karibu na miji mikubwa, kwa hivyo ikiwa ulikuwa kwenye njia ya baiskeli, kuna nafasi nzuri uko karibu na ustaarabu ambapo bahari sio nzuri kwa majeraha yako. Nilikulia katika nyumba ya pwani huko Hawaii na ujue kuwa hadi jeraha litakapofungwa hautaki kwenda kuogelea, unaweza kuambukizwa. Ilifanyika kwa mguu wangu, Frekn alinyonya! Wasamoa huosha baharini baada ya kupata tatoo, lakini hawana nguvu kama sisi. Mchanga yenyewe sio mbaya kabisa, sio mbaya kama uchafu ambao umechanganywa nayo. Kuiosha na maji safi na kuifunika na tambara hiyo, kwa muda mrefu kama haikuwa na mafuta juu yake, inapaswa kuwa nzuri ya kutosha kukufanya nyumbani ambapo unaweza kuisafisha bora. Shida unayopata sio so much with what you did the first hour or so but sounds more like what you did after you got home wasn't enough. Hydrogen peroxide is good, keeping it clean, make sure there is no sand in there. Band-aids are supposed to take the place of the scab, so that is why you are not scabbing up.  If you are sure it is clean and you keep it clean with fresh bandages you should be OK. Some wounds take 3 weeks to start to look better. If the skin around the wound looks red and swollen (as opposed to scraped up from the road rash) then you might need to break down and go to a DR. I hate going to the DRs more than the any one I know, but there are times when a bunch of people you don't know giving you medical advice just isn't good enough...

Kwa nambari kubwa ya kiholela $ n $ ya vigezo, formula ifuatayo ya CNF $ \ phi $ haiwezi kuridhishwa, ina vifungu vitatu tu, na $ 2K_2 $ -free kifungu-kinachoweza kutofautisha graph: $ c_1 = (x_1) $, $ c_2 = (\ neg x_1) $, $ c_3 = (x_1, \ ldots, x_n) $. Kwa hivyo, ili kupata mipaka ya chini ya kuvutia mtu anahitaji kudhani juu ya ukubwa wa chini wa kifungu au juu ya saizi ya madarasa ya vifungu ambavyo vina vigezo sawa (i.e. ambavyo vina vitongoji sawa katika picha ya matukio ya kutofautisha). Angalia kwamba wakati ukubwa wa kifungu cha chini ni $ k $, basi mfano hapo juu unaweza kubadilishwa ili kutoa fomula na $ 2^k+1 $ vifungu na idadi kubwa ya kiholela ya $ n $ that are not satisfiable. Moreover, when the number of clauses is $m<2^k+1$, then the formula is satisfiable even for arbitrarily large $n>k$: Let $C_m$ be the clause that has is incident with the largest set of variables. Since $n>k$, there is a variable $y$ that is not contained in the variable set of $C_1$, the clause with the smallest set of incident variables. Now, as for $k$-CNF formulas, the clauses $C_1,\ldots,C_{m-1}$ can be satisfied via an assignment of the first $k$ variables (which they all contain) and $C_m$ can be satisfied via the appropriate assignment of $y$.

Chati za Shimano kumbuka kuwa utangamano wa Shimano unategemea matarajio yao kwamba unaweza kuwa unasambaza treni ya kuendesha gari kama inavyoonyeshwa kwenye mfano hapa chini. Chati zao kila wakati huruhusu mnyororo wa kuendesha gari kwa kuwa hawajui uzoefu wa mpanda farasi kwamba baiskeli inauzwa kwa hatua ya utengenezaji na muundo. Mfano huu hapo juu unaonyesha mabadiliko yasiyofaa na hakuna mpanda farasi aliye na uzoefu anayefanya hivi. Mfano huu hapo juu unaonyesha kubadilika kwa mara tatu. Unaweza kufikiria kutoka kwa hii kwamba hata kwenye crank mara mbili kwamba mabadiliko sahihi hayatakuwa katika hali ya mnyororo. Utangamano wa derailleur-cassette ambao unasemwa, ninapenda kuwa karibu kila wakati unaweza kuongeza meno 2-3 kwenye gia ya chini ya kaseti. Kama Nathan alisema, unaweza kufinya na 11-30 na marekebisho ya B-screw hadi kiwango cha juu. Kuwa 105 unaweza kupata 11-32 kwani mifano ya chini ya derailleur kama Tiagra na Sora hawana muundo mzuri kama viwango vya juu. Kwa mfano, mstari wa Sora kutoka miaka 6-8 iliyopita ulikuwa na shida kufanya meno zaidi ya 2 kwa raha lakini kwa kuwa mifano ilibadilika mwaka jana na kuongeza kasi 12, Sora sasa ni tiagra derailleur ambayo katika hali nyingi inaweza kuongeza raha Cassette na meno 3. Kwa hivyo sio mfano tu wa derailleur lakini pia years or age of it makes a difference as well. Derailleur hanger position/style to dropout position plays a roll and and sometimes 1-2mm can make all the difference in whether it works or doesn't.  Capacity Solution  As for capacity, you could solve some of this by eliminating the smallest front chainring or adjusting the front derailleur stops from allowing it to drop down to it. Triples have been deprecated for a reason and even with an older 8 or 9 speed, a double allows enough combination to get up the steepest of hills unless a person is very out of shape and in that case it would only take riding on flatter roads for 2-4 months to build up the strength. Pro racing setup did not have triples even for mountain stages and these triple cranks were primarily for touring setups where one would have panniers and cargo going through mountain passes. Hapa kuna algorithm ya mgawanyiko-na-mshindi na wakati unaoendesha $ o (n^{1.585}) $, kwa $ D $ $, ikizingatiwa maadili ni "nasibu" na kusambazwa sawasawa. Acha $ x^0 $ ieleze seti ya $ x_i $ ambayo inaanza na 0 kidogo, na $ x^1 $ seti ya $ x_i $ ambayo inaanza na 1 kidogo. Vivyo hivyo fafanua $ y^0 $ na $ y^1 $ kuwa seti ya $ y_i $ ambayo huanza na 0 au 1 kidogo, mtawaliwa. Tunatarajia kwamba kutakuwa na vitu vya $ N/2 $ katika kila moja ya seti hizi. Now we'll recursively check whether there is an element of $X^0$ that is $\le$ an element of $Y^0$; an element of $X^0$ that is $\le$ an element of $Y^1$; or an element of $X^1$ that is $\le$ an element of $Y^1$.  The recursion bottom out when the set is of constant size.  The running time of this algorithm satisfies the recurrence  $$T(n) = 3 T(n/2) + O(1),$$  which has the solution $T(n) = O(n^{\lg 3}) = O(n^{1.585})$.

Nimekuwa nikitumia breki za disc kwenye mlima, cyclocross, na baiskeli za barabara kwa zaidi ya miaka 10 sasa. Hapo awali matoleo ya kuvunja diski hakika yalichukua muda kufikia viwango vya nguvu bora, laini, na vilivyobadilishwa ambavyo wanafurahiya kwa sasa. Katika muktadha huo, brashi iliyobadilishwa vibaya au iliyoundwa iliyoundwa dhidi ya V-iliyobadilishwa vizuri ilionyesha uwezo mdogo wa utendaji. Walakini, katika miaka ya hivi karibuni (5+), teknolojia inayozunguka disc imeongezeka sana. Haswa na mifumo ya kuvunja majimaji. Mifumo ya diski ya hydraulic huwa na nguvu kubwa ya kusimamisha kuliko mfumo wowote wa kuvunja wa RIM ambao nimetumia. Athari nyingine ya upande wa nguvu ya ziada ya kusimamisha ni uwezo wa "kuibadilisha" nguvu hiyo vizuri zaidi. Unaweza kudhibiti ni nguvu ngapi unayotumia kwa urahisi zaidi. Kama ilivyoonyeshwa hapo juu - kuna mahitaji tofauti ya matengenezo na mifumo ya kuvunja diski kuliko na mifumo ya kuvunja RIM. Walakini, kawaida sio ngumu zaidi kujifunza kuliko itifaki zingine za matengenezo kwa sehemu yoyote ya baiskeli. Mbali na mifumo ya kuvunja majimaji, kuna matoleo ya mitambo ambayo hutumia cable yako ya jadi kutoa lever kwa nguvu ya kushinikiza ya caliper kwenye rotor ya disc. Mifumo hii ina faida ya kutumiwa na mifumo ya lever ya kuhama/kuvunja (kawaida hupatikana kwenye baiskeli za barabarani au baiskeli zilizo na "baa za kushuka"). Nimepata mifumo ya kuvunja disc ya mitambo kuwa na nguvu nyingi na moduli kama mifumo ya majimaji. Kwa kuongezea, huwa zinahitaji matengenezo mengi/utaftaji ili kuwafanya wafanye kazi vizuri. Sehemu za mawasiliano ya PAD zinahusika zaidi kwa kufanya kelele au kuvuta wakati wanavaa. Mifumo ya mitambo inashikilia kutoka upande mmoja tu. Pedi moja imewekwa mahali, pedi nyingine inasukuma dhidi ya rotor kuipepea kidogo kwenye pedi iliyowekwa ili kutoa nguvu ya kusimamisha. Mifumo ya hydraulic zaidi ina calipers mbili tofauti ambazo zinasukuma pedi kutoka pande zote mbili, (kawaida) kutoa nguvu ya kusimamisha kutoka pande zote, bila kupindukia rotor (mengi). Mfumo wa kuvunja RIM huwa huvaa uso wetu wa gurudumu ikiwa hutumiwa katika hali ya hewa ya mvua. Kama grit inapoingia kwenye mdomo, na kuvunja, grit kimsingi 'mchanga chini' ukingo kwa wakati. Mwishowe itabidi ubadilishe ukingo kwani umechoka. Nyembamba mdomo gets, the more likely that heat transferance from the braking action can affect the rubber of the tire itself, sometimes causing catastrophic failure (exploding tire).  This is fairly rare, and requires circumstances to be "just right" (i.e. well worn rims with thin side walls, possibly mis-adjusted brake pads, and long extended descents where the rider is "dragging" their brakes constantly causing heat buildup, tire casings that don't handle heat well, etc...).  Generally speaking, the maintenance requirements for rim brakes and hydraulic disc brakes tends to be about the same.  Over time, you may need to have the hydraulic brake lines "bled" to keep them in good performance.  However, most modern hydraulic brake systems typically don't need to be bled that often.  I find my mountain bike hydraulic systems to require it only after 18 to 24 months of riding (I typically ride about 3,000 miles on my MTB in that interval).  Otherwise, it's simply a matter of replacing pads as they wear out.  I do believe that disc brake pads will tend to wear out faster than rim brakes.  They're simply smaller in surface area, and have a lot more heat demands placed on them.  This is not true in foul weather riding conditions though - since wet/sandy conditions tend to affect rim brake pads a lot more than disc brake pads.  A lot of people will cite that disc brake systems are heavier.  This is true in general.  However, the majority of the 'extra weight' is non-rotational weight, which has a lot less effect on the ride quality or feeling of a bike.  Since the weight is at the axle area, the weight is fairly insignificant.   Rim brake systems require thick, heavy tracks for the pads to press against.  This requires that a rim brake wheel rim be significantly heavier than a disc brake rim.  All of that weight is rotational mass at the outermost edges of the wheel.  Any additional weight in this area is significantly increased in terms of the feeling/impact of that weight.    I often see rims made for disc brake applications that average anywhere from 100 to 250 grams lighter in weight than their rim brake counterparts.  This is a significant amount of weight when it is at the worst possible location.

Ikiwa unatumia kifaa cha iOS, ninatumia programu inayoitwa Aero Weather (kuna toleo la bure, lakini nilipenda ya kutosha kuonyesha msaada kwa msanidi programu na kulipwa kwa toleo la pro). Hii inaonyesha majibu anuwai yanayopatikana kutoka kwa viwanja vya ndege vingi, barabara za runways, aerodromes na tovuti zingine zinazofanana. Unaweza kuonyesha muhtasari wa viwanja vya ndege 4-5 kwenye skrini ya iPhone - zaidi ya kutosha kupata muhtasari wa haraka wa hali za kawaida. It shows current readings, but you're able to drill in to their forecasts. As others have said, the airport analyses tend to be written by experts so is credible, but the readings are also frequently updated.   For my commute/training rides, I have a local list of various airports within 20-30 miles of home so I can get an instant picture of how the wind/temperature/cloud and so on is differing in the various directions.

Nitachukua uhuru kutafsiri swali kidogo zaidi, juu ya jinsi baiskeli zinavyobadilishwa kwa kupanda nguo za kawaida. Mbali na Raingear, sijawahi kubadilisha nguo za baiskeli katika maisha yangu (sio wakati nilienda kwenye safari ya baiskeli ya km 700). Skirt Guard / Coat Guard Hauitaji Fenders kwa baiskeli na jeans. Fenders zote hufanya ni kukuzuia kupata mvua na chafu, kwa hivyo unapaswa kuwataka na aina yoyote ya mavazi. Walakini, watu sio tu wanapanda baiskeli na jeans, lakini pia na sketi (kuanzia kila mwaka kwenye Rokjesdag). Na sketi, mavazi, au kanzu ndefu (juu), sketi guard/coat guard prevents clothes from ending up in the spokes, which not only damages the clothes but may well lead to accidents.     SkirtCoat guard.  Source: Wikimedia Commons  If you are commuting by bicycle and commuting in your normal clothes, as you should, and your normal clothes include anything that may get stuck in the spokes, a skirt guard / coat guard is recommended.  As pointed out in the comments, the guard on the bicycle in the photo is unlikely to be intended for protection of long dresses, as a traditional "ladies bicycle" would have a lowered top tube to assist with the same.

Ikiwa unataka breki za uthibitisho wa hali ya hewa unapaswa kuzingatia breki za ngoma au roller. Ninatumia breki za roller katika abiria wangu bike and they're working flawlessly for over 5 years in mud, snow and salt (I'm doing about 5k km/year).

Kiti cha kutolewa kwa baiskeli yangu kimekuwa kikishuka hivi karibuni. Niligundua wakati rafiki yangu wa baiskeli (pro) alisema jinsi kiti cha chini kwenye baiskeli yangu kilikuwa, na akanirekebisha kwa msaada kwangu. Baiskeli ikawa rahisi. Jana, while biking, I noticed that biking was difficult again, so dismounted and checked the seat -- it was way down again. So I fixed it.....but what can I do to make sure it doesn't happen again?
Sio vitendo kama suluhisho zingine, lakini ikiwa unajua mtu wa gari, labda wamepata pedi ya kuvunja spreaders laying around.  You should be able to get an edge or corner far enough in to use them.

Kulingana na ramani na picha zinazopatikana katika https://www.floridastatepark.org/sites/default/files/inline-files/fkoht_brochure_033120-web.pdf njia inaonekana kuwa ya muhuri zaidi na sehemu zingine za barabara. Hakutakuwa na sehemu za barabarani, na hakuna kupanda muhimu. Kwa hivyo utaweza kubeba kiwango sawa cha baiskeli yako ikiwa imejaa vizuri. Ningependa kupendekeza kubeba zilizopo 3 au 4 za ndani za saizi ili kuendana na magurudumu na matairi yako. Kwa kuongeza, kubeba pakiti ya stika (viraka vilivyowekwa hapo awali ambavyo haziitaji glasi) kama zana, ningeenda na levers 3x ambazo unapenda, ikiwa mtu atavunjika. Kwa kuwa unapenda Koolstop Jack yako, kabisa kubeba hiyo pia. Utataka pampu ya hewa kuima tena, na cartridge za hewa zilizoshinikwa ni chaguo pia lakini ikiwa watamaliza bado unahitaji pampu. Kuna hila za kushughulika na vikali tyres/rim combinations, and it can really help to pack along some plastic or velcro cable ties.  The technique is documented in this answer   https://bicycles.stackexchange.com/a/63961/19705 and I've mounted schwalbe marathons for a coworker with this method. You can also carry a spare folding tyre too - they're more bulky than heavy, but sometimes a gash may not be repairable.  With touring, its all about being ready for the most likely issues.  Your final resource is other riders.  I almost always check on other riders who are off the bike, with a wheel out.  If you're stuck, don't hesitate to wave down another rider and ask for help. There's definitely a difference between helping someone who is prepared but stuck, vs someone who simply didn't prepare.  Who knows - positions could be reversed on another day.

Mada ya uthibitisho wa pendekezo unalozungumza ni kuelezea tu kwamba $ exp \ subset p/poly $ inamaanisha $ exp = \ sigma_2^p $ (kuna uthibitisho mfupi wa hii katika kitabu cha Arora na Barak katika Sura juu ya ugumu wa mzunguko), halafu unaweza kuonyesha kutumia wakati huu $ 2^{n^{o (1)}} poly (m) $ mzunguko sat algorithm kwamba $ \ sigma_2^p \ subseteq dtime [2^{n^ {o (1)}}] $, ambayo inapingana na wakati wa uongozi wa wakati (naweza kuhariri kwa wazo la hii ikiwa hii ni ya kuhitajika). Ikiwa tutabadilisha dhana hiyo, hatutapata tena kitu chochote tunachojua kuwa utata katika hoja hapo juu. Kama moja ya maoni yaliyotajwa, kwa sasa iko wazi ikiwa $ ZPP = exp $, na hata toleo dhaifu la pendekezo hilo na algorithm isiyosababishwa ingetupa utenganisho huu (kumbuka, kama maoni inavyosema, $ BPP $ na $ ZPP $ ziko katika $ p/poly $). Inajulikana kuwa ikiwa $ p = np $ (kwa hivyo katika ladha ya hapo juu, ikiwa mzunguko wa Sat una $ poly (n+m) $ wakati wa algorithm), tunapata mipaka ya ukubwa wa chini dhidi ya $ e $. Hii inafuata kama tunavyojua $ e^{\ sigma_2^p} $ ina exponential size lower bounds, and if $P=NP$, then $E=E^{\Sigma_2^p}$. I'm not sure who this argument first came from, but the idea is that using a $\Sigma_2^p$ oracle, on an input $x$ of length $n$, we can find the lexicographically first truth table of an $n$-bit boolean function with the maximum circuit complexity over $n$-bit boolean functions in time $2^{O(n)}$. After doing this, we can simply look up the value of $x$ in this truth table and output accordingly. In doing this, not only are we computing a function which requires exponential sized circuits, but we are actually showing, as Ricky pointed out in the comments, that $E^{\Sigma_2^p}$ has a language of maximum circuit complexity.  Also, to clarify a point mentioned in the post, to get $P=BPP$, you actually need that $E$ does not even infinitely often have circuits of size $2^{\delta n}$. This does follow from $P=NP$, but it is a stronger hypothesis than $E\not\subset SIZE[2^{\delta n}]$. The argument above works for any runtime that falls into $2^{n^{o(1)}}$, so this includes $2^{n^{1/\log\log(n)}}$.

Yangu ya kwanza ingawa ni gurudumu la mbele linapaswa kwenda sawa kila wakati - kama ulivyopata hapo awali. Kunaweza kuwa na tofauti fulani, lakini haipaswi kuwa na kutosha kuathiri breki za diski kwa kiasi kikubwa. Kama matokeo, ningeshuku kuwa gurudumu halijakaa kwa usahihi, licha ya uhakikisho wako ni. Ondoa na usakinishe tena, kabla ya kushinikiza QR kugeuza gurudumu mara chache, kuibadilisha, kuifungua na kugeuza tena - mbinu zote nina hakika unajua. Inawezekana zaidi ni kwamba akaumega alikuwa amefungwa na gurudumu mbali, na pedi hazipo tena sitting correctly. Remove the pads and reinstall them carefully -paying attention to correct alignment.  If the caliper is out of alignment now, and previously it wasn't, it has moved. This should take considerable force - or if it's alignment changed with light force, it would change back when you applied the brakes.  If you need to adjust caliper alignment, I would be seriously concerned as to why, and be looking for answers to that question before riding the bike.   As far as caliper alignment - @jimirings gives an excellent answer, but it would not be my starting point for fixing this problem.

Hariri: Nilikosea juu ya maana ya mizunguko ya hesabu. Nadhani inawezekana. Inatumia maoni katika tathmini sambamba ya maneno ya hesabu na contraction ya mti. Fikiria formula ya hesabu, ni mzunguko wa hesabu ambao huunda mti ulioelekezwa. Fikiria kila lango kama kazi ya fomu $ f (x, y) = a (x \ mraba y)+b $ kwa $ a $ a, b $ na operesheni $ \ mraba $. Kwa hivyo, lango la $ \ mraba $ ni $ 1 (x \ mraba y)+0 $. Tunaita $ $ sehemu ya mstari, na $ b $ sehemu ya mara kwa mara. Mtu anaweza kutathmini formula na operesheni ya "contraction ya mti". Inachukua vertices 3 $ u, v, w $ na inarudisha vertex moja mpya kwenye mti huu. Hapa $ u, v $ ni watoto wa $ w $, na $ u $ ni jani. Hiyo ni, tunaweza kufuta node $ u $, mkataba $ w $ na $ v $ hadi vertex $ w '$, na lango kwa $ w' $ ni kazi ya fomu $ A (x \ mraba y )+B $ kwa baadhi ya $ $ $ na $ B $, na tunayo mti unakagua kwa thamani sawa. Hapa kuna mfano: Acha $ \ ell (v) $ iwe lebo ya $ V $, iliyofafanuliwa kama pembejeo yote inayotumika kushughulikia sehemu ya mstari na ya mara kwa mara ya lango $ V $. Ukweli: One can apply tree contraction to a constant fraction of vertices in  parallel. Let such parallel operation be called a single iteration. At any moment of the computation, $\{\ell(v) | v\in V_t\}$ forms a partition of the input, where $V_t$ is the vertices of the formula after the $t$th contraction. The coefficient of the linear term and constant term on each node can be expressed as a single-use expression (i.e. each variable in the input is used at most once). It implies if $y$ is the constant part or linear part of the vertex $v$, then $|y| \leq \sum_{x\in \ell(v)} |x|$. Note this fact is only used to bound the size of the coefficient. The computation of the coefficient itself is not related to the single-use expression.   Consider an algorithm that does $O(\log(n))$ iterations of tree contraction in parallel, and get a constant size tree. We evaluate the final tree directly. In each iteration, the running time is bounded by the sum of the size of the labels for each node, which is $O(m)$ due to disjointness of the label sets over the vertices.  Together the running time is $O(m\log n)=O(m\log n)$.

Kuna mkusanyiko mzuri wa ufafanuzi wa shida zinazohusiana za kuridhisha za np-kamili katika http://courses.csail.mit.edu/6.890/fall14/scribe/lec7.pdf mmoja wao, planar monotone 3-Sat, hukuruhusu kugawanyika kila terminal kuwa chanya na hasi, na vituo vilivyowekwa kwenye mstari na chanya part on one side of the line and the negative part on the other side of the line. The clauses have only positive or only negative terminals and are placed on the positive or negative side of the line respectively.
Labda Euler-maclaurin formula can help.

Inaonekana kuna shida nyingi za kupendeza sana katika nadharia ya graph ambayo inaweza kuandikwa kwa njia ya kuongeza/kupunguza fomu ya quadratic juu ya ad ama $ {\ bf a} $ au matrix ya laplacian $ {\ bf l} $ ya grafu . Mfano ni: 1) Tatizo la kukatwa kwa max ni sawa na kupata vector ya ishara ambayo inakuza fomu ya quadratic $ $ \ max_ {x_i \ in \ {\ pm1 \}} \ jumla_ {i, j} a_ {i, j} . T {\ bf x} = 1} {\ bf x}^t {\ bf a} {\ bf x} $ $ 3) Grothendieck mara kwa mara inahusisha maximizing the adjacency's quadratic form over sign vectors $$\max_{x_i\in\{\pm1\}} {\bf x}^T{\bf A}{\bf x},$$ 4) The spectral profile of a graph  $$\Lambda(\delta) = \min_{d(\text{supp}({\bf x}))\le \delta} \frac{{\bf x}^T{\bf L}{\bf x}}{\sum_i \text{deg}(\text{vertex}_i) x_i^2},$$ where $d(\text{supp}(x))$ is the fraction of edges incident on vertices within the support of vector ${\bf x}$  ( http://www.eecs.berkeley.edu/~prasad/Files/spectralprofile.pdf )  4+$\epsilon$) Anything involving the computation of an adjacency/laplacian eigenvalue.  ${\bf Q}$: Which other problems in graph theory can be expressed as maximizing/minimizing a quadratic form?

Nakala hiyo ni sawa, mbali kama kusimamishwa kunakwenda. Kitaalam nguvu ya kuvunja inatumika kwa sehemu tofauti ya rotor inamaanisha umehamisha caliper ya kuvunja, ambayo inaweza influence the way that force is felt on the seat/chainstay (depending on where the mounts are). Inageuka derailleur hii inahitaji pedi/hanger ya kawaida ya derailleur. Kwa sasa nina mlima wa moja kwa moja. Mwakilishi wa korongo alidhani hanger ya SRAM ilikuwa kwa kasi 10. Kwangu, ni is now clear that a 'SRAM' pad/hanger is the same as a Shimano 'standard mount'. So, I purchased the SRAM hanger (aka standard mount) from Canyon and it works!

Ndio, kwa njia za moja kwa moja. Ili kushughulikia orodha za sehemu, madaktari huacha kupendekeza baada ya kukataliwa kutoka kwa kila hospitali kwa utaratibu wao, na kubaki bila kulinganishwa. Hospitali hukataa moja kwa moja daktari anayependekeza ambaye hayuko kwenye orodha yao, hata ikiwa inamaanisha kubaki bila kulinganishwa. Unaweza kupiga picha hizi kama orodha ya upendeleo $ h_1 \ succeq h_2 \ succeq \ cdots \ succeq \ maandishi {unmatched} \ succeq h_j \ succeq \ cdots $. Ili kubeba hospitali zilizo na inafaa nyingi, unaweza tu kuunda $ k_h $ copies of hospital $h$, all sharing the preferences of hospital $h$ and compared by doctors in the same way (e.g. my preference ordering could go $h_1 \sim \cdots \sim h_{k_h} \succeq \cdots$ where $\sim$ means indifference).  You should be able to find details pretty easily by searching. (By the way, the USA National Residency Matching Program uses a version of deferred acceptance that works with all these constraints, and more besides.)

Ninajua jinsi NUSMV inaweza kutumika kwenye mfano ili kuangalia ikiwa taarifa fulani za mantiki za muda zimeridhika, haswa LTL. Ninajua pia LTL kwa njia za ubadilishaji za BA zinazopatikana mkondoni. Nina wasiwasi na aina maalum za vikwazo vya mantiki ya muda kama vile: kazi hii inaweza kuanza baada ya kazi hii kazi hii inaweza kutokea tu katika muda huu nadhani hii inaanguka katika LTL, kikoa cha STL. Ninavutiwa sana na kutoa mipango ya mwendo na kazi kulingana na vikwazo vya mantiki ya muda. NUSMV inaonekana tu kuangalia uhalali wa taarifa fulani kwenye mfano. Ninavutiwa zaidi na zana ya programu au nambari ambazo zinaweza kusababisha muundo mzuri wa mpango kulingana na uainishaji wangu wa LTL nk? Najua kuna karatasi za utafiti ambazo zinatatua shida hii. Lakini i do not know the theory of LTL, BA, etc. in depth so it is difficult to understand what these papers are doing and then recreate the process. Can someone tell some seminal papers or simply written paper easy to understand that explain how to build such algorithms. Even relevant sections of book are useful. Most books on model checking solve the inverse that is given a model does it satisfy this LTL constraint? I am interested in creating a model that satisfies a given LTL, STL constraint etc.? This technology is lying around so if someone can even suggest me some source codes that tackle such problems that will be even more helpful. I am not keen on understanding the theory if possible and would be happy to use someone else's software to develop plans and test them.
Inaweza pia kuwa rahisi kama nyuzi kwenye BB zinazohitaji grisi zilizotumika kwao. Lakini you should certainly make sure the bb isn't loose, either in the frame or in the bearings.

Haifanyi kazi kuuliza au kujibu swali hili bila hesabu ya gia ya nyuma ya nguzo, anuwai, na tofauti ya jino. Hasa, pengo la mbele la barabara dhidi ya kiwango cha mbele cha barabara husababisha mikakati tofauti kabisa na kuhama. Gia zaidi za nyuma kwa safu fulani ya nguzo, upande mdogo ni wa kukaa tu katika mnyororo huo uliochaguliwa kulingana na eneo ulilo. starehe chini ya kufanya yote nyuma na mbele kuhama ili kukaa juu yake. Athari hii imeongezeka kidogo na kila kizazi cha kasi. Pengo kubwa zaidi la mnyororo, mabadiliko ya nyuma zaidi unahitaji kufanya ikiwa unasisitiza kufuata utaftaji wako haswa. Hiyo ni sababu kubwa kwa nini Compact iliondoka katika siku za kasi 10 na sio kasi 5 - na kasi 5 rear ends you're priced in to doing that sequencing, but with 10 it matters a lot less.  Also the greater the ring gap, the more gear values you're going to have back to back on the same ring at the extremes of the bike's gear range. For example, on 11-speed 34-50 11-25, the top 6 or so gears are all on the large ring and the bottom 4 or so are all on the small, so there's going to be a lot of the time where the most optimal sequencing involves no front shifting at all. Compare that to five-speed 42-52 13-25, where the only the top 1 or 2 and bottom 1 or 2 gears are on their respective chainrings. Again, you're then priced in to hunting around.  If you want to master this topic, studying different setups in a gearing calculator like https://www.sheldonbrown.com/gear-calc.html is a good idea.

Fikiria kikundi $ G $. Tunaita $ G $ karibu bure ni kuwa na kikundi kidogo cha bure cha faharisi ya Finite. Ikiwa $ g $ imetengenezwa kwa pesa na seti fulani $ x \ subseteq g $ moja inaweza kuzingatia shida ya neno $ wp (g) $ ambayo ni lugha rasmi inayojumuisha maneno yote juu ya alfabeti $ x \ kikombe x^{-1} $ ambayo tathmini kwa kitengo katika $ G $. Ni matokeo maarufu na Mueller and Schupp that the $WP(G)$ is context-free if and only if $G$ is virtually free.  It is also known that if $WP(G)$ is context-free, it is deterministic context-free.  My question is: Do we know more about how the class of deterministic context-free languages that can be represented as the word problem of some group, is contained in the class of all (deterministic) context-free languages?

Nilipata mkufunzi wa nyumbani-chini na ninataka kuitumia na baiskeli yangu ya barabara ya disc (na nafasi ya nyuma ya 135mm). Ili kuweka bajeti ya chini, nataka kutumia gurudumu la zamani la 130mm. Kuacha kwangu ni kwa kutolewa haraka Je! Ninaweza kutumia aina fulani ya spacers (kwenye upande usio na gari?) to achieve that?  Since it's on a home-trainer I don't need to brake, so there is no problem of rotor/caliper alignment. However it would be great if I didn't have to tune my rear derailleur each time I swap wheels.  Is it doable or should I just look for a cheap second-hand 135mm wheel?

Kwa uwasilishaji katika vitongoji nadhani hautahitaji baiskeli ya mlima kwani unataka kitu haraka kwa usafirishaji. Hii kimsingi inapunguza swali zaidi kama baiskeli zenye ubora zaidi kwa kusafiri/kuwasiliana nk hazijengi na kusimamishwa nyuma. Pia kushuka chini ya curb inapaswa kuwa kitu ambacho kinafyonzwa na mwili. Kwa hivyo sasa tunapaswa kuamua ikiwa unahitaji kusimamishwa mbele. Sidhani kama itakupunguza kwani kusimamishwa kwa mbele haina athari kubwa kwenye eneo la eneo ambalo umepanda. Jambo lingine la kuzingatia ni jinsi unavyosafirisha usafirishaji. Je! Wanasafirishwa kwenye mkoba au kwenye rack ya nyuma au ya mbele. Ikiwa mwisho ni hivyo na unataka kutumia rack ya mbele front suspension is out of the question as the typical forks are not made to be used with a front rack ( you just can't mount them ) In case of a backpack you are good with a suspension fork most likely your hands will be glad you buy one.  But what you should consider ultimatly is how much you gonna spend on the bike. If it will be a cheaper bike I would consider buying a bike without a suspension fork as those tend to be pretty crappy. With crappy I mean poor quality of dampinig and high weight so you are better of with a stiff fork. Also if you are doing deliveries your mileage will probably a bit higher so lesser parts which will break are better.

Mwelekeo wa kawaida wa nyuzi unahitaji kugeuza kukabiliana na wrench saa kutoka upande usio na gari. Vifaa vinaweza kuwa vikali sana na mara nyingi huwa na kufuli kwa nyuzi. Nina njia kadhaa. Piga mwisho mfupi wa wrench ya Allen katika vise. Weka gurudumu kwenye wrench na ugeuke gurudumu. Wrench ya 12mm ni mwanzo lakini bado haiongezei ufikiaji by much. Use a 12 inch piece of 1/2" black iron pipe( available at most hardware stores). Slide the pipe over the short end of the allen wrench for more leverage. The third method is to use the box (closed) end of a larger wrench like a 3/4" or 18mm. Hook the box end over the short end of the allen for increased leverage.

Mojawapo ya baiskeli yangu ni hii Dohiker 14 "baiskeli ya umeme, lakini kwa kweli mimi hutembea sana wakati wa kuipanda, na kiti cha kiti ni kifupi sana. Ni karibu 50cm, na ningehitaji sentimita chache zaidi. Mimi ni mimi. Tayari inazidi kidogo urefu wa kuingiza, lakini haitoshi. Pia, viti virefu vile vinatumia nguvu nyingi kwenye sura kwa sababu ya ufikiaji, kwa hivyo lazima niingize urefu salama wa kiti kwenye sura. Shida: The Kipenyo ni kawaida kabisa 30.4mm, na kiti cha muda mrefu pia sio kawaida. Nilitafuta kila mahali for a 30.4mm × 550~600mm seatpost, without success...  So far, after already a lot of research, my best (and only) solution would be to use these two parts:   This 30.4mm → 27.2mm adapter (I'm considering this model because it's 10cm long, whereas other models are 8cm or 6cm long only…) This 27.2mm × 600mm seatpost (I think it's initially intended for BMX)   Do you think this solution is acceptable? Do you have better proposals?   (and extra kudos if you find a similar seatpost (27.2mm × 600mm, color black), but without any branding on it :)

Kwenye safari ndefu kama hii, baiskeli atataka kujiridhisha iwezekanavyo. Vipengele vya baiskeli na vifaa mara nyingi huwa biashara kati ya uzani na gharama, lakini utalii huleta uimara na urahisi wa ukarabati kwa mstari wa mbele. Aina hii ya wanaoendesha mara nyingi huitwa utalii wa kubeba, na ina maana kubwa kwamba baiskeli amebeba kila kitu kinachohitajika kama chakula, vifaa vya kambi, zana, sehemu za vipuri, ramani, na wakati mwingine zaidi. Kuna mitindo mingine ya utalii kama vile utalii unaoungwa mkono, lakini mimi nadhani baiskeli ambaye baiskeli yake uliyoona haikufanya hivi. Vipengele vya baiskeli inayofaa kwa utalii wa kupanuliwa ni pamoja na: sanda nzuri inaweza kuwa sehemu muhimu zaidi ya baiskeli ya utalii ya almasi. Baiskeli atakuwa akitumia siku nyingi, wiki, miezi, au hata miaka ameketi kwenye saruji hiyo. Brook B-17 ni sanda maarufu sana, na ni kawaida kwenye baiskeli za kutembelea. Brooks amefanya matapeli wa ngozi huko England kwa miaka mingi. Saddles za ngozi ni vizuri kwa sababu zinaendana na kitako cha yule aliyevaa kwa wakati, na zinaweza kuwa sio vizuri hadi wawe na maili mia kadhaa juu yao. Ikiwa utaona baiskeli na tambara la zamani la ngozi, lenye sura nzuri, kuna nafasi nzuri unaangalia baiskeli inayopendwa sana na iliyotumiwa vizuri. Baiskeli za utalii zinahitaji kuwa za kudumu. Hii ni sababu kwamba muafaka wa chuma hupendelea. Chuma ni rahisi, nguvu, na inaweza kusanidiwa na kulehemu. Muafaka wa chuma ni wa kutosha kwa racks kusanikishwa juu yao. Vifaa vingine vya sura, kama vile alumini na nyuzi za kaboni, ni nyepesi kuliko chuma lakini sio nguvu. Kuna baiskeli za utalii zilizotengenezwa kutoka kwa alumini, zingine nzuri, lakini nyuzi za kaboni haziwezi kuchukua uzito wa pauni 30-60 za panniers na vifaa vya kambi. Chuma pia ni ghali. Kwa bahati mbaya, chuma ni nzito kuliko vifaa vingine vya sura. . Kwa kuwa mkao wa mpanda farasi kwenye baiskeli ya utalii utaelekezwa zaidi kuelekea faraja kuliko baiskeli ya barabarani, waendeshaji mara nyingi wanapendelea mkao ulio wazi zaidi na mikoba huwekwa juu. Vipimo vinaweza kuwa na nafasi ya vifaa kama kompyuta na taa. Magurudumu ambayo yana nguvu ni bora, kwani baiskeli ambayo imebeba uzito mwingi itavunja spika zaidi. Kuhesabu kwa kiwango cha juu kawaida kunamaanisha gurudumu lenye nguvu. Magurudumu 700C ni kawaida kwenye utalii bikes, but 26" rims are more commonly found worldwide simply because of the availability of 26" tires and tubes worldwide.  Tires will be selected for durability rather than speed. A tire that is faster but is prone to flats will slow the rider down more than a tire that is more durable.  Navigation hardware can include a standard bike computer with an odometer paired with maps, a GPS with routing capabilities, or even both.  Sturdy racks are important. Weaker, inexpensive racks will bend and break under a heavy load. Most racks used for touring are sold with a maximum weight capacity figure. Tubus makes an excellent selection of touring racks.  Panniers will be selected based on durability. The question of whether a rack will have many small pockets or one large one (i.e., a simple sack with attachment hooks) is a matter of packing style and personal preference. Ortlieb and Arkel are two higher-end touring pannier manufacturers.  Drivetrain components should be durable and easily fixed on the road. For this reason, internally geared hubs are seldom used, even though they are generally more trouble-free. A traditional derailer can be fixed at the side of the road in many cases. A gear ratio should be selected that allows for hill-climbing, even at the expense of sacrificing speed. Bar-end shifters are often favored, because they're simpler to fix than more complex shifters.  Suspension is often not used on a touring bike, since they are less efficient at translating pedaling into forward motion. However, there are offroad touring bikes. Suspension also makes it difficult to attach racks, particularly rear suspension.   Brakes are usually rim brakes, for similar reasons as drivetrain components: they can be fixed with few tools. However, disc brakes are starting to be more common on touring bikes.    Common touring bikes include the Surly Long-Haul Trucker and the Trek 520. (The Novara Randonee is essentially a clone of these bikes.) Rivendell and Bike Friday also make well-regarded touring bikes; there are no doubt many other manufacturers of sturdy frames. Steel hardtail (non-suspension) mountain bike frames can be converted into touring bikes relatively easily.   There's an old touring adage: You can tour on any bike. Carbon-fiber racing bikes can pull a trailer full of gear. The above outline of what's helpful on a touring bike is what I would consider a best-case scenario, but is by no means mandatory.   I'll close this with a picture of one of my touring bikes.

Uko sawa katika kugundua kuwa nafasi ya serikali ya mashine ya NL ni kubwa tu (i.e. idadi ya majimbo yanayoweza kufikiwa ni polynomial kwa urefu wa $ N $ ya pembejeo). Mashine ya Logspace ya kuamua inaweza kuzidisha majimbo haya yote, na angalia ikiwa mmoja wao anakubali. Lakini hii haitoshi. Ili kuiga kwa uaminifu mashine ya NL, mashine ya kuamua ya LogSpace lazima iamue ikiwa kuna njia kutoka kwa hali ya kuanzia hadi hali ya kukubali. Njia kama hiyo inaweza kuwa na urefu ambao ni polynomial katika $ n $. Hii ni sawa na kuamua ikiwa vertex $ s $ inaweza kufikia vertex $ t $ katika grafu iliyoelekezwa; Shida hii wakati mwingine huitwa STCON (kwa $ S-T $ -connectivity). Kazi hii is quite difficult, which is why no deterministic logspace procedure is known that solves it.  Let me illustrate the difficulty of the problem by showing that even with the use of randomness, it is not obvious how to solve this problem. That is, $RL\overset{?}{=}NL$ is unknown. A first attempt to solve STCON with randomness is to perform a random walk on the vertices of the graph, each time taking one of the outgoing edges with independent equal probability. But this approach fails, for example, on a path of $n$ vertices from $v_1$ to $v_n$, where each vertex is connected to the first, i.e., $(v_i,v_1)\in E$. The average time a random walk takes to reach $v_n$ from $v_1$ is $2^{O(n)}$.

Je! Ni hali gani ya sanaa juu ya ugumu wa swala ya njia sahihi za kujifunza 2-DNF zilizo na maswali ya mfano na chini ya usambazaji sawa? Au yoyote isiyo ya maana juu yake? Kwa sababu sijui na nadharia ya kujifunza na swali hili linachochewa na uwanja tofauti, jibu linaweza kuwa dhahiri. Niliangalia kitabu hicho na Kearns na Vazirani, lakini zinaonekana hazizingatii mpangilio huu wazi. Sasisha. Ingawa main parameter of interest is query complexity, running time is also important. If possible, running time should preferably be roughly the same as query complexity or at most polynomial.  upd. Appendix B (top of the page 18) of the paper "Learning Submodular Functions" by Balcan and Harvey mentions that "It is well known that 2-DNFs are efﬁciently PAC-learnable." However, they don't mention, whether this result is for proper learning or give any reference.

Maandishi mengi juu ya madai ya ugumu wa kesi ya wastani: 1) Usambazaji wowote wa polytime pia ni sampuli ya poly wakati. 2) Usambazaji wa sampuli ya polytime ni moja ambapo TM ya polytime inazalisha usambazaji kwenye pembejeo 1^n. Sasa, tuseme tuna usambazaji, ambapo prob (0) = 1/3 prob (1) = 2/3. Kwa wazi, usambazaji huu ni wa polytime. Maandishi mengi yangedai kuwa pia ni sampuli ya polytime. Walakini, sioni jinsi TM yoyote ya uwezekano wa TM inaweza kutoa usambazaji hapo juu. [I see how expected polytime proabilistic TM can generate this distribution; but that is not the same as polytime probabilistic TM.]  Question: Where am I going wrong? Am I misunderstanding polytime sampleable, or polytime computable? The distribution defined above, is it  (1) NOT polytime computable (i.e. writing out 1/3 would take an infinite number of bits)  or (2) It is actually polytime sampleable; since in reality, we only require that the algorithm run in expected polytime?  Thanks!

Jambo lingine la kutazama wakati wa kufuata ushauri wa Argenti (sahihi): Angalia mwisho wa mmiliki wa noodle kwa uangalifu sana. Nimeona breki za zamani, za bei rahisi za V ambazo hii ilikuwa laini sana na kufunguliwa ikiruhusu noodle ipite kwa njia sawa na picha kwenye swali, wakati unapunguza breki ngumu sana. Hapa kuna mchoro wa mwisho wa mmiliki wa noodle - mzuri upande wa kushoto, umeinama on the right.  Imagine you're looking through the boot:    Either the ferrule can slip through the hole, or more likely the noodle can ride through the slot that should only clear the cable; either way the brake fails.  Squeezing it back together is easy with pliers, but a get-you-home fix as the metal will bend more and more easily as it's flexed.  The proper fix if this has happened id to replace the V-brake

Kila mtu hupanda kwa kiwango chake bora na udadisi. Kwenye tandem, waendeshaji wote wawili wanapaswa kupanda kwa kiwango sawa na udadisi, ambao utakuwa karibu na wale wa mpanda farasi hodari. Kwa hivyo hakuna hata mmoja wao anayepanda kwa kiwango bora na udadisi. Kwenye sanjari na waendeshaji wanaofanana sana, kwa kweli ni wepesi zaidi, largely due to the draughting effect of the two riders being so close together.  On the other hand, if the hill is so steep that the riders would have to stand, it becomes a matter of rider skills. Many tandem riders struggle to master the two-person coordination of efforts required to make the transition to the standing position.

Pawls kwenye freehub yako ina uwezekano mkubwa wa kukwama, na kuwafanya wasifunge na kuhamisha nguvu kutoka kwa kaseti hadi gurudumu. Kwa upande wako kama baiskeli ni mpya labda ni kwa sababu ya kukusanywa na grisi badala ya mafuta nyepesi, lakini shida pia inaweza kuja na kuzeeka. Utahitaji kujenga tena FreeHub. Huu sio utaratibu rahisi na inahitaji zana fulani (mjeledi wa mnyororo na lishe ya FreeHub angalau) kwa hivyo labda pata duka lako la baiskeli kuifanya. Gia zisizoweza kusomeka on the back could be a number of things, rear derailleur limit screws, lack of cable tension, bent hanger/derailleur... If you are already taking it to a bike shop just ask them to fix it.  EDIT: Based on the additional information (-30 not 30  Celcius and secondhand), like others say the freehub is most likely frozen due to old grease and or water which has gotten inside the hub. Same advice still applies though, you will need to overhaul it and get new grease in there or just buy a new one.

Mwenzi wangu wa takriban ukubwa sawa alikuwa na suala linalofaa na Ruby, alijaribu baiskeli tofauti na akagundua kuwa vizuri zaidi. 48cm waliona kidogo sana kwake na 51cm kubwa sana. Nadhani 44cm itakuwa ndogo sana kwako mwishowe, na labda ingeenda na 48cm lakini haiwezekani kuwa na uhakika bila kukuona kwenye baiskeli, na kujua aina ya wanaoendesha unayotaka kufanya. Jambo kuu ni kupata mtu wa kukufaa ambaye una imani nayo. Ikiwa utapata maoni kuwa yeye ni muuzaji tu, ambaye alipanda baiskeli ilikuwa miaka 30 iliyopita, na anavutiwa tu kufanya mauzo - then any form of initial discomfort is just going to niggle at you. If you trust the person, they seem to know what they are talking about, and can assess your strength and flexibility, then you're more likely to adapt to the new position.   If a shop doesn't actually put you on the bike, won't make adjustments to the saddle position, seat height, and handlebar rotation then personally I would run a mile and go elsewhere. If they have none in stock, then any reputable dealer should be prepared to order one in and replace it if it doesn't fit well.  As a side note: although fit is much more important, be aware that on smaller frames it can be impossible to fit two water bottles.

Hii labda inasikika kabisa, lakini utajua kuwa hauitaji magurudumu ya mafunzo wakati hautumii tena magurudumu ya mafunzo. Nina hakika labda umechoka na "usitumie magurudumu ya mafunzo" vile vile ... hapa kuna shida na magurudumu ya mafunzo. Gurudumu lolote mbili, gari la mstari (i.e., baiskeli, pikipiki) ni usawa na inaongozwa na uboreshaji*; Operesheni inadhibiti usawa na mwelekeo kwa kugeuza gurudumu la mbele mwelekeo unaoanguka, au kugeuka, mbali na njia inayotaka ya kusafiri ili kuilazimisha kutegemea. Gari yoyote iliyo na alama zaidi ya mbili za kuwasiliana na ardhi (basi, Gari, pikipiki na pembeni, baiskeli na magurudumu ya mafunzo), haifanyi; Miongozo inadhibitiwa "kawaida" kwa kuashiria gurudumu la mbele ambapo unataka kwenda. Hii hufanya magurudumu ya mafunzo- kwenye uso wazo nzuri- shida, kwani mfumo wako wa gari unajaribu kujifunza seti mbili tofauti za ujuzi. Kwa bora, umebadilisha baiskeli yako kuwa quadcycle. Mbaya kabisa ambapo hawagusa ardhi wakati wote, wakati mwingine ni a tricycle, sometimes it's not, and you're forcing your brain to switch modes rapidly, making it harder to learn, not easier.  There's a video on YouTube channel "Smarter Every Day" with a backward steering bicycle; maybe you've seen them at a fair or carnival. The steering is geared so turning the bars right make the wheel turn left. It is very difficult to learn how to ride, because you have to retrain your motor skills. Should you watch it, note at 1:02 to 1:05, when he attempts to ride it- the bike starts falling to rider's left, and he tries to steer the front tire back under it- causing it to fall faster. Later he tries to ride a normal bicycle, and can't at first; his brain has to switch modes. This is what you're doing to yourself by wanting to use training wheels. Smarter Every Day, Backwards Bicycle  Good Luck!  *The mechanics of which are beyond the scope, etc; for this article, let's run with the belief in magic. Or, Countsteering 101

Inaonekana kama milo yako, cogs au cranks hazijatengenezwa kwa uvumilivu mkali zaidi. Labda mnyororo sio wa pande zote, au labda buibui katika vifurushi ambavyo mnyororo huambatana na ni kidogo sana. Kawaida haijalishi hata kidogo, ingawa husababisha matangazo magumu uliyoelezea, na hivyo kuruhusu kucheza kidogo kwenye matangazo huru. Pia, kwa kuwa ni ubadilishaji, nitadhani haukutumia vifaa vipya vya drivetrain. Any amount of wear on the chainring will cause this kind of play.  Then again, the issue you described is not really an issue but one of the inherent features of proper chain tension. I personally prefer even a bit more of that play in the chain as it gives me a clear feedback when my spinning technique starts getting wonky. As to this question, I suggest you re-check your chain tension an possibly loosen it up a bit.

Walakini, watalii wengi wa mzunguko wanataka kichwa-up high front end so that they   can see into the middle distance without getting a stiff neck. For   those cyclists who come from a road/700c background, they typically   want a lower handlebar setting at the front, so the number of spacers   is less, so generally its not an issue.

Shida moja ni kwamba gurudumu la nyuma pia limefungwa na brake ya ngoma upande wa kushoto, hakuna wazo la kuiweka vizuri kwenye gurudumu mpya. Pia, ningependa kuweka sehemu nyingi za asili zinazowezekana kwenye baiskeli. Kubadilisha kitovu cha gurudumu kuwa FreeHub kusaidia basette. This has the advantage that the bike will stay with most of its original parts, but would be really involved. Again, might be difficult to impossible to re-fit the drum brake.  Advices welcome, I'm not an expert bike tehnician. Chainring sizes: 54-48-40. Current chainrings:  Chainrings' Bolt:   Update a few months later I thought it would be useful for anyone having a similar question to have an update on this question after following the very good advices that I have received here. What I ended up doing: I replaced the right side crank and chainrings for a lower overall gear. Unfortunately I couldn't replace just the chainrings, as there was no way to fit smaller ones on the existing crank. I only replaced the right side because this is a tandem and on the left side there's the connecting chain. Finding a complete tandem crankset is difficult and more expensive, but fortunately replacing just the right side of it did the trick. The only difficulty was finding a crank with exactly the same length as before. I also replaced the chain, as it was very dirty. Unfortunately this led to the replacement of the freewheel, as the new chain was slipping on the old one. I guess it was also worn out. Although I couldn't avoid an upgrade spiral, I managed to bring down the gear ratios so now we can enjoy more difficult rides. Indeed, replacing the crankset was quite easy and I might actually do it again if I notice that we need an even lower gearing. Thank you for the advices!

Kawaida hii itakuwa rahisi "kuirudisha kwenye duka la baiskeli", kwani baiskeli haijakusanyika kwa usahihi. Lakini kwa bahati mbaya labda una kitu cha umbo la baiskeli (BSO) ambalo ulinunua kwenye sanduku (au lilikusanywa na mithali "moron kwa haraka"). Inawezekana kwamba hata BSO inaweza kufanywa kufanya kazi baada ya mtindo. Walakini unaweza kugundua kuwa duka la baiskeli litakataa kufanya kazi kwenye BSO yako kwa sababu ni ya hali ya chini kiasi kwamba duka halitaweza kutoa dhamana juu ya kazi yake. Shida rahisi ni kwamba screw ya kikomo kwenye derailleur ya nyuma haijawekwa kwa usahihi. Hii ni hila kidogo kuelezea kwa hivyo ikiwa hii haisaidii kujaribu ufafanuzi wa kina wa Sheldon Brown. Kimsingi, kuna screws mbili za "Marekebisho ya Kikomo" (moja kwa kila kikomo cha kusafiri) na ile inayoweka kikomo kuelekea gurudumu inahitaji kusongeshwa kidogo: na kuhama kwa cog kubwa nyuma, kisha bila inazunguka Misingi huhamisha mabadiliko ya gia (twist grip) njia yote (hadi mahali ambapo mnyororo kawaida huanguka kwenye gurudumu). Sasa pindua screw hadi derailleur pulley lines up with the largest cog on the freewheel. If the derailleur doesn't move when you turn the screw, you're either turning the wrong screw (put it back!) or you're turning it the wrong way (reverse!)  Note on the left hand diagram above there's a line from the pulley to the right hand side of the smallest cog. You're trying to get the mirror image of that line - from the derailler puller to the left-most cog and probably a little to the left of the cog if you want to be really fussy about it.  If you're unlucky this is not the problem at all, and instead you're mounted the derailleur wrong (but normally they're already mounted inside the box), or something has been bent or broken in transit. Maybe use Google image search to look at pictures to make sure it's not something obvious in how it's attached. If it's bent things get tricky, as there are tools to help re-align it and doing that by eye is unlikely to work well (and could break something).  First, try setting the limit screws.  If that works, you might find the adjust rear derailleur answer helps with the next step.

Acha $ \ sigma $ iwe alfabeti laini, na uzingatia safu ya nguvu ya formel zaidi ya $ \ sigma $ kuzingatiwa kama vigezo visivyo vya kuandaa na coefficients katika semiring $ \ mathcal n: = \ mathbb n \ kikombe \ {\ infty \} $ $ $ $ $ $ $ $ $ $ $ $ $ $ $ na $ $ n \ cdot \ infty = \ infty \ cdot n = \ infty \ mbox {kwa $ n \ ne 0 $,} \ qquad \ infty \ cdot \ infty = \ infty \ qquad n + \ infty = + n = \ infty \ mbox {kwa $ n $,} \ qquad 0 \ cdot \ infty = \ infty \ cdot 0 = 0 \ qquad \ infty + \ infty = \ infty. $ $ Mfululizo rasmi wa nguvu ni polynomial ikiwa tu idadi laini ya coefficients sio sifuri. Mfululizo wa Nguvu ya Fomu huitwa busara ikiwa inaweza kujengwa kutoka kwa polynomials na matumizi ya mwisho ya kuongeza (pointwise), kuzidisha (bidhaa ya Convolutional), na uendeshaji wa nyota, ambayo kwa $ f = \ jumla_ {w \ katika \ sigma^ [ \ mathcal n \ katikati i \ in i \} $ hufafanuliwa kama $ \ sup \ {\ sum_ {j \ in j} k_j \ katikati j \ subseteq i \ mbox hesabu, kwa hivyo usemi hapo juu hufanya akili. Mawazo haya yanarudi Schützenberger na Eilenburg, ambapo ya mwisho huita haya $\mathcal N$-subsets instead of formal power series. Now given $f$ we define $$  xf_s := \left\{ \begin{array}{ll}   \infty & xf = \infty \\    0     & \mbox{ otherwise.} \end{array}\right. $$ the singular part, i.e. all entries whose coefficient is $\infty$ are retained, and  $$  xf_n := \left\{    \begin{array}{ll}     xf & xf \ne \infty \\     0  & \mbox{ otherwise }   \end{array} \right. $$ the non-singular part, where we retain those entries that do not evaluate to $\infty$. Surely $$  f = f_s + f_n $$ and we have \begin{align*}  (f + g)_s & = f_s + g_s \\  (f g)_s & = f_s g + g_s f. \end{align*}  Now let $\mathcal C$ be the class of formal power series $f$ such that $f_s$ is rational, then why does the above formula imply that $\mathcal C$ is closed under multiplication?  The argument is taken from Samuel Eilenberg, Automata, Machines, Languages, Volume A to show that for rational $f$, also $f_s$ and $f_n$ are rational, and he uses exactly the above argument. Buf if $f_s$ is rational, and $g$ such that $g_s$ is rational, why should then $f_s g + f g_s$ be rational?

Sina hakika kuwa hii inahesabiwa kama "msingi", lakini karatasi ifuatayo: L. Fortnow. Ugumu wa maarifa kamili ya sifuri. Maendeleo katika Utafiti wa Kompyuta (ed. S. Micali) Vol. 18 (1989) had a flaw pointed out here: http://www.wisdom.weizmann.ac.il/~/oded/PSX/gop.pdf  Also, László Babai announced that he had fixed the error in his landmark graph isomorphism algorithm, as stated here: https://www.quantamagazine.org/graph-isomorphism-vanquished-again-20170114/

Katika mstatili wa Polygon, Sehemu ya 2: Idadi ya chini ya mstatili wa mafuta, muundo wa vitendo wa shida ya mstatili unaosababishwa na wasiwasi katika VLSI imewasilishwa: Tatizo la utaftaji wa mstatili wa mafuta: Kwa kuzingatia polygon $ $ $, kuongeza upande mfupi zaidi wa $ \ Delta $ juu ya mstatili wote wa $ p $. Kati ya the partitions with the same $\delta$, choose the partition with the fewest number of rectangles.   As yet, only a theoretical algorithm exists, with a running time of $O(n^{42})$. (That is not a typo, and it is obtained through a “natural” dynamic programming solution to the problem stated there.)

Acha $ a, b $ iwe bipartition ya $ g $ na $ | a | = | B | = n. $ madai: $ c_1 + c_2 + c_3 \ equiv n \ pmod {2}. $ Kuonyesha hii, kwa kawaida tunaweza kuhusisha kila kulinganisha $ m_i $ na vibali $ \ sigma_i \ katika s_n. $ $ $ f: S_n \ kwa \ {0, 1 \} $ kama kwamba $ f (\ sigma) = 0 $ iff $ \ sigma $ ni kibali hata, na kufafanua $ c: s_n \ kwa \ mathbb {n} $ ili $ c . mizunguko katika $ m_i \ kikombe m_j $ ni $ c (\ sigma_j^{-1} \ sigma_i) \ equiv n-f (\ sigma_j^{-1})-f (\ sigma_i) \ equiv n-f (\ sigma_j) -f . n \pmod{2}$$ as claimed.  So you question really is: are there planar cubic graphs with an odd number of vertices on each side of the bipartition? At this point it's not hard to draw out an explicit counterexample; I'll give a sketch of how to find one.  Make 3 hexagons, so that $G$ would have $9$ vertices on both sides of its bipartition. Now, we have to add 9 more edges, 3 between each pair of hexagons that preserves the graph being bipartite and is planar. It isn't hard to just draw 9 such edges by hand. Ask if you are still having trouble, I can explicitly describe the graph then.

Kwa mito ya kawaida $ s_a: = \ nu x. a \ mara x $, kuna lemma ya biisimulation. Inasema kuwa mito miwili ni sawa ikiwa kuna biisimulation kati yao. Uboreshaji ni uhusiano $ \ sim $ kwenye mito iliyofafanuliwa kama hii: $ s_1 \ sim s_2 \ iff \ operesheni {kichwa} s_1 = \ opatorname {kichwa} s_2 \ wedge \ operesheni {mkia} s_1 \ sim S_2 $. Sasa, wacha $ M $ iwe monad. Tutafafanua aina ya "mito ya monadic" $ s^m_a: = \ nu x. m (a \ mara x) $. Intuitively, ikiwa $ m $ inalingana na athari ya upande, kila wakati ninapopata head from the stream I have to perform the side effect. I can define $\operatorname{head}^M: S^M_A \to M A$ and $\operatorname{tail}^M: S^M_A \to M S^M_A$ (using functoriality of $M$).  My question is now: Is there anything similar to bisimulation for monadic streams? Can I prove equality of monadic streams in the same way, using $\operatorname{head}^M$ and $\operatorname{tail}^M$? If not, what are proof methods that work on this coinductive type? Maybe the approximation lemma?  Edit: Maybe there has to be a restriction on the monad, like being completely positive?

Sio tu matumizi ya mafuta lakini pia glycogen, kemikali inayofanana na wanga ambayo huhifadhiwa kwenye ini na pia moja kwa moja kwenye misuli. Sijui hali bora za kufanya hivyo, lakini misuli inaweza "kufunzwa" kuhifadhi glycogen zaidi. . , sio kitu cha kufanya kazi kwa siku chache kabla ya safari kubwa. Na glycogen ni muhimu sio tu kwa sababu inaweza kusaidia misuli ya mafuta masaa kadhaa ndani ya safari ndefu, baada ya sukari ya damu kumalizika, lakini pia kwa sababu inaweza kusaidia kutoa "nishati ya kilele" even when one is well-fed.  (Note that burning fat directly in the muscles is quite inefficient and can lead to "ketosis", causing a sense of fatigue and loss of mental acuity.  Fat is more efficiently "burned" in the liver, but the rate of fat processing by the liver is insufficient to support a sustained high-energy effort.)  It needs to be remembered that there is a lot of really crappy advice out there, often from "experts", re nutrition.  Probably 80% is bogus.  In particular, many "experts" who talk about "burning fat" have probably never even heard of glycogen.  My "expert" opinion is informed by having a genetic disorder (myoadenylate deaminase deficiency) that affects how muscles use energy, so I've taken interest in these topics for decades.

Hapa kuna majibu ya maswali yako mawili ya mwisho. . . na mzunguko wa saizi $ (1+O (1)) \ cdot 2^n/n $. (Shannon alithibitisha hii hadi mara kwa mara na Lupanov got the optimal constant.) By the time hierarchy theorem, there exists a function $f$ with uniform time complexity between $\Omega(3^n)$ and $O(n \cdot 3^n)$. This gives a counterexample: $f$ has circuits of size $O(2^n/n)$ (which I think are computable in $2^{\mathrm{poly}(n)}$ time) but is not computable in $\tilde{O}(2^n/n)$ time. You should probably ask for $s(n) = o(2^n/n)$.  This is an interesting question; I hope someone can answer (1)-(3).

Kama technical matter, I'm perhaps most interested in weak-linear-time on a single-tape nondeterministic machine, but other linear-time models are still interesting, ala deterministic or multi-tape models.  I'm aware that strong-linear-time on a single tape nondeterministic machine is regular, hence linear-time on a single-tape deterministic machine is regular too.

Seti ya lugha inayotambuliwa na POSIX Regex ni nafasi ya kweli ya lugha ya aina 3. Lakini Posix Regex ana nguvu gani? Je! Iko katika darasa linalojulikana tayari? Je! Ni darasa lake mwenyewe? Ikiwa ni hivyo, ni darasa gani kubwa zaidi (kwa muktadha fulani)? Uthibitisho kwamba POSIX REGEX ni nguvu zaidi kuliko aina ya 3: (a+) b (\ 1) ambayo inatambua $ \ {a^nba^n | n \ geq 1 \} $ sijapata really good description of what features POSIX regex allows but this is one link that lists all features (as far as I know): regex manual  Emil Jeřábek mentioned that POSIX regex is not even completely contained in type 2 languages because (.*)\1 is $\{ ww | w \in \Sigma^* \}$. So, it recognizes all type 3 languages, some type 2 languages and some type 1 languages, maybe even some type 0 languages.

Tuseme kwamba kwa kila $ k \ katika \ mathbb {n} $ shida ya uamuzi $ a_k $ ni ngumu kwa $ \ mathsf {n} k \ maandishi {-} \ mathsf {exptime} $. Je! Ni ugumu gani wa umoja wao usiofaa $ a = \ {(k, x) \ katikati k \ katika \ mathbb {n}, x \ katika a_k \} $? Iko katika kiwango cha nne cha Grzegorczyk Hierarchy $ \ Mathcal {E}^4 $ na ni ngumu kwa $ \ mathsf {Elementary} $. Lakini tunaweza kusema zaidi? Motisha ninayosoma the complexity of the satisfiability of monadic logics with several equivalence symbols in agreement. Let $k$ be the number of equivalence symbols allowed. If $k$ is fixed then problem is complete for $\mathsf{N}k\text{−}\mathsf{ExpTime}$. I am looking for a nice characterization of the complexity of the problem when $k$ is not a fixed parameter but part of the input.

Ndio, wanaume wana faida kubwa juu ya wanawake, kwa wastani, kwa aina ya shughuli ambazo jamii inageuka kuwa michezo. Wanaume kawaida ni kubwa, mrefu, wana uwezo mkubwa wa mapafu, mioyo mikubwa, na uwezo mkubwa wa kubeba oksijeni. Miili ya kiume na ya kike ina uwiano tofauti wa misuli na mafuta hata kwa watu wazima wawili wa uzito sawa, na wanaume wana misuli zaidi. Lakini, hiyo haimaanishi kuwa mwanamke hawezi kufikia uwezo wa mwanaume, sivyo? Kwa hivyo, wacha tuangalie taarifa hii kwa kina, na ni mwanaume gani na ni wanawake gani tunalinganisha. Kile nilichoelezea hapo juu, ni kulinganisha kati ya watu wa wastani. Mtu wa kawaida haipo. Na, tofauti kati ya mwanaume mwepesi zaidi na wa kiume mwenye kasi zaidi ni kubwa kuliko tofauti kati ya wastani wa kiume na mwanamke wa wastani. Kwa hivyo kutakuwa na tani za wanawake haraka kuliko wanaume. Kwa hivyo wakati unashindana katika mashindano ambayo yamejaa amateurs with day-jobs that are in it for the fun and challenge, women can absolutely take the podium. To win, you need to persevere and work hard. However, when you are looking at the world records, or best-in-the-world class competitions like the Tour-de-France, that variance becomes irrelevant, because we're not looking at average males or females anymore. There, you are competing within a segment of the population representing the very fastest, most capable specimens our species can produce. To compete at these levels, you don't get there by just working hard and persevering. Everyone there is doing that. You also need the genetic advantage to get you that extra edge. And unfortunately, in that kind of competition, women are at an insurmountable disadvantage. Sexual dimorphism is a real thing, and humans are no exception to it. Note:  There are some events where for whatever reason, women do seem to have an advantage over men, such as in ultra-distance swimming.

Uhakikisho wa PAC unatupatia algorithm ya kujifunza $ a_n (\ cdot) $ na ugumu wa sampuli $ n _ {\ mathcal {f}} (\ epsilon, \ sigma) $ ambayo inahakikisha $ p \ kushoto [l_p (a (\ mathcal {d d) }^n))-l_p (f^*) \ leq \ epsilon \ kulia] \ geq 1- \ sigma $ wakati $ n> n _ {\ mathcal {f}} (\ epsilon, \ sigma) $. Kwa upande mwingine tunasema kwamba darasa la nadharia $ \ mathcal {f} $ haiwezi kujifunza sawa ikiwa tunaweza kutoa ugumu wa mfano $ n _ {\ mathcal {f}} (\ sigma, \ epsilon, f) $ na a kujifunza algorithm $ a (\ cdot) $, kwamba $ p \ kushoto [l_p (a (\ mathcal {d}^n))-l_p (f) \ leq \ epsilon \ kulia] \ geq 1- \ sigma $ wakati wakati $ n> n _ {\ mathcal {f}} (\ sigma, \ epsilon, f) $. Kujifunza isiyo ya sare ni kupumzika kwa ujifunzaji wa PAC tangu $ P\left[L_P(A(\mathcal{D}^n))-L_P(f^*)\leq \epsilon\right]\geq 1-\sigma \implies P\left[L_P(A(\mathcal{D}^n))-L_P(f)\leq \epsilon\right]\geq 1-\sigma $ but the contrary is not true, namely $\mathcal{F}$ may be non-uniform learnable but not PAC learnable. My question is, if we are given a non-uniformly learnable class $\mathcal{F}$ and we define $n_{\mathcal{F}}(\sigma,\epsilon)=\sup_{f \in \mathcal{F}} n_{\mathcal{F}}(\sigma,\epsilon,f)$, does it become PAC learnable? or the supremum over an uncountable set nullifies the implication? Making the complexity bound vacuous?  Thanks for any clarification
