Kuhusu "swali la hariri" yako: Inafanya tofauti kubwa ikiwa unauliza juu ya uwezo au ugumu. Ikiwa kuna mipaka ya ugumu kwenye TM, basi unapata mfano unaoitwa wa Oracle. Ikiwa TM inaweza kutumia rasilimali kubwa-lakini-mwisho, basi uko kwenye world of relative randomness: there are randomness hierarchies of oracles, much as there are Turing degrees.  (Side point: one of the (in)famous critiques by Koblitz and Menzes was about the use of the random oracle model, so your meta-question is touching on recent academic debates.)

Nilichofanya mwishowe ni hii: mnyororo mpya ulikuwa mwelekeo mweusi na sehemu nzuri ya tabo. Kwa kweli nilienda na moja isiyo na maana, lakini kuiendesha iliruka haingefanya kazi kwa sababu ya kukabiliana kwake. Kuendesha bila kukabiliana na nati ilisababisha mnyororo kukwama kwenye karanga wakati wa pete ya ndani. Nilitumia kuchimba visima kidogo kwenye kuchimba visima vya mkono ili kukata kwenye shimo kwenye upande usio na kazi hadi shimo juu ya uso wa juu iliongezwa kwa kipenyo kinachohitajika kusafisha karanga. Kwa grins, nilijaribu kusimama hapo na kuweka pete kwa njia hiyo ili kuona ikiwa nguvu kutoka kwa lishe/bolt ingekuwa ya kutosha kupunguza nyenzo za kutosha kutoa kibali cha mnyororo. Haikufanya kazi. Ili kuunda counterbore, niliamua kupata hatari, na nikatumia dremel yangu ya bure na mtoto wa mwisho anayeonekana kidogo aliyekuja nayo, ambayo nadhani ni Dremel 196 kidogo. Nilikata kwa uangalifu kutoka ndani ya kila shimo kwenda kwa kuu diameter, then went in a circle from there. The countersink bit took away half of the material that was in the way of me making this circle, whereas the bit going off course into where I didn't want to cut would require a lot more force, as would driving the bit deeper, so I was able to use tactile feedback to stay pretty much on course. After getting it most of the way there, I cleaned it all up with alcohol, and colored the cut areas with a Sharpie. Having it all black again let me observe any irregularities and touch up those spots to better keep the surface for the nuts to bear against flat. I also tested that the nuts were sitting neatly just below the surface of the ring. I mounted it all up and the counterbores worked perfectly. Because the crank in question is strange, I had to play with spacers under the small ring to work out issues with chain rub on the new large ring in more gear combos than I liked.

Kiasi cha msuguano kati ya casing na bomba ni ya kuvutia, haswa kwa wakati (kuna picha huko nje ambayo nilijaribu kupata kuionyesha lakini ilishindwa- ikiwa mtu yeyote anaweza kuipata feel free to edit), but if you don't see an obvious spot where it looks like the tube "wore through" then you probably had a puncture where the offending object simply fell out.
Ushirikiano wa FOL ulifanywa huko Hol na John Harrison, na kuripotiwa at TPHOLs 1998.  See Formalizing basic first order model theory.

Kuna vitu vichache vya kuangalia: Hakikisha kuwa mkanda wa mdomo uko katika hali nzuri (hakuna machozi/mashimo, hakikisha imeunganishwa vizuri kwenye mdomo) Ondoa mkanda wa mdomo na uangalie ikiwa spika yoyote inaendelea zaidi ya takriban 1-2mm zamani juu ya juu ya nipples zilizoongea, ikiwa watafikiria kufupisha spika hizi na faili, dremel au kadhalika au kurekebisha spika kwamba hazijatoka tena (ikiwa inawezekana kuweka gurudumu la kweli/pande zote) angalia kitanda/kingo (mahali ambapo Tairi huwasiliana na mdomo) kwa uharibifu (matangazo makali/ya uhakika ambayo yanaweza kuharibu tairi), ikiwa utapata mchanga/faili yoyote chini kwa hivyo ni laini angalia tairi yako kwa vipande vya chuma/glasi/vitu vingine vilivyoingia/chini ya uso (kwa kuzunguka tire whilst removed from the wheel and pinching it every 2cm approx to reveal any splinters, do this on both the inside and outside of the tire check if valve hole has any sharp edges whilst installing inner tube make sure it is not pinched in between rim and outer tube (inflate inner tube just a bit, check if it is not pinched anywhere and if all is good inflate the rest of the way)   For fixing flats I personally find it useful to clamp the inner tube with patch in between a bench vice (potentially with some pieces of wood in between the vice and the tube/patch for wider inner tubes), you could also use screw clamps for this purpose.

Hapa kuna mipaka ya chini na ya juu. Rekebisha $ d \ le n $ kama katika chapisho. Acha $ k^*$ kuashiria thamani kubwa zaidi ya $ k $ mkutano wa masharti katika chapisho. Tunaonyesha kuwa $ k^* = \ exp (\ theta (d \ logi d) $) kwa $ d \ ge 3 \ sqrt n $, lakini $ k^* \ le 2 $ kwa $ d \ le n^{1 /3} $. Ninashuku kuwa mwisho wa mwisho unaweza kuimarishwa (k.m. kuonyeshwa kwa $ D $). Lemma 1. $ d!/{N \ Chagua d} \ le k^* \ le d! $ Uthibitisho. Kiwango cha juu cha $ k^*\ le d! $ Kinashikilia kwa sababu kila kibali kilichochaguliwa huchochea kibali tofauti kwenye $ d $ -subset $ \ {1, \ ldots, d \} $. Kwa dhamana ya chini, sema kwamba vibali viwili vya $ [n] $ mzozo ikiwa, kwa $ d $ -subset $ t $ ya $ [n] $, wanashawishi agizo moja kwa $ t $. Kibali kilichopewa $ \ sigma $ huchochea agizo la jamaa kwa $ n \ chagua d $ $ d $ -subsets. Kila $ D $ -subset $ t $ na agizo la jamaa kwa $ t $ limesababishwa na $ n!/D! $ Vibali vya $ [n] $. Ifuatayo kwamba kibali chochote cha $ \ sigma $ migogoro na zaidi ya $ c = {n \ chagua d} \ mara n!/D! $ Vibali vingine. Kwa hivyo, seti yoyote ya juu ya vibali visivyo vya kupingana lazima iwe na saizi angalau $ N! / c = d!/ {n \ chagua d} $. $ \ Diamond $ corollary 1. ikiwa $ d \ ge 3 \ sqrt n $, basi $ k^* = \ exp (\ theta (d \ logi d)) $. Uthibitisho. Na Lemma 1 na hesabu kutoka kwa ukaribu wa Stirling, $ $ k^* \ ge d!/{N \ chagua d} = \ frac {d^{2d+1} \ exp (d^2/2n - 2d+o (1 ))} {n^d} = \ exp (\ omega (d \ logi d)) $ $ kwa $ d \ ge 3 \ sqrt n $. Kwa juu, kumbuka $ k^*\ le d! = \ Exp (o (d \ logi d)) $. $ ~ ~ ~ ~ Tunatoa uthibitisho mbili. Uthibitisho 1. Fikiria $ D $ na $ 2 \ le d \ le n^{1/3} $. Ili kuona kwamba $ k^*\ ge 2 $, kumbuka kuwa (kama Zihan alivyosema katika maoni yake) kwa $ d \ ge 2 $ kila $ d $ -subset inaweza kutofautishwa na kibali cha kitambulisho na mabadiliko yake. Ili kumaliza tunaonyesha $ k^*\ le 2 $. Kurekebisha vibali vitatu $ \ sigma_1, \ sigma_2, \ sigma_3 $. Fikiria wlog kwamba $ \ sigma_1 $ ni kibali cha kitambulisho: $ \ sigma_1 (k) = k $ kwa $ k \ katika [n] $. Tunaonyesha kuwa $ D $ -subset ya $ [n] $ haiwezi kutofautishwa na jozi zingine za vibali vitatu. Ikiwa $ \ sigma_2 $ ina kuongezeka kwa urefu wa $ D $, basi kwamba baadaye husababisha kibali sawa kwa $ d $ -subset $ t $ hiyo $ \ sigma_1 $, kwa hivyo $ t $ haiwezi kutambulika na $ \ sigma_1 $ $ na $ \ sigma_2 $, na tumekamilika. Vinginevyo, na The Erdős -Szekeres Theorem, $ \ sigma_2 $ ina kupungua kwa urefu wa $ n/d \ ge d^2 $ kwa sehemu ndogo, sema $ t '$, ya $ [n] $. Kwa $ t '$, $ \ sigma_1 $ inaongezeka na $ \ sigma_2 $ inapungua. Kutumia nadharia hiyo kwa $ \ sigma_3 $ iliyozuiliwa kwa $ t '$, $ \ sigma_3 $ ina ama kuongezeka kwa urefu wa $ \ sqrt {d^2} = d $ kwa $ d $ -subset $ t' '$ ndani ndani $ T '$, au kupungua kwa urefu wa urefu huo kwa $ d $ -subset $ t' '$ ndani ya $ t' $. Katika kesi ya kwanza, $ \ sigma_1 $ na $ \ sigma_3 $ usitofautishe $ t '' $. Katika kesi ya pili, $ \ sigma_2 $ na $ \ sigma_3 $ usitofautishe $ t '' $. $ ~ ~ \ Almasi $ hapa kuna dhibitisho mbadala la Lemma 2, kwa kurekebisha uthibitisho wa Erdsős -Szekeres Theorem, kwa maana Wale ambao wanavutiwa na maelezo. Uthibitisho wa 2. Fikiria $ D $ na $ 2 \ le d \ le n^{1/3} $. Ili kuona kwamba $ k^*\ ge 2 $, kumbuka kuwa (kama Zihan alivyosema katika maoni yake) kwa $ d \ ge 2 $ kila $ d $ -subset inaweza kutofautishwa na kibali cha kitambulisho na mabadiliko yake. Ili kumaliza tunaonyesha $ k^*\ le 2 $. Kurekebisha vibali vitatu $ \ sigma_1, \ sigma_2, \ sigma_3 $. Fikiria wlog kwamba $ \ sigma_1 $ is the identity permutation: $\sigma_1(k) = k$ for $k\in [n]$. Assume for contradiction that every $d$-subset $T$ of $[n]$ is distinguishable by each pair of these three permutations.   For each pair $i, j$ with $1\le i < j \le 3$, define $I_{ij}(k)$ to be the maximum size of any subset $T\subseteq [k]$ that contains $k$ such that the order imposed on $T$ by both $\sigma_i$ and $\sigma_j$ is monotonically increasing.  Define $D_{ij}(k)$ to be the maximum size of any subset $T\subseteq \{1,\ldots,k\}$ that contains $k$ such that the order imposed on $T$ by both $\sigma_i$ and $\sigma_j$ is monotonically decreasing.  Define 3-tuple  $$s(k) =  ig(I_{12}(k),\,I_{13}(k),\,D_{23}(k) ig),$$  and $S = \{s(k) : k\in[n]\}.$  Claim 1. For every $k,\ell$ with $1\le k<\ell \le n$, we have $s(k) 
e s(\ell)$.  Before we prove the claim, note that it implies the lemma as follows. The claim implies that $|S| = n$. Each of the three values in any 3-tuple $s(k)$ is in $[d-1]$ (because, for example, there is a subset of $[n]$ of size $I_{12}(k)$ that is not distinguishable by $\sigma_1$ and $\sigma_2$). So $S\subseteq [d-1]^3$, so $n = |S|\le(d-1)^3$, implying that $d>n^{1/3}$, contradicting that $d\le n^{1/3}$ and proving the lemma.  To prove the claim, consider any $k,\ell\in[n]$ with $k<\ell$. Consider the relative order that each of the three permutations induces on the pair $k, \ell$: for each $i\in[3]$, either $\sigma_i(k) < \sigma_i(\ell)$ or $\sigma_i(k) > \sigma_i(\ell)$.  Since $\sigma_1$ is the identity, $\sigma_1(k) < \sigma_1(\ell)$.  First consider the case that $\sigma_2(k) < \sigma_2(\ell)$. By definition of $I_{12}$, there is a subset $T$ of $[k]$ that contains $k$ such that $|T| = I_{12}(k)$ and $\sigma_1$ and $\sigma_2$ are monotonically increasing on $T$.  So $T' = T\cup\{\ell\}$ is a subset of $[\ell]$ that contains $\ell$ such that $|T'| = I_{12}(k)+1$ and $\sigma_1$ and $\sigma_2$ are monotonically increasing on $T'$.  It follows that $I_{12}(\ell) \ge |T'| > I_{12}(k)$.  It follows that $s(\ell) 
e s(k)$ in this case.  For the case when $\sigma_3(k) < \sigma_3(\ell)$, by the same argument $I_{13}(\ell) > I_{13}(k)$, so $s(\ell)
e s(k)$ in that case. In the remaining case, $\sigma_2(\ell) < \sigma_2(k)$ and $\sigma_3(\ell) < \sigma_3(k)$.  By a similar argument $D_{23}(\ell) > D_{23}(k)$.  So $s(\ell)
e s(k)$ in all cases, proving the claim.  $\diamond$  EDIT: Comment on the tightness of the proof of Lemma 2. The proof of Lemma 2 shows the existence of a $d$-subset $T$ which is indistinguishable by two of the permutations and that has the following stronger property: the two permutations are both increasing or both decreasing over $T$.  Given this, I believe the bound of $\Theta(n^{1/3})$ on $d$ is best possible.  That is, I believe that for, say, $d\ge 2n^{1/3}$, choosing appropriate random permutations w.h.p. yields $\exp(\Theta(d\log d))$ permutations such that, for every pair $\sigma$ and $\sigma^*$ of the permutations, there is no $d$-subset $T$ on which $\sigma$ and $\sigma^*$ are both increasing, or both decreasing.  (The argument is similar to the proof of Lemma 1 above, with the additional observation that, for a random permutation, w.h.p. there are only about ${n\choose d}/d!$ $d$-subsets on which the permutation is increasing or decreasing.)  So, to strengthen the lemma, the proof would have to somehow consider indistinguishable subsets on which the two permutations are not monotonic.

Kwa mfano kuna baadhi ya vitongoji vyenye ufafanuzi, ambayo ni, vitongoji ambavyo ukubwa wake unakua katika urefu wa pembejeo $ n $, ambayo inaweza kutafutwa kwa wakati wa polynomial kwa suluhisho bora, angalia kwa mfano A study of exponential neighborhoods for the Travelling Salesman Problem and for the Quadratic Assignment Problem by Deineko and Woeginger. [Hariri kuu ya pili tangu kuchapisha kwanza:] Hii ni nyongeza ya jibu la @Carlmummert, na kutokubaliana kidogo au ufafanuzi. . Mwisho wa pembejeo ya bure ya kiambishi. Chochote kilicho zaidi ya hatua hiyo hakitasomwa chini ya hali yoyote. Chochote kinaweza kuwa kwenye sehemu zaidi ya mkanda, na haitafanya tofauti yoyote kwa tabia ya mashine. Mtu anaweza kuiangalia kwa njia hii: kuna maana gani kusema kwamba mlolongo wa maadili "unakubaliwa" na mashine wakati hawawezi kufanya tofauti yoyote kwa matokeo? . Kile kinachohesabiwa kama kamba iliyokubaliwa, na sema kwamba tu kamba isiyo na kiambishi awali inakubaliwa.) Sidhani kama mashine za bure za kiambishi zina uhusiano wowote maalum kwa maneno tofauti. Hakuna kitu katika maelezo ya mashine za bure za kiambishi awali ambazo zinaonyesha kuwa zinastahili kuendeleza zaidi ya mwisho wa pembejeo isiyo na kiambishi awali kutafuta pembejeo inayofuata. Sio jinsi wazo la a Turing machine is typically used; Turing machines just map single inputs to single outputs (even if they code ntuples).    In another text in the same area as D&H's, Li & Vitanyi 2008 3d, p. 7 (section 1.2) explains that one can encode a pair of natural numbers $\langle x, y \rangle$ as a unique natural number $y + (x + y + 1)(x + y)/2$. In chapter 3, L&V describe prefix-free machines in several ways, specifying in a few places (pp. 200, 201, 209) that when a prefix-free machine reads a program string, all operations halt once the last element of the prefix-free string has been read, and the next element is never read.  On page 202, L&V define a universal prefix machine $U$ whose argument three other arguments using the page 7 encoding (cf. p. 105).  (On the other hand, later on the same page, L&V define the prefix complexity of a pair of strings using a machine $V$ that reads two prefix-free strings separately and then outputs an encoded version of a pair of outputs.  That is like what I take Carl Mummert to describe, but as I interpret the text, $V$ is not a prefix-free machine.  It's certainly not one that stops after it reads a complete prefix-free string.)  (I'm not sure whether the read-only forward-only behavior that D&H describe in the quoted passage is required for prefix-free machines.  This is part of a question I asked in cs.SE.)

Mtindo wa baiskeli sio muhimu sana kama kifafa cha baiskeli. Baiskeli ya barabara isiyofaa haitakuwa nzuri kama mseto unaofaa kabisa na kinyume chake. Ningeenda kwa yako local bike store and try several bikes in different styles and sizes. One will click with you. If it's a good shop, they should let you ride around the block to test different riding positions, etc.

Kuna aina mbili za minyororo inayopatikana kwa baiskeli: minyororo ya aina ya bushing na minyororo ya bushing. Minyororo ya aina ya bushing ina sehemu tano: viungo vya nje, viungo vya ndani, pini, bushings na rollers. Mnyororo wa bushinghing huondoa bushing kutoka sehemu (na hivyo kuacha sehemu 4 tu) na kuchukua nafasi ya bushing na vifungo viwili vya nusu vilivyowekwa kwenye viungo vya ndani. Kwa sababu mnyororo wa bushing una sehemu 4 tofauti na 5, ni rahisi. Mlolongo wa aina ya bushing ni ya kudumu zaidi ikiwa inachukua vizuri mnyororo. Utunzaji sahihi unamaanisha kuwa unasafisha mnyororo tu wakati inahitajika kama lubrication ina hatari ya kubeba uchafu ndani ya nyumba za mnyororo, na kusafisha mnyororo kabisa kabla ya kila tukio la lubrication. Sababu ya uimara bora ni kwamba bushing inazuia uchafu kutoka ndani ya mnyororo ambapo inaweza kufanya uharibifu, na hufanya kazi bora ya kuhifadhi lubricant ndani ya mnyororo. Kinyume na mnyororo wa aina ya bushing ambayo ni ya kudumu zaidi, mnyororo wa bushing hauna nguvu. Kwa hivyo, ikiwa wewe ni mpanda farasi mzito wa kilo 120 amepanda MTB ya umeme na minyororo ndogo ya meno 22 na vikosi visivyo na picha, vikosi vya pamoja vya umeme na umeme vinaweza kusababisha mvutano mkubwa sana kwenye mnyororo kupitia mnyororo mdogo. Mlolongo wa aina ya bushing hauwezi kuhimili mvutano huu wa mnyororo wa juu. Pia uchanganye ukweli kwamba baiskeli wengi hubadilika chini ya mzigo ambao mnyororo usio na busing ni bora kuhimili, na unaona ni kwa nini mnyororo wa businging ni mkubwa leo. Mlolongo wa bushing ni mkubwa sana kwamba mtu hawezi kupata minyororo ya aina ya bushing kwa baiskeli zilizo na malengo ya derailleur tena. Hii ni bahati mbaya, kwani maisha ya mnyororo na utunzaji sahihi wa mnyororo yamepungua kwa sababu ya minyororo isiyo na basi. Baada ya kugundua kuwa wazalishaji tayari wamefanya chaguo kwa aina ya mnyororo na huwezi kufanya uchaguzi mwenyewe (i.e. lazima ununue busingless), chaguo la pili ni hesabu ya kasi. Baada ya minyororo ya kasi ya 5/6/7/8, ambayo ilikuwa saizi sawa (isipokuwa kasi 7/8 zina maelezo mafupi ya pini zamani), kila kizazi cha hesabu za kasi siku hizi huja na vipimo vipya vya mnyororo. Hesabu ya kasi lazima ichaguliwe kulingana na idadi ya sprockets za nyuma. Hesabu za kasi za juu zina minyororo nyembamba. Unaweza kudhani kwa hivyo ni duni, lakini kwa kweli mazungumzo ni kweli: utengenezaji bora na vifaa huwafanya kuwa wa kudumu zaidi, lakini kwa gharama kubwa zaidi. Kasi moja au baiskeli zilizowekwa ndani zinaweza kutumia mnyororo mpana wa 1/8 "kinyume na mnyororo wa takriban 3/32" unaotumiwa na baiskeli za Derailleur. Walakini, kuna kasi moja na baiskeli zilizowekwa ndani kwa kutumia mnyororo wa baiskeli ya derailleur pia. Baada ya kuamua ni hesabu gani ya kasi ya kupata, lazima uamue juu ya urefu sahihi wa mnyororo. Hii inategemea hesabu za mbele na za nyuma za jino kwa sprocket kubwa na mnyororo, na urefu wa mnyororo. Mahesabu yanapatikana. Angalau kwa Shimano, urefu mrefu zaidi wa mnyororo ni viungo 116 na katika hali nyingi unapaswa kuchagua hii, kwani minyororo inaweza kufupishwa kwa urahisi lakini kupanua mnyororo ni gumu na inahitaji ununuzi wa minyororo miwili. Ni bahati mbaya kwamba leo baiskeli nyingi zinauzwa na minyororo fupi nyingi, na kusababisha minyororo iliyouzwa kuwa fupi sana, kwa hivyo baiskeli ndefu ya mnyororo kama baiskeli ya utalii inaweza kuwa na mnyororo wa bei ya kawaida na lazima utumie 138- mnyororo wa kiunga. Sehemu muhimu zaidi ya mnyororo ni chain pin, as it is the part wearing the most. Unfortunately, information about the material quality of the pin is not easily available, so most people buying a chain cannot reasonably compare the quality of pins in two chains of different prices. Ideally the pins would be chrome hardened. Information about the presence or absence of a hardening process is very hard to obtain, but most name brand chains should have hardened pins. An important consideration for chains is how to repair them with roadside emergency tools during a trip if a chain fails. Carrying a mini chaintool in the emergency tool kit is very useful. Ideally, chains would have reusable pins. However, the proliferation of shifting under load and the need to have very short pin protrusion past the side plates due to the ridiculously huge sprocket counts in modern bicycles has demanded chain makers to "punch" the pins for extra positive retention strength in a manner that makes them not reusable. They can be driven out, but not driven back in. There are two approaches for allowing a chain with "punched" pins to be (re)connected:  Reinforced connecting pin (used by Shimano) Quick link (used by many non-Shimano manufacturers such as SRAM and KMC)  The quick link chains are sold to buyers wanting reusability and tool-free disconnection, but fail to provide tool-free disconnection of the two. They have a number of drawbacks:  A single quick link is more expensive than a single reinforced connecting pin, and the emergency tool kit should have several of the chosen connecting device to allow repairing many failures A single quick link is heavier than a single reinforced connecting pin, and the emergency tool kit should have several of the chosen connecting device to allow repairing many failures It is practically impossible to disconnect a quick link by hands in a dirty chain. When the chain is clean, it is possible, but dirt gets into the quick link mechanism necessitating either cleaning the chain or using pliers.  The only benefit of quick links is that they can be reused, but as they have pins that wear, ideally a new quick link is used for a new chain. Reinforced connecting pins are for single use only. In theory, the reinforced connecting pin is a more secure connecting mechanism, but in practice we aren't seeing quick links snapping open en masse. Most of the differences in various N-speed chains by a manufacturer are whether the chain is asymmetric / directional (more expensive but shifts better) and what cosmetic look the chain has. Even the cheapest chains today shift well enough for most purposes, so it may not make sense to pay the great recurring cost of an asymmetric / directional chain for such a fast-wearing part. Of the cosmetic finishes, some may prevent the outside parts of the chain from rusting. Cosmetic external rust in a chain is of no durability concern and an externally rusted chain works as well as a rust-free chain. Besides, this matters only if the bicycle is left in the rain for extended periods. Thus, the cheapest cosmetic finish is preferrable. It's in the inside where it matters, and if a chain is lubricated and left standing in the rain, the inside parts of the chain won't rust.

Katika sehemu ya baiskeli inayotumika ni "bei rahisi, nyepesi, ya kuaminika - chagua mbili". Kuelezea hii, sehemu ya bei rahisi inaweza kuwa ya kuaminika vya kutosha, lakini itakuwa nzito. Sehemu nyepesi za juu zitakugharimu sana. Ni wakati unapoona vitu nyepesi na vya bei rahisi kwenye uuzaji unapaswa kuwa mwangalifu sana. Vipengele vya kiwango cha kuingia kawaida hufanywa kwa aloi za chuma na aluminium na kawaida hutengenezwa na michakato ya kiteknolojia iliyothibitishwa vizuri lakini sio damu. Chuma ni nzito lakini ni ngumu kuvunja. Vitu vya safu ya kati vina alumini zaidi ndani yake, ambayo ni nyepesi lakini bado ni ya kuaminika sana kwa kila kitu kutoka barabara hadi kuteremka. Vipengele vya kiwango cha ushindani huwa pamoja na kaboni nyingi au vifaa vingine vya kigeni iwezekanavyo, na hufanywa kwa kutumia maendeleo bora ya kiteknolojia hadi leo. Kaboni wana had bad reputation in reliability in the past, which is no longer true if manufacturing quality control is adequate. All this is not free of course.  Off-brand or counterfeit stuff is made without regard to quality or tolerance control, which cuts down on the price, but also on performance, reliability and life expectation.    If I may reformulate your question "which bike parts may not be allowed to be less reliable?", then the answer would be "everything supporting your weight or participating in braking". Which is, basically, everything on the bike, including everything braking-related, handlebars, frame, pedals, crank, saddle, even chain. Shifting components do not carry your weight, so, theoretically, they may be less reliable (not that I would recommend it), as different bells and whistles, such as lamps, reflectors, fenders.

I'm not necessarily looking for a specific make/model (unless there's a hybrid you think I should try), more for what would be the best most practical configuration given my needs.

Hili sio jibu kamili; Ni maoni ambayo yalikuwa makubwa sana. Ikiwa unapanua hesabu ya lambda iliyochapishwa na bidhaa zilizo na vifaa vya kujiondoa (yaani, bidhaa za kuondoa bidhaa FST (E) na SND (E)), hakuna maswala yoyote ya kimsingi. Sababu ilichukua muda mrefu kujua ni kwa sababu inageuka kuwa ya asili zaidi kufanya upanuzi wa ETA badala ya kupungua kwa ETA. Tazama sifa za Barry Jay za upanuzi wa ETA. Ikiwa unataka bidhaa kuwa na muundo wa mtindo wa kuweka (a, b) = e katika t basi mambo ni more complex. The primary difficulty with pattern matching are the commuting conversions. That is, these calculi have the equation   C[let (a,b) = e in t] === let (a,b) = e in C[t]   and figuring out (a)  which context C[-] to use and (b) how to orient this equation gets tricky. IMO, the state of the art for rewriting-style approaches are Sam Lindley's  Extensional Rewriting with Sums and Gabriel Scherer's Deciding Equivalence with Sums and the Empty Type, both of which consider the typed lambda calculus with both products and sums.

Kufafanua juu ya maoni yangu kama ilivyopendekezwa na OP: Wacha tuanze kwa kutoa ufafanuzi kwa ufafanuzi mbili kwa ugumu wa mpango kama ulivyopendekezwa na watoa maoni wengine na mimi. Ufafanuzi (Ugumu wa Kolmogorov wa $ L $): Acha $ l $ iwe lugha fulani. Tunafafanua ugumu wa Kolmogorov $ K (L) $ ya $ L $ kuwa (maelezo) urefu wa mpango mdogo ambao unaamua $ L $ (kwa kutumia lugha fulani ya programu) au $ \ infty $ ikiwa hakuna mpango kama huo. Ufafanuzi (Ugumu wa Jimbo la $ L $): Acha $ l $ iwe lugha fulani. Tunafafanua ugumu wa serikali $ s (l) $ ya $ l $ kuwa idadi ndogo ya majimbo ambayo TM ambayo inaamua $ l $ inahitaji kuwa na au $ \ infty $ ikiwa hakuna TM kama hiyo. Uchunguzi wa kwanza tunafanya ni kwamba kuna mipango mingi tu ya urefu wa $ n $ (na hiyo hiyo inashikilia mashine za Kujaribu ikiwa tutarekebisha alphabets na majina ya serikali). Ifuatayo kwamba darasa lolote lisilo na kikomo $ \ Mathcal C $ ya lugha na $ m \ katika \ mathbb n $, kuna lugha fulani katika $ \ mathcal c $ ambayo ina Kolmorogov complexity which is at least $m$ (and the same holds for state complexity).   Indeed, this means that even problems which can be decided in constant time can have an arbitrarily large program complexity, which makes me pessimistic about the existence of results that imply that a large program complexity incurs a large runtime complexity. What about the converse statement?  The same argument from above yields directly that if we have two (infinite) decidable complexity classes $\mathcal{C}_1$ and $\mathcal{C}_2$, then for any $L_1 \in \mathcal{C}_1$ there must exist some $L_2 \in \mathcal{C}_2$ with $K(L_2) > K(L_1)$ (and the same result holds for state complexity) as $K(L_1)$ is finite (by decidability) and he program complexity for any infinite complexity class is unbounded. Even stronger, it follows that there exist infinitely many such $L_2$ and the difference in program complexity can be arbitrarily large (again by the first observation). In particular, one can deduce that for any decidable language, there exist infinitely many languages with (arbitrarily) larger program complexity but constant time complexity.

Nakala ya sheria husika nchini Uswizi iko kwenye admin.ch (akinukuu toleo la Kijerumani, matoleo ya Ufaransa na Italia yanapatikana pia kwenye kiungo hicho na kama kisheria. . 43 Motorräder, Motorfahrräder und Fahrräder; Hintereinanderfahren (Art. 46 Abs. 2 und 47 Abs. 1 Svg) Die führer von Fahrrädern und Motorfahrrädern dürfen nicht neben Andern Fahr-rädern Oderfahrrädern Fahren. Sofern der übrige Verkehr nicht nyuma ya wird, ist das nebeneinanderfahren zu zweit jedoch gestattet: a. Katika geschlossenem verband von mehr als zehn fahrrädern oder motorfahr-rädern; b. Bei Dichtem Fahrrad- oder Motorfahrradverkehr; c. AUF Radwegen und auf signisisierten rad-wanderwegen auf nebenstrassen; d. Katika Begegnungszonen die führer von Motorrädern dürfen weder nebeneinander noch neben fahrrädern oder motorfahrrädern fahren. Radfahrer und Motorfahrradfahrer Dürfen Nicht Neben Motorädern Fahren. Ninaelewa hii kumaanisha kuwa hali yoyote A-D inatosha kuruhusu baiskeli mbili (za motorized) kando, na pango ambalo hauruhusiwi kamwe kuzuia trafiki iliyobaki. Labda kuna sheria nyingine mahali pengine kufafanua nini maana ya kuzuia trafiki, lakini sikuweza kuipata papo hapo. ASVZ Rennvelo (Klabu ya Baiskeli ya Vyuo Vikuu Kubwa vya Uswizi) ina yafuatayo katika hati yao ya utangulizi kwa watu wanaopenda kujiunga one of their riding groups:     Die  Fahrer  am  Ende  der  Gruppe  weisen  auf  von  hinten kommendem  Verkehr  hin  mit  dem  Ruf  «Auto!»,  was  heisst,  dass    jetzt  in  einer  Spur  gefahren  werden  muss  und  nicht  abgelöst    werden  darf,  bis  der  Verkehr  sicher  überholt  hat.  (Gemäss    Verkehrsregelv erordnung  Art.  43  darf  «[...]  in  geschlossenem    Verband von mehr als zehn Fahrrädern [...]» nebenei nander gefahren   werden.)   So they are interpreting it in a careful way: You should not ride side by side (to switch to the back of the riding formation) if there is any (motorized) traffic overtaking you.  On the other hand groups like Critical Mass or Vélorution stretch the law in the other direction and regularly ride in large groups (20-600) with 3-10 riders side by side taking up to 3 regular lanes and no one to my knowledge has ever been taken to court for that. Police on bicycles recently showed up at such events so they are well aware of them.  Basically I think this boils down to: Only do it on official cycling roads (marked by brown/red signs, no or little motor traffic) and in large groups. That large group should have someone more experienced who can tell when it's okay and when not.

As suggested earlier, the best (most cost efficient) option for you is to swap this bike for something smaller.

Re swali lako la kwanza, ikiwa aina hii ya grafu ina jina: ni picha ya graph ya grafu ya bipartite (grafu ya bipartite ambayo ina vertex kwa kila safu isiyo na maana au safu na makali for each point). Line graphs of bipartite graphs are an important subclass of the perfect graphs. They are generally not planar (e.g. if you have five points on the same row or column you get a $K_5$ subgraph).

Katika utaftaji wa faili za Willard zisizo na usawa na zisizo na msingi katika $ \ logi \ logi n $ wakati, anataja toleo la awali (la karatasi iliyounganishwa) inayoitwa "Algorithms ya Utafutaji wa kushangaza kwa faili zisizo za kawaida" zinazoonekana kwenye Mkutano wa 21st Allerton juu ya Udhibiti wa Mawasiliano na Kompyuta mnamo 1983, Uk. 656-662. Siwezi kupata karatasi hii kwenye wavuti, lakini katika toleo la baadaye (lililounganishwa) hapo juu, anasema kwamba karatasi ya zamani inaonyesha kuwa umoja kati ya utaftaji wa binary na tafsiri unaweza kupunguza wakati wa utaftaji hadi $ o (\ logi n) $ kwa $ kwa Ugawanyaji fulani usio sawa wa funguo za rekodi. Hasa, piga simu $ $ \ mu $ mara kwa mara ikiwa kuna $ b_1, b_2, b_3, b_4$ such that $\mu(x) = 0$ for $x < b_1$ or $x > b_2$ and $\mu(x) \geq b_3 > 0$ and $|\mu\prime(x)| < b_4$ for $b_1 \leq x \leq b_2$. For data produced by regular PDFs, interpolation search takes $\Omega(\log n)$ expected time, while binary search takes $\Theta(\log n)$ expected time. Interleaving them, however, takes $O(\sqrt{\log n})$ expected time.  You may also be interested in Willard and Reif's "Parallel processing can be harmful: The unusual behavior of interpolation search", which shows that "parallel processing before the literally last iteration in the search of an unindexed ordered file has nearly no usefulness".

Kesi ya kuvutia na isiyojulikana ni yafuatayo. Tuseme tunayo grafu yenye uzito wa $ $ g $ na mizizi node $ r $. Tunataka kiwango cha chini cha bei ya chini ya $ G $ kwamba kuna $ k $ makali-disjoint njia kutoka $ r $ hadi kila nodi kwenye grafu. Wakati $ k = 1 $ hii ndio shida ya arborescence ya min katika kuelekezwa graphs and in undirected graphs it is equivalent to the MST problem. Both solvable in poly-time though the undirected case is easier. However the problem is poly-time solvable in directed graphs for any $k$ while it is NP-Hard in undirected graphs for $k=2$ (since it captures the min-cost $2$-edge-connected sub-graph problem).
